clauses.original_text:
Definitions & interpretation
Definitions
In this Agreement (including the Schedules) except where the context otherwise requires the following definitions are used:
Term
This Agreement commences on 7th May, 2020 and continues until completion of the Services on
30 Apr 2022 or until it is terminated earlier in accordance with its terms.  
Services
The Services
The Contractor will:
provide the Services to the highest standards of skill, care and diligence in accordance with Schedule 1 including any specified timetable and to the satisfaction of Lilly;
ensure that the performance of the Services will at all times comply with all relevant laws and regulations including the applicable Indian laws and with Lilly’s Ethical Interactions : Preventing Corruption Policy and any other policies specified by Lilly;  
not subcontract the performance of the Services (or any part of the Services) without the prior written consent of Lilly except as provided in clause 12.7 and
at the request of Lilly, cooperate with any other agencies appointed by Lilly.
Personnel
The Contractor will supply the Services to Lilly using appropriately skilled, qualified and experienced Personnel. 
Lilly reserves the right to reject Personnel who it considers (in its discretion) unsuitable to provide the Services.  If Lilly does reject any Personnel, the Contractor will use its best endeavors to provide suitable replacement Personnel. Lilly will have no obligation, and will incur no cost, in respect of any Personnel rejected by it.
The Contractor is responsible for all obligations arising out of its employment of the Personnel, including but not limited to:
the payment of all amounts due to Personnel performing on the Services on the Contractor’s behalf;
the provision of all entitlements arising out of the employment relationship between the Contractor and the Personnel, where such employment relationship exists;
the withholding of Tax Deduction at Source (TDS), Service tax and any other applicable taxes,  and paying these amounts to the Income Tax Department, Government of India   ;
procurement of any workers’ compensation cover required under the relevant legislation in the relevant jurisdiction.
Lilly’s obligations
Lilly to perform Lilly's duties
Lilly will perform Lilly’s duties (if any) specified in Schedule 1 and will provide as soon as reasonably practicable:
all decisions required in connection with the Services;
all Materials Lilly requires to be incorporated into the Services or used in connection with the provision of the Services by the Contractor other than that which the Contractor is providing as expressly set out in Schedule 1;
any other information, ideas or suggestions which the Contractor is required to consider in performing the Services,
but Lilly will not provide the Personnel with any employee related benefits.
Nature of Materials
In respect of the Materials, Lilly must ensure that:
the use of the Materials in connection with the Services is lawful and does not require the consent, permit or authorization of any party;
to the extent that the Materials contain statements or claims in relation to the products or the subject matter of the Services, the Materials are accurate, complete and current; and
the Materials do not infringe the Intellectual Property Rights or other rights of any person.
Contract for Services
This Agreement is a contract for services and the Contractor and Lilly acknowledge and agree that in performing the Services under this Agreement, the Contractor will be operating solely as an independent contractor.  Unless otherwise stated expressly, nothing in this Agreement makes the Contractor nor the Personnel, an employee, partner or agent of Lilly.
Neither the Contractor nor Lilly has the authority to bind, commit or incur any liability on behalf of the other or to otherwise act in any way as an agent or representative of the other party.
The Contractor will ensure that all contractors and other third parties involved in the supply of the Services (including the Personnel) execute appropriate agreements consistent with the rights and obligations of this Agreement including but not limited to clauses 8 and 9. 
Payment
Fees
Lilly will pay the Contractor the fees at the rate or amount and in the manner specified in Schedule 2.   Lilly is not required to pay any amounts above those specified in Schedule 2 unless the parties have agreed to the increase in writing.
.
Invoices
The Contractor will submit an invoice to Lilly monthly or otherwise in accordance with Schedule 2 which should quote Lilly’s Purchase Order Number.
Lilly must pay those invoices within 60 days of date of invoice.
Taxes 
Fees and other expenses payable by Lilly under this Agreement are inclusive of any applicable GST and other similar charges payable in respect of the Services.
Intellectual Property Rights
Ownership of IP
Each party retains its rights in its Background IP, and those rights will not be transferred or changed by the use of Background IP in connection with the Services.  The Contractor represents and warrants that the Project IP and its use by Lilly will not infringe the rights of any person.  The Project IP will be owned on its creation or development by Lilly, and the Contractor must ensure that all necessary assignments or documentation to vest ownership in Lilly are executed in a timely manner.  In relation to all copyright works created under this Agreement, the Contractor must procure the consents necessary to allow Lilly to materially alter those works and deal with those works without attributing authorship.
Confidential Information 
Both parties must (except as may be required by law or with the other party's prior written consent) maintain the secrecy and confidentiality of any Confidential Information of the other party and refrain from disclosing, using, copying, transmitting, retaining or removing any Confidential Information of the other party, or attempting to do the same except to the extent necessary to perform the Services. 
If a party becomes aware of an unauthorized disclosure or use of any Confidential Information or any such suspected disclosure or use, it must immediately notify the other party
Each party acknowledges and agrees that breach of this clause 9, may cause loss or damage for which damages may not be adequate compensation and difficult to ascertain and the other party may immediately seek to restrain any actual or threatened breach of this clause by injunction or similar remedy.
Liability & warranties
Representations and warranties
The Contractor represents and warrants to Lilly that:
the Contractor will perform the Services with due care and skill, and that any Personnel are suitably qualified and experienced to provide the Services;
the Contractor will comply with all applicable laws and government regulations and orders and industry codes in providing the Services;
the Contractor holds all licenses, permits and other authorizations required or necessary to lawfully provide the Services and is in compliance (and will take all necessary steps to comply) with all such licenses, permits and authorizations;
neither the Contractor, nor any of its directors, officers, employees or agents is an official or employee of any government, or of any agency, instrumentality, body or authority of any government, and that no official or employee of any government owns, directly or indirectly, any shares or other beneficial interest in the Contractor;   and
It has and will maintain for the duration of the Agreement, public liability and professional indemnity insurance and will, upon request, will provide Lilly with evidence of such insurance (to the reasonable satisfaction of Lilly)
The parties understand and agree that the Contractor shall be able to provide only those warranties to Lily which are allowed to be provided by the principal (OEM) of the products involved in the fulfilment of hardware / software license.
Indemnity
The Contractor indemnifies Lilly, its Related Bodies Corporate, and each of their officers, employees or agents and will keep them indemnified in connection with any claims, damages, costs, proceedings or any other remedies actual, contingent or otherwise, arising directly or indirectly:
in contract, statute or tort (including negligence) in connection with this Agreement or the performance of the Services;  and
out of any claims made by a Personnel (whether against the Contractor, Lilly or any other person) including but not limited to those arising from the termination of the Services or the termination of the Personnel’s employment or engagement with the Contractor, benefits or entitlements to be paid by the Contractor (and any taxes, duties and charges associated with them) or other terms and conditions under which the Personnel provides his/her services to the Contractor,
but not including such claims, damages, costs, proceedings or other remedies to the extent they arise directly out of the wrongful or unlawful acts or omissions of Lilly.
No Solicitation And Conflicts Of Interest
During the term of this Agreement, Lilly will not solicit the employment of any Personnel without the prior written consent of the Contractor.
The Contractor undertakes that, to the best of its knowledge, the Services to be provided to Lilly under this Agreement do not present a conflict of interest with existing or future work or commitments undertaken by the Contractor on behalf of other clients.

clauses.clause_title: PURCHASE OF PRODUCT(S) BY THE TARGET CUSTOMER BY AVAILING LOAN
clauses.original_text:
As part of the online purchase/ booking of the Product(s), by the Target Customer through the Merchant Platform, the Merchant shall obtain before following steps, the express consent of the Target Customers authorizing the Merchant to share the Customer Information with the Bank either directly or through any service provider(s) of the Merchant . 
The Merchant agrees and undertakes to adhere to the following process and to perform its obligations as under: 
On the Target Customer approaching the Merchant to avail a Loan for purchase of the Product, the Merchant shall check the eligibility of the Target Customer to avail a Loan in accordance with Schedule 3 hereto. Upon the confirmation from the Merchant in regard to eligibility, the Target Customer will complete the Loan Process and shall pay the Down Payment  through the payment gateway. 
Upon receiving the Down Payment, the Merchant shall confirm the order and provide an electronic confirmation of Down Payment to the Bank and if so required by the Bank, the Merchant will furnish necessary proof/ suitable evidence in this regard. 
After the Bank decides to sanction a Loan to a Target Customer (which decision the Bank will make, in its sole discretion, subject to the Customer fulfilling the eligibility criteria and after completing such checks and receipt of such information, applications and/ or documents from the Target Customer as the Bank deems fit), and after completion of all Conditions Precedent and the Approval of Loan,  the Bank may disburse the Loan (subject to the Terms & Conditions applicable to the Loan as accepted by the Target Customer), directly to the account specified by the Merchant. It is clarified that, where the Loan is disbursed by the Bank in the aforementioned mode, such disbursement shall be deemed to be a disbursement by the Bank to the  Customer and the full amount thereof shall be deemed to have been paid by the Bank to the Merchant on behalf of the Customer towards purchase of the Product.
The Loan can be offered on the Products on the Merchant Platform subject to the credit limit as the Bank may decide for each Target Customer. 
The Merchant shall assist the Bank in the collection of any information and such requisite documents online from the Target Customer for availing the Loan, as may be required by the Bank. The Merchant may change the look, feel, design sequencing, contents on the Merchant Platform as may be mutually agreed between the Parties from time to time. 
Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein or any other documents, the Bank may at its absolute and sole discretion grant or refuse to grant the Loan and it shall not at any point of time be required to give any reason or explanation for such refusal to the Merchant or any Customer and regardless of whether the Customer fulfils the eligibility criteria.
Upon the disbursement of the Loan into the Merchant’s account, the Merchant shall be responsible for the delivery of the Product to the Customer and shall provide confirmation to the Bank of due delivery of the Product to the Customer and if so required by the Bank, the Merchant will furnish necessary proof in this regard.
Return of Product by Customer and cancellation of Loan:
In case where a Customer initiates a return of the Product to the Merchant and the Merchant accepts the return in accordance with the Product’s return policies within a week, such an action shall amount to cancellation of the Loan by the Bank to the Customer.
As more particularly described in Schedule 3 hereto, the Merchant will share the list of Customers whose return of the Product has been accepted by the Merchant with the Bank as and when required through the cancellation API.
While disbursing the Loan amount(s) as mentioned under Clause 2.2 hereto, the Bank shall have the right to deduct/ set-off the amounts pertaining to cancelled Loans amounts., the Bank shall disburse only the difference in the Loan amounts of the Customers whose Loan the Bank has boarded and the cancelled Loan amounts. The balance amount of the Loan for the Product shall therefore be paid by the Merchant to the Manufacturer, as if disbursed by the Bank. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, the Bank shall be deemed to have disbursed the complete Loan amount(s) to the Merchant as if no set off was done by it.
For each Loan granted by the Bank,  an  email will be sent by the Merchant from [ noreply@softcell.com]  to the Bank with the name of the Customer, date of purchase of Product, Product details, Product Price, Loan amount disbursed by the Bank, Terms & Conditions accepted by the Customer by way of Online Acceptance on the Merchant Platform and such other details and in such form and manner as the Bank may require. For this purpose, the Bank shall specify an email address from time to time. The Merchant shall also copy the Customer to whom such a Loan is being granted on every such email being sent to the Bank. The Merchant shall use the corporate email address of the Customer, as registered with the Bank for these purposes.

clauses.original_text:
6.1. The Parties hereby agree and acknowledge that at all points in time during the Term of this Agreement, the Bank shall upon giving a prior written notice of 10 (ten) days to the Merchant, be entitled to either by itself, or through its internal or external auditors or any external specialists appointed by it in this behalf (“Bank’s Authorised Personnel”), to audit, review, monitor and assess the use of any software, data or other materials, Customer Information, all the documents, records, (including copies of any audit carried out or review reports and findings made with regard to the Services), information, books or transactions, the security practices, control processes and other necessary information in the nature of operations, financial and business records which the Bank / Bank’s Authorised Personnel in their absolute discretion deem to be relevant to the ability of the Merchant to provide the Services, and compliance by the Merchant of the terms and conditions of the Agreement. Any such audit shall not interfere with the normal business operations of Merchant and shall be conducted at Bank’s costs. The Merchant shall forthwith upon being thus required shall permit taking copies of any Records, documents, books or other writings of the Merchant, by the Bank/ Bank’s Authorised Personnel. 
Without prejudice to the right of the Bank to require audit as provided for in Clause 6.1 above, the Merchant shall regularly provide updates to the Bank with respect to the provision of the Services, and shall meet with the officials designated by the Bank to discuss and review the performance of the Merchant at such intervals as may be agreed between the Parties.
The Merchant shall during the Term of this Agreement, preserve/maintain in good order and as per generally accepted industry practices, all documents, data and records in relation to the provision of the Services as contemplated under this Agreement which documents and records shall at all times be in accordance with the Applicable Law. In addition to the same, the Merchant shall retain requisite audit trails and logs in relation to the Services and shall make the same accessible to the Bank on request.
The Merchant shall co-operate in good faith with the Bank and its employees, representatives and the Bank’s Authorised Personnel to correct any practice, which is found to be deficient during any audit or monitoring and assessment process. Additionally, the Merchant shall make available reasonable time of a qualified professional towards responding to queries that may arise in the course of such monitoring or assessment process on mutually agreed terms.
Notwithstanding anything contained herein, it is hereby agreed between the Parties that any government regulator who is entitled to regulate and supervise the activities of the Bank, including the Reserve Bank of India and/or any persons authorised by such regulator shall be entitled to require the Merchant to furnish and submit such data, documents and records, and / or inspect / cause an inspection to be made of the Merchant and its respective operations or books and accounts by one or more of its officers or employees or other persons, or enter upon the premises of the Merchant and access, inspect, examine, audit and call for all the documents, records or transactions and other necessary information given to, stored or processed by the Merchant (including information maintained in paper and/or electronic formats) in the nature of operations and business records and which the regulator may, in its sole and absolute discretion, deem to be relevant to the provision of the Services and the other terms and conditions, as set forth in the Agreement, with or without provision of prior notice, as the regulator may deem fit and necessary.
In the event that any data, information, documents or Records, which are required by the Bank, the Bank’s Authorised Personnel and / or any such regulator is stored or maintained at any location other than the premises of the Merchant (whether in India or abroad), the Merchant shall ensure that the Bank, the Bank’s Authorised Personnel and / or the concerned regulator, as the case may be, has access to such data, information or records to the same extent as if such data, information and Records were maintained by the Merchant at its own premises.
The Bank understands that during the audit process, it may access confidential information relating to the Merchant’s systems. The Bank hereby agrees to destroy or return all confidential information received by it or any third party appointed by the Bank once the audit process is completed except for any data/information which the Bank in its opinion requires for any regulatory compliances or pursuant to or in relation to any legal, regulatory, judicial, quasi-judicial, governmental, statutory requirements, proceedings, orders, directions, etc 
The Bank shall have a right to review and monitor the security practices and control processes of the Merchant on a regular basis and require the Merchant to disclose security breaches, if any, without prejudice to Bank’s other rights and remedies in this regard.

clauses.original_text:
This Agreement shall come into force from the Effective Date and shall be in force and effect for the period of 3 (Three) years (“Term”), unless terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement. After completion of the Term, this Agreement may be renewed for a further periods of 3 (Three) year(s) by the Parties, upon such mutually agreed terms and conditions, as the Parties may agree, in writing. 
Either Party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement without assigning a reason by issuing 60 (sixty) days prior written notice to the other Party to that effect. 
Either Party shall be entitled to forthwith terminate this Agreement in the event that:
the other Party is in default of any of its material obligations hereunder and such default is not remedied within sixty (60) days from receipt of written notice thereof from the non-defaulting Party, 
the other Party is adjudicated bankrupt or becomes insolvent, makes any assignment for the benefit of creditors, proceedings are instituted by the such Party seeking relief, reorganization or rearrangement under any laws relating to insolvency, bankruptcy or similar laws of any jurisdiction, a receiver, liquidator or trustee is appointed in respect of any property or assets of the other Party or an order is made for the liquidation, dissolution or winding up of the other Party. 
Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Bank shall be entitled to forthwith terminate this Agreement in the event a regulatory order is passed, which prejudicially affects the Bank’s ability to continue with the collaboration envisaged herein;
Upon termination of this Agreement for any reasons whatsoever or expiry of this Agreement, as the case may be :
The Merchant shall forthwith hand over to the Bank the possession of all documents, material and any other property belonging to the Bank and the customers or pertaining to the Loan that may be in the possession of the Merchant;
The Merchant will cease to sell, promote, market or advertise the Loan and shall remove all signs and boards in connection with the Loan from its premises; and
Each Party shall refrain from any action that would or may indicate any relationship between it;
Each Party will immediately cease to use in any manner whatsoever the trademarks, name, and logos of the other Party.
Consequences of expiry or termination of this Agreement 
In the event of termination by either Party as per clause 9.2 mentioned hereinabove, the rights and obligations of the Parties under this Agreement shall continue in full force and effect during the notice period (i.e. a period of 180 days) till the applicable date of termination of the Agreement.
The expiry or the termination of this Agreement shall not affect:
The obligations of the Parties under Clauses 3.2, 3.3, 3.4, 3.5, 3.6 , 6.7, 8, 10 , 11 and Clause II of Schedule 6 of this Agreement. 
The accrued rights and obligations of the Parties including in relation to all Customers who have been granted Loans by the Bank till the point of any termination shall remain in full force and effect and be enforceable notwithstanding such expiry or termination.

NOTWITHSTANDING THE FOREGOING, TOTAL CUMULATIVE LIABILITY FOR ANY DIRECT DAMAGES OR LOSSESOF EACH PARTY, HOWSOEVER CAUSED, SHALL NEVER EXCEED THE PRICE OF THE PRODUCT(S) IN RESPECT OF WHICH SUCH CLAIM HAS ARISEN. Both the Parties hereby acknowledge that it shall derive benefits in terms of its business growth and strengthening of customer base as a result of entering into this Agreement, which by itself is sufficient and complete consideration for themselves to enter into this Agreement. Neither Party shall be obligated to pay any other consideration in a monetary form or otherwise to the other.  
GOVERNING LAW, JURISDICTION AND ARBITRATION
This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of India. The Parties agree that if the process of the courts is required to be invoked for enforcement of Clause 13.2 below, including for seeking of any interim relief prior, during or after invocation of Clause 13.2 below, the competent courts and tribunals at Mumbai shall have exclusive jurisdiction and both the Parties hereto submit to the same.
All disputes, differences and/or claims arising out of these presents or as to the construction, meaning or effect hereof or as to the rights and liabilities of the Parties shall be settled by arbitration to be held in Mumbai in accordance with the provisions of the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996 and shall be referred to the sole arbitration of a person to be nominated mutually by both the Parties. The award including interim award/s of the arbitrator shall be final and binding on all Parties concerned. The arbitrator may lay down from time to time the procedure to be followed by him in conducting arbitration proceedings and shall conduct arbitration proceedings in such manner as he considers appropriate.

clauses.original_text:
The Merchant agrees and undertakes during the term of this Agreement and for 3 (Three) years after its termination for any reason (except in case of obligations towards Customer Information which shall not be limited to expiry of said 3 (Three) years), to regard and preserve as confidential, all Confidential Information of the other Party which may be obtained from any source as a result of this Agreement. In maintaining confidentiality hereunder, the Merchant agrees that it shall not disclose or make available to any third party, person, firm or enterprise, reproduce or transmit, or use (directly or indirectly) for its own benefit or the benefit of others, any Confidential Information of the Bank. "Confidential Information" means:
Customer Information, any documents, data, or information that is not generally known to the public, including but not limited to, operations, customer relationships, customer profiles or other customer information relating to the past, present or future business activities of a Party, its parent corporations, subsidiaries and affiliates and the customers, clients and suppliers of any of the foregoing;
any scientific or technical information, design, process, procedure, formula or improvement that is commercially valuable and not publicly available;
all confidential or proprietary concepts, documentation, reports, lists, files, data, specifications, software, systems, source code, object code, flow charts, databases, data files, inventions, information, know-how and trade secrets, whether or not patentable or copyrightable.
If the Merchant violates or causes to be violated any of the provisions of this Clause II (Confidentiality) the Bank shall, without prejudice to its other rights to claim injunctive relief, be entitled to claim from the Party at fault, and the Party at fault shall be liable to pay to the Bank, compensation to the tune of actual amount of damages as determined and supported by proof of evidence, by the Bank.
The Merchant shall, upon the request of the Bank, immediately destroy all Confidential Information of the Bank in its possession or control, by shredding or incineration of all documents and other material, which is in a physical form or irretrievably delete such Confidential Information recorded or stored by electronic means or otherwise, including all copies thereof and evidence of such destruction shall be provided to Bank to its reasonable satisfaction.
The Merchant confirms that it shall, upon the request of the Bank, immediately return all Confidential Information of the Bank in its possession or control, which is in a physical form or recorded or stored by electronic means or otherwise, including all copies thereof.
This Clause II (Confidentiality) shall survive expiry or termination of this Agreement.

clauses.original_text:
Client shall, in consideration for the Services provided by Service Provider in accordance with what the Parties have agreed in this Agreement and the related SOW, and upon acceptance of such Services by Client, pay Service Provider the undisputed invoices which are submitted by the Service Provider to Client as per the terms of the SOW, purchase order issued by Client and as per procurement policy of Client.
All amounts and rates mentioned in each SOW shall be construed as being inclusive of all taxes and duties (except GST) imposed by Indian government in connection with this Agreement which shall be borne by Service Provider. Client shall bear the GST. Income-tax will be deducted as per the applicable rates. 
The invoices shall be submitted with all supporting as may be required by Client.
Supplier shall ensure that each invoice/ debit note/credit note it presents to Client under this Agreement in respect of any Indirect Tax Amount is a valid document which meets applicable requirements under applicable indirect taxation laws (including, but not limited to, the applicable GST law).
Supplier undertakes to remit all amounts of Indirect Tax applicable and any other payments to the applicable taxing authority of the appropriate tax jurisdiction within the time specified in the applicable Indirect Tax Law.
Supplier shall deposit the tax amount (collected from Client) to the credit with the appropriate authorities and file the GST return within the timelines to enable us to avail the input tax credit. Where the vendor has not deposited appropriate GST liability to the credit of appropriate government or filed the GST return and Client has availed the credit on provisional basis, then any increase in output liability of Client on account of such non-compliance will be recovered along with interest as applicable under the GST Act.
In the event the credit of Indirect Tax is not granted or denied to Client under its appropriate Indirect Tax registration under applicable laws (including, but not limited to, on the GSTN platform) for non-payment by Supplier of taxes charged to Client, or on account of any non-compliance by Supplier (including, but not limited to non-filing of information, non-filing of returns, non-payment of appropriate Indirect Tax to appropriate government) and/or incorrect submission of information (including, but not limited to, on the GSTN platform), then the Supplier  shall rectify the said non-compliances/errors to ensure that Client gets the credit in the subsequent month.  In the event, the Supplier’s non-compliance/error is not rectified by the Supplier as above, then Client shall have the right to set off such shortfall against the subsequent payments of the fees or charges to the Supplier or recover the amount of Indirect Tax charged to it along with the interest, penalty and/or any other cost from the Supplier. In such event, Supplier shall subsequently have the right to recover the Indirect Tax amount from Client upon payment of such Indirect Tax to the appropriate tax jurisdiction of the applicable taxing authority and filing of the Indirect Tax returns, subject to Client receiving the Indirect Tax Credit for such Indirect Tax amount charged to it by Supplier.
All undisputed invoices payable as per this clause shall be paid within 30 days of receipt of the same by Client. If the payment is to be made monthly as per respective SOW, the Service Provider shall raise the invoice not earlier than the last day of the month to which Services’ correspond to.  If the payment is to be made quarterly as per respective SOW, the Service Provider shall raise the invoice not earlier than the last day of such quarter or if the payment is to be made as per any other frequency the Service Provider shall raise the invoice not earlier than the last day of such agreed period.
If there is any dispute relating to any invoice, the Parties shall make good faith efforts to resolve all such matters by escalation to the authorized persons within each organization with a view to reach amicable resolution. Upon the failure of the Parties to resolve the dispute amicably within 90 days from the date of raising such dispute, the dispute shall be referred to arbitration as provided under clause 10 of this Agreement.
It is hereby agreed that the Service Provider shall continue to provide the Services in accordance with the terms of this Agreement and the SOW during the period of any dispute resolution
Without prejudice to any other rights and remedies available at law, Client shall be entitled to set-off or deduct any amount payable to the Service Provider under this or any other agreement from the amounts due from the Service Provider under this or any other Agreement.
Without prejudice to any other rights and remedies available at law, Client shall be entitled to withhold any and all amount payable to the Service Provider under this Agreement in the event of breach of terms and conditions of this Agreement by the Service Provider and/or its personnel and/or its sub-contractors and/or its agents and/or its representatives.

clauses.original_text:
MASTER SERVICE AGREEMENT
This Master Service Agreement is made and entered into on 21st day of August 2024 (“Effective Date”) by and between:
Softcell Technologies Global Private Limited, is a Service Provider incorporated under the Companies Act 2013 and having its registered office at 303, B-wing, Commercial-1 Kohinoor City, Kirol Road, Kurla(W) Mumbai – 400070  (hereinafter referred to as the “Service Provider”, which expression shall, unless repugnant to the context or meaning thereof, be deemed to mean and include its successors and permitted assigns) of the One Part; 
and
Care Health Insurance Limited is a company incorporated under the Companies Act 1956 and having its  office at 3rd Floor, Vipul Tech Square, Sector 43, Golf Course Road, Gurugram-122009, Haryana (hereinafter referred to as the “Customer”, which expression shall, unless repugnant to the context or meaning thereof, be deemed to mean and include its successors and permitted assigns) of the Other Part. 
The Service Provider and the Customer are hereinafter, wherever the context requires, individually referred to as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties”. 
WHEREAS,
The Service Provider is a leading provider of business-to-business IT infrastructure solutions and is an authorized reseller of the subscription to the OEM Software (as defined in this Agreement)
Based on the expertise and representation of the Service Provider, the Customer has procured ManageEngine (Subscription based) licenses (“OEM Software”) from Softcell and is now seeking implementation services from the OEM subject to the terms and conditions pursuant to this Agreement.
NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants set forth herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows.
DEFINITIONS.
Capitalized terms used in this Agreement, will have the definitions assigned below, or as indicated in context. Except as otherwise provided in this Agreement, technical terms commonly used in the industry will be so construed. 
“Agreement” shall mean this Master Service Agreement, including its annexures, amendments, modifications and supplements thereto.
“Confidential information” shall mean all non-public information in oral, written, electronic, optical or other form including any information / data / materials, whether specifically designated as “confidential” or not, which (a) relates to past, present and future research, Intellectual Property Rights, development, business activities, chat history and details, products (prototype or otherwise), software, hardware, trade secrets, services, courses and its materials, discoveries, concepts ,techniques, models, data, documentation, processes, procedures, know-how, marketing techniques and materials, contents, marketing and development plans, business models, customer names, financial information, technical information and information related to customers, vendors, employees, price lists, pricing policies, financial information, trade secrets and  personal data, and technical knowledge, written or verbal or any other electronic form or contained in any media or machine-readable form, and (b) has been identified as confidential or would be understood to be confidential by a reasonable person under the circumstances in which it is disclosed. Confidential Information does not include information that (i) was in the public domain at the time it was disclosed or becomes part of the public domain after disclosure, without breach of this Agreement ; (ii) was known to the  receiving Party  prior to disclosure or becomes known to it from a third party which is legally entitled to disclose it; or (iii) is required to be disclosed under applicable laws and regulations or by competent governmental order or legal process; (iv) was independently developed by the receiving Party without use of the disclosing Party’s Confidential Information. In case the Confidential Information disclosed orally, the Parties shall ensure to reduce the same in writing within 10 days from the date of disclosure.
“Fees” shall mean the fees payable by the Customer to the Service Provider for (i) the purchase of subscription(s) to the Software as per applicable Order and (ii) Implementation Services as per the applicable SOW.
“Implementation Services” shall mean the services rendered for implementation of the Software including any consulting, training services as detailed in the SOW or any other services mutually agreed to be provided by the Service Provider as per the SOW to the Customer. 
“Intellectual Property Rights”  includes, but all patents, trademarks, ideas, concepts, creations, discoveries, inventions, know-how, permits, service marks, brands, trade names, trade secrets, techniques, methods, processes, proprietary information and knowledge, technology, computer programs, databases, copyrights, licenses, franchises, formulae, designs, data, documents, instruction manuals, records, memoranda, notes, whether or not copyrightable or patentable, or any written or verbal instructions or comments and other confidential information.
“Master Service Agreement/MSA” shall mean this agreement entered into between the Service Provider and the Customer for subscription to the Software and other documentation entered into between the Service Provider and the Customer excluding any end-user license agreement, which may be entered into by the end user of the Customer with the OEM. 
“OEM” shall Original Equipment Manufacturer and/or any of its affiliates. 
“Order(s)” shall mean a written order, in the form set forth in Annexure B, that the Parties may enter into from time to time under this Agreement for the sale and purchase of the subscription(s) to the Software, setting forth the details as to the subscription, Fees for the subscription(s) to the Software and other terms mutually agreed between the Parties.  
“Reseller Agreement” shall mean the agreement entered into between the OEM and the Service Provider by virtue of which the Service Provider is appointed as a reseller of the OEM, including any schedules, annexures, modifications and supplements thereto. 
“Software” shall mean software, provided on subscription basis by the OEM through the Service Provider as reseller to the Customer, subject to terms and Conditions of the MSA. 
“Services” shall mean services, as enumerated in Annexure A.
“Statement of Work” or “SOW” shall mean the individual document containing the scope of Implementation Services, milestones, deliverables and other details, which has been executed between the Parties pursuant to this Agreement.
“Term” shall have the meaning as ascribed to it clause 13.
SCOPE OF THIS AGREEMENT. 
Scope:
Subject to the terms of the Reseller Agreement and subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the Service Provider hereby agrees to resell the subscription to the Customer pursuant to any Order accepted by the Service Provider.

clauses.clause_title: The Service Provider shall have a comprehensive Information ...
clauses.original_text:
The Service Provider shall have a comprehensive Information Security Policy that governs the services being provided to Care Health and the security policy must be reviewed and updated at least annually or earlier if there is a significant change to the operating environment. The Security Policy must validate the implemented controls as per ISO27001:2013. The Service Provider shall perform compliance validation yearly basis with Information Technology (IT) Act, 2008. Appropriate access control mechanisms will be deployed by the Service Provider so that un-authorized personnel cannot gain access to Care Health data.
The Service Provider shall label the Confidential Information while sharing it internally and externally and must implement comprehensive controls to protect Confidential Information w.r.t ISO 27001:2013, IT Act 2008. The Service Provider shall ensure that usernames and passwords used to access Care Health data will not be shared or divulged to any un-authorized person, or unauthorized personnel, Service Provider shall also ensure that usernames and passwords stay encrypted during transit and during storage.
Appropriate physical, technical & deterrent controls shall be implemented to prevent intrusions and unauthorized access to hard copy output containing Personal Information, Network Racks, Computing Devices, Care Health Confidential Information or Media containing Care Health Data.
The Service Provider shall annually reconcile their all Information Assets which are used for processing data of Care Health. 
Service Provider shall inform Care Health and obtain an approval before further outsourcing any service/services to third party, which may include sharing of personal data of Care Health users with resepct to this Agreement .
Exchange of any Care Health related Confidential Information shall be only done after written consent from Care Health.
Service Provider shall have a proactive solution for threat intelligence & remediation - capture/remediate/Delete Viruses and Malware in Files/Scripts/Software & Emails.
The Confidential Information involved in online transactions/Electronic Commerce shall be restricted and protected to prevent incomplete transmission, mis-routing, unauthorized message alteration, unauthorized disclosure, unauthorized message duplication or replay. 
Audit Logging for all System/s and application/s involved in Processing Care Health related data shall be enabled & protected to ensure unauthorized access and alteration. 
Vulnerability Assessment and Penetration Testing shall be conducted yearly on Internet facing systems and Vulnerability Assessment shall be conducted on Internal systems or network at least Yearly by Service Provider.
The Service Provider receiving the sensitive personal data or confidential information from Care Health or from any of its representatives shall not disclose it further. The international Standard IS/ISO/IEC 27001 on "Information Technology - Security Techniques - Information Security Management System - Requirements" shall also be adhered.
Service Provider shall have defined process for: 
Patch Network Devices and Servers using the formal change management process;
Password management policy;
Service Provider shall revoke the access provided to admin users and general users within one business day once they exit from the premises from Service Provider.
Service Provider shall have Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) where the Internet Facing servers/applications will reside and relevant (Physical & logical) segregation of Networks in place.
Service Provider shall report cyber/Information security incidents and also security incidents related information along-with correction and corrective actions to Care Health.
Service Provider shall implement Cryptographic controls (Email Encryption, Endpoint Encryption, Network Encryption).
All the Confidential Information shared during the Agreement will be disposed off by the Service Provider after the termination of the Agreement with Care Health.
No USB Access, Internet Access & E-Mail to outer Domain should be available on the systems processing Care Health Confidential information/Care Health customer information. In case the same is not feasible, compensating controls - relevant data leakage controls shall be implemented.
Sensitive personal data or information shall be Protected and controls to be demonstrated— Sensitive personal data or information of a person means such personal information which consists of information relating to;—
password;
financial information such as Bank account or credit card or debit card or other payment instrument details ;
physical, physiological and mental health condition;
sexual orientation;
medical records and history;
Biometric information;
Email address, physical address, phone number and name;
INCIDENT RESPONSE & NOTIFICATION:
The Service Provider shall promptly notify the Company of any actual or suspected security breach, unauthorized access, loss, or theft of the Company's data.
The Service Provider shall cooperate fully with the Company in investigating and resolving any security incidents and take appropriate measures to mitigate the impact of such incidents.

This Reseller Agreement does not have to be signed in order to be binding. You indicate your assent to the terms by clicking on the "I agree" (or similar button) that is presented to you at the time of your order.
1.Order Requirements.

Subject to this Reseller Agreement, we grant you a one-time, non-exclusive, non-transferable right to resell the Products and Services specified in the Order to the end user specified in the Order, solely for use by such end user in accordance with the applicable Product Agreement. This right to resell does not apply to any other end user or any other Product or Service (including without limitation any sale to any related party, organization or affiliate, or to any subsequent, additional or renewal sale to the same party).

For the avoidance of doubt, Reseller is not permitted to, and shall not, negotiate the terms of the Product Agreements with end users or enter into any side letters or other arrangements purporting to amend or supplement the terms of the Product Agreements.
3.2. Enforcement Cooperation. You agree to immediately notify us of any known or suspected breach of the Product Agreements, or other unauthorized use of the Products or Services, and to assist us in the enforcement of the terms of the Product Agreements.
4.Identification as Reseller.
Subject to this Reseller Agreement, you are permitted to identify yourself as a Posit "Reseller" solely in connection with your resale of the Products and Services. You may not use any Posit trademark, logo or service mark ("Marks") except as permitted by Posit’s Trademark Guidelines at https://posit.co/about/trademark-guidelines/. All goodwill arising from your use of Marks inures to the benefit of Posit.
5.Payment and Delivery.
5.1. Fees. Your non-refundable, non-cancelable payment to Posit is due when you submit your Order unless otherwise set forth in the Order and in any event no later than forty-five (45) days from your receipt of a Posit invoice. In the event that you have not made payments satisfactory to Posit for previous transactions, Posit reserves the right to require prepayment or other payment arrangements satisfactory to Posit going forward. All amounts payable by you shall be paid in full without set-off, deduction or other withholding of any amount. You are solely responsible for collecting payment from your end user customers. Late payment or nonpayment by any end user to you shall not delay or excuse payment by you to Posit hereunder.
5.2. Delivery. Upon receipt of payment, we will deliver any applicable license keys, access credentials and other information necessary for end users to download and use, or otherwise access and use, the Products and Services subscribed to in the Order, directly to the delivery contact specified in the Order in accordance with our standard delivery procedures. If we deliver the license keys or access credentials to you, you agree that you will, in turn, deliver them directly to the end user specified in the Order, and not to use or access the Products or Services in any way. You must either delete all license keys and/or access credentials promptly thereafter or maintain them in confidence. You agree not to (and will not allow any third party to) take any steps to interfere with or defeat any license keys or access credentials.
5.3. Taxes. Payments made by you under this Reseller Agreement exclude any taxes or duties payable in respect of the Products and Services in the jurisdiction where the payment is either made or received. To the extent that any such taxes or duties are payable by Posit, you must pay to Posit the amount of such taxes or duties in addition to any fees owed under this Reseller Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, you may have obtained an exemption from relevant taxes or duties as of the time such taxes or duties are levied or assessed. In that case, you will have the right to provide to Posit any such exemption information, and Posit will use reasonable efforts to provide such invoicing documents as may enable you to obtain a refund or credit for the amount so paid from any relevant revenue authority if such a refund or credit is available.
5.4. End User Pricing and Payment; Refunds. You will independently set your own pricing to each end user. You bear all risk of non-payment by end users, and you are solely responsible for all of your costs and expenses. You may not terminate an Order or receive any refunds due to non-payment by an end user. If Posit provides any refund to an end user under our standard return policy, Posit, at its option, will refund the applicable amounts either directly to the end user or to you for distribution to the end user. You agree to cooperate with Posit in connection with any such refund.
6.Feedback.
If you provide any feedback, comments, suggestions, ideas, description of processes, or other information to us about or in connection with the Products and Services, our other products, solutions, or services, or our Reseller program, including without limitation any ideas, concepts, know-how or techniques contained therein ("Feedback"), then you grant us a worldwide, royalty-free, fully-paid up, non-exclusive, perpetual, transferable and irrevocable (with right of sublicense) license to use, copy, modify, create derivative works of, and otherwise exploit the Feedback for any purpose, without any compensation to you or any restriction or obligation on account of intellectual property rights or otherwise. For clarity, no Feedback will be deemed your Confidential Information, and nothing in this Reseller Agreement (including without limitation Section 12 (Confidentiality)) limits Posit’s right to independently use, develop, evaluate, or market products, whether incorporating Feedback or otherwise.
7.No Use Rights; Reserved Rights.
Only the end user customer of the Products and Services (and its authorized users) may use the Products and Services. You are not permitted to use any Products or Services resold under this Reseller Agreement for your own benefit. To the extent that you nevertheless gain any access to the Products and Services, all terms and conditions of the Product Agreements apply to you. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Reseller Agreement, except for the limited resale right in Section 2 above, Posit and its suppliers have and will retain all rights, title and interest (including without limitation all patent, copyright, trademark, trade secret and other intellectual property rights) in and to all products, services, software, service descriptions, documentation, user manuals, tools, content, photos, videos, works of authorship, processes, methodologies and all other technology comprising, used in or used to provide the Products and Services ("Posit Technology"), and all copies, modifications and derivative works thereof, including without limitation all intellectual property rights therein and thereto and as may incorporate Feedback. 8.Reseller Obligations and Liability.
8.1. End User Relationships; Business Practices. You agree not to represent yourself as an agent or employee of Posit and agree that we will have primary control over any end user communication regarding the Products and Services once you submit an Order. You will indemnify, hold harmless and (at Posit’s option) defend Posit from and against any claims, demands, suits, proceedings, investigations, actions, losses, costs, expenses, settlement amounts, fines, penalties, damages and any and all other liabilities, including without limitation reasonable attorneys’ fees, arising from or relating to: (a) any breach or alleged by you of any term of this Reseller Agreement, (b) the issuance by you of any warranty or representation regarding Posit or its Products and Services not specified in the End User Agreement, or (c) any of your other acts or omissions in connection with the marketing or resale of the Products and Services under this Reseller Agreement.
9.Termination.
9.1. Termination. We may terminate this Reseller Agreement if you materially breach any provision in this Reseller Agreement and fail to cure such breach within five (5) days of written notice of such breach. In addition, either party may terminate this Reseller Agreement for any reason or no reason upon thirty (30) days’ written notice to the other party. Posit may also terminate this Reseller Agreement immediately upon notice to you if (a) it ceases to offer the current reseller program or (b) it reasonably believes that continuing hereunder could result in business or legal liability for Posit or otherwise harm Posit or its end users.
9.2. Effect of Termination. You expressly agree that Posit will have no obligation or liability to you resulting from termination or expiration of this Reseller Agreement in accordance with its terms. Upon termination or expiration of this Reseller Agreement: (a) you must immediately cease identifying yourself as an Posit Reseller and using Posit Marks in connection with your resale activities hereunder, (b) you must destroy all Confidential Information in your possession and certify destruction (unless we request that you return such materials to us) and (c) Sections 5 (Payment and Delivery) (but only with respect to Orders completed during the Term), 6 (Feedback) and 7 (No Use Rights; Reserved Rights) through 14 (General) will survive. Notwithstanding any termination or expiration of this Reseller Agreement all Product Agreements with end users for the subscriptions to the Products and Services which are in compliance with this Agreement shall survive for the subscription term set forth in the applicable Order. Posit shall have no liability to you and you expressly waive any liability of Posit, as a result of termination or expiration of this Reseller Agreement in accordance with its terms, including without limitation claims relating to loss of profit, goodwill, advertising costs, termination of employees, employees' salaries, unrecovered expenditures, investments, inventory purchases, leases, property improvements, or any other items.
10.Changes to Agreement.
From time to time, we may modify this Reseller Agreement and/or our Product Agreements. The version of this Reseller Agreement and Product Agreements in place at the time you submit each Order is the version that will govern such Order. We will use reasonable efforts to notify you of these changes through communications through our website or other forms of communication, but we also suggest that you bookmark this Reseller Agreement and the Product Agreements and read them periodically.
11. Confidentiality.
Except as otherwise set forth in this Reseller Agreement, each party agrees that all software code, software applications, content, videos, photos, works of authorship, know-how, methodologies, technology, inventions, and any other business, technical and financial information it obtains or accesses (as "Receiving Party") from the disclosing party ("Disclosing Party") constitute the confidential property of the Disclosing Party ("Confidential Information"), provided that it is identified as confidential at the time of disclosure or should be reasonably known by the Receiving Party to be Confidential Information due to the nature of the information disclosed and the circumstances surrounding the disclosure. Any Posit Technology and any performance information relating to the Products and Services shall be deemed Confidential Information of Posit without any marking or further designation. Except as expressly authorized herein, the Receiving Party will hold in confidence and not use or disclose any Confidential Information. The Receiving Party’s nondisclosure obligation shall not apply to information which the Receiving Party can document: (i) was rightfully in its possession or known to it prior to receipt of the Confidential Information; (ii) is or has become public knowledge through no fault of the Receiving Party; (iii) is rightfully obtained by the Receiving Party from a third party without breach of any confidentiality obligation; (iv) is independently developed by employees of the Receiving Party who had no access to such information; or (v) is required to be disclosed pursuant to a regulation, law or court order (but only to the minimum extent required to comply with such regulation or order and with advance notice to the Disclosing Party). Affiliates/Related Companies of the Company including any affiliates or subsidiaries of the Company may use the Services(s)/deliverable(s) delivered by the Service Provider under this Agreement, subject to the terms of the Agreement.
Provided that the Parties may amend or alter the list of ABC Companies from time to time, by amending the provisions. 
If any ABC Company wish to use the Service(s)/ deliverable(s) delivered by Service Provider pursuant to this Agreement, such ABC Company may do so subject to the other provisions of this Agreement. 
Each ABC Company shall directly make payment to Service Provider for the use of the Service(s)/ deliverable(s) as per the “Consideration” clause as Clause 3 in the Agreement and in accordance with the SoW as agree upon and executed between the Service Provider & ABC Company. 
This Agreement shall be deemed to automatically apply to the Service Provider and such ABC Company with such ABC Company taking the place of the Company hereunder (and exercising and being subject to the Company's rights and obligations).
If an ABC Company disputes the application of this Agreement to itself, any use by such ABC Company of the application(s)/deliverable(s) or Services delivered by the Service Provider shall be and shall be automatically deemed to be invalid use thereof. Unless otherwise agreed by the concerned Parties in writing, the expiry or termination of this Agreement between the Service Provider and the Company shall not affect the term of such independent SoW signed between the Service Provider and such Related Companies.

This Agreement will be deemed to commence on and from the 1st day of March 2024 and will remain in force for a period of three (3) years (hereinafter referred to as “Term”) until the 27thFebruary 2027unless terminated earlier in accordance with this Agreement. The Parties may renew this Agreement on or before expiry of the initial Term by agreement in writing
TERMINATION:
ABFSSL shall have the right to terminate this Agreement or SoW as applicable if any forthwith under following circumstances:
Material Breach:
if Service Provider breaches any of the terms and conditions of this Agreement or SoW.
if Service Provider breaches its representation and warranties.
if Service Provider commits any fraud, willful omission, breach of confidentiality including data and security breaches.
if Service Provider while providing services hereunder, violates any law or regulation or service standards.
Additional Termination Events:
The Service Provider’s license/permission to provide services under this Agreement or respective SoW has been suspended or cancelled.
If it is lawfully required to do so by ABFSSL/ABC Companies due to any order/direction/notification of any competent legal, governmental, supervisory or regulatory authority or body. In such cases the ABFSSL/ABC Companies shall be fully liable to the Service Provider for all the payment obligations as per the invoice.
The Service Provider, its officers, directors or employees or its affiliates are involved in any material investigation or subject to any government action or having pending material litigations.
If the Service Provider has been declared insolvent or goes into liquidation or presents or is presented with a petition for or passes a resolution for winding up, either compulsory or voluntary (except for the purposes of reconstruction or amalgamation), or makes any arrangement with its creditors or any assignment for the benefit of creditors, or if a receiver or manager of its business or undertaking is duly appointed, or if distress or execution shall be levied or threatened upon any of its property, or if it suffers any similar action in consequence of debt.
If there occurs any circumstance(s) or event which materially affect the business and/or operation of the Service Provider impacting the Services in the opinion of ABFSSL.
Any other reason attributable to the acts of the Service Provider excluding those of any OEM, which causes non-performance of this Agreement or respective SoW.
The Service Provider adopts malpractice’s which affect the fair name and reputation of ABFSSL/ABC Companies or for gross negligence or inefficiency or any other irregularity on the part of the Service Provider in fulfilling its duties and responsibilities under this Agreement.
If the appointment or continuance of the Service Provider under this Agreement is likely to result in loss of goodwill or reputation of ABFSSL/ ABC Companies.
Failure to obtain requisite Permits necessary for conduct of these services pursuant to this Agreement
Any other event or circumstances or breach which ABFSSLnotifies  in writing to the Service Provider such breach if curable is not cured by the Service Provider within a period not later than thirty (30) days from the date of such notice, ABFSSL shall have the right to terminate this Agreement and/or respective SoW forthwith.
Termination for Convenience:
Either Party may elect to terminate this Agreement or the respective SoW as applicable if any by providing thirty (30) days prior written notice to the other Party. The Service Provider agrees to provide services to the respective ABFSSL/ ABC Companies during the notice period. However, in case of any termination for convenience by the respective ABFSSL/ABC Companies, they shall be liable to the Service Provider for all payment obligations as per the terms of the invoice.
Consequence of Termination:
In the event of termination of this Agreement or respective SoW by either Party, the Service Provider shall not be liable to refund any fees received by respective ABFSSL/ ABC Companies. 
In the event of termination of the Agreement by ABFSSL, the Respective ABC Companies agree that they shall pay Service Provideras per the terms of the invoice.
After the effective date of termination or expiry of this Agreement all the rights shall extinguish. However, it does not affect the rights, liabilities or obligations of any Party which have arisen on or before termination or which are expressly or impliedly to survive termination or expiry or the right to claim damages for breach of this Agreement.
The Service Provider agrees to provide handover of implementation services as per the applicable SOW either to ABFSSL or any other Service Provider as identified by ABFSSL for performance of the services under this Agreement.
The Service Provider shall not divulge any information relating to details of technical or service knowhow, administration and/or organizational matters pertaining to ABFSSL and its business or any other proprietary information which the Service Provider and/or any of its personnel or individual may gain knowledge by virtue of instant service arrangement hereof.
Termination of this Agreement shall automatically terminate all the respective SoWs to it.
Destruction of records in the manner specified by the ABFSSL.
The rights and obligations of the Parties which by their nature must survive termination or expiration of this Agreement in order to achieve its fundamental purposes including, without limitation, the provisions of the SECTIONS entitled “AUDIT,” “CONFIDENTIALITY”, “INDEMNITY,” “GOVERNING LAW & DISPUTE RESOLUTION,” and “TERMINATION” shall survive in perpetuity any termination of this Agreement.
In the event of termination or expiry of this Agreement in whole or in part or of any SoW hereunder, Service Provider may, at ABFSSL’s request, provide any termination assistance required to ensure the orderly transition of the Services to ABFSSL and/or the successor supplier at ABFSSL’s expense (hereinafter referred to as "Exit Assistance").  
REPRESENTATIONS & WARRANTIES:
Each Party represents and warrants to the other Party as on the Effective Date, that:
It has all the requisite power and authority to execute, deliver and perform this Agreement and the terms and conditions contained herein.
This Agreement has been validly executed and delivered and constitutes a legal, valid and binding obligation of such Party.
The execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement does not in any way conflict or violate any provision of law, rule, judgment, order or any other contract applicable to such Party.
Such Party is permitted and eligible to execute and perform this Agreement under the laws of the country of such Party.
It has no outstanding commitments, liabilities or obligations, contractual or otherwise, which would in any material respect conflict with or impede its ability and right to enter into this Agreement or fulfill any and all of its obligations hereunder, or to fulfill its duties and obligations contemplated herein.
It is not subject to any bankruptcy, reorganization, compulsory composition or dissolution proceeding, and has not explicitly suspended payment of any debt as it has become due except debts contested in good faith.
The Service Provider warrants that:
It has complied with and agrees to comply with all applicable laws, regulatory requirements, standards, guidelines and codes of practice as applicable to it from time to time, during the validity of this Agreement.
It will provide the services in good faith with due care, skill and diligence, in a professional and workmanlike manner in accordance with accepted standard practice and with the terms agreed on between the Parties as set out in this Agreement.
The Service Provider shall perform all the services as stipulated in the Agreement.
It shall ensure that it will adhere to the ABFSSL code of conduct, processes and policies of ABFSSL.
It shall not violate any proprietary and intellectual property rights of any third party, including without limitation, confidential relationships, patent, trade secrets, copyright and any other proprietary rights.
The execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement in accordance with its terms shall not breach or cause a default of its Memorandum and Articles of Association or under the terms and conditions of any documents, agreements or other writings to which it is a party.
The Service Provider shall also not use the employees for the purpose of utilizing for furtherance of your own business practice separately. 
There is no outstanding litigation, arbitration matter or other dispute or pending regulatory or statutory enquiries or show cause notices from any government or statutory or regulatory authority to which the Service Provider is a party which, if decided against the Service Provider, would reasonably be expected to have a material adverse effect on the Service Provider’s ability to fulfil its respective obligations under this Agreement or likely to adversely impact the brand or image of the Service Provider or ABC Companies as a Service Recipient, and the Service Provider shall notify ABFSSL immediately if the Service Provider becomes the subject of any such litigation, arbitration or dispute or enquiries or show cause notice.
The Service Provider shall not do and/or indulge in any activity, which shall adversely affect the business, brand and/or goodwill of other Party.
The Service Provider, your agents and representatives shall maintain strict confidentiality with regard to any information, documentation and data that comes into its knowledge.
Service Provider warrants that this Agreement does not conflict, breach or cause a default of the terms and conditions of any documents, agreements or other writings to which it is a Party.
Service Provider shall not issue any press release or make any other public announcement or communication regarding this Agreement nor the matters contained therein without obtaining the prior written consent of respective ABFSSL/ ABC Companies.
Service Provider shall provide services to ABFSSL on all days as stated into the applicable SOW.
