The Service Provider will obtain at its own expenses all Permits as required under Applicable Law.
ABFSSL/ ABC Companies reserves the right to alter instructions due to changes in requirement or any other reason. Such circumstances shall in no way affect or violate or alter the terms and conditions of this Agreement.  
It is agreed and understood by the Service Provider that ABFSSL/ ABC Companies shall not be liable, in any manner, for any damages or claim of whatever nature by reason of cancellation or termination of this Agreement for any reason, whatsoever.
The Service Provider shall be bound and comply with all orders and directions given by the ABFSSL/ ABC Companies and/or its officials and/ or authorized representatives, in pursuance of the powers conferred upon ABFSSL by this Agreement.
CONFIDENTIALITY:
The Service Provider agree that whether or not Confidential Information has been designated as “confidential”, the same shall be deemed to be confidential in nature. All Confidential Information shall remain the property of ABFSSL/ ABC Companies, as the case may be. The breach of this clause shall be construed as a material breach and ABFSSL/ ABC Companies shall have the right to terminate this Agreement forthwith in case of such material breach by the Service Provider. 
The Service Provider  hereby agrees:
to maintain and use the Confidential Information only for the purposes of this Agreement and only as permitted herein;
to only make copies as specifically authorized by the prior written consent of ABFSSL//ABFSSL Group Companies and with the same confidential or proprietary notices as may be printed or displayed on the original;
to restrict access and disclosure of Confidential Information to such of its personnel or individual, agents, and third parties on a "need to know" basis, and upon the execution of a written undertaking from such personnel or individual, agents, and third parties to maintain confidentiality of the Confidential Information disclosed to them.
The Service Provider shall not at any time now or in future either directly or indirectly, disclose, publish, or use Confidential Information without ABFSSL/ ABC Companies prior written consent; provided however, that the Service Provider may use and disclose Confidential Information personnel or individual, agents or advisors, who need to know such Confidential Information to the extent necessary for the purpose of performing its obligations hereunder. The Service Provider shall use high standard of care and discretion to avoid disclosure of Confidential Information. 
All information provided by ABFSSL/ ABC Companies to the Service Provider shall, at all times, remain the sole and exclusive property of ABFSSL/ ABC Companies. The Service Provider shall, immediately upon the termination or expiration of this Agreement, either return to ABFSSL/ ABC Companies all Confidential Information and all copies thereof held by it or if so directed by ABFSSL/ ABC Companies in writing, destroy the same and provide a certificate certifying that same is destroyed. ABFSSL/ ABC Companies may at its sole option, witness the destruction.
The Service Provider shall keep the consideration and all other terms and conditions of Agreement confidential, except to the extent required to be disclosed under Applicable Law. Any public statement concerning this Agreement or the relationship between Parties shall require the prior written approval of ABFSSL/ ABC Companies.
In the event that the Service Provider becomes legally compelled to disclose any Confidential Information to the government authority, the Service Provider shall give sufficient notice to ABFSSL/ ABC Companies to enable ABFSSL/ ABC Companies to prevent or minimize to the extent possible, such disclosure. The Service Provider shall not disclose to a third party any Confidential Information or the contents of this Agreement without the prior written consent of ABFSSL/ ABC Companies. 
The Parties acknowledge that it would be impractical for ABFSSL/ ABC Companies to monitor all information made available to the Service Provider / the Service Provider's personnel or individual under such circumstances and to provide notice to the Service Provider of the confidentiality of all such information. Therefore, the Service Provider agrees that any of ABFSSL/ ABC Companies technical or business information that the Service Provider’s personnel or individual, subcontractors, or agents acquire while on ABFSSL/ ABC Companies Premises shall be deemed Confidential Information
Service Provider shall not use any data whether of the ABFSSL, respective Group Companies for any reason for any other purpose than the purpose of carrying out the Services of this Agreement. 
This Section shall survive the termination of this Agreement for any reason.
INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS:
Except as expressly provided in this Agreement, the Parties agree that:
Each Party retains ownership of all intellectual property rights in any of its works that pre-exist or were developed outside of this Agreement, including any modifications or enhancements thereto (hereinafter referred to as "Pre-Existing IP").
Nothing herein shall give either Party any right, title or interest in any of the other Party’s intellectual property rights, or, except as provided herein, any right to use any of the other Party’s intellectual property rights in any manner
The Service Provider shall not use the trademark/logo of ABFSSL or ABC Companies for any purpose without prior written consent from ABFSSL.  
All ABFSSL intellectual property and any rights thereto made available to Service Provider by ABFSSL with respect to rendering Services under this Agreement shall solely and exclusively belong to ABFSSL. Service Provider or any of its employees, consultants and directors, shall not have any right or claim over such intellectual property. 
ABFSSL retains ownership of all materials, and the intellectual property rights in those materials, provided to Service Provider by or on behalf of ABFSSL (hereinafter referred to as “ABFSSL Materials”). The Service Provider agrees that the work products/deliverables/reports/ analysis/flow charts including but not limited to all information, reports, material of any nature whatsoever produced by or as result of any of the Services rendered hereunder (New/Derived Material) shall be the sole and exclusive property of ABFSSL. In furtherance thereof, the Service Provider thereby irrevocably grants, assigns, transfers to ABFSSL all rights, title and interest of any kind, in and to any work product produced hereunder including the New Material.
This clause shall survive the expiration/termination of the Agreement.
INDEMNITY:
The Service Provider will indemnify, defend, and hold harmless ABFSSL&ABC Companies and its respective officers, directors, employees, agents, successors, and assigns from and against all direct and actual, losses, damages, injury, liabilities, claims, actions, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys’ fees and court fees relating to, resulting from or in any way arising out of: 
Any breach of whole or any one of the provisions of this Agreement including the provisions for Representations and Warranties, Information and Data Security and Confidentiality Obligations under this Agreement by Service Provider or its personnel;
Non-adherence by the Service Provider and/or its personnel to the directives of the Company;
Acts of omission, negligence, willful misconduct, fraud, wrongful acts or commission by the Service Provider or/and its employees/agents in relation to providing the Services and or complying with the duties, responsibilities and obligations under this Agreement; 
Any penalty, fine, claim, sanction levied by any statutory, regulatory authority, quasi-judicial authority arising in relation to non-compliance/ violation by the Service Provider with any covenants set out in this Agreement, including non-compliance with the Applicable Laws;
Breach or contravention of the Applicable Laws, Regulations/Guidelines pertaining to IT, Information Security or Data Privacy laws;
Any third-party claims arising out of or related to Service Provider’s performance or failure to perform its obligations on the terms of this Agreement.
In the event of a breach by Service Provider and/or its personnel of this section, monetary damages may not be an adequate remedy; therefore, the Company shall be entitled to injunctive relief to restrain Service Provider from any breach, threatened or actual.  
Indemnification Procedures:
The Indemnified Party will promptly notify the Indemnifying Party in writing of any claim for which the Indemnified Party intends to seek indemnification pursuant to this Agreement. However, the Indemnified Party’s failure to so notify the Indemnifying Party does not relieve the Indemnifying Party of its obligation to indemnify the Indemnified Party under this Agreement except to the extent that the Indemnifying Party can demonstrate (i) damages to the Indemnifying Party attributable to such failure; or (ii) impact in the defense of such claim due to such failure.
The Indemnifying Party will, to the extent practicable, promptly notify the Indemnified Party in writing, but not less than twenty (20) days before the date on which any response to a complaint or summons is due if the Indemnifying Party elects to assume control of the defense and settlement of a claim (a “Notice of Election”)
If the Indemnifying Party delivers a Notice of Election relating to any claim within the required notice period, then the Indemnifying Party is entitled to have sole control over the defense and settlement of such claim. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Indemnified Party is entitled to participate in the defense of such claim and to employ counsel at its own expense to assist in the defense of such claim.
If the Indemnifying Party does not deliver a Notice of Election relating to any claim within the required notice period, but not less than twenty (20)days of receipt of notification from the Indemnified Party, then the Indemnified Party is entitled to defend the claim in such manner as the Indemnified Party may reasonably deem appropriate until such time as the Indemnifying Party delivers a Notice of Election and assumes the defense. 
The provisions of this Section set forth the entire obligation of the Indemnifying Party, and the Indemnifying Party’s sole remedies, with respect to any claim or matter related to this Section.
The provisions of this clause shall survive the termination/expiry of this Agreement for a period of one (1) year.
INSPECTION & RIGHT TO AUDIT:
Subject to a prior written notice of 45 days, ABFSSL/ ABC Companies or its External Professional Advisors or its Regulators, mayhave the right from time to time to: 
conduct audits, inspection and investigation of Service Provider solely in relation to the services provided under the scope of the applicable SOW (or Softcell’s representatives as applicable);
examine the books, records, information, systems and the internal control environment in the service provider (or its representative and subcontractors as applicable), to the extent that they relate to the service being performed for the ABFSSL/ ABC Companies.
access redacted versions of any internal audit reports or external audit findings of the Service Provider that concern the service being performed for the respective ABFSSL/ ABC Companies.
The Parties shall conduct such audit on a mutually agreed date and develop a procedure for smooth conduct of audit and regulatory findings related to the provision or receipt of the services under this Agreement. 
GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE:
The Service Provider &ABFSSL shall jointly form a Governance Committee to inter-alia review the performance of the services to be delivered and decide upon related matters including disputes, if any and penalties under this Agreement or respective SoW. The Governance Committee shall comprise of the following members:
DISPUTE RESOLUTION & GOVERNING LAW:
In the event of any dispute between the Parties, including but not limited to interpretation of this Agreement or any matter arising out of its activities under this Agreement, the parties to the dispute will endeavour in the first instance to settle the dispute amicably through the Governance Committee constituted as stated in the above clause on a good faith basis.
In the event such dispute is not settled by the Governance Committee within thirty (30) days of the commencement of the discussions, the dispute shall be referred to and be resolved by sole mediator appointed through Centre for Mediation and Conciliation (CMC, Mumbai-Bombay Chamber of Commerce) and such mediation shall be conducted in accordance with applicable Rules. The cost of mediation shall be equally borne by the Parties to the dispute.
In the event such dispute is not settled by mediation between the Parties within thirty (30) days from the commencement of the mediation, the dispute shall be referred to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Mumbai and governed by the laws of India. 
In the event of any dispute arising out of or in connection to this Agreement or any SoW executed between the Service Provider and ABC Companies (as Service recipients), then the parties executing the SoW shall be the only parties to such dispute and it shall be resolved between them in accordance with the provisions given under this Agreement.
Any dispute arising out of or in connection to this Agreement or any SoW signed between the Service Provider and any ABFSSL/ ABC Companies (as Service recipients) would not impact the Service(s) provided by the Service Provider to the other ABFSSL Group Companies (as Service recipients) not being parties to that dispute along with the payment obligations.
Each Party shall bear its own cost of bear its own cost of preparing and presenting its case.
CHANGE IN BUSINESS CIRCUMSTANCES:
The Service Provider and ABFSSL understand and agree that ABFSSL’s resource and service requirements may be subject to significant variation as a result of growth, reduction or other changes in their business, including but not limited to variation due to: 
mergers, acquisitions or divestitures; 
a general economic slowdown, downturn or upturn;
changes in ABFSSL’s clients, markets or products served by ABFSSL, operational or market priorities, or locations where ABFSSL operates, or methods of ABFSSL product/service delivery; or
material changes in applicable Laws, business re-organisation or organisational structure, (hereinafter collectively referred as “Material Adverse Event”). Upon the occurrence of any such Material Adverse Event, ABFSSL shall notify the Service Provider with 45 days advance writtennotice in writing setting out the details of the Material Adverse Event. 
Upon occurrence of any such Material Adverse Event that may impact the resource or service requirement, ABFSSL shall have the right to initiate suitable negotiation and subject to mutual agreement between the Parties, modify or adjust the terms and payment terms (including minimum business norms if any applicable) of the MSA or the respective SoW as the case may for the remaining tenure of the Agreement to reflect such revised understanding of the Parties for the Services due to such change in business circumstances.In the event of a Material Adverse Event, Service Provider shall have the right to terminate this MSA or the applicable SoW, and ABFSSL shall reimburse the Service Provider for all services as per the agreed terms of the invoice up to the date of such termination.
FORCE MAJEURE:
“Force Majeure” for the purpose of this Agreement shall mean any acts of God, including but not limited to storm, flood, earthquake, lightning, cyclone, landslides or other natural disasters, explosions or fires, strikes, lockout, lockdown, work to rule actions, or similar labour disturbances or other labour action by workers or employees of either Party, public disorder, insurrection, sabotage, rebellion, riots, terrorism, cyberattacks beyond the reasonable control of the Parties or violent demonstrations of a local, regional or national character at the mine or at any place where the Agreement or part thereof is to be performed, the outbreak of an epidemic, pandemic, or other communicable disease in any place where the Agreement or part thereof is to be performed, any order (including lock down orders), regulation, directive, requirement from any Governmental, legislative, executive or judicial authority or a change in law.
Neither of the Parties to this Agreement shall be liable or responsible for any failure to perform or delay in performance of their respective obligations hereunder, when such failure or delay is due or attributable to or arises out of, any Force Majeure Event, provided a notice of occurrence of any Force Majeure Event is promptly given to the other Party;
If Force Majeure event continues for a period of more than thirty (30) days’ then ABFSSL and Service Provider shall have the right to immediately terminate this Agreement and the respective SoW(s).
SUB-CONTRACTING:
Service Provider shall not appoint any subcontractors for providing the Services without prior written approval of ABFSSL/ ABC Companies. Service Provider shall ensure that subcontractor so appointed acts at all times in consonance with all the terms of this Agreement and that the terms of the agreement or arrangements between the Service Provider and the subcontractor do not in any manner contradict or conflict with the terms of this Agreement. Engagement of subcontractor shall not absolve the Service Provider of its responsibilities under this Agreement.
Service Provider confirms that it is their sole responsibility towards all the obligations of sub-contractors including making payments to sub-contractor and simultaneously Service Provider also confirms that ABFSSL/ ABC Companies are not liable to any such obligations towards sub-contractor. Service Provider shall indemnify against all claims if any raised by sub-contractor towards ABFSSL/ ABC Companies.
Service Provider shall on regular basis provide confirmation with proof to ABFSSL/ ABC Companies regarding making payments to sub-contractor and shall also provide any other details if required by ABFSSL/ ABC Companies from time to time.
AMENDMENT & WAIVER: This Agreement may be amended, modified or supplemented only by a written instrument executed by each of the Parties and no waiver of any provision of this Agreement shall be effective unless set forth in a written instrument executed by the Party waiving such provision.
DELAYS & PENALTIES:
The Service Provider acknowledges that time is the essence of this Agreement and undertakes to perform the Services strictly in accordance with the details provided in Annexure below. This clause shall not be applicable for delays that are solely attributable to the OEM.
BUSINESS CONTINUITY PLANNING:
Service Provider represents that it has requisite Business Continuity Planning and Disaster Recovery Process in place to ensure uninterrupted Services to ABFSSL/ ABC Companies and shall also provide all reasonable assistance to the Company in its Business Continuity Planning procedures. In case of disruption of services due to any force majeure, Service Provider shall start the provision of Services from alternate locations or through an alternate Service Provider immediately, or as per the agreed terms between both the parties. In case of disruption of services due to any Force Majeure, Service Provider shall start the provision of Services from an alternate location within a period of thirty (30) days from the commencement of the Force Majeure Event. Service Provider’s use of any alternate locations or Service Provider shall not increase ABFSSL/ ABC Companies costs for such services. However, in case such event continues to exist for a continuous period of one (1) month or more either party will have a right to terminate the agreement as per the provisions of this agreement. 
Any breach under this clause shall give ABFSSL/ ABC Companies an option to terminate with prior written notice of thirty (30) days to Service Provider and all consequences of termination shall follow. The provisions of this clause will survive the termination of this Agreement.

clauses.original_text:
The Service Provider agrees that they have an incident reporting systems in place which would identify the criticality of incident including but not limited to breach of confidentiality data and intimate immediately within twenty-four (24) hours to ABFSSL/ ABC Companies. Service Provider shall on regular basis share and intimate ABFSSL/ ABC Companies of the maintenance of the system and shall also on the steps they have taken to remediate further incidents. 
NON-SOLICITATION: Notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement, during the term of this Agreement, each Party to this Agreement and the parties signing the respective SoWs agree not to hire as its own employee or consultant, any employee or consultant of the other party to the SoW who is directly involved in the delivery or receipt of services under that SoW.
ENTIRE AGREEMENT: This Agreement constitutes the whole agreement between the Parties relating to the subject matter hereof and supersedes any prior agreements or understanding relating to such subject matter.
SEVERABILITY: If any provision or portion of a provision of this Agreement is held invalid or unenforceable, the remainder of the Agreement shall not be affected, and the remaining terms will continue in effect and be binding on the Parties.
ASSIGNMENT: 
Neither Party shall assign to any third party, this Agreement, or any part thereof, or any rights, benefits, obligations or interests herein, except with prior written consent of the other Party.
In the event that either of the Party is acquired, merged, amalgamated, reconstituted, consolidated or otherwise subject to corporate or capital restructuring by or with any other entity then this Agreement shall be binding on the acquirer or the Resultant Entity formed as a result of such restructuring for the remainder of the term of this Agreement without any change in terms of agreement.
COVENANTS REASONABLE: The Parties agree that, having regard to all the circumstances, the covenants contained herein are reasonable and necessary for the protection of the Parties and their investments. If any such covenant is held to be void the covenant will apply with such minimum modifications regarding its scope and duration as may be necessary to make it valid and effective.

clauses.original_text:
Words importing persons or parties shall include firms and corporations and any organizations having legal capacity.
Words importing the singular include the plural and vice versa.
The headings and titles in this Agreement are for reference only and shall not affect the interpretation or construction hereof.
Reference to the words “include” or “including” shall be construed without limitation.
Any reference to “writing” shall include printing, typing, facsimile, lithography, transmissions by facsimile or in electronic form (including email) and other means of reproducing words in visible form but shall exclude text messages via mobile phones.
References to this Agreement include any SOW, Recitals and Annexures to it and references to Clauses, Annexure are to the clauses of, and annexures to, this Agreement. References to paragraphs are to paragraphs of the Annexures. 
Reference to this Agreement or any other agreement, instrument, or document shall be construed as a reference to this Agreement or such other agreement, instrument, or document as the same may from time to time be amended, varied, supplemented or novated in accordance with the terms of such document.
Any reference to books, records or other information means books, records or other information in any form including, without limitation, paper, electronically stored data, magnetic media, film and microfilm. 
Reference to any statute or statutory provision shall include: (i) any previous legislation or statute relating to that statute or statutory provision to the extent applicable under the relevant Clause or Annexure; (ii) any subordinate legislation, rules and regulations under the specific statute or statutory provision framed from time to time; and (iii) such statute or provision as may be amended, modified, repealed, re-enacted or consolidated.
Reference to Applicable Law shall include laws as may from time to time be enacted amended, supplemented, or re-enacted.
In the event of any disagreement or dispute between the Parties, regarding the materiality or reasonableness of any matter as set out in the Agreement including of any event, occurrence, circumstance, change, fact, information, document, authorization, proceeding, act, omission, claims, breach, default or otherwise, the opinion of ICICI Bank, as to the materiality or reasonableness of any of the foregoing shall prevail.
Time is of essence in the performance of Parties’ respective obligations.

ICICI Bank may, by giving written notice to the Service Provider at any time during the Term, request a change to the Services (“Change Request”).
On receipt of a Change Request from ICICI Bank, the Service Provider shall provide ICICI Bank with a Change Proposal in the format specified under Annexure II, which shall consist of a written estimate of:
any increase or decrease in the price payable to effect such change;
brief details of the likely impact, if any, of the Change Request on any existing Services; 
statement of the cost of the implementation and/or ongoing operation of the relevant change, including any increase of or reduction in the fees or additional fees payable for the proposed change; and
a timeline for the implementation, together with any proposals for acceptance, of the Change Request.
[Notwithstanding the other provisions of this Clause 3, if any changes are necessary to respond to an emergency situation that will materially affect the provision of the Services or the Software, and ICICI Bank believes it is not reasonably practical to agree to the contents of that change in advance in accordance with the foregoing provisions, then:
ICICI Bank will notify the Service Provider of the need for an urgent change;
the Service Provider will immediately or as soon as reasonably practicable make that change; and 
the Service Provider will document the change as soon as possible.]
The timelines pertaining to the acceptance, rejection, implementation (if any) with respect to a Change Request shall be detailed in the relevant SOW.

The Service Provider shall ensure that in order to account for Virus based contingencies, it shall maintain a back-up of the Confidential Information.
The Service Provider will ensure that the Services are provided in strict compliance with the internal cyber and security policies of ICICI Bank as communicated to the Service Provider in writing from time to time and that no forms of Viruses or Vulnerabilities are introduced into ICICI Bank’s network and information systems via the Services or Software or any computer system, database, software, equipment, web site, or processes used to provide the Services.
If a Virus or Vulnerability is found to have been introduced into any environment/system as described above, the Service Provider shall within [●] business days notify ICICI Bank in writing of the introduction and at no additional charge to ICICI Bank, assist ICICI Bank in reducing the effects of the Virus or Vulnerability and if the Virus or Vulnerability causes an interruption of the Services, a loss of operational efficiency or loss of data, assist ICICI Bank to the same extent to mitigate and restore such losses.

clauses.original_text:
The Service Provider shall comply with the requirements contained under the relevant SOW on Service Levels. Service Levels and the mechanisms to baseline and measure them will be defined in under the relevant SOW and will be effective and enforced from the commencement date of the Services as specified under the relevant SOW.
Service Levels are priority levels assigned to any issues including but not limited to interruptions, delays, and errors affecting the functionality of the Software (collectively, "Errors") based on urgency, number of users affected, type and extent of service disrupted and availability of a workaround or fall-back. When an Error is communicated to the Service Provider, ICICI Bank shall assign the severity level of the Error based on the severity definitions listed below. ICICI Bank reserves the right to re-classify the severity levels if the needs arise.
If, for any reason, the Service Provider is not able to perform the Services, or meet the agreed standards and service levels as specified under the relevant SOW, the Service Provider shall:
notify ICICI Bank immediately of such failure;
deploy all additional resources and take all remedial action that is necessary to rectify or to prevent the failure of the Service Level from recurring.
within 3 (three) business days or any other timeline more particularly identified in the SOW, the Service Provider will be required to perform and provide to ICICI Bank a root-cause analysis for any incident that would contribute to the Service Provider missing a service level.
If there is a failure of Service Levels, the Service Provider shall pay or credit to the Service Provider service level credits in accordance with the relevant SOW in recognition of the diminished value of the Services resulting from the Service Provider’s failure to meet the agreed upon level of performance. 
Service Level Review: The Service Provider, on a  basis, will be responsible for implementing and operating all measurement and monitoring tools and procedures required by ICICI Bank to measure and report its performance relative to the applicable Service Levels The Service Level measurement, monitoring and reporting process will be subject to audit from time to time as required by ICICI Bank. Both Parties will meet once in a to review the performance in relation to Service Levels. Any revisions, deletions or additions to the Service Levels will be decided mutually between the Parties.

clauses.original_text:
ICICI Bank Materials:
ICICI Bank shall be the sole and exclusive owner of the following (collectively referred to as “ICICI Bank Materials”) and Service Provider shall obtain no right, title or interest herein:
All Materials owned by ICICI Bank as of Effective Date and thereafter;
All Materials acquired by/licensed to ICICI Bank from third parties before or after Effective Date;
All Materials developed by the Service Provider or its subcontractors (including Materials jointly developed with ICICI Bank) under the Agreement and all modifications, enhancements and derivative works of such Materials.
ICICI Bank may grant to the Service Provider a limited, non-exclusive license during the Term to use, operate, access, copy, maintain, modify, enhance and create derivative works of ICICI Bank Materials for the sole purpose of providing the Services. However, all such modified, enhanced, derivative work of the ICICI Bank Materials shall be exclusive property of ICICI Bank and the Service Provider shall have no claim over the same. 
Upon prior written confirmation of ICICI Bank and subject to terms therein, the Service Provider may use ICICI Bank Materials only for the purpose of discharging its obligations under this Agreement or SOW and may not sublicense any rights with respect to ICICI Bank Materials.
Service Provider Materials:
The Service Provider will retain all rights in and shall be the exclusive owner of Materials independently developed and/or owned by the Service Provider outside the scope of Services under this Agreement and SOW, and used by the Service Provider in connection with the Services (“Service Provider Materials”). Service Provider shall seek prior written permission from ICICI Bank to introduce the same for the Services under this Agreement. 
The Service Provider will describe its procedure for the use of Service Provider Materials for the Services to be provided to ICICI Bank under the Agreement and/ or SOW.
Upon introduction of any Service Provider Materials in providing the Services, the Service Provider will grant ICICI Bank [and its Affiliates], at no additional fee or cost, a non-exclusive, sub-licensable, world-wide, irrevocable, perpetual license to use, operate, copy, maintain, modify, enhance and create derivative works of such Materials.
Third Party Materials:
The Service Provider shall seek prior written approval from ICICI Bank to introduce any third-party Materials in connection with the Services.

clauses.original_text:
The Service Provider shall give ICICI Bank months prior written notice, should it decide to discontinue any of the Services detailed in the relevant SOW and the Parties shall mutually agree on the steps to be undertaken as a result of such discontinuation of Services detailed in the relevant SOW.
The Service Provider shall comply with the terms and conditions specified in this Agreement and all other Transaction Documents and also ensure compliance with the Transaction Documents by its personnel and relevant persons who are party to, or have executed or furnished, the Transaction Documents.
The Service Provider shall adhere to the Best Industry Practice in the performance of the Services.
The Service Provider shall segregate and keep separately all information, documents, properties, assets, monies and records pertaining to the Services, ICICI Bank and customers of ICICI Bank and also hold the same in trust for ICICI Bank and customers of ICICI Bank.
The Service Provider shall exercise the same high standard of care in the provision of Services as would be exercised by ICICI Bank if the activities were conducted within ICICI Bank and not outsourced.
The Service Provider shall, at its own costs, undertake all repair, replacement, upgradation or procurement of equipment and infrastructural facilities necessary for the provision of Services.
The Service Provider shall regularly provide updates to ICICI Bank with respect to the provision of the Services and shall meet with the officials designated by ICICI Bank to discuss and review the performance of the Service Provider at such intervals as may be agreed between the Parties.
The Service Provider shall preserve and maintain the documents, data and records in relation to the Services in accordance with the Applicable Laws and as per directions of ICICI Bank in writing in this regard. The Service Provider shall furnish all such records, data and documents as may be required by ICICI Bank.
The Service Provider shall 
comply with all applicable laws, regulations, legal and statutory requirements related to anti-bribery and anti-corruption including but without limitation to the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988, of India, Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA) in the United States of America and UK Bribery Act, 2010 of United Kingdom, as any of the foregoing may be amended or enacted from time to time (“Anti-Corruption Laws”)
notify, in writing, ICICI Bank, of all incidents of fraud, bribery (including Anti-Corruption Laws), suspicious transactions including fraudulent / suspicious currency transactions immediately upon occurrence of such incidents.
The Service Provider warrants and agrees that it shall not, [and shall cause its Affiliates not to,]  make, offer, promise, or authorize any unlawful payment or give, offer, promise, or authorize the giving of anything of value to any official, officer, employee, or representative of, or any  person acting in an official capacity for or on behalf of, any government or governmental authority, or any candidate for political office (each, a “Government Official”) for the purpose of influencing any act or decision of such Government Official in connection with the Agreement, and that neither it [nor any of its Affiliates] have done so.
The Service Provider shall, forthwith upon any change in the constitutional documents of the Service Provider, inform ICICI Bank of such change and provide such details in respect of the change and its effect, as may be required by ICICI Bank.

clauses.original_text:
ICICI Bank shall have a paramount charge, lien and right of set off on all monies payable, to the Service Provider or standing to the credit of the Service Provider with ICICI Bank or any of Affiliates of ICICI Bank against all or any sums which the Service Provider is liable to pay under this Agreement and/or the other Transaction Documents or in respect of any other arrangement entered into by the Service Provider with ICICI Bank. In the event that there remains any amount due from the Service Provider to ICICI Bank under the Agreement or otherwise, the monies payable to the Service Provider or standing to the credit of the Service Provider shall be applied first towards the outstanding amount owed by the Service Provider to ICICI Bank under the Agreement, the Transaction Documents or any other agreement or facilities and the Service Provider consents, confirms and agrees to execute all such documents in this regard.
ICICI Bank and the RBI or persons authorised by the RBI, shall at all times during the tenure of the Agreement, be entitled to access the Service Provider’s documents, records of transactions, and other necessary information given to, stored or processed by the Service Provider.
The rights available to ICICI Bank under the Agreement and the other Transaction Documents may be exercised by ICICI Bank either by itself or through such other persons as it may nominate, designate or specify from time to time.

clauses.clause_title: BUSINESS CONTINUITY PLAN AND DISASTER RECOVERY
clauses.original_text:
Service Provider shall maintain plans for business continuity, disaster recovery, and backup capabilities and facilities designed to ensure Service Provider’s continued performance of its obligations under this Agreement, including, without limitation, loss of production, loss of systems, loss of equipment, failure of carriers and the failure of Service Provider’s or its supplier’s equipment, computer systems or business systems (“Business Continuity Plan”). 
Such Business Continuity Plan shall be reviewed and updated as suggested by ICICI Bank from time to time. The Service Provider shall test the Business Continuity Plan as specified in the relevant SOW or as specified by ICICI Bank from time to time. 
The Business Continuity Plan shall include, but shall not be limited to, testing, accountability and corrective actions designed to be promptly implemented, if necessary. In addition, in the event that Service Provider has knowledge of an incident affecting the integrity or availability of such Business Continuity Plan, then Service Provider shall, as promptly as practicable, but no later than as advised by ICICI Bank in writing (or sooner to the extent required by Applicable Law) after Service Provider becomes aware of such incident, notify ICICI Bank in writing of such incident and provide the ICICI Bank with updates, as deemed appropriate by Service Provider under the circumstances, with respect to the status of all related remediation efforts in connection with such incident. 
The Service Provider represents that, as of the date of this Agreement, such Business Continuity Plan is active and functioning normally in all respects.
ICICI Bank shall be entitled to intervene and take such appropriate measures (including appointing another person to provide the Services or the possibility of bringing the outsourced activity back in-house) in the event the performance of the Services by the Service Provider are interrupted for any reasons whatsoever.

Notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement, if ICICI Bank is of the opinion that such change of Control has an adverse effect on the operations of ICICI Bank, then ICICI Bank has the right to terminate this Agreement immediately.

clauses.original_text:
Commencing at the beginning of any applicable Termination Assistance Period, if requested by ICICI Bank, the Service Provider shall at no additional cost to ICICI Bank provide services that are reasonably required to allow the Services to continue without interruption. Such provision shall include the facilitation of the orderly transfer of the Services to ICICI Bank or any of its nominees, assistance as described under this Clause 23, and any additional requirements as may be necessary (“Termination Assistance”).

The Service Provider acknowledges that, in the event it breaches (or attempts or threatens to breach) its obligation to provide Termination Assistance as provided in this Clause 23, ICICI Bank and its Affiliates will be irreparably harmed. In such an event, ICICI Bank may proceed directly to court to obtain the appropriate equitable remedies, including any appropriate order for specific performance.
Objectives: The purpose of Termination Assistance is:
to enable the Service Provider to cease providing the Services or such part thereof which are to be terminated, and for ICICI Bank or its nominee, from the expiry of the Termination Assistance Period, to undertake services in substitution (the “Replacement Services”); and
to eliminate or minimise any disruption or deterioration of the Services, or failure to achieve the Service Levels, during and as a result of the handover from the Service Provider and the commencement of the Replacement Services.
The timelines, process, and procedure for Termination Assistance shall be detailed in the relevant SOW.
The Service Provider agrees that the provisions of this Clause shall not limit or restrict nor shall they preclude ICICI Bank from pursuing such further and other legal actions, against the Service Provider for any breach or non-compliance of the terms of this Agreement.

clauses.original_text:
The Service Provider shall treat as confidential all Confidential Information of ICICI Bank supplied under this Agreement. The Service Provider shall not divulge any such Confidential Information to any person except to its own employees, sub-contractors, and consultants who need to know it solely for the purpose of performing their obligations or providing the Services under this Agreement.
The Service Provider shall execute appropriate agreements with each such employee, sub-contractor, and consultant that contain obligations detailed in this Clause and is in a form and manner approved or acceptable to ICICI Bank.
The Service Provider acknowledges and agrees that it is aware of the sensitivity and banking secrecy obligations of ICICI Bank in keeping the customer information and transaction records confidential and shall ensure that neither the Service Provider nor any of its employees, sub-contractors, and consultant will do any act violating the same.
The Service Provider will, at all times, maintain confidentiality regarding the contents of this Agreement and any business, technical or financial information that is, at the time of disclosure, designated in writing as confidential, or would be understood by Parties, exercising reasonable and prudent business judgment, to be confidential.
The Service Provider agrees to protect the proprietary information of the other with the same standard of care and procedures used by themselves to protect their own proprietary information of similar importance but at all times using at least a reasonable degree of care.
The provisions of this Clause shall survive the termination of this Agreement.
DATA PROTECTION, SECURITY, INTEGRITY, AND EXPORT OF DATA
The Service Provider undertakes that it shall comply with all applicable requirements of data protection rules, laws, notifications, and guidelines in force, including but not limited to the Information Technology Act, 2000 and all rules thereunder and all applicable notifications and orders issued by the RBI from time to time.
ICICI Bank shall be entitled to review and monitor the security practices and control processes of the Service Provider on a regular basis. The Service Provider shall immediately and in any case within  hours notify ICICI Bank of any breach or potential breach of security and leakage of any information including Confidential Information. The Service Provider shall be liable for all damages arising out of such breach of security.
The Service Provider shall, in relation to any of the ICICI Bank’s Confidential Information processed in connection with the performance by the Service Provider of its obligations under this Agreement:
maintain complete and accurate records and information to demonstrate its compliance with this Clause; 
[not transfer or export any of the ICICI Bank’s Confidential Information out of India;] 
notify ICICI Bank without undue delay on becoming aware of any breach of ICICI Bank’s Confidential Information;
ensure that it has in place appropriate technical and organisational measures, reviewed and approved by ICICI Bank, to protect against unauthorised or unlawful processing of the ICICI Bank’s Confidential Information and against accidental loss or destruction of, or damage to, ICICI Bank’s Confidential Information, appropriate to the harm that might result from the unauthorised or unlawful processing or accidental loss, destruction or damage and the nature of the data to be protected, having regard to the state of technological development and the cost of implementing any measures (those measures may include, where appropriate, pseudonymising and encrypting ICICI Bank’s Confidential Information, ensuring confidentiality, integrity, availability and resilience of its systems and services, ensuring that availability of and access to ICICI Bank’s Confidential Information can be restored in a timely manner after an incident, and regularly assessing and evaluating the effectiveness of the technical and organisational measures adopted by it).
ICICI Bank and/or the RBI shall be entitled to review and monitor the security practices and control processes of the Service Provider on a regular basis.
ensure that the details of the transfer of any Confidential Information are provided to ICICI Bank in the form and manner as set out in Annexure III to this Agreement.

clauses.clause_title: WHEREAS, Estee Lauder may disclose to Supplier certain infor...
clauses.original_text:
WHEREAS, Estee Lauder may disclose to Supplier certain information deemed proprietary and confidential by Estee Lauder which relates to Estee Lauder’s products or to Estee Lauder’s business and information systems, process and related needs (“Estee Lauder Information”): and
WHEREAS, Supplier is in the business of                                          to its customers, and may disclose to Estee Lauder proprietary information and/or trade secrets pertaining to Supplier’s service offering, documentation, business strategies, business data, marketing plans and customers, systems and operations and related materials for the purpose of Estee Lauder evaluating and considering Supplier’s service offerings; and
WHEREAS, the purpose of such disclosures of confidential and proprietary information is to facilitate discussions regarding a potential relationship between the Parties or to help Estee Lauder evaluate its interest in Supplier’s service offering (“Services”) (collectively, the “Potential Relationship”);
NOW, THEREFORE, the Parties hereby agree as follows:
CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION.
For the purpose of this NDA, “Confidential Information” shall be deemed to include all information and materials, identified as confidential by the disclosing Party or that by their nature or the circumstances surrounding their disclosure should be reasonably regarded as confidential,  furnished by either Party to the other in connection with the Potential Relationship, regardless of form, including,  but not limited to, all proprietary information, computer programs, customer and prospect lists, trade secrets, trade names or proposed trade names, algorithms, know-how, formulas, inventions (whether patentable or not), ideas, concepts, designs, drawings, flow charts, diagrams and other intellectual property,  business information and technical information of the Parties.
PROTECTION OF CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION.
Each Party acknowledges that it is receiving such Confidential Information in confidence and will not publish, copy, or disclose any Confidential Information other than to those employees with a need to know such Confidential Information in order to perform their duties and who are under a written obligation to keep information such as the Confidential Information confidential. The Parties acknowledge that they will only use the Confidential Information within their own organization to the extent necessary to determine whether the Parties may have an interest in entering into a further business relationship.  Furthermore, the Parties will use their best efforts, and at least the same efforts they would use to prevent unauthorized disclosure of their own confidential information, and in any case, not less than reasonable efforts to prevent disclosure of the Confidential Information to any third party.  Without the prior consent of the other Party, a Party shall not disclose to any third party, any information (including Confidential Information) regarding the Potential Relationship, including without limitation the fact that discussions are occurring concerning the Potential Relationship, any of the terms or conditions relating to the Potential Relationship being discussed by the Parties, or the existence of this NDA.  Notwithstanding the foregoing, the receiving Party may disclose the disclosing Party’s Confidential Information to its accountants, lawyers and other professional advisors who have a need to know provided such advisors are under a written obligation to hold such Confidential Information in strict confidence with such writing having terms substantially restrictive as those in this NDA.   The receiving Party shall remain liable for any improper use or misappropriation of the disclosing Party’s Confidential Information by any such employees, accountants, lawyers and other professional advisors. 
3. OBLIGATIONS TERMINATED.
The obligations of paragraph #2 shall terminate with respect to any particular portion of Confidential Information which:
(a) was in the public domain at the time of the disclosing Party's communication thereof to the receiving Party;
(b) entered the public domain through no fault of the receiving Party subsequent to the time of the disclosing Party's communication thereof to the receiving Party;
(c) was in a receiving Party’s possession free of any obligation of confidence at the time of the disclosing Party's communication thereof to the receiving Party;
(d) was rightfully communicated by a third party who had the right to disclose such information to a receiving Party free of any obligation of confidence subsequent to the time of the disclosing Party's communication thereof to the receiving Party;
(e) was developed by employees or agents of a receiving Party independently of and without reference to any Confidential Information or other information that the disclosing Party has disclosed in confidence to the receiving Party;
(f) is approved for release to the receiving Party by written authorization of the disclosing Party; 
(g) is required to be disclosed pursuant to any statute, law, rule or regulation of any governmental authority or pursuant to any order of any court of competent jurisdiction, but in any case, the disclosing Party will be notified by the receiving Party before disclosure and given a reasonable opportunity to obtain a protective order or other form of protection.
4. ACTION FOR BREACH.
The receiving Party will notify the disclosing Party immediately upon discovery of the possession, use or knowledge of any Confidential Information by any third party not authorized to possess, use or have such Confidential Information and will cooperate in every reasonable way to help the disclosing Party regain possession of the Confidential Information and prevent further breach.
The receiving Party acknowledges and agrees that due to the unique nature of the disclosing Party’s Confidential Information, there may be no adequate remedy at law for any breach of its obligations hereunder, which breach may result in irreparable harm to the disclosing Party, and therefore, that upon any such breach or any threat thereof, the disclosing Party will be entitled, without waiving any other rights or remedies, to seek such injunctive or equitable relief as may be deemed proper by a court of competent jurisdiction.
5. NO RIGHTS, INTEREST OR JOINT VENTURE.
Confidential Information shall remain the sole property of the disclosing Party and nothing in this NDA is intended to grant any right or interest by license or otherwise, under any patent, copyright, trademark, service mark trade name, trade secret or other intellectual property right of the disclosing Party. This NDA is not intended to and shall not be construed as: (i) creating a joint venture, partnership or other form of business association between the Parties, or (ii) creating any obligation on the part of either Party to retain the Services or to compensate the other Party in any manner, except as may be set forth by a separate written agreement duly executed and delivered by the Parties.
6. OWNERSHIP OF MATERIALS.
The Parties agree that all originals and copies of any Confidential Information remain the property of the disclosing Party.  The Parties shall reproduce all copyright and other proprietary notices, in the same form that they appear on all the materials provided by the disclosing Party to the receiving Party, on all copies of the Confidential Information made by the receiving Party.  Each Party agrees to return or destroy all originals and copies of Confidential Information, as well as all materials containing the Confidential Information to the disclosing Party at the disclosing Party’s request, except that one copy of the Confidential Information may be retained by receiving Party solely to enable the receiving Party to ascertain its rights and obligations in the event of a dispute hereunder. 
7. ASSIGNMENT, TRANSFER AND GOVERNING LAW.
The rights and obligations of the Parties hereunder shall not be sold, assigned, or otherwise transferred by either Party without the express written consent of both Parties. The validity, interpretation and enforceability of this NDA shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of INDIA . any dispute between the Parties arising from or relating to the application or interpretation or breach of this Agreement shall be subject to the Courts of competent jurisdiction of Mumbai alone to the exclusion of all other courts in India.
8. INTEGRATION.
This NDA supersedes any and all agreements of confidentiality that may have been executed between the Parties.  
Any notices, requests, demands, and other communications hereunder shall be deemed given by certified mail, return receipt requested or nationally recognized over night courier upon verification of receipt to the addresses listed above or such other address as either Party may notify the other.  Such notification shall be in writing.  
If any provision of this NDA is found to be unenforceable, the remainder shall be enforced as fully as possible and the unenforceable provisions shall be deemed modified to the limited extent required to permit its’ enforcement in a manner most closely representing the intention of the Parties as expressed herein, and all of the remaining terms shall nonetheless survive in full force and effect.  
The failure of either Party to enforce any right resulting from breach of any provision of this NDA by the other Party shall not be deemed a waiver of any right relating to a subsequent breach of such provision or of any right hereunder. 
The disclosing Party disclaims all warranties regarding all Confidential Information disclosed pursuant to this NDA, including but not limited to all warranties regarding the accuracy or utility of such Confidential Information.  
With respect to any equipment, component, software, or other items delivered to the receiving Party by the disclosing Party, the receiving Party agrees not to copy, reverse engineer, decompile, disassemble or otherwise analyze the physical construction of any such items, and not to export or re-export (within the meaning of India or other export control laws or regulations) any such items or products thereof.
This NDA constitutes the complete and entire agreement between the Parties with regard to the subject matter and may be amended only as by instrument in writing specifying it as an amendment to this NDA executed by the Parties hereto and there are no understandings, agreements or representations expressed or implied not specified herein.
9. TERM AND TERMINATION.
This NDA shall be effective from the Effective Date as stated above and shall continue in effect until terminated by a party giving thirty (30) days written notice to the other party.  Notwithstanding termination or expiration of this NDA, any disclosing Party’s Confidential Information disclosed hereunder shall be protected in accordance with this NDA for so long as the disclosing Party’s Confidential Information is in the possession of or under the control of the receiving Party. 
IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have duly executed this NDA on the date signed below.
Company Name: ELCA Cosmetics Private Limited. Company Name:
BY:       BY:
Signed:        Signed:       
Printed Name: Tarun Pathria                                          Printed Name:

clauses.clause_title: 3.4 To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law: (i) a...
clauses.original_text:
3.4 To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law: (i) all monies payable under this Agreement are of all goods and services taxes, withholding, and value added taxes; (ii) shall be responsible for paying all taxes on Services; 
However, if applicable law requires that Jamf directly pay any goods and services taxes, sales taxes, value added taxes or similar taxes in connection with Services hereunder, Integrator shall so notify Jamf in writing at the time of receiving the PO, and all such amounts of tax must be separately listed on Integrator’s invoice. 
4.0 Qualifications; Oversight. Integrator shall ensure that only such of its personnel that have been certified by Jamf in writing as a “Jamf Certified Integrator” will provide Services as set forth in Exhibit A and if applicable, Integrator shall ensure that only such of its personnel that have been certified by Jamf in writing as a “Jamf Certified Trainer” will provide Services as set forth in Exhibit B. If permitted by local law, Jamf may, from time to time, conduct background and references investigations and verifications, criminal background checks, and Integrator shall, if permitted by local law, ensure that its personnel have consented in writing to allow Jamf to conduct such investigations. 
4.1 Jamf Certified Trainer Requirements. The following requirements are applicable to Integrator’s provision of Services described in Exhibit C.  
4.1.1  Integrator and its personnel must be in good standing with Jamf.  
4.1.2 Integrator personnel seeking to become a Jamf Certified Trainer must: (i) attend the appropriate Jamf training course and complete the course receiving certification of 90% or better; (ii) attend and satisfactorily complete a Train the Trainer (T3) program; (iii) assist Jamf in delivering one Jamf offered training course; and (iv) lead delivery of one Jamf offered training course under Jamf’s supervision. Jamf’s observation feedback will determine if Integrator’s Jamf Certified Trainer can begin providing the Jamf training course solo.  
Jamf may require Integrator personnel to complete a minimum number of solo training courses of one level prior to becoming certified to train advanced Jamf Certified Training courses. Integrator personnel that become certified to provide a Jamf Certified Training course shall participate in ongoing training that includes re-certification on major course changes, acknowledgment of minor course changes and attendance at Jamf’s “Train the Trainer (T3)” events. 
Jamf offers various levels of training courses for which Integrator may become certified. The certification requirements contained in this Section 4.1.2 are required to obtain certification at each level.  
4.1.3 Jamf may require ongoing re-certification related to major training course changes. Jamf will determine re-certification needs and communicate such needs to Integrator in advance. Recertification may be delivered in person or virtually by Jamf depending on the complexity of change in Jamf’s Software and/or required training coursework. Acknowledgment of minor course changes may occur on a frequent basis. Integrator’s Jamf Certified Trainers are required to acknowledge receipt of updates and may be required to perform a routine examination to verify capability to conduct courses containing minor changes.   
5.0 Ownership. As between Jamf and Integrator, all rights, title and interest in and to Inventions and all Works of Authorship (as those terms are defined below) created or developed under an Integrator SOW shall be exclusively owned by Jamf. Integrator shall and hereby does assign all of its rights, title and interest in and to the Inventions and Works of Authorship, including all intellectual property rights related thereto, to Jamf and waives all moral rights in and to the Works of Authorship. To the extent such assignment and transfer is legally impossible, Integrator hereby grants to Jamf the exclusive, perpetual, royalty-free, freely transferable, freely sublicensable, worldwide, unrestricted right of use in and to such Work of Authorship. At Jamf’s request, both during and after the Term of this Agreement, Integrator shall  Jamf to patent any Invention or improvement or to register any copyright and shall take any reasonable action requested by Jamf to enforce its rights in any Invention or Work of Authorship. Integrator agrees to take these steps both during and after Integrator’s performance under this Agreement. For the purposes of this Agreement, “Inventions” shall mean discoveries, designs, apparatus, practices, concepts, and ideas, processes, improvements and inventions whether patentable or not, relating to any present or prospective product, service, business, research or development of Jamf. “Works of Authorship” shall mean all forms of original expression fixed in any tangible medium, including without limitation, user documentation, translations of user documentation into local languages, computer programs, programming tools, and designs related to the business products or business of Jamf. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the provisions of this Section 5.0 shall not apply to: (i) created works for which no property, materials, equipment, supplies, facility, Confidential Information or trade secret information of Jamf, Jamf’s customer or Jamf’s licensors was used; (ii) which were developed entirely on Integrator’s own time; and (iii) do not result from any work performed by Integrator for Jamf. 
6.0    Confidential Information.  
6.1 Integrator acknowledges, understands and agrees that, whether developed by or received from Jamf’ or Jamf’s customers, all Confidential Information (as defined below) provided directly by Jamf’ or which may become known to Integrator under this Agreement, is the exclusive and confidential property of the originator of such Confidential Information and shall be at all times regarded, treated, and protected as such in accordance with this Agreement. Failure to mark any writing “Confidential” shall not affect the confidential nature of such writing or the information contained therein.

clauses.original_text: 6.2 “Confidential Information” shall mean information which is used in Jamf’s (or its affiliates’) or a Jamf customer’s business, and (i) is proprietary to, about, or created by Jamf (or its affiliates), Jamf’s customers or Jamf’s licensors; (ii) gives Jamf (or its affiliates), Jamf’s customers or Jamf’s licensors some competitive business advantage or the opportunity of obtaining such advantage or the disclosure of which could be detrimental to the interests of Jamf (or its affiliates), Jamf’s customer, or Jamf’s licensors; (iii) is designated as Confidential Information by Jamf or Jamf’s customers, or from all the relevant circumstances should reasonably be assumed by Integrator to be confidential and proprietary to Jamf (or its affiliates), Jamf’s customers, or Jamf’s licensors; or (iv) is not generally known by other than Jamf (or its affiliates), Jamf’s customers, or Jamf’s licensors. Confidential Information shall include, but not be limited to, software products licensed to or owned by Jamf’ or its affiliates (“Jamf Software”), Jamf’s customers’ software, or Jamf’s supplier’s software (including both source and object code) and documentation, and any modifications or enhancements thereto.

clauses.clause_title: 6.3 Confidential Information shall not include information t...
clauses.original_text: 6.3 Confidential Information shall not include information that: (a) is or becomes publicly known and such public knowledge or disclosure is not the result of any act or failure to act on the part of the Integrator; (b) is, at the time of disclosure, already known to the Integrator without utilizing the Confidential Information; (c) is information disclosed to Integrator by a third party which is not, to the Integrator’s knowledge, under a duty of confidentiality to Jamf; or (d) is independently developed by Integrator without access to or use of any Confidential Information. Integrator shall have the burden to prove that information qualifies for one of these exceptions. If the Integrator becomes legally compelled (by oral questions, interrogatories, requests for information or documents, subpoena, civil investigative demand or similar process) to disclose any Confidential Information or the fact that such Confidential Information has been made available to Integrator, Integrator agrees that Jamf will be provided with reasonable advance written notice of such intention or requests so that Jamf has the opportunity to pursue its legal and equitable remedies to prevent or limit such potential disclosure.

clauses.clause_title: 6.4 As a consequence of Integrator’s acquisition or anticipa...
clauses.original_text:
6.4 As a consequence of Integrator’s acquisition or anticipated acquisition of Confidential Information, Integrator shall occupy a position of trust and confidence with respect to the affairs and business of Jamf, Jamf’s customer, or Jamf’s licensors. In view of the foregoing, Integrator agrees that it is reasonable and necessary that Integrator make the following covenants: 
6.4.1 No Disclosure. During and after the Term of this Agreement, Integrator shall not disclose Confidential Information of Jamf, Jamf’s customers, or Jamf’s licensors to any person or entity other than as necessary in carrying out its duties hereunder on behalf of Jamf without first obtaining Jamf’s written consent, and Integrator shall take commercially reasonable precautions to prevent inadvertent disclosure of such Confidential Information. This prohibition against Integrator’s disclosure of Confidential Information includes, but is not limited to, disclosing the fact that any similarity exists between the Confidential Information and information independently developed by another person or entity, and Integrator understands that such similarity does not excuse Integrator from abiding by its covenant or other obligations under this Agreement.

clauses.clause_title: 6.4.2 No Use, Copying or Transfer. During and after the Term...
clauses.original_text: 6.4.2 No Use, Copying or Transfer. During and after the Term of this Agreement, Integrator shall not use, copy or transfer Confidential Information of Jamf, Jamf’s customers, or Jamf’s licensors other than as necessary in carrying out Integrator’s duties on behalf of Jamf, without first obtaining Jamf’s written consent, and Integrator shall take all reasonable precautions to prevent inadvertent use, copying or transfer of such Confidential Information. This prohibition of Integrator’s use, copying, or transfer of Confidential Information includes, but is not limited to, selling, licensing or otherwise exploiting, directly or indirectly, any products or services (including software in any form) which embody or are derived from the Confidential Information, or exercising judgment in performing analysis based upon knowledge of the Confidential Information.

clauses.original_text: Unless otherwise agreed between the Parties in writing, the Products shall be delivered by the Company at the location agreed by the Parties in an Order. The Company will use reasonably commercial efforts to deliver the Products in accordance with the delivery schedule agreed in an Order or any other date as may be accepted by the Company in writing. The Company may, at any time, prior to the delivery date, reschedule any Order, in whole or in part, or modify the delivery schedule set forth in an Order by giving a prior written notice of fifteen (15) days to the Customer. The Company also reserves the right to refuse, cancel or delay delivery of any Products to the Customer when in the Company’s opinion Customer has been/is delinquent in payments, or when the Customer has failed to perform its other obligations under this Agreement. In the event of a delay or foreseeable delay in delivery, the Company shall as promptly as practicable notify the Customer in writing the reasons for such delay or foreseeable delay in delivery.

clauses.original_text:
In consideration of the sale of subscriptions to the Platform or provision of Professional Services, the Customer shall pay the Fees as more specifically elaborated in applicable Order (“Fees”). 
Except as otherwise specified in the Order, the Consideration is non-refundable. Such Consideration shall be exclusive of applicable taxes. The Customer is responsible for delivery charges and all taxes related to this purchase and the import of the Products, if applicable, including but not limited to all GST, import taxes/customs/duties and any other similar taxes imposed by any governmental entity. [LegaLogic Comment for Softcell: Kindly validate if the Consideration will be exclusive of all applicable taxes.]
Unless expressly otherwise agreed in the applicable Order, the Customer shall be obligated to pay full payment of each invoice raised by the Company, in advance, within a period of fifteen (15) days from the receipt of invoice. In the event, the Customer fails to make the payment within the aforesaid due date, the Purchaser shall be liable to pay an interest of 1% per month or any amount prescribed by applicable laws, whichever is higher on the amounts due till the date of actual payment. In addition to the above, the Company shall also be entitled to withhold the delivery of the Products in respect of which the invoices are outstanding and/or withhold the delivery of any other Order., the Customer shall also be responsible for all collection costs and/or legal expenses necessitated by delay or default in payment of the price by the Customer.  [LegaLogic Comment for Softcell: We have inserted a 15 days’ period considering the payment period agreed with Cyble i.e. 30 days from the date of receipt of invoice. We suggest atleast 15 days buffer shall be kept.]
The Customer will not setoff or offset against the Company’s invoices, any amounts that the Customer claims are owed to it by the Company under this Agreement and the Customer waives any right it may have to offset, setoff, or withhold payment of the Fees.

clauses.original_text:
Each Party acknowledges that it may obtain the Confidential Information of other Party in the course of performance of its obligations under this Agreement. 
The receiving Party shall only use the Confidential Information for the purpose, for which it is disclosed or otherwise agreed in writing between the Parties. Furthermore, the receiving Party shall keep Confidential Information received from the disclosing Party, in strict confidence and shall not disclose it to any third parties, except to a limited group of the receiving Party’s directors, officers, agents, authorized representatives on a “need-to-know” basis. The receiving Party shall treat all Confidential Information with the same degree of care as it uses to protect its own confidential information of like importance but in no event with less than reasonable care. 
In the event that the receiving Party is required to disclose Confidential Information pursuant to law or any order passed by the governmental department or court of law, the receiving Party will notify the disclosing Party of the required disclosure with sufficient time for the disclosing Party to seek relief, will cooperate with the disclosing Party in taking appropriate protective measures, and will make such disclosure in a fashion that maximizes protection of the Confidential Information from further disclosure.
Upon the termination or non-renewal of this Agreement or upon receiving a request from the disclosing Party, as the case may be, the receiving Party shall either return or dispose (as per the instructions of the disclosing Party) all the Confidential Information belonging to the disclosing Party and certify its actions to the disclosing Party.  
It is agreed that the unauthorized use or disclosure of any Confidential Information by the Customer in violation of this Agreement will cause severe and irreparable damage to the Company.  In the event of any violation of the confidentiality provisions of this Agreement, the Customer agrees that the Company shall be authorized and entitled to obtain from any court of competent jurisdiction preliminary and/or permanent injunctive relief, as well as any other relief permitted by applicable law. The Customer agrees to waive any right it may have as a condition for obtaining any such relief.
Notwithstanding the disclosure of Confidential Information, all Confidential Information shall be and shall remain the sole property of the Disclosing Party. The confidentiality obligations stated herein shall survive for a period of three (3) years from the date of termination or non-renewal of this Agreement.

NOTWITHSTANDING THE FOREGOING, THE MAXIMUM AGGREGATE LIABILITY OF THE COMPANY (WHETHER IN CONTRACT OR UNDER ANY OTHER FORM OR LIABILITY)) TOWARDS THE CUSTOMER OR ANY THIRD PARTY, HEREUNDER FOR ALL DIRECT DAMAGES OR LOSS, UNDER OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT, REGARDLESS OF THE FORM OF ACTION, SHALL BE LIMITED TO  (A) FOR THE SUBSCRIPTIONS TO THE PLATFORM :THE FEES RECEIVED BY THE COMPANY UNDER THE APPLICABLE ORDER IN IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING TWELVE (12) MONTHS FROM THE EVENT GIVING RISE TO A CLAIM; AND (B) FOR PROFESSIONAL SERVICES, FEES  RECEIVED BY THE COMPANY UNDER THE APPLICABLE ORDER IN RELATION TO WHICH A CLAIM HAS ARISEN.[LegaLogic Comment for  Softcell: Please confirm the cap].
