clauses.original_text:
MASTER PURCHASE AGREEMENT
This Master Purchase Agreement (”Agreement”) is entered into as of [month and date], [year] (“Effective Date”) between Nutanix Technologies India Private Limited, with its registered office at 9th Floor, Mercury 2B Block, Prestige Tech Park, Outer Ring Road, Kadubeesanahalli, Bangalore, Karnataka 560103 India (“Nutanix”) and [vendor name] with its principal place of business at  ("Seller") for the purpose of setting forth the terms by which Nutanix may retain Seller to provide certain goods. Nutanix and Seller may be referred to herein individually as a (“Party”) and collectively as the (“Parties”).  The Parties hereby agree as follows: 
GOODS AND SERVICES. Seller shall provide those goods (the “Products”) as specified in a mutually executed Statement of Work (“SOW”) issued under this Agreement or in a Nutanix purchase order (“PO”) issued in lieu of or in conjunction with a SOW. Should the scope of any SOW change, the Parties must document those changes in a written change order to the applicable SOW (for example, changes to fees, scheduling, acceptance criteria and so forth). SOWs and POs are collectively referred to herein as the “Order Documents”.. 
SHIPMENT AND DELIVERY; DESTRUCTION OF PRODUCTS. All dates referred to in this Agreement and the applicable Order Documents are firm. Seller shall promptly notify Nutanix in writing if Seller’s performance is delayed or likely to be delayed. Such notice shall not constitute a waiver by Nutanix of any of Seller’s obligations hereunder.  If no delivery schedule is specified, the order shall be filled promptly. Unless otherwise specified in the Order Documents, Seller shall ship Products prepaid at Seller’s sole expense and deliver Products DDP (Incoterms 2010) to the Nutanix delivery destination stated in the Order Documents, with title and risk of loss transferring from Seller to Nutanix at the delivery destination upon Nutanix’s actual receipt of the Products. Nutanix’s return shipment to Seller of any of the following Products shall be at’s own risk and expense, including, without limitation, transportation and insurance charges. 
3.  INSPECTION; INVOICES; PAYMENT; AUDIT.  Unless otherwise specified in the Order Documents, Seller shall invoice Nutanix upon delivery of the Products by submitting invoices via email to invoices@nutanix.com. Invoices must contain the following information: applicable PO number, description of item, quantities, unit prices, extended totals, shipping information, ship to city and state, taxes, and any other information reasonably required by Nutanix. Applicable taxes and other charges such as shipping costs, duties, customs, tariffs, and government-imposed surcharges shall be stated separately on Seller's invoice. The payment of all undisputed fees shall be due within (0) days after Nutanix’s receipt of an invoice from Seller. Nutanix reserves the right to return all invoices that were sent incorrectly or were provided with missing or incorrect information. Seller agrees to invoice Nutanix in the correct form and manner no later than one hundred twenty (120) days after delivery of the Products. Nutanix shall not be obligated to make payment against any invoices submitted after such period. Payment by Nutanix shall be made via check, electronic funds transfer, or any other reasonable means as determined by Nutanix. . Nutanix shall only reimburse Seller for reasonable expenses (at cost and without mark-up) as specified in the applicable Order Documents which are pre-approved in writing by Nutanix and comply with the Nutanix Travel and Expense Policy. Seller will make commercially reasonable efforts to completely resolve the Billing Dispute within thirty (30) days following the date on which Seller received Nutanix's initial billing inquiry. Upon Nutanix’s request, Seller shall issue separate invoices for undisputed and disputed amounts. Nutanix’s rights and remedies with respect to any disputed amount shall not be restricted, including Nutanix’s failure to identify a disputed fee prior to payment or Nutanix’s acceptance of Products.  Seller shall maintain in reasonable detail accurate records relating to the Agreement. For a period of one year after the date of each Order Document: (i) Nutanix and its agents may audit Seller’s relevant records to confirm compliance with the Agreement, and (ii) Seller will notify Nutanix and provide Nutanix with reasonably requested information if a government authority audits Seller’s business related to the Products. 
4.  REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES. Each Party represents and warrants that: (A) it has full power and authority to enter into and fulfill its obligations under the Agreement, and to grant the rights and licenses it grants the other in the Agreement; and (B) its compliance with the Agreement will not violate any agreements it has with any third party. Seller represents and warrants that: (A) Seller’s performance under the Agreement will be of professional quality and performed with the degree of skill and care that is required; () Seller will comply with, and will cooperate with all requests of Nutanix needed to comply with, all applicable laws, rule, regulations, accords, treaties, or other legal obligations whether local, state, federal, or foreign (collectively, “Legal Requirements”). .

Affiliates/Related Companies of the Company including any affiliates or subsidiaries of the Company may use the Services(s)/deliverable(s) delivered by the Service Provider under this Agreement, subject to the terms of the Agreement.
Provided that the Parties may amend or alter the list of ABC Companies from time to time, by amending the provisions. 
If any ABC Company wish to use the Service(s)/ deliverable(s) delivered by Service Provider pursuant to this Agreement, such ABC Company may do so subject to the other provisions of this Agreement. 
Each ABC Company shall directly make payment to Service Provider for the use of the Service(s)/ deliverable(s) as per the “Consideration” clause as Clause 3 in the Agreement and in accordance with the SoW as agree upon and executed between the Service Provider & ABC Company. 
This Agreement shall be deemed to automatically apply to the Service Provider and such ABC Company with such ABC Company taking the place of the Company hereunder (and exercising and being subject to the Company's rights and obligations).
If an ABC Company disputes the application of this Agreement to itself, any use by such ABC Company of the application(s)/deliverable(s) or Services delivered by the Service Provider shall be and shall be automatically deemed to be invalid use thereof Unless otherwise agreed by the concerned Parties in writing, the expiry or termination of this Agreement between the Service Provider and the Company shall not affect the term of such independent SoW signed between the Service Provider and such Related Companies.

clauses.original_text:
This Agreement will be deemed to commence on and from the 1stday of  202and will remain in force for a period of three (3) years (hereinafter referred to as “Term”) until the th 202unless terminated earlier in accordance with this Agreement. The Parties may renew this Agreement on or before expiry of the initial Term by agreement in writing
TERMINATION:
ABFSSL shall have the right to terminate this Agreement or SoW as applicable if any forthwith under following circumstances:
Material Breach:
if Service Provider breaches any of the terms and conditions of this Agreement or SoW.
if Service Provider breaches its representation and warranties.
if Service Provider commits any fraud, willful omission, breach of confidentiality including data and security breaches.
if Service Provider while providing services hereunder, violates any law or regulation or service standards.
Additional Termination Events:
The Service Provider’s license/permission to provide services under this Agreement or respective SoW has been suspended or cancelled.
If it is lawfully required to do so by ABFSSL/ABC Companies due to any order/direction/notification of any competent legal, governmental, supervisory or regulatory authority or body. 
The Service Provider, its officers, directors or employees or its affiliates are involved in any material investigation or subject to any government action or having pending material litigations.
If the Service Provider has been declared insolvent or goes into liquidation or presents or is presented with a petition for or passes a resolution for winding up, either compulsory or voluntary (except for the purposes of reconstruction or amalgamation), or makes any arrangement with its creditors or any assignment for the benefit of creditors, or if a receiver or manager of its business or undertaking is duly appointed, or if distress or execution shall be levied or threatened upon any of its property, or if it suffers any similar action in consequence of debt.
If there occurs any circumstance(s) or event which materially affect the business and/or operation of the Service Provider impacting the Services in the opinion of ABFSSL.
Any other reason attributable to the acts of the Service Provider which causes non-performance of this Agreement or respective SoW.
The Service Provider adopts malpractice’s which affect the fair name and reputation of ABFSSL/ABC Companies or for gross negligence or inefficiency or any other irregularity on the part of the Service Provider in fulfilling its duties and responsibilities under this Agreement.
If the appointment or continuance of the Service Provider under this Agreement is likely to result in loss of goodwill or reputation of ABFSSL/ ABC Companies.
Failure to obtain requisite Permits necessary for conduct of these services pursuant to this Agreement
Any other event or circumstances or breach which ABFSSLnotifies  in writing to the Service Provider such breach if curable is not cured by the Service Provider within a period not later than thirty (30) days from the date of such notice, ABFSSL shall have the right to terminate this Agreement and/or respective SoW forthwith.
Termination for Convenience:
Either Party may elect to terminate this Agreement or the respective SoW as applicable if any by providing thirty (30) days prior written notice to the other Party. The Service Provider agrees to provide services to the respective ABFSSL/ ABC Companies during the notice period.
Consequence of Termination:
In the event of termination of this Agreement or respective SoW by either Party, the Service Provider refund  fees received by respective ABFSSL/ ABC Companies. 
In the event of termination of the Agreement by ABFSSL, the Respective ABC Companies agree that they shall pay Service Provider.
After the effective date of termination or expiry of this Agreement all the rights shall extinguish. However, it does not affect the rights, liabilities or obligations of any Party which have arisen on or before termination or which are expressly or impliedly to survive termination or expiry or the right to claim damages for breach of this Agreement.
The Service Provider agrees to provide  of services either to ABFSSL or any other Service Provider as identified by ABFSSL for performance of the services under this Agreement.
The Service Provider shall not divulge any information relating to details of technical or service knowhow, administration and/or organizational matters pertaining to ABFSSL and its business or any other proprietary information which the Service Provider and/or any of its personnel or individual may gain knowledge by virtue of instant service arrangement hereof.
Termination of this Agreement shall automatically terminate all the respective SoWs to it.
Destruction of records in the manner specified by the ABFSSL.
The rights and obligations of the Parties which by their nature must survive termination or expiration of this Agreement in order to achieve its fundamental purposes including, without limitation, the provisions of the SECTIONS entitled “AUDIT,” “CONFIDENTIALITY”, “INDEMNITY,” “GOVERNING LAW & DISPUTE RESOLUTION,” and “TERMINATION” shall survive in perpetuity any termination of this Agreement.
In the event of termination or expiry of this Agreement in whole or in part or of any SoW hereunder, Service Provider may, at ABFSSL’s request, provide any termination assistance required to ensure the orderly transition of the Services to ABFSSL and/or the successor supplier at ABFSSL’s expense (hereinafter referred to as "Exit Assistance").  
REPRESENTATIONS & WARRANTIES:
Each Party represents and warrants to the other Party as on the Effective Date, that:
It has all the requisite power and authority to execute, deliver and perform this Agreement and the terms and conditions contained herein.
This Agreement has been validly executed and delivered and constitutes a legal, valid and binding obligation of such Party.
The execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement does not in any way conflict or violate any provision of law, rule, judgment, order or any other contract applicable to such Party.
Such Party is permitted and eligible to execute and perform this Agreement under the laws of the country of such Party.
It has no outstanding commitments, liabilities or obligations, contractual or otherwise, which would in any material respect conflict with or impede its ability and right to enter into this Agreement or fulfill any and all of its obligations hereunder, or to fulfill its duties and obligations contemplated herein.
It is not subject to any bankruptcy, reorganization, compulsory composition or dissolution proceeding, and has not explicitly suspended payment of any debt as it has become due except debts contested in good faith.
The Service Provider warrants that:
It has complied with and agrees to comply with all applicable laws, regulatory requirements, standards, guidelines and codes of practice as applicable to it from time to time, during the validity of this Agreement.
It will provide the services in good faith with due care, skill and diligence, in a professional and workmanlike manner in accordance with accepted standard practice and with the terms agreed on between the Parties as set out in this Agreement.
The Service Provider shall perform all the services as stipulated in the Agreement.
It shall ensure that it will adhere to the ABFSSL code of conduct, processes and policies of ABFSSL.
It shall not violate any proprietary and intellectual property rights of any third party, including without limitation, confidential relationships, patent, trade secrets, copyright and any other proprietary rights.
The execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement in accordance with its terms shall not breach or cause a default of its Memorandum and Articles of Association or under the terms and conditions of any documents, agreements or other writings to which it is a party.
The Service Provider shall also not use the employees for the purpose of utilizing for furtherance of your own business practice separately. 
There is no outstanding litigation, arbitration matter or other dispute or pending regulatory or statutory enquiries or show cause notices from any government or statutory or regulatory authority to which the Service Provider is a party which, if decided against the Service Provider, would reasonably be expected to have a material adverse effect on the Service Provider’s ability to fulfil its respective obligations under this Agreement or likely to adversely impact the brand or image of the Service Provider or ABC Companies as a Service Recipient, and the Service Provider shall notify ABFSSL immediately if the Service Provider becomes the subject of any such litigation, arbitration or dispute or enquiries or show cause notice.
The Service Provider shall not do and/or indulge in any activity, which shall adversely affect the business, brand and/or goodwill of other Party.
The Service Provider, your agents and representatives shall maintain strict confidentiality with regard to any information, documentation and data that comes into its knowledge.
Service Provider warrants that this Agreement does not conflict, breach or cause a default of the terms and conditions of any documents, agreements or other writings to which it is a Party.
Service Provider shall not issue any press release or make any other public announcement or communication regarding this Agreement nor the matters contained therein without obtaining the prior written consent of respective ABFSSL/ ABC Companies.
Service Provider shall provide services to ABFSSL on all days as stated into the applicable SOW.

clauses.original_text:
The Service Provider will obtain at its own expenses all Permits as required under Applicable Law.
ABFSSL/ ABC Companies reserves the right to alter instructions due to changes in requirement or any other reason. Such circumstances shall in no way affect or violate or alter the terms and conditions of this Agreement.  
It is agreed and understood by the Service Provider that ABFSSL/ ABC Companies shall not be liable, in any manner, for any damages or claim of whatever nature by reason of cancellation or termination of this Agreement for any reason, whatsoever.
The Service Provider shall be bound and comply with all orders and directions given by the ABFSSL/ ABC Companies and/or its officials and/ or authorized representatives, in pursuance of the powers conferred upon ABFSSL by this Agreement.
CONFIDENTIALITY:
The Service Provider agree that whether or not Confidential Information has been designated as “confidential”, the same shall be deemed to be confidential in nature. All Confidential Information shall remain the property of ABFSSL/ ABC Companies, as the case may be. The breach of this clause shall be construed as a material breach and ABFSSL/ ABC Companies shall have the right to terminate this Agreement forthwith in case of such material breach by the Service Provider. 
The Service Provider  hereby agrees:
to maintain and use the Confidential Information only for the purposes of this Agreement and only as permitted herein;
to only make copies as specifically authorized by the prior written consent of ABFSSL//ABFSSLGroup Companies and with the same confidential or proprietary notices as may be printed or displayed on the original;
to restrict access and disclosure of Confidential Information to such of its personnel or individual, agents, and third parties on a "need to know" basis, and upon the execution of a written undertaking from such personnel or individual, agents, and third parties to maintain confidentiality of the Confidential Information disclosed to them.
The Service Provider shall not at any time now or in future either directly or indirectly, disclose, publish, or use Confidential Information without ABFSSL/ ABC Companies prior written consent; provided however, that the Service Provider may use and disclose Confidential Information personnel or individual, agents or advisors, who need to know such Confidential Information to the extent necessary for the purpose of performing its obligations hereunder. The Service Provider shall use high standard of care and discretion to avoid disclosure of Confidential Information. 
All information provided by ABFSSL/ ABC Companies to the Service Provider shall, at all times, remain the sole and exclusive property of ABFSSL/ ABC Companies. The Service Provider shall, immediately upon the termination or expiration of this Agreement, either return to ABFSSL/ ABC Companies all Confidential Information and all copies thereof held by it or if so directed by ABFSSL/ ABC Companies in writing, destroy the same and provide a certificate certifying that same is destroyed. ABFSSL/ ABC Companies may at its sole option, witness the destruction.
The Service Provider shall keep the consideration and all other terms and conditions of Agreement confidential, except to the extent required to be disclosed under Applicable Law. Any public statement concerning this Agreement or the relationship between Parties shall require the prior written approval of ABFSSL/ ABC Companies.
In the event that the Service Provider becomes legally compelled to disclose any Confidential Information to the government authority, the Service Provider shall give sufficient notice to ABFSSL/ ABC Companies to enable ABFSSL/ ABC Companies to prevent or minimize to the extent possible, such disclosure. The Service Provider shall not disclose to a third party any Confidential Information or the contents of this Agreement without the prior written consent of ABFSSL/ ABC Companies. 
The Parties acknowledge that it would be impractical for ABFSSL/ ABC Companies to monitor all information made available to the Service Provider / the Service Provider's personnel or individual under such circumstances and to provide notice to the Service Provider of the confidentiality of all such information. Therefore, the Service Provider agrees that any of ABFSSL/ ABC Companies technical or business information that the Service Provider’s personnel or individual, subcontractors, or agents acquire while on ABFSSL/ ABC Companies Premises shall be deemed Confidential Information
Service Provider shall not use any data whether of the ABFSSL, respective Group Companies for any reason for any other purpose than the purpose of carrying out the Services of this Agreement. 
This Section shall survive the termination of this Agreement for any reason.
INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS:
Except as expressly provided in this Agreement, the Parties agree that:
Each Party retains ownership of all intellectual property rights in any of its works that pre-exist or were developed outside of this Agreement, including any modifications or enhancements thereto (hereinafter referred to as "Pre-Existing IP").
Nothing herein shall give either Party any right, title or interest in any of the other Party’s intellectual property rights, or, except as provided herein, any right to use any of the other Party’s intellectual property rights in any manner
The Service Provider shall not use the trademark/logo of ABFSSL or ABC Companies for any purpose without prior written consent from ABFSSL.  
All ABFSSL intellectual property and any rights thereto made available to Service Provider by ABFSSL with respect to rendering Services under this Agreement shall solely and exclusively belong to ABFSSL. Service Provider or any of its employees, consultants and directors, shall not have any right or claim over such intellectual property. 
ABFSSL retains ownership of all materials, and the intellectual property rights in those materials, provided to Service Provider by or on behalf of ABFSSL (hereinafter referred to as “ABFSSL Materials”). The Service Provider agrees that the work products/deliverables/reports/ analysis/flow charts including but not limited to all information, reports, material of any nature whatsoever produced by or as result of any of the Services rendered hereunder (New/Derived Material) shall be the sole and exclusive property of ABFSSL. In furtherance thereof, the Service Provider thereby irrevocably grants, assigns, transfers to ABFSSL all rights, title and interest of any kind, in and to any work product produced hereunder including the New Material.
This clause shall survive the expiration/termination of the Agreement.
INDEMNITY:
The Service Provider will indemnify, defend, and hold harmless ABFSSL&ABC Companies and its respective officers, directors, employees, agents, successors, and assigns from and against all direct and actual, losses, damages, injury, liabilities, claims, actions, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys’ fees and court fees relating to, resulting from or in any way arising out of: 
Any breach of whole or any one of the provisions of this Agreement including the provisions for Representations and Warranties, Information and Data Security and Confidentiality Obligations under this Agreement by Service Provider or its personnel;
Non-adherence by the Service Provider and/or its personnel to the directives of the Company;
Acts of omission, negligence, willful misconduct, fraud, wrongful acts or commission by the Service Provider or/and its employees/agents in relation to providing the Services and or complying with the duties, responsibilities and obligations under this Agreement; 
Any penalty, fine, claim, sanction levied by any statutory, regulatory authority, quasi-judicial authority arising in relation to non-compliance/ violation by the Service Provider with any covenants set out in this Agreement, including non-compliance with the Applicable Laws;
Breach or contravention of the Applicable Laws, Regulations/Guidelines pertaining to IT, Information Security or Data Privacy laws;
Any third-party claims arising out of or related to Service Provider’s performance or failure to perform its obligations on the terms of this Agreement.
In the event of a breach by Service Provider and/or its personnel of this section, monetary damages may not be an adequate remedy; therefore, the Company shall be entitled to injunctive relief to restrain Service Provider from any breach, threatened or actual.  
Indemnification Procedures:
The Indemnified Party will promptly notify the Indemnifying Party in writing of any claim for which the Indemnified Party intends to seek indemnification pursuant to this Agreement. However, the Indemnified Party’s failure to so notify the Indemnifying Party does not relieve the Indemnifying Party of its obligation to indemnify the Indemnified Party under this Agreement except to the extent that the Indemnifying Party can demonstrate (i) damages to the Indemnifying Party attributable to such failure; or (ii) impact in the defense of such claim due to such failure.
The Indemnifying Party will, to the extent practicable, promptly notify the Indemnified Party in writing, but not less than twenty (20) days before the date on which any response to a complaint or summons is due if the Indemnifying Party elects to assume control of the defense and settlement of a claim (a “Notice of Election”)
If the Indemnifying Party delivers a Notice of Election relating to any claim within the required notice period, then the Indemnifying Party is entitled to have sole control over the defense and settlement of such claim. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Indemnified Party is entitled to participate in the defense of such claim and to employ counsel at its own expense to assist in the defense of such claim.
If the Indemnifying Party does not deliver a Notice of Election relating to any claim within the required notice period, but not less than twenty (20)days of receipt of notification from the Indemnified Party, then the Indemnified Party is entitled to defend the claim in such manner as the Indemnified Party may reasonably deem appropriate until such time as the Indemnifying Party delivers a Notice of Election and assumes the defense. 
The provisions of this Section set forth the entire obligation of the Indemnifying Party, and the Indemnifying Party’s sole remedies, with respect to any claim or matter related to this Section.
The provisions of this clause shall survive the termination/expiry of this Agreement 
INSPECTION & RIGHT TO AUDIT:
ABFSSL/ ABC Companies or its External Professional Advisors or its Regulators, have the right from time to time to: 
conduct audits, inspection and investigation of Service Provider (or representatives as applicable);
examine the books, records, information, systems and the internal control environment in the service provider (or its representative and subcontractors as applicable), to the extent that they relate to the service being performed for the ABFSSL/ ABC Companies.
access redacted versions of any internal audit reports or external audit findings of the Service Provider that concern the service being performed for the respective ABFSSL/ ABC Companies.
The Parties shall conduct such audit on a mutually agreed date and develop a procedure for smooth conduct of audit and regulatory findings related to the provision or receipt of the services under this Agreement. 
GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE:
The Service Provider &ABFSSL shall jointly form a Governance Committee to inter-alia review the performance of the services to be delivered and decide upon related matters including disputes, if any and penalties under this Agreement or respective SoW. The Governance Committee shall comprise of the following members:
DISPUTE RESOLUTION & GOVERNING LAW:
In the event of any dispute between the Parties, including but not limited to interpretation of this Agreement or any matter arising out of its activities under this Agreement, the parties to the dispute will endeavour in the first instance to settle the dispute amicably through the Governance Committee constituted as stated in the above clause on a good faith basis.
In the event such dispute is not settled by the Governance Committee within thirty (30) days of the commencement of the discussions, the dispute shall be referred to and be resolved by sole mediator appointed through Centre for Mediation and Conciliation (CMC, Mumbai-Bombay Chamber of Commerce) and such mediation shall be conducted in accordance with applicable Rules. The cost of mediation shall be equally borne by the Parties to the dispute.
In the event such dispute is not settled by mediation between the Parties within thirty (30) days from the commencement of the mediation, the dispute shall be referred to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Mumbai and governed by the laws of India. 
In the event of any dispute arising out of or in connection to this Agreement or any SoW executed between the Service Provider and ABC Companies (as Service recipients), then the parties executing the SoW shall be the only parties to such dispute and it shall be resolved between them in accordance with the provisions given under this Agreement.
Any dispute arising out of or in connection to this Agreement or any SoW signed between the Service Provider and any ABFSSL/ ABC Companies (as Service recipients) would not impact the Service(s) provided by the Service Provider to the other ABFSSL Group Companies (as Service recipients) not being parties to that dispute.
Each Party shall bear its own cost of bear its own cost of preparing and presenting its case.
CHANGE IN BUSINESS CIRCUMSTANCES:
The Service Provider and ABFSSL understand and agree that ABFSSL’s resource and service requirements may be subject to significant variation as a result of growth, reduction or other changes in their business, including but not limited to variation due to: 
mergers, acquisitions or divestitures; 
a general economic slowdown, downturn or upturn;
changes in ABFSSL’s clients, markets or products served by ABFSSL, operational or market priorities, or locations where ABFSSL operates, or methods of ABFSSL product/service delivery; or
material changes in applicable Laws, business re-organisation or organisational structure, (hereinafter collectively referred as “Material Adverse Event”). Upon the occurrence of any such Material Adverse Event, ABFSSL shall notify the Service Provider with notice in writing setting out the details of the Material Adverse Event. 
Upon occurrence of any such Material Adverse Event that may impact the resource or service requirement, ABFSSL shall have the right to initiate suitable negotiation and subject to mutual agreement between the Parties, modify or adjust the terms and payment terms (including minimum business norms if any applicable) of the MSA or the respective SoW as the case may for the remaining tenure of the Agreement to reflect such revised understanding of the Parties for the Services due to such change in business circumstances.In the event of a Material Adverse Event, Service Provider shall have the right to terminate this MSA or the applicable SoW, and ABFSSL shall reimburse the Service Provider for all services up to the date of such termination.
FORCE MAJEURE:
“Force Majeure” for the purpose of this Agreement shall mean any acts of God, including but not limited to storm, flood, earthquake, lightning, cyclone, landslides or other natural disasters, explosions or fires, strikes, lockout, lockdown, work to rule actions, or similar labour disturbances or other labour action by workers or employees of either Party, public disorder, insurrection, sabotage, rebellion, riots, terrorism, cyberattacks beyond the reasonable control of the Parties or violent demonstrations of a local, regional or national character at the mine or at any place where the Agreement or part thereof is to be performed, the outbreak of an epidemic, pandemic, or other communicable disease in any place where the Agreement or part thereof is to be performed, any order (including lock down orders), regulation, directive, requirement from any Governmental, legislative, executive or judicial authority or a change in law.
Neither of the Parties to this Agreement shall be liable or responsible for any failure to perform or delay in performance of their respective obligations hereunder, when such failure or delay is due or attributable to or arises out of, any Force Majeure Event, provided a notice of occurrence of any Force Majeure Event is promptly given to the other Party;
If Force Majeure event continues for a period of more than thirty (30) days’ then ABFSSL and Service Provider shall have the right to immediately terminate this Agreement and the respective SoW(s).
SUB-CONTRACTING:
Service Provider shall not appoint any subcontractors for providing the Services without prior written approval of ABFSSL/ ABC Companies. Service Provider shall ensure that subcontractor so appointed acts at all times in consonance with all the terms of this Agreement and that the terms of the agreement or arrangements between the Service Provider and the subcontractor do not in any manner contradict or conflict with the terms of this Agreement. Engagement of subcontractor shall not absolve the Service Provider of its responsibilities under this Agreement.
Service Provider confirms that it is their sole responsibility towards all the obligations of sub-contractors including making payments to sub-contractor and simultaneously Service Provider also confirms that ABFSSL/ ABC Companies are not liable to any such obligations towards sub-contractor. Service Provider shall indemnify against all claims if any raised by sub-contractor towards ABFSSL/ ABC Companies.
Service Provider shall on regular basis provide confirmation with proof to ABFSSL/ ABC Companies regarding making payments to sub-contractor and shall also provide any other details if required by ABFSSL/ ABC Companies from time to time.
AMENDMENT & WAIVER: This Agreement may be amended, modified or supplemented only by a written instrument executed by each of the Parties and no waiver of any provision of this Agreement shall be effective unless set forth in a written instrument executed by the Party waiving such provision.
DELAYS & PENALTIES:
The Service Provider acknowledges that time is the essence of this Agreement and undertakes to perform the Services strictly in accordance with the details provided in Annexure below. 
BUSINESS CONTINUITY PLANNING:
Service Provider represents that it has requisite Business Continuity Planning and Disaster Recovery Process in place to ensure uninterrupted Services to ABFSSL/ ABC Companies and shall also provide all reasonable assistance to the Company in its Business Continuity Planning procedures. In case of disruption of services due to any force majeure, Service Provider shall start the provision of Services from alternate locations or through an alternate Service Provider immediately. In case of disruption of services due to any Force Majeure, Service Provider shall start the provision of Services from an alternate location within a period of thirty (30) days from the commencement of the Force Majeure Event. Service Provider’s use of any alternate locations or Service Provider shall not increase ABFSSL/ ABC Companies costs for such servicesHowever, in case such event continues to exist for a continuous period of one (1) month or more  will have a right to terminate the agreement . 
Any breach under this clause shall give ABFSSL/ ABC Companies an option to terminate with prior written notice of thirty (30) days to Service Provider and all consequences of termination shall follow. The provisions of this clause will survive the termination of this Agreement.

clauses.original_text:
The Service Provider agrees that they have an incident reporting systems in place which would identify the criticality of incident including but not limited to breach of confidentiality data and intimate immediately within twenty-four (24) hours to ABFSSL/ ABC Companies. Service Provider shall on regular basis share and intimate ABFSSL/ ABC Companiesof the maintenance of the system and shall also on the steps they have taken to remediate further incidents. 
NON-SOLICITATION: Notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement, during the term of this Agreement, each Party to this Agreement and the parties signing the respective SoWs agree not to hire as its own employee or consultant, any employee or consultant of the other party to the SoW who is directly involved in the delivery or receipt of services under that SoW.
ENTIRE AGREEMENT: This Agreement constitutes the whole agreement between the Parties relating to the subject matter hereof and supersedes any prior agreements or understanding relating to such subject matter.
SEVERABILITY: If any provision or portion of a provision of this Agreement is held invalid or unenforceable, the remainder of the Agreement shall not be affected, and the remaining terms will continue in effect and be binding on the Parties.
ASSIGNMENT: 
Neither Party shall assign to any third party, this Agreement, or any part thereof, or any rights, benefits, obligations or interests herein, except with prior written consent of the other Party.
In the event that either of the Party is acquired, merged, amalgamated, reconstituted, consolidated or otherwise subject to corporate or capital restructuring by or with any other entity then this Agreement shall be binding on the acquirer or the Resultant Entity formed as a result of such restructuring for the remainder of the term of this Agreement without any change in terms of agreement.
COVENANTS REASONABLE: The Parties agree that, having regard to all the circumstances, the covenants contained herein are reasonable and necessary for the protection of the Parties and their investments. If any such covenant is held to be void the covenant will apply with such minimum modifications regarding its scope and duration as may be necessary to make it valid and effective.

clauses.original_text:
MASTER PURCHASE AGREEMENT
This Master Purchase Agreement (”Agreement”) is entered into as of [month and date], [year] (“Effective Date”) between Nutanix Technologies India Private Limited, with its registered office at 9th Floor, Mercury 2B Block, Prestige Tech Park, Outer Ring Road, Kadubeesanahalli, Bangalore, Karnataka 560103 India (“Nutanix”) and [vendor name] with its principal place of business at [address] ("Seller") for the purpose of setting forth the terms by which Nutanix may retain Seller to provide certain goods or services. Nutanix and Seller may be referred to herein individually as a (“Party”) and collectively as the (“Parties”).  The Parties hereby agree as follows: 
GOODS AND SERVICES. Seller shall provide those goods, services, and results of services (the “Products”) as specified in a mutually executed Statement of Work (“SOW”) issued under this Agreement or in a Nutanix purchase order (“PO”) issued in lieu of or in conjunction with a SOW. Should the scope of any SOW change, the Parties must document those changes in a written change order to the applicable SOW (for example, changes to fees, scheduling, acceptance criteria and so forth). SOWs and POs are collectively referred to herein as the “Order Documents”. Nutanix reserves the right to reschedule any delivery or cancel any Order Documents issued at any time prior to shipment of goods or prior to commencement of any services and shall not be subject to any charges or fees because of such cancellation. Seller shall ensure that: (i) each of its employees, contractors, subcontractors, agents and any other third party engaged by Seller or acting on Seller’s behalf (individually and collectively, (“Personnel”)) complies with the terms of this Agreement and Seller shall be fully responsible all acts, omissions, and breaches by its Personnel. 
SHIPMENT AND DELIVERY; DESTRUCTION OF PRODUCTS. All dates referred to in this Agreement and the applicable Order Documents are firm. Seller shall promptly notify Nutanix in writing if Seller’s performance is delayed or likely to be delayed. Such notice shall not constitute a waiver by Nutanix of any of Seller’s obligations hereunder.  If no delivery schedule is specified, the order shall be filled promptly. Unless otherwise specified in the Order Documents, Seller shall ship Products prepaid at Seller’s sole expense and deliver Products DDP (Incoterms 2010) to the Nutanix delivery destination stated in the Order Documents, with title and risk of loss transferring from Seller to Nutanix at the delivery destination upon Nutanix’s actual receipt of the Products. Seller shall be designated Exporter and Importer of Record on all shipments of Products. If no carrier is specified in the Order Documents, Seller shall use the least expensive carrier. In the event Seller fails to deliver the Products within the time specified, Nutanix may, at its option decline to accept the Products and cancel the Order Documents without liability. Seller will package Products according to good commercial practice, clearly mark Products to ensure safe arrival, include packing sheets in each package, and label packaging with the applicable name of the recipient and any information required to identify contents without opening. Seller will clearly mark all Products (or the container if there is no room on the Products) with the country of origin for all Products delivered. Seller shall, in marking the Products, comply with the requirements of the customs authorities of the country of receipt. Nutanix’s return shipment to Seller of any of the following Products shall be at Seller’s own risk and expense, including, without limitation, transportation and insurance charges. 
3.  INSPECTION; INVOICES; PAYMENT; AUDIT.  Nutanix shall have thirty (30) days after receipt of Products and before payment to inspect them for conformity to the Order Documents and accept or reject. If Products are rejected, risk of loss shall pass to Seller upon Nutanix's delivery to the common carrier. Unless otherwise specified in the Order Documents, Seller shall invoice Nutanix upon delivery of the Products by submitting invoices via email to invoices@nutanix.com. Invoices must contain the following information: applicable PO number, description of item, quantities, unit prices, extended totals, shipping information, ship to city and state, taxes, and any other information reasonably required by Nutanix. Applicable taxes and other charges such as shipping costs, duties, customs, tariffs, and government-imposed surcharges shall be stated separately on Seller's invoice. The payment of all undisputed fees shall be due within Sixty (60) days after Nutanix’s receipt of an invoice from Seller in the correct form and manner. Nutanix reserves the right to return all invoices that were sent incorrectly or were provided with missing or incorrect information. Seller agrees to invoice Nutanix in the correct form and manner no later than one hundred twenty (120) days after delivery of the Products. Nutanix shall not be obligated to make payment against any invoices submitted after such period. Payment by Nutanix shall be made via check, electronic funds transfer, or any other reasonable means as determined by Nutanix. Payment of an invoice shall not constitute acceptance, and is subject to adjustment for errors, shortages, or other failure of Seller to meet the requirements of this Agreement and applicable Order Documents. All duties and taxes assessable upon the Products prior to receipt by Nutanix of Products conforming to the Order Documents shall be borne by Seller. Nutanix shall only reimburse Seller for reasonable expenses (at cost and without mark-up) as specified in the applicable Order Documents which are pre-approved in writing by Nutanix and comply with the Nutanix Travel and Expense Policy. If Nutanix disputes the accuracy of an invoice (a "Billing Dispute"), Nutanix will not later than Sixty (60) days following the date of receipt of the applicable invoice in the correct form and manner, notify Seller in writing of the nature of the Billing Dispute. Nutanix may withhold payment of the disputed amount and such payment will not be considered past due during the investigation into the Billing Dispute. Seller will make commercially reasonable efforts to completely resolve the Billing Dispute within thirty (30) days following the date on which Seller received Nutanix's initial billing inquiry. Upon Nutanix’s request, Seller shall issue separate invoices for undisputed and disputed amounts. Nutanix’s rights and remedies with respect to any disputed amount shall not be restricted, including Nutanix’s failure to identify a disputed fee prior to payment or Nutanix’s acceptance of Products.  Seller shall maintain in reasonable detail accurate records relating to the Agreement. For a period of one year after the date of each Order Document: (i) Nutanix and its agents may audit Seller’s relevant records to confirm compliance with the Agreement, and (ii) Seller will promptly notify Nutanix and provide Nutanix with reasonably requested information if a government authority audits Seller’s business related to the Products. 
4.  REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES. Each Party represents and warrants that: (A) it has full power and authority to enter into and fulfill its obligations under the Agreement, and to grant the rights and licenses it grants the other in the Agreement; and (B) its compliance with the Agreement will not violate any agreements it has with any third party. Seller represents and warrants that: (A) Seller’s performance under the Agreement will be of professional quality and performed with the degree of skill and care that is required by current and sound professional procedures; (B) the Products will comply with the specifications set forth in the Order Documents; (C) Products will be new, unused, and not refurbished at the time of delivery, and will be safe for normal use and substantially free from defects in design, materials, and workmanship for a period of one (1) year from date of delivery to Nutanix or for the period provided in Seller’s standard warranty covering the Products, whichever is longer; (C) it will to the extent it is contractually permitted to do so, provide to Nutanix the benefits of manufacturers’ or suppliers’ warranties and guarantees for material or equipment incorporated into the Products, and will perform its responsibilities so that such warranties or guarantees remain in full effect; and (D) Seller will comply with, and will cooperate with all requests of Nutanix needed to comply with, all applicable laws, rule, regulations, accords, treaties, or other legal obligations whether local, state, federal, or foreign (collectively, “Legal Requirements”). Seller shall make spare parts available to Nutanix three (3) years from the date of shipment at Seller's then current price, less applicable discounts. If Nutanix identifies a warranty problem with the Products during the warranty period, Nutanix will promptly notify Seller of such problems and will return the Products to Seller, at Seller's expense. As soon as reasonably possible, but no less than within thirty (30) days of receipt of the returned Products, Seller shall, at Nutanix's option, either repair or replace such Products, or refund Nutanix for all amounts paid for any defective or non-conforming Products. Replacement and repaired Products shall be warranted for the longer of the remainder of the warranty period or twelve (12) months following the delivery date of such repaired or replaced Products. 
5.  INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR AND PERSONNEL. Seller is an independent contractor for all purposes, without express or implied authority to bind Nutanix by contract or otherwise. Neither Seller nor its Personnel are agents or employees of Nutanix, and therefore are not entitled to any employee benefits of Nutanix, including but not limited to, any type of insurance. Seller shall be responsible for all costs and expenses incident to performing its obligations under this Agreement and shall provide Seller's own supplies and equipment. Seller shall ensure that its Personnel observe Nutanix’s work rules, policies and procedures while on Nutanix premises, including without limit those related to integrity, confidentiality, security, personal data and health and safety. Seller’s Personnel will not remove any materials or property from Nutanix’s premises without first obtaining Nutanix’s express consent to do so. Nutanix may refuse access to its premises and network(s) at any time and for any lawful reason. If Seller’s Personnel will be accessing Nutanix systems, Seller shall comply with the terms and conditions of the Nutanix Acceptable Use Policy.

contract_name: PS-Master Procurement Agreement PMLI version V2 - 31052020 2_53.docx

clauses.original_text:
In consideration of the satisfactory performance of the Services rendered by the Supplier and performance of the terms and conditions contained in this Agreement, the PNB MetLife shall pay to the Supplier the consideration as mentioned in Annexure B attached herewith. In addition, the applicable taxes, including, but limited to, the goods and services tax, shall be borne by the Party who is liable to pay such taxes as per the provisions of applicable law. The Parties agree that the PNB MetLife shall not be liable to pay any amount to the Supplier other than the mentioned amount of consideration. Consideration payable to Supplier by PNB MetLife subject to withholding tax at rate applicable as per Income Tax Act, 1961.
The Supplier shall raise an invoice to the PNB MetLife in the first week of every month for the amounts due and payable under this Agreement for the previous month. The payment under the undisputed invoices shall be paid within forty five (45) days from the date of receipt of the invoice by the PNB MetLife and these invoices shall be raised on the principal address of PNB MetLife as specified in Annexure C.
The invoice shall be duly raised by the Supplier within 30 (thirty) days from the date of supply of goods/services as prescribed under the GST provisions.  It is hereby agreed between the Parties that GST invoices shall be raised from the states/jurisdictions where the taxable supplies of goods/services are made. Further, under the GST provisions, the tax invoices/ credit notes and debit notes (as applicable) shall be raised from the Service Provider’s location which is directly linked to the provision of supply and these invoices shall be raised on the principal address of PNB MetLife as specified in Annexure C.
It is the obligation of the Supplier to ensure that the tax invoice is appropriately raised with the correct GSTIN number or at PNB MetLife’s request, the ISD number provided by PNB MetLife.  In the event of any omission or commission on part of the Supplier for failure to use, or correctly use, the GSTIN or ISD number or for any other reason what so ever, resulting in loss of credit to PNB MetLife, PNB MetLife is hereby entitled to recover the same from the Supplier through set-off or otherwise.
The Supplier hereby undertakes to comply with all compliances that are required and/or mandated under the GST provisions, such as but not limited to filing of timely returns, deposit of GST amounts collected from PNB MetLife to the appropriate Government.  In case of any omission or commission on part of the Service Provider, to timely and fully comply with the GST provisions, resulting in any credit loss to PNB MetLife, PNB MetLife reserves the right to recover such losses.
The Supplier would not have any claim against PNB MetLife due to any reclassification of services at any point of time.
In case the supplies made by the Supplier is liable to GST provisions under the reverse charge basis, PNB MetLife would remit the applicable taxes under GST on such supply and adhere to the compliances prescribed under the GST provisions with respect to such reverse charges.  The Supplier would not be responsible for any non-payment by PNB MetLife of reverse charge and accordingly, no claims towards the taxes under GST provisions would be made by the Service Provider.  Further, it is the obligation of Supplier to inform PNB MetLife that it is registered under GST provisions which are applicable for the registered suppliers. Any such information related to registration of Supplier or changes thereto should be given in writing to PNB MetLife by or before 15th day of the month. Information provided after 15th day of the month will be considered and given prospective effect from the following month.
In case if any advance is collected by the Service Provider, the advances paid shall clearly be appropriated to the supplies agreed to be made and the advance so paid by PNB MetLife shall be inclusive of the taxes under the GST provisions applicable on such invoice.
In case the supplies made by the Supplier is returned or found to be deficient, it is agreed between the Parties that the Supplier shall raise a credit note on PNB MetLife adjusting the value of the supply (either proportionate or full) including the adjustments to the taxes applicable on the same.
In case of any mismatches on account of non-reporting of supplies, Supplier would be liable to provide all relevant information to PNB MetLife to correspond with the relevant authorities under the GST provisions and also in case of any liability arising or accruing due to omission or commission shall be Service Provider’s obligation.
In the event the PNB MetLife disputes the amount raised in an invoice or any part thereof, the PNB MetLife may withhold payment of such disputed amount. The Parties agree that they shall endeavour to negotiate on the disputed amount in good faith and expeditiously and based on the decisions made by them, the amount will be paid on the revised invoices. In the event the Parties are unable to resolve the dispute, the matter shall be referred to arbitration in accordance with Clause 16 of the Agreement.
Where the Supplier is a related party or a group entity of the Company, the PNB MetLife shall ensure that the consideration payable under the Agreement shall be consistent with accepted arms’ length principles. 
5. RELATIONSHIP.
5.1 Independent Contractor. Supplier is an independent contractor. All employees of Supplier, its Affiliates and Agents are Supplier Personnel and not personnel of PNB MetLife for any purpose, are not entitled to any compensation or benefits from PNB MetLife, and are under the exclusive control and direction of Supplier. Supplier is solely responsible for the (a) recruitment, hiring, training, assignment, promotion, discipline, termination, or other employment-related activities of such personnel, and (b) payment of all such personnel’s taxes, benefits, immigration related costs, and any deductions, withholdings and fees required by Law. Supplier may not bind or obligate PNB MetLife in any manner.
5.2 Supplier Personnel. 
Supplier, at its cost and expense, shall conduct, or cause to be conducted, a background check and notify PNB MetLife if any Supplier Personnel have been convicted of a crime, prior to deploying any such individual to PNB MetLife’s premises, and PNB MetLife may, at its sole discretion, disqualify such individual from providing such Services.
Supplier shall use commercially reasonable efforts to ensure the continuity of Supplier Personnel. If any Supplier Personnel are unacceptable to PNB MetLife, Supplier shall take immediate and appropriate corrective action, including, upon PNB MetLife’s request, removal of such persons from PNB MetLife’s account.
5.3 Conflict of Interest. 
Personal Conflict of Interest. Supplier represents and warrants that no employee of Supplier, its Agents or Affiliates has received or shall receive compensation other than from Supplier related to obtaining or negotiating this Agreement, and that Supplier knows of no relationship with an employee of PNB MetLife, its Agents or Affiliates, or other entity, that may impair the objectivity of performance under this Agreement. Supplier will promptly notify PNB MetLife in writing if it becomes aware of any such conflict of interest.

clauses.original_text:
The  SERVICE PROVIDER shall (and shall ensure that its employees and agents shall) be required to maintain such administrative, technical and physical safeguards, and such processes, procedures and checks, to secure the information which is received from the HDFC AMC in relation to the services (“Customer Information”) as may be stipulated under Applicable Law and/or industry standards or regulations issued by any Governmental Authority, which safeguards must be at least equal to or better than (a) the safeguards it currently has in place to protect its own data; and (b) generally accepted security standards in the financial service industry.
The administrative, technical and physical safeguards, processes, procedures and checks as provided for in this Clause will be designed to: 
protect the security and confidentiality of the Customer Information in  SERVICE PROVIDER’s possession;
ensure protection against any anticipated threats or hazards to the security and confidentiality of the Customer Information; 
protect against unauthorised access to or use of the Customer Information or associated records which could result in substantial harm or inconvenience to the HDFC AMC or any of its customers, including without limitation the Customers; and 
ensure the proper and secure disposal of such data. 
Without limiting the generality of the foregoing,  SERVICE PROVIDER shall initiate all measures which a prudent organisation, in a similar situation, would take to secure and defend its systems that contain the Customer Information against “hackers” and others who may seek, without authorisation, to modify or access its systems or the Customer Information.  SERVICE PROVIDER will periodically test its systems for potential areas where security could be breached.
SERVICE PROVIDER covenants that it shall take appropriate technical and organisational measures against (a) any unauthorised or unlawful processing or alteration of the Customer Information in the systems of  SERVICE PROVIDER, (b) any resultant loss or destruction of, or damage to, the Customer Information due to unauthorised processing or alterations, and (c) unauthorised or accidental access, processing, erasure, transfer, use, modification, or other misuse of the Customer Information and shall ensure that only authorised personnel bound by adequate confidentiality obligations shall have access to the Customer Information and strictly on a ‘need to know’ basis.
SERVICE PROVIDER shall (and shall ensure that its employees, agents and sub-contractors shall) in respect of the Information:
comply with any reasonable request made or direction given by any authorised personnel of the HDFC AMC in connection with the requirements of any data protection laws; 
not do or permit anything to be done which might jeopardise or contravene the terms of any registration, notification or authorisation under any data protection laws; 
use the Customer Information only for the purposes of fulfilling its obligations under this Agreement and to comply with instructions given by the HDFC AMC from time to time in connection with use of such data, and not retain the data for any longer than is necessary for these purposes;
consider and comply with all suggestions by the HDFC AMC to ensure that the level of protection provided for the Customer Information is in accordance with this Agreement;
take all reasonable steps to ensure the reliability of the personnel which will have access to the Customer Information and ensure that the personnel of  SERVICE PROVIDER who access the Customer Information give a written undertaking not to access, use, disclose or retain the Customer Information except in performing their duties of employment and is informed that failure to comply with this undertaking may be a criminal offence and may also lead the HDFC AMC and/or  SERVICE PROVIDER to take disciplinary action against the employee;
SERVICE PROVIDER shall ensure that the Customer Information is maintained in such a way that it is protected and is not mixed or mingled with any other data including any data of its other customers or clients.
SERVICE PROVIDER further confirms and agrees that it shall at all times during the subsistence of this Agreement:
comply with the provisions of the Information Technology Act, 2000 and the applicable rules thereunder including without limitation the Information Technology (Reasonable security practices and procedures and sensitive personal data or information) Rules, 2011;
monitor the security practices, control processes and checks in respect of any Confidential Information received by the AMC on a regular basis.
SERVICE PROVIDER shall ensure complete security of all Confidential Information and shall be responsible therefore at all times when:
The Confidential Information is stored whether permanently or temporarily on the systems of  SERVICE PROVIDER or any of its agents, subcontractors or representatives;
The Confidential Information is being transferred to and from the systems of  SERVICE PROVIDER.
SERVICE PROVIDER shall be solely liable for any breach of security, compromise, theft, modification and/or corruption of the Confidential Information which occurs at the times specified in Clause 7(Data Security) above (“Data Compromise Events”), irrespective of whether the Data Compromise Events were the direct or indirect result of any act or omission of  SERVICE PROVIDER.
SERVICE PROVIDER agrees to be vigilant and to report all violations of information security and all suspected security events immediately to HDFC AMC.
Indemnity
SERVICE PROVIDER hereby agrees to fully indemnify, defend and hold harmless Client and its Directors, officers, employees and agents, at all times, against and in respect of all damage, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses arising out of or in consequence to any breach of this Agreement (including if alleged by an outside / external party) of any of the terms and conditions or any non fulfillment of its obligations by  SERVICE PROVIDER under or pursuant to this Agreement. The obligations under this clause shall survive any termination of this Agreement.
Indemnification obligations of  SERVICE PROVIDER shall be without prejudice to the rights and remedies of the Client under applicable law, including without limitation, claiming appropriate compensation or damages from  SERVICE PROVIDER and / or the termination of this Agreement.
Material Adverse Events
The following events, among others, may be considered Material Adverse Events:
a) Significant data breach resulting in unauthorized access or loss of customer data.
b) Extended and unanticipated interruption or unavailability of the cloud services.
c) Substantial degradation of the security measures protecting the cloud services.
d) Financial insolvency or bankruptcy of the  SERVICE PROVIDER.
e) A change in applicable laws or regulations that significantly impacts the provision of the cloud services.
Upon the occurrence of a Material Adverse Event, the  SERVICE PROVIDER shall take all necessary steps to remedy the Material Adverse Event and restore the affected services to the extent reasonably possible.
Further the Client shall have the following rights and remedies:
a) The right to renegotiate the terms of this agreement to address the impact of the Material Adverse Event.
b) The right to terminate this agreement, in whole or in part, by providing written notice to the  SERVICE PROVIDER.
Notices
All notices, requests and other communications to any Party hereunder shall be in writing and shall be given to such Party by e-mail of by Government speed post to: 
If to the  SERVICE PROVIDER
Kind Attn: [To be inserted]
e-mail:
Address:
If to the Client
Kind Attn: [To be inserted]
e-mail:
Address:
Each such notice, request or communication shall be effective:
if delivered by registered speed post; 48 hours after such communication is deposited with the speed post office, shipping charges paid and properly addressed, and
if given by any other means, when delivered at the address specified herein.
Term & Termination
This Agreement shall come into force from the Effective Date and terminate upon successful completion of all the Services being provided by the  SERVICE PROVIDER to the satisfaction of the Client.
The Client shall have a right to terminate this Agreement at any time by giving a one month written notice without cause and without assigning any reason. 
[Other termination related provisions & consequences, if any, to be discussed prior to finalizing. Generally this would include what should happen to the partly completed assignments or work in progress, amounts paid/ to be paid, exit stratergies, data expunging clause etc.]
Relationship between the Parties
This Agreement is executed by the Parties on a ‘Principal to Principal’ basis and nothing in this Agreement shall be construed to make either of the Parties to this Agreement a partner, an agent or legal representative of the other for any purpose; except with the express written consent of the other Party.
The relationship between the Parties shall only be that of Independent Contractors. The relationship of the Parties under this Agreement shall be non-exclusive and the Parties, including their affiliates, subsidiaries and divisions, are free to pursue other agreements or collaborations of any kind.
It is understood by the Parties herein that this Agreement is based on the professional competence and expertise of  SERVICE PROVIDER and hence,  SERVICE PROVIDER shall not without the prior consent of the AMC, transfer, assign or delegate any of the rights obligations or responsibilities arising under this Agreement, either wholly or in part, to any third party.
SERVICE PROVIDER shall not sub-contract or assign any or all of its rights or obligations under this Agreement to any third party, without the prior written consent of the Client. [If the Client consents to the  SERVICE PROVIDER sub-contracting or assigning any or all its rights or obligations under this agreement to any third party then, the  SERVICE PROVIDER shall undertake risk assessment/due diligence in hiring such third-party vendors/sub-contractors. The  SERVICE PROVIDER shall ensure that the vendors/sub-contractors appointed by it follow the best industrial practices while providing services to the AMC.  The  SERVICE PROVIDER shall be contractually liable for any mal performance/non-performance/risk management practices of vendor/sub-contractor. SEBI/AMC shall have the right to seek information from the  SERVICE PROVIDER about the third-party vendors/sub-contractors (in the supply chain) engaged by the  SERVICE PROVIDER.]

clauses.original_text:
It shall and hereby undertakes to provide regular updates at such intervals as may be specified by the HDFC AMC with respect to the Services provided in terms of this Agreement. HDFC AMC shall carry out monitoring and assessment with the purpose of undertaking any necessary corrective measure including but not limited to termination of the Agreement. The minimum period required to execute such termination/provision shall be (   ) days before the execution of the termination. 
SERVICE PROVIDER hereby agrees to ensure that high standards of care in performing the Services are maintained by it at all times and the HDFC AMC has the right to intervene with appropriate measures to meet legal and regulatory obligations and require it to take such appropriate measures as the HDFC AMC may deem fit.
Force majeure
It is expressly agreed that neither Party shall be liable for any default, delay, lapse or inability to fulfill their commitments hereunder, occasioned in whole or in part due to reasons beyond their control like strikes, lock-out, fire, war, tempest, sabotage, change of law, act or regulation of Government, inability to secure Government authorization and / or approvals or any other act of God or any other cause beyond their reasonable control (“Force Majeure Event”).
The Party claiming the Force Majeure Event shall promptly notify the other Party in writing of its reasons for the delay or stoppage and its likely duration and shall take all reasonable steps to overcome the delay or stoppage.
Either Party may resume performance under the Agreement after the Force Majeure Event comes to an end.

clauses.original_text:
The  SERVICE PROVIDER agrees and undertakes that it shall develop and establish a robust framework for:
documenting, maintaining and testing business ‘continuity and recovery procedures’ in relation to the services, and 
development of a comprehensive full-proof system for safe custody and retrieval of all records, data, documents and other information material to the services.
It shall periodically test all such business continuity and recovery plans and all reports and documents relevant to such testing shall be sent to the HDFC AMC forthwith. Notwithstanding anything contained in this Clause (Business Continuity), the business continuity and recovery processes may be tested and reviewed by the HDFC AMC at such intervals as the HDFC AMC may in its sole discretion deem fit and it shall be required to make, at its own cost any revisions and modifications suggested by the HDFC AMC, in relation thereto.
Entire Agreement
This Agreement represents the entire understanding as to the subject matter hereof and shall supersede any other prior understanding between the Parties on the subject matter hereof.
In the event that anyone or more of the provisions contained herein, or the application thereof in any circumstance, is held invalid, illegal or unenforceable in any respect, such provision or provisions shall be ineffective only to the extent of such invalidity, illegality or unenforceability, without invalidating the remainder of such provision(s) of this Agreement, and such invalid, illegal or unenforceable provision(s) or portion thereof shall, to the maximum extent possible, be substituted by an enforceable provision(s) or portion thereof that preserve(s) the original intentions of the parties.
Dispute Resolution
Any dispute, differences, controversy or claims arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the breach, termination or invalidity thereof, shall be settled amicably pursuant to a written notice in this regard from one Party to the other Party; through discussions and negotiations in good faith between senior officers to be nominated by the respective Parties. 
In the event any such aforesaid disputes or claims are not settled amicably within thirty days of the aforesaid notice, the same shall be decided through arbitration in accordance with the provisions of the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996. The arbitral tribunal shall be composed of three arbitrators, one arbitrator to be appointed by each Party and third arbitrator appointed by the mutual consent of the arbitrators so appointed. 
The place of arbitration shall be Mumbai and any award whether interim or final, shall be made, and shall be deemed for all purposes between the Parties to be made, in Mumbai.
The arbitral procedure shall be conducted in English language and any award or awards shall be rendered in English. The procedural law of the arbitration shall be applicable Indian law.
Governing Law & Jurisdiction
This Agreement shall be governed by the applicable laws of India. The Courts in Mumbai shall have exclusive jurisdiction. 
Counterparts
This Agreement is executed in counterparts with each being deemed to be an original and having equal legal validity.

In case the  SERVICE PROVIDER fails to provide the invoice within stipulated time, the Client shall not be liable under the Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises Development Act, 2006 (the “MSMED Act”) for the delayed payment to  SERVICE PROVIDER or any other applicable law applicable to this agreement.

During the term of this Agreement, the Client may disclose/exchange information/data which may be strategic, proprietary and confidential in nature including price sensitive information as described in detail below and defined as ‘Confidential Information’ and  SERVICE PROVIDER recognizes that careful protection and non-disclosure of the Confidential Information provided by the Client to  SERVICE PROVIDER is of utmost importance; and in consideration of the promises made herein, the Parties agree to disclose and receive certain Confidential Information under the following terms and conditions:

clauses.original_text:
As used herein ‘Confidential Information’ shall mean all present, past or future information, data and materials which is or will be provided/disclosed by Client to  SERVICE PROVIDER, either written or oral or any other tangible or intangible or in any other form or medium including electronic or digital means, or which is learnt or disclosed in the course of discussions, studies or other work undertaken by the  SERVICE PROVIDER prior to or after the Effective Date whether in original or copies or duplicates thereof, which has been acquired or will be acquired by  SERVICE PROVIDER from Client, including, but without limitation any UPSI, financial and accounting information relating to any company or entity, commercial strategies, processes, product details, drawings, documents, market analysis, plans, ideas, data compilations, forecasts, studies, diagrams, models, samples, flow charts, technical, financial or business information including credit risk data, liquidity risk data, market risk data, audit data or promotional and marketing activities/ opportunities or request for proposal, request for information and responses thereto or system & sub-system information, internal or partner IP Schema, network topography & design, system configuration data, system vulnerability information, risk exception information, supplier information and its dependencies or other documents prepared based on any of the foregoing, whether labeled as ‘Confidential’ or not and whether  patentable, copyrightable or susceptible to any other form  of  protection or not; which is provided by Client to  SERVICE PROVIDER, or otherwise becomes available to the  SERVICE PROVIDER directly or indirectly, under or pursuant to this Agreement. 
The terms and existence of Agreement, the fact that Confidential Information has been made available hereunder, that discussions or negotiations are taking place concerning the Purpose between the Parties and all of the terms, conditions and other facts with respect thereto (including the status thereof) shall also be considered Confidential Information that is subject to the provisions of Agreement. 
‘UPSI’ shall have the meaning assigned to the term Unpublished Price Sensitive Information under the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Prohibition of Insider Trading) Regulations 2015; and ‘applicable law’ shall be deemed to mean and include such law for the time being in force as well as any future amendments, modifications, clarifications, interpretations and re-enactments thereof.

2.1.1  SERVICE PROVIDER shall use the Confidential Information only for the purpose stated in Clause 1.2 hereinabove.  SERVICE PROVIDER recognizes that Agreement imposes an affirmative duty upon it to hold such information in confidence and to protect the same from dissemination to and use by, unauthorized parties. In the absence of prior written consent,  SERVICE PROVIDER shall not disclose the Confidential Information to any third party including the competitors of Client under any circumstances. 
2.1.2  SERVICE PROVIDER shall not disclose, share or disseminate any Confidential Information and to hold in strict confidence and to take adequate precautions to protect, the security, integrity and confidentiality of the Confidential Information in the possession of the  SERVICE PROVIDER, and not use or attempt to use, disclose, publicize, provide access, or disseminate any Confidential Information to any person and take proper care to protect and preserve the confidentiality and secrecy of all Confidential Information, including without limitation, implementing physical security measures and operating procedures. Such measures shall in no event be less than a reasonable degree of care.  SERVICE PROVIDER will grant access to the Confidential Information only to their officers, employees, agents, contractors, consultants, advisors, affiliates (‘Representatives’) who have a clear need to know, for the purpose of Service Agreement and only if: (a) such Representative is advised in writing by  SERVICE PROVIDER of the existence and terms of Agreement and of the obligations of confidentiality herein; and (b) such Representative is made subject to confidentiality obligations similar to those in Agreement by the  SERVICE PROVIDER.  SERVICE PROVIDER shall be responsible for any breach of the terms of Agreement by it or by its Representatives at all times.
SERVICE PROVIDER undertakes not to communicate discussions in which it participates or will participate as well as any resulting recommendations to and/or decisions of Client, except as explicitly agreed to by Client from time to time.
