clauses.original_text:
SERVICE PROVIDER shall not be bound by any obligations of confidentiality and non-use to the extent that it is clearly able to demonstrate that any part of the Confidential Information:
(a) is known to it or has been in its possession prior to the execution of the Service Agreement and without any obligations of confidentiality; or
(b) is in the public domain at the time of disclosure by Client; or 
(c) becomes part of the public domain through no fault of  SERVICE PROVIDER; or
(d) becomes available to  SERVICE PROVIDER from a third party not in breach of any obligations of confidentiality; or
(e) if disclosure was required by any Governmental authority under any applicable law, rule or regulation or was in response to a valid and binding order of a Court of competent jurisdiction, provided that prior written notice is given to Client so that a protective order or other relief, if appropriate, could be sought by Client. In the event no such protective order or other remedy is obtained,  SERVICE PROVIDER shall furnish only that portion of the Confidentiality Information which is required and will exercise all reasonable efforts to obtain reliable assurances that confidential treatment will be accorded to the Confidential Information so disclosed.
Prohibitions
Without foregoing the generality of the above, the  SERVICE PROVIDER hereby agrees and undertakes not to exploit the Confidential Information, directly or indirectly, by itself / himself or through some other person, in any manner whatsoever, where such exploitation includes but is not limited to use of the Confidential Information for dealing or trading or any activity of a similar nature for the buying and selling of shares, debentures or other securities. It is clarified that the  SERVICE PROVIDER may engage in dealing or trading or similar activity in shares, debentures or other securities in accordance with the applicable laws in force. Also, notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement, the  SERVICE PROVIDER also agrees and undertakes that any Confidential Information relating to the HDFC HDFC AMC or its customers or employees that the  SERVICE PROVIDER receives or accesses for the purpose of this Agreement is kept, stored, saved and maintained within the territory of mainland India at all times and is not transmitted, copied, stored, saved, processed or maintained at any location outside the territory of India.
Remedies
SERVICE PROVIDER recognizes and acknowledges that Confidential Information of Client may be of a special, unique and extraordinary character and that disclosure, misappropriation or unauthorized use of such Confidential Information may, in addition to breach of applicable laws, also cause injury or loss to Client’s business and/or reputation and money damages would be both incalculable and insufficient remedy for any breach of Agreement by the  SERVICE PROVIDER. The  SERVICE PROVIDER expressly agrees, therefore, that Client shall be entitled to seek preliminary/injunctive and/or any other equitable relief to prevent the breach or the threatened breach of any of the terms and provisions hereof by  SERVICE PROVIDER and shall also be entitled to claim or recover from  SERVICE PROVIDER any losses, damages, costs and expenses suffered/incurred as a result of the breach by  SERVICE PROVIDER of its obligations hereunder or any other remedies at law or in equity that it may have including specific performance.
Inspection
Representatives of Client shall be entitled to visit the premises of  SERVICE PROVIDER with prior notice and during normal business hours, to review compliance with the terms of Agreement.

Public Statements
In addition to the limitations on the use and disclosures of Confidential Information set forth herein,  SERVICE PROVIDER agrees that it shall not, without written consent of Client, issue or release or confirm any statement to the general public, to the news media, or to any third party about the Client Mutual Fund or Client or any of its business affairs, except with the prior written consent, both as to the content and timing of any such issue or release or confirmation.
Sharing of Information with Third Party
SERVICE PROVIDER shall not engage in by itself and/or solicit/ assist/ finance or in any other way facilitate any third party, directly or indirectly in developing any products or services by using or application of Confidential Information of Client.

clauses.original_text:
This Reseller Agreement (the “Agreement”) is made as of (the “Effective Date”), by and between Salt Security, Inc.., a Delaware corporation (“Salt Security”), with an address of 3921 Fabian Way, Palo Alto, CA 94303 and [insert Reseller legal name], a [insert Reseller entity type and state/country of incorporation] (“Reseller”) with an address of [insert address] (Salt Security and Reseller each a “Party” and together, the “Parties”).
WHEREAS, Salt Security desires to appoint Reseller as a nonexclusive reseller of the software products and services listed and described on Exhibit A (the “Products and Services”) on the terms and conditions set forth herein; and
WHEREAS, Reseller desires to accept such appointment on the terms and conditions set forth herein.
NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants contained herein and other valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows:
clauses.summary: No relevant standard clause found for type 'Intellectual Property' or similarity too low (0.00).

clauses.original_text:
Resale Orders; Appointment.  Reseller may request to resale Products and Services by submitting a written quote request to Salt Security or a Salt Security authorized distributor (“Distributor), which must contain the following information:  (i) the identity of the applicable end user of the Products and Services; (ii) the applicable end user’s business and email addresses; and (iii) the specific Products and Services, applicable volume levels, subscription start date, and subscription length, to be resold to the applicable end user.  All such information must be accurate and complete and must reflect bona fide orders Reseller has received from end users.  Salt Security may accept or reject a quote request, whether from Reseller or a Distributor, in its sole discretion.  Upon Salt Security’s written acceptance of a quote request, Salt Security shall issue to Reseller (or the applicable Distributor) a written quote that identifies the amount Reseller (or Distributor) shall pay to Salt Security in connection with Reseller’s (or Distributor’s) resale of the Products and Services to the end user identified in the applicable quote request and any other terms and conditions in connection therewith (a “Quote”).  Salt Security will use commercially reasonable efforts to provide Reseller with a Quote not later than seven days following Salt Security’s acceptance of a quote request.  Reseller (or Distributor) must either accept or reject the Quote in writing within three days following receipt thereof, as set forth in the Quote.  Reseller may accept or reject such Quote in its sole discretion, provided that if Reseller rejects such Quote, Reseller may not resell the Products and Services in connection with the Quote.  Subject to the terms of this Agreement, including Salt Security’s written acceptance of a quote request and Reseller’s written acceptance of a Quote (which may be by issuing a purchase order against the Quote, referencing the Quote number, and otherwise matching all information in the Quote), Salt Security authorizes Reseller to resell the Products and Services described in each Order on a nonexclusive basis to the applicable end user specified in the Order, solely for use by such end user in accordance with the terms and conditions of a EULA (as defined below).  Upon Salt Security’s receipt of a purchase order from Reseller, each individual deal will be final and non-cancelable as of the date listed on the purchase order.  The authorization above does not apply to resales to any end user or Products and Services not set forth in an Order.  Salt Security may revise Exhibit A to add or delete Products and Services upon 30 days prior written notice to Reseller.  Any revision will apply to all Orders accepted after the effective date of the revision.  For the avoidance of doubt, Reseller shall independently set its own pricing for the Products and Services to each end user.
Delivery of Credentials.  Subject to Salt Security’s written acceptance of each Order and Reseller’s written acceptance of the applicable Quote, Salt Security will deliver the access credentials needed by the applicable end user to access and use the Products and Services set forth in the applicable Order directly to delivery contact for the end user specified in the applicable Order.  If Salt Security delivers such access credentials to Reseller, Reseller agrees that Reseller shall deliver them directly to the applicable end user and not use or access the Products and Services in any manner.  Reseller shall either delete such access credentials thereafter or maintain them in confidence as Salt Security’s Confidential Information.
EULAs.  All use of the Products and Services by end users shall be subject to the terms and conditions of Salt Security’s end user license agreement located at https://salt.security/customer-terms-and-conditions (“EULA”). Reseller shall require each end user of the Products and Services to agree in writing to Salt Security’s EULA or otherwise ensure that such end users enter into such EULA in a manner that is legally binding upon the end user. Reseller shall provide evidence of each end user’s acceptance of such end user license agreement to Salt Security upon Salt Security’s request.
Enforcement Cooperation.  Reseller shall immediately notify Salt Security of any known or suspected breach of any EULAs or other unauthorized use of the Products and Services and shall assist Salt Security in the enforcement of the EULAs.  Reseller shall make Salt Security an express third-party beneficiary of each EULA.
Identification as Reseller.  Subject to the terms and conditions of this Reseller Agreement, Reseller is permitted to identify Reseller as a Salt Security “Reseller” solely in connection with Reseller’s resales of Products and Services.  Reseller may not use any Salt Security trademark, logo, or service mark (“Salt Security Marks”) except pursuant to Salt Security’s then-current trademark usage guidelines and any other guidelines, policies, and instructions provided to Reseller by Salt Security.  Reseller shall submit Salt Security all representations of the Salt Security Marks that Reseller intends to use in connection with the Products and Services, for Salt Security’s approval of design, color, and other details.  If Reseller acquires any goodwill in any of the Salt Security Marks, all such goodwill will automatically vest in Salt Security and Reseller shall take all such actions or execute any documents necessary to affect such vesting.  Reseller shall not contest the validity of any of the Salt Security Marks or Salt Security’s exclusive ownership of the Salt Security Marks.  Reseller shall not adopt, use, or register, whether as a corporate name, trademark, service mark or other indication of origin, any of the Salt Security Marks, or any word or mark confusingly similar to the Salt Security Marks in any jurisdiction.  Reseller shall not remove or efface any proprietary notices on the Products and Services.
Marketing and Promotion.  Reseller, at Reseller’s own expense, shall:  (i) obtain any licenses, permits, or certifications required in connection with Reseller’s activities under this Agreement; (ii) use its commercially reasonable efforts to conduct its activities under this Agreement to realize maximum resale opportunities for the Products and Services; (iii) conduct its business in a manner that reflects favorably at all times on the Products and Services and Salt Security’s goodwill and reputation; (iv) not make any representations or warranties on Salt Security’s behalf with respect to the Products and Services; and (v) not engage in deceptive, misleading, and illegal practices or representations in connection with the marketing, promotion, and resale of the Products and Services.
Feedback.  Reseller may have the opportunity to present to Salt Security recommendations or feedback for new features, functionality, or other improvements to the Products and Services (“Feedback”), which Salt Security will consider, at its sole discretion, implementing in future updates to the Products and Services.  The Parties agree that all Feedback is and shall be given voluntarily.  Feedback, even if designated as confidential by Reseller, shall not, absent a separate written agreement, create any confidentiality obligation for Salt Security.  Reseller will not provide Salt Security with any Feedback that Reseller is not authorized or permitted to provide to Salt Security.  Salt Security shall be free to use, disclose, reproduce, license or otherwise distribute, and exploit the Feedback provided to it as it sees fit, entirely without obligation or restriction of any kind on account of intellectual property rights or otherwise.
Reserved Rights.  Only the end user of the Products and Services may use the Products and Services.  Reseller shall not use any Products and Services resold under this Agreement for Reseller’s own benefit.  Nevertheless, to the extent Reseller gains any access to the Products and Services, all restrictions set forth in the Salt Security EULAs shall apply to such access.  Salt Security retains all right, title, and interest (including all intellectual property rights) in and to the Products and Services.  No implied right or license is granted by Salt Security to Reseller, whether by implication, estoppel, or otherwise.

clauses.original_text:
Payment.  Reseller shall pay to Salt Security the amounts set forth in each Quote accepted by Reseller in writing, subject to the payment terms and conditions set forth therein.  Unless otherwise set forth in a Quote, Reseller shall pay to Salt Security the amounts set forth in each invoice received by Reseller from Salt Security not later than 30 days following the date of such invoice and via the method set forth on such invoice.  Reseller shall pay all amounts due hereunder in U.S. dollars.  All amounts payable hereunder are non-refundable. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Section 2, if Reseller is paying a Distributor (rather than Salt Security directly), then this Section 2 shall not apply.
Taxes.  Reseller shall pay all taxes, duties, costs, and expenses in connection with its resale of the Products and Services, except for taxes based on Salt Security’s net income.  If Reseller is required to pay Salt Security a lower amount under this Agreement because of any withholding tax, Reseller shall pay to Salt Security such grossed-up amount as would be necessary to provide Salt Security the full amount of the amounts due hereunder, absent any withholding tax imposed on amounts payable hereunder.  Reseller shall provide Salt Security with copies of any withholding certificates or documentation supporting Reseller’s withholding of any taxes on amounts due hereunder.
Late Payments.  Any amount not paid when due hereunder shall be subject to interest at a rate equal to 1.5% of the unpaid amount per month, or the highest rate permitted by applicable law, whichever is less, determined and compounded daily from the due date of such unpaid amount until the date it is paid.  Reseller shall promptly pay to Salt Security any costs of collection (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) in connection with unpaid amounts under this Agreement.
Records and Audit.  Reseller shall keep and maintain complete and accurate records of regarding the resale of the Products and Services hereunder and shall allow Salt Security, or its designee, at Salt Security’s expense (except as set forth below) and during office hours and at reasonable intervals, to inspect and make extracts or copies of such records for the purpose of ascertaining Reseller’s compliance with Reseller’s obligations hereunder (an “Audit”).  If an Audit discloses any underpayment by Reseller of amounts actually due hereunder of five percent (5%) or more, Reseller shall pay to Salt Security, not later than 30 days following a receipt of an invoice therefor, (i) the amount of such underpayment and (ii) the costs of such Audit.  Reseller shall keep and maintain all records required under this Section for at least five years following the expiration or termination of this Agreement for any reason.

clauses.original_text:
Term.  The term of this Agreement will commence on the Effective Date and will continue for a term of one year, unless sooner terminated under this Section 3.  This Agreement will automatically renew for successive one year terms unless terminated by either Party upon no less than 30 days’ written notice prior to the termination of the initial or any renewal term.
Termination for Breach.  This Agreement may be terminated for material breach of any provision of this Agreement by either Party, provided that written notice of the breach has been given to the breaching Party and the breaching Party has not cured the breach within 30 days after delivery of the notice.
Termination for Convenience.  Salt Security may terminate this Agreement at any time, for any reason or no reason and without further liability to Reseller, by providing Reseller with 5 days’ prior written notice.
Effect of Termination; Survival.  Reseller expressly agrees that Salt Security will have no obligation or liability to Reseller resulting from termination or expiration of this Agreement in accordance with its terms.  Upon expiration or termination of this Agreement for any reason, Reseller shall immediately cease all reseller activities with respect to the Products and Services under this Agreement and shall cease identifying itself as a Salt Security reseller or using the Salt Security Marks in connection with Reseller’s activities hereunder.  The provisions of Sections 1.3, 1.4, 1.7, 1.10, 2, 3.4, and 4–6 will survive expiration or termination of this Agreement for any reason.

clauses.original_text:
Sarvatra is a leading end-to-end solution provider for the rural banking sector and designs software products that address all major technological and operational concerns of this sector. Sarvatra Anywhere Money Platform enables the rural branches of banks to offer modern services, like Any Branch Banking, ATM/Debit Cards, RTGS/NEFT processing at branch-level, SMS Alerts, Statement by Email and Phone Banking to rural customers in a cost effective manner. Sarvatra's offerings allow banks to participate in a larger financial ecosystem by providing them access to the national ATM/POS network through connectivity with NFS.
Softcell is a leading Systems Integration services company in India and specialises in sales of IT software, hardware, solutions and consulting services to corporate customers in India. Softcell specialises in providing end-to-end IT solutions to corporate customers and its portfolio of solutions (“Services”) include: Software reselling, Hardware and Networking services, IT Security services, Engineering (MCAD/PLM) Services, Testing Services and Internet Hosting services.

clauses.original_text:
“Agreement” shall mean this agreement including all SOW(s), PO(s) and any amendments agreed in writing by mutual consent of the Parties from time to time.
“Confidential Information” shall mean and include, but is not restricted to all non-public information of either Party that is technical and commercial concerning business, books of record and account, data systems, software, services, any materials, trade secrets, know-how, formulae, processes, algorithms, ideas, strategies, inventions, data, network configurations, system architecture designs, flow charts, drawings, proprietary information, personal data, business and marketing plans, financial and operational information, and all other non-public information, material or data relating to the current and/ or future business and operations, wages related information provided by the disclosing party  (“Disclosing Party”) to the other Party (“Receiving Party”) pursuant to this Agreement including the existence and terms and conditions of this Agreement , or any other information which may come to the knowledge of the Receiving Party. Confidential Information shall not include information which as evidenced by records: (a) is or becomes a part of the public domain through no breach of its confidentiality obligations by the Receiving Party; (b) was in the Receiving Party’s lawful possession prior to the disclosure and had not been obtained by the Receiving Party either directly or indirectly from the Disclosing Party; (c) is lawfully disclosed to the Receiving Party by a third party entitled to disclose such information,  without restriction on disclosure; or (d) is independently developed by the Receiving Party or its Representatives (as defined hereunder) without reference to the Confidential Information.
“Equipment’s” shall mean the list of equipment’s specified in each SOW for which the Service Provider shall carry out the Services.  
“Personal Data or Personal Information” shall mean any information relating to a natural person, which either directly or indirectly, independently or in collaboration with other information, is capable of identifying such person disclosed to or given access to the Service Provider for the purposes of providing the Services.
“Purchase Order” or “PO” shall mean an order in written form issued by SG GSC and accepted by the Service Provider with respect to any requirement for the Services under this Agreement.
“Service Location” shall mean the location(s) specified in each SOW at which the Equipment’s are located and the Service Provider is required to carry out the Services
“Services” shall mean broadly refer to services agreed to be provided by the Service Provider from time to time in accordance with the terms of this Agreement or under applicable SOW.
“SG Group” shall mean a unit formed by SG GSC’s parent company i.e. Societe Generale SA (SG) and a company where SG or SG GSC exercises management control or owns fifty percent (50%) or more of the shareholding in that company
“Statement of Work” or “SOW” shall mean an order in written form made and entered into between the Parties with respect to each PO under this Agreement.

The Parties will sign a SOW with respect to each of its requirement and such SOW shall specify the details including but not limited to services specific details, scope of service, duration, timelines, deliverables, fees, milestones etc. A template of SOW is provided as Annexure A in this Agreement.
The Service Provider shall adhere to the service levels as agreed in each SOW. In case of Service Provider’ failure to adhere to such timelines, SG GSC shall have the right to impose for every breach 2% of the total fees as penalty per week until the issue is rectified by the Service Provider. 
SG GSC will provide the Service Provider with reasonable access to its premises and make available to the Service Provider certain space in its premises as reasonably required for the Service Provider to perform its obligations under this Agreement.

clauses.original_text:
The Service Provider shall submit valid tax invoice(s) in the format prescribed under the relevant legislation, through SG GSC designated online Portal (TradeShift), hereinafter referred as the “Portal”, within seven (7) days from the date as specified in the applicable SoW for payment of fees.  The invoice date shall not be older than three (3) days from the date of submission of invoice on the Portal. Unless otherwise agreed in the respective SOW, SG GSC will not accept invoices submitted manually. The invoice submission process and guidelines are specified in Annexure B to this Agreement.
SG GSC shall make the payment in respect of undisputed invoices within thirty (30) days from the date of receipt of the invoice. An invoice shall be deemed to be undisputed provided no dispute is raised by SG GSC within fifteen (15) days of receipt of the same. If an undisputed invoice remains unpaid for forty-five (45) days, the matter shall be escalated to the Chief Operating Officer (“COO”) of SG GSC for resolving the same.
In the event an invoice is disputed, the Parties shall make all reasonable efforts to amicably resolve the same as soon as the dispute is raised. If a disputed invoice remains unpaid for seventy-five (75) days, the matter shall be referred to the COO of SG GSC for resolution of such dispute.
For any amounts due under this Agreement in each financial year, the Service Provider shall submit the relevant invoices on or before the end of that financial year, except for the month of March. All the invoices pertaining to the month of March shall be submitted on or before 30th April in the subsequent financial year.

clauses.original_text:
Unless otherwise specified, the charges or the fees payable for the services provided herein are exclusive of all applicable taxes including Goods and Services Tax (“GST”), as required under the relevant legislation at the then prevailing rates. SG GSC shall bear such taxes and cesses (if any) payable thereon. However, as per Integrated Goods and Services Tax Act, 2017 (“IGST” Act), supply of goods and services to a SEZ unit are considered to be zero rated supply. Hence, SG GSC being a Special Economic Zone unit (“SEZ unit”), GST is not chargeable on the services provided to SG GSC. Notwithstanding anything contrary stated herein, SG GSC shall not be under any obligation to make any payment to the Service Provider until the receipt of the tax invoice with applicable taxes.
In the event of any discrepancy in data uploaded by the Service Provider on the GSTN portal or any error in the invoice submitted by the Service Provider, the Service Provider shall rectify the same within two (2) days from the date of notification by SG GSC by accepting corrections and if required by issuing invoices/ debit notes/ revised invoices/ credit notes as per the prescribed format, containing all the information as is required for the SG GSC to avail refund or input tax credit (if any). 
If any amount of credit, refund or any other benefit is denied or delayed by the Government to SG GSC or any penalty, interest  imposed on SG GSC due to any non-compliance by the Service Provider, including but not limited to failure to correctly upload details of supply on GSTN portal, failure to issue invoice within the specified timeline, failure to pay GST to the appropriate authority etc. the Service Provider shall be liable to reimburse the loss, penalty or interest which may be incurred by SG GSC on the aforesaid account. SG GSC shall withhold the subsequent payments to the Service Provider and adjust such amount against amount payable to the Service Provider.
All payments shall be made to the Service Provider after withholding applicable taxes under the Income Tax Act, 1961. If any such amount is deducted, SG GSC shall issue a tax deduction at source (“TDS”) certificate to the Service Provider with respect to aforesaid deductions. 
The Service Provider shall continuously maintain a high GST compliance rating score as per the GST laws.
The Service Provider, wherever applicable, shall pass on the benefit of decreased cost arising on account of implementation of GST to SG GSC as per the Anti-profiteering provisions contained in the GST Laws or any rules made thereunder.

clauses.original_text:
Each Party agrees to: (a) use the Confidential Information solely for the purpose of performing its obligations under this Agreement; (b) not to disclose any Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party to any third party without prior written consent of the Disclosing Party; (c) limit the dissemination of the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information to only those of the Receiving Party's officers, and employees (“Representatives”) who require access to such information to perform their functions in connection with the purpose for which the Confidential Information is disclosed and to the  attorneys and financial advisors on a strict ‘need to know’ basis; (d) to ensure that each person or entity who is permitted to receive or have access to the Confidential Information is bound by a confidentiality obligation consistent with this Agreement; (e) to exercise the same degree of care with respect to the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information as it uses for its own confidential information of like importance, but no less than reasonable care; and (f) to return to the Disclosing Party, or if such return is not possible destroy, Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party at source which will be incapable of being recovered through normal or laboratory means upon receipt of a written request from the Disclosing Party without retaining any copy thereof
Either Party shall have a right to disclose the Confidential Information to the legal / regulatory authorities pursuant to a binding court order or government regulation, provided that if permitted under law, the Receiving Party provides a notice to the Disclosing Party, in order for the Disclosing Party to obtain a protective order. If the Disclosing Party is unable to obtain a protective order, the Confidential Information may be disclosed only to the extent necessary under law.
Either Party is not permitted to discuss the other Party’s affairs with any member of the press and other news media without written authorization from the appropriate authorized representative of such other Party. Each Party acknowledges and agrees that any breach of the confidentiality obligations set forth in this Clause shall cause the other party irreparable harm for which monetary damages would be inadequate. Accordingly, in the event of such a breach, the Disclosing Party may seek injunctive or other equitable relief to enforce this Agreement in addition to any available legal remedies.
All Confidential Information disclosed by the Disclosing Party hereunder is provided "AS IS" and without warranty of any kind. All Confidential Information shall remain the property of the Disclosing Party. Nothing contained in this Clause or any disclosure pursuant to this Agreement shall be construed as granting any license or right under any intellectual property right, whether present or future.
This obligation to keep information confidential by both Parties shall survive determination, termination or expiration of this agreement.

clauses.original_text:
The Service Provider shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless SG GSC, its Group Companies and their respective officers, directors, employees and agents from and against all claims, actions, suits, demands, damages, obligations, liabilities, losses, settlements, judgments, costs and expenses (including without limitation reasonable attorneys’ fees and costs)  which arise out of or resulting from (i) death, bodily injury or damage to tangible property; or (ii) any negligent act or willful misconduct; or (iii) fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation; or (iv); or (v) any breach of any representation, warranty or covenant made by the Service Provider under this Agreement.
In the event of a third party claim, the SG GSC shall: (i)  as soon as practicable provide a written notice of any claim, demand or action for which SG GSC is seeking or may seek indemnification hereunder and may at its discretion gives the Service Provider the right to control the defense; (ii) commercially reasonable efforts to cooperate with the Service Provider and assist in the Service Provider in the defense of the claim and in the negotiations or settlements of any such claim, demand or action; and (iii) allow the  Service Provider, at its own expense, to participate in such litigation, negotiations and settlements with counsel of its own choosing. However, Service Provider shall not have the right to settle any claim if such settlement may adversely affect any rights or interest of SG GSC or contains a stipulation to, or an admission or acknowledgement of, any wrongdoing (whether in tort or otherwise) on the part of SG GSC. Notwithstanding the foregoing, SG GSC’s failure to so notify Service Provider will not diminish Service Provider’s indemnity obligations hereunder.

"Solicit" shall not be deemed to include public advertising (e.g., in newspapers, websites, job portals or trade publications) and it is hereby clarified that in the event an advertisement recruiting personnel is published by one Party and any employee of the other Party, including an employee who has rendered any Services or is directly involved in the Services under this Agreement, applies for such post of its own volition, the Party who has advertised for recruitment of personnel shall not be deemed to be soliciting such personnel and shall be free to hire such employee if found to be suitable.

For avoidance of any doubt, illegitimate benefit means any benefit or advantage (whether in cash or kind) which is not legitimately due to the recipient, and includes any bribe or kickback.
The Service Provider shall report any possible acts of seeking bribery, illegitimate benefits and/or favors, illicit gratification, existence of conflict of interest, money laundering, corruption, violations of applicable law/policy or any other unlawful or unethical activity by the employees or representatives of SG GSC in dealing with Service Provider or in relation to the business activities of  SG GSC, which the Service Provider has knowledge or information of, via an email to GSC-Whistleblower@socgen.com. The identity of the Whistleblower/Service Provider will be kept secret and will not be disclosed without the consent of the Whistleblower/Service Provider.

clauses.original_text:
Compliance with law: Supplier shall comply with all Supplier Applicable Law.
Good standing: Supplier shall: (i) not at the time of this Agreement or of accepting a PO/Work Order be involved in any litigation, process, contract or investigation that could have a material impact on its ability to perform its obligations; (ii) at all times obtain and maintain all permissions, licences and consents necessary for it to perform its obligations; and (iii) not infringe the rights of a third party in the performance of its obligations.
Vodafone policies: Supplier shall comply with the VPC Supplier Policies as defined and/or as documented in Schedule 4. 
Environmental policy: Supplier shall operate in accordance with a fully documented environmental policy applicable to its activities and shall monitor and manage its environmental impact and set targets for continual improvement. If Supplier breaches the obligations in this clause it shall indemnify Vodafone against any costs, claims and liabilities arising as a result of the breach.
Issued Property: Supplier shall keep all Issued Property safe and in the condition it was received subject to normal wear and tear.  
Data protection: Supplier shall: (i) not do, cause or permit anything which may result in a breach by Vodafone of Applicable Law in connection with the Processing of Personal Data; (ii) where Supplier will Process Personal Data, enter into Vodafone’s standard data processing agreement with Vodafone (and any relevant VGC), including the relevant appendix completed to Vodafone’s satisfaction; and (iii) carry out such Processing in accordance with the terms of such data processing agreement before it enters into it. If Supplier breaches the obligations in this clause it shall indemnify Vodafone against any costs, claims and liabilities arising as a result of the breach.
Information and record keeping: Supplier shall: (i) provide Vodafone with catalogue information and other information as requested by Vodafone in relation the Services, Deliverables and Documentation and the performance of Supplier’s obligations in relation to this Agreement; (ii) ensure that all information provided to Vodafone is complete and accurate and consistent with all other information provided to Vodafone; (iii) ensure that all Documentation and Deliverables provided and any training given to Vodafone/VGC is complete, accurate and sufficient to enable Vodafone/VGC to make full and proper use of the applicable Services; (iv) keep comprehensive records to evidence compliance with obligations, preserve these records for at least 3 years from creation (or longer if required by Applicable Law) and permit Vodafone and its representatives (giving reasonable assistance where requested) to inspect and copy them; and (v) permit Vodafone and its representatives to inspect relevant equipment, premises and to observe the performance of any Services and the production of any Documentation and Deliverables. In each case, such provision of information, access or inspection shall: (i) be on reasonable notice; (ii) be subject to reasonable arrangements to ensure that duties of confidentiality on the part of Supplier to its other clients and third parties are preserved.
Insurance: Supplier shall: (i) effect and maintain in force a public liability insurance policy with a limit of not less than INR[…………] per claim and which provides coverage for Vodafone in like manner to the insured; (ii) effect and maintain in force a professional indemnity (errors and omissions) insurance policy with a limit of not less than INR[…………] per claim and in the annual aggregate; and (iii) maintain the insurances for 3 years after termination of the Agreement.
GST: Supplier shall: (i) raise invoices against the GST registration number provided by Vodafone; (ii) raise invoices which meet all relevant requirements of taxation authorities and all conditions necessary to allow Vodafone to obtain any available tax relief; (iii) provide to Vodafone an explanation of the nature and rate of any tax charged; (iv) on the occurrence of any GST error, provide a corrected invoice to Vodafone showing the overpayment or underpayment, make a reconciling payment to Vodafone of any overpayment within 30 Business Days of the error and allow Vodafone the whole of the Payment Period to make a reconciling payment for any underpayment; (v) provide the information required by Vodafone to enable compliance with the tax elements of Vodafone Applicable Law and any statistical reporting requirements, including the relevant Commodity Code; and (vi) use all reasonable endeavours to ensure that all Documentation are classified under a correct part of Commodity Code attracting the lowest possible duty rate. If Supplier breaches the obligations in this clause it shall indemnify Vodafone against any costs, claims and liabilities arising as a result of the breach.
The Supplier:
undertakes to submit all the necessary information and documents, including in particular, GSTIN of the Supplier, Supplier Site, Billing Location, Shipping Location, certificate of GST registration and such other documents that may be required by Vodafone to adhere to statutory compliances as applicable under the GST law. Vodafone shall not be responsible for verification of GST registration number. Any tax liability arising consequent to non-compliance of law or due to furnishing of incorrect registration number shall be borne solely by the Supplier.  In the event that the Supplier fails to furnish the correct GST registration number, the Supplier shall be treated as `unregistered’.
acknowledges and agrees that it will adhere to all the applicable GST compliances and provide all assistance with any transaction reconciliations to Vodafone, as may be required. Vodafone shall notify the Supplier, in case of any modifications required to be made in outward supply mentioned by Supplier in GSTR-1 against Vodafone, and Supplier shall undertake to make the necessary corrections, modifications, updates or changes within the statutory timelines, as may be prescribed by the Government or any other statutory authority from time to time, so as to enable Vodafone to avail appropriate input credit.
acknowledges and agrees that in the event of any enquiry, scrutiny, audit, assessment or any other tax proceedings are initiated against Vodafone, the Supplier shall fully cooperate with Vodafone and shall furnish all the relevant information, documentation or any other data relevant to the services provided by the Supplier as may be required by Vodafone from the Supplier.
shall adhere to the suggested GST guidelines as shared by Vodafone.
Withholding tax: Supplier shall: (if Vodafone is required to pay withholding tax or make any other tax deduction): (i) accept payment from Vodafone net of the required withholding tax/deduction; (ii) provide any relevant exemption certificates which allow Vodafone to reduce the required withholding tax/deduction; (iii) only require necessary and reasonable evidence from Vodafone that it has accounted to the relevant authority; and (iv) be liable to pay such withholding or deduction to the relevant authority together with any interest and penalties due where Vodafone, in good faith, pays an amount to Supplier without withholding tax/deduction and a subsequent audit identifies that it should have been withheld/deducted.  If Supplier breaches the obligations in this clause it shall indemnify Vodafone against any costs, claims and liabilities arising as a result of the breach.
Tax residence and payments: Supplier shall: (i) be the beneficial owner of all amounts payable by Vodafone to Supplier; (ii) be tax resident in its country of incorporation or in such other country as may be notified in writing to Vodafone prior to entering into this Agreement; (iii) inform Vodafone in advance of the country from which the Documentation/Deliverables are to be dispatched and dispatch such Documentation/Deliverables only from that country; and (iv) only be paid by Vodafone in jurisdictions where Supplier is located or renders services, by wire transfer or other traceable instrument to a bank account in Supplier’s name. If Supplier breaches the obligations in this clause it shall indemnify Vodafone against any costs, claims and liabilities arising as a result of the breach.
Announcements: Except as required by Applicable Law, Supplier shall not issue any announcement or other communication to any third party concerning its dealings with Vodafone in relation to this Agreement in any promotional, advertising or other materials, without Vodafone’s prior express written consent.
Assignment, novation and subcontracting: Supplier shall not under any circumstances assign, novate or otherwise transfer any of its rights or obligations under this Agreement without Vodafone’s prior express written consent, which may be withheld at Vodafone’s absolute discretion (save that Vodafone shall act reasonably in the event that the proposed assignment, novation or transfer is to a Supplier Group Company). Vodafone’s prior express written consent shall be deemed to have been given where assignment occurs pursuant to Vodafone’s supply chain finance scheme. Supplier may subcontract the performance of its obligations under this Agreement provided that: (i) the subcontracted part does not exceed 20% of the work effort envisaged under this Agreement; and (ii) Supplier notifies Vodafone in writing of the identity of the subcontractor(s) prior to such subcontracting.
Evidence of compliance and instructions: Supplier shall (save to the extent prohibited by Applicable Law), in respect of all its obligations: (i) give Vodafone formal written notice in the event that Supplier breaches its obligations; (ii) upon Vodafone’s request, provide reasonable evidence of compliance; and (iii) follow all reasonable instructions from Vodafone.

clauses.original_text:
Compliance with law: Vodafone shall comply with all Vodafone Applicable Law.
Assignment, novation and subcontracting: Vodafone may assign, novate, subcontract, or otherwise transfer any of its rights or obligations in this Agreement to: (i) any VGC; (ii) the purchaser of any business or assets of Vodafone; and (iii) any contractor or third party service provider of any VGC for the purpose of providing services to such VGC, provided that in each case the entity is of sound financial standing.
VAT: Vodafone shall provide to Supplier the VAT registration number for each PO/Work Order.

clauses.original_text:
Confidentiality: 
Vodafone and Supplier shall each, as a receiving party: (i) keep confidential all Confidential Information disclosed by the disclosing party throughout the duration of this Agreement and for a 5 year period following the termination of this Agreement; (ii) use the Confidential Information disclosed by the disclosing party solely in connection with performing its obligations or exercising its rights and not otherwise for its own benefit or the benefit of any third party; and (iii) not disclose the Confidential Information disclosed by the disclosing party to any person save to an any director, officer, employee or professional advisor of a Party, any VGC, or any Supplier Group Company to whom disclosure of Confidential Information is necessary to perform obligations or exercise rights in connection with this Agreement.
Vodafone and Supplier shall each, as a receiving party, ensure that each person to whom it disclosed Confidential Information complies with confidentiality provisions no less onerous than those contained in this clause and will remain liable for any disclosure of Confidential Information by each such person as if it had made such disclosure.
Vodafone and Supplier shall each, on the other Party’s request and on termination of this Agreement: (i) permanently destroy and provide written confirmation of such destruction to the other Party; or (ii) deliver to the other Party, all of the requesting party’s Confidential Information, save where the retention of such Confidential Information is necessary to comply with Applicable Law or otherwise for the other Party to exercise its rights or receive benefits due under this Agreement.
Vodafone and Supplier both agree that the provisions of Core Terms 3.1.1, 3.1.2 and 3.1.3 shall not apply to any information which the receiving party can prove: (i) is or becomes public knowledge other than by breach of this clause; (ii) was in the possession of the receiving party without restriction in relation to disclosure before the date of receipt from the disclosing party; (iii) is received from a third party who lawfully acquired it and who was under no obligation restricting its disclosure; or (iv) was independently developed without access to any Confidential Information disclosed by the disclosing party
Vodafone and Supplier both agree that these provisions shall not apply so as to prevent disclosure of Confidential Information by the receiving party to the extent that such disclosure is required to be made by any authority of competent jurisdiction or by any Applicable Law provided that the receiving party: (i) gives the disclosing party reasonable formal written notice (provided that this is not in contravention of Applicable Law) prior to such disclosure to allow the disclosing party a reasonable opportunity to seek a protective order; and (ii) uses reasonable endeavours to obtain prior to the disclosures written assurance from the applicable entity that it will keep the Confidential Information confidential.
Bribery and corruption:
Compliance with Applicable Law in relation to bribery and corruption is a matter of fundamental importance for Vodafone.
Each Party, including its employees, agents, consultants, contractors and subcontractors, shall:
act in accordance with all Applicable Law relating to bribery and corruption;
not do or omit to do anything likely to cause the other Party to be in breach of any of the law referred to in clause 3.2.2(a);
not give, promise, receive or request any bribes (financial or other advantage), including in relation to any public official;
maintain an effective anti-bribery (including gift and hospitality) compliance programme, designed to ensure compliance with the law referred to in clause 3.2.2(a), including the monitoring of compliance and detection of violations; and
reasonably assist the other Party, at that other Party’s reasonable request and expense, to comply with obligations related to bribery and corruption required by the law referred to in clause 3.2.2(a).
Supplier shall promptly notify Vodafone of any allegation of fraud, bribery or corrupt or unlawful practices made against Supplier in court, arbitration or administrative proceedings, or if any investigation is commenced in respect of such allegations, at any time during the term of this Agreement.
Each Party hereby indemnifies the other Party and its directors, officers, employees, agents and affiliates against all losses which they may suffer as a result of a breach or deemed breach of this clause by the Party granting the indemnity.
clauses.summary: No relevant standard clause found for type 'Termination' or similarity too low (0.00).

clauses.original_text:
Services: Supplier shall perform the Services as set out in Work Orders, and shall deliver all Deliverables accordingly.
Health & safety: Supplier shall insofar as they relate to the Services to be performed, comply with the VPC Supplier Policy A3 Health and Safety. If Supplier breaches the obligations in this clause it shall indemnify Vodafone against any costs, claims and liabilities arising as a result of the breach. Supplier shall exercise all reasonable care when visiting Vodafone / VGC’s premises and follow all reasonable instructions in relation to the use of such premises.
Law enforcement: Supplier shall comply with the VPC Supplier Policy A5 Supplier Assistance with Law Enforcement. If Supplier breaches the obligations in this clause it shall indemnify Vodafone against any costs, claims and liabilities arising as a result of the breach. 
Viruses: Supplier shall: (i) not knowingly or intentionally introduce or permit the introduction of a Virus into the Vodafone network (unless Vodafone expressly directs Supplier to do so in writing); (ii) immediately report to Vodafone if Supplier finds a Virus in the Vodafone network, and provide all information reasonably requested by Vodafone in relation to the Virus; and (iii) where a Virus is introduced by Supplier into the Vodafone network, promptly take all steps necessary as agreed by Vodafone to support Vodafone in eliminating the Virus and if the presence of the Virus results in a loss of data or has a negative impact on the operation of the Vodafone network, mitigate the loss and take all steps necessary as agreed by Vodafone to support Vodafone in restoring the data and ensuring the restored operation of the Vodafone network. If Supplier breaches the obligations in this clause it shall indemnify Vodafone against any costs, claims and liabilities arising as a result of the breach.
Third party products, services and documentation: Supplier shall, on Vodafone’s request, disclose to Vodafone information about third party products, services and documentation that are a part of the Services, Documentation or Deliverables. Where third party products, services and documentation form part of the Services, Documentation or Deliverables, Vodafone may require Supplier to replace those with an equivalent provided by Vodafone, with an equitable reduction in the Price Book to reflect this, and yet nonetheless remain responsible for providing the Services, Documentation or Deliverables as a whole.
Risk: Supplier shall bear all risk of loss or damage to Documentation and Deliverables at all times when they are under Supplier’s control.
Contact with regulatory authorities: Supplier shall not contact any competition, data protection, tax or other regulatory authorities in relation to its work in connection with this Agreement except with the prior written consent of the Category Manager. This provision shall not affect the ability of Supplier to contact any competition, data protection, tax or other regulatory authorities about any matter in relation to its own affairs or to make any contact required by Applicable Law.
Conflict: Supplier shall not participate in any matter which gives rise to a conflict of interest with Vodafone, or any VGC, in relation to a piece of work without the prior written consent of the Category Manager.  
Account manager: Supplier shall provide a dedicated “Account Manager” for Vodafone. The Account Manager shall: (i) meet with Vodafone to undertake a review of the relationship at such times, dates and places as requested by Vodafone up to a maximum of 4 times per calendar year; (ii) provide Vodafone with such management information as Vodafone may require in relation to the Services, in such format as Vodafone may reasonably require. 
Key personnel: Supplier shall, before replacing a Key Person, obtain the written consent of [the Category Manager, such consent not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed. Supplier shall maintain succession plans for each Key Person and make these available to Vodafone on request. Supplier agrees to ensure that the Key Personnel will not, where requested by Vodafone or a VGC (acting reasonably) and documented in the relevant Work Order, provide any services similar to the Services to any business or person that sells or provides services in competition with the applicable VGC for a period of six (6) Months (or such other period as the Parties may agree in writing).
Training: Supplier shall attend training sessions on regulatory, compliance and other matters relevant to the Vodafone or any VGC as reasonably requested by Vodafone.
Knowledge transfer: Supplier shall, in relation to PO, provide to Vodafone or applicable VGC any assistance reasonably requested as necessary to interpret/understand the Services.
clauses.summary: No relevant standard clause found for type 'Payment' or similarity too low (0.00).

clauses.original_text:
Intention not to transfer employees: 
Vodafone and Supplier both agree the intention is that at no time shall there be any transfer of employment either: (i) from Vodafone, or any VGC of their employees (or persons under their control) to Supplier or any Supplier Group Company (or persons under their control); or (ii) from Supplier or any Supplier Group Company of their employees (or persons under their control) to Vodafone or any VGC (or persons under their control).
If an employee claims that his employment or related liability has transferred pursuant to the application of law contrary to the Parties’ intention set out above, the Party receiving the claim will give formal written notice to the other.
Each Party shall indemnify the other Party against all claims arising under or in connection with such a claimed transfer for wages benefits up to the date of transfer, termination of employment (including for pay in lieu of notice, statutory, customary or contractual redundancy pay or unfair and wrongful dismissal), infringement of any other statutory or common law employment right (including for unlawful discrimination and personal injuries) and any failure to inform and consult appropriate representatives.
clauses.summary: No relevant standard clause found for type 'Termination' or similarity too low (0.00).

clauses.original_text:
General: Supplier shall provide the Services and Documentation to Vodafone as more particularly described in the following table or in any PO/WO.
No commitment: The volume of Services and Documentation which Vodafone or any VGC may require Supplier to provide under this Agreement may vary from time to time and Vodafone does not in any way undertake, warrant or represent that this Agreement will generate a specified volume of business or revenue for Supplier or any Supplier Group Company.
Provision of Services: Services shall be provided by Supplier for the period specified in [until terminated in accordance with] the relevant PO/WO (subject to any rights of termination in accordance with Part F (Duration and Termination)). 
Problems: Supplier shall inform Vodafone without undue delay if it becomes aware of any event likely to have a negative impact on the proper performance of this Agreement or any PO/WO.
clauses.summary: No relevant standard clause found for type 'Termination' or similarity too low (0.00).

clauses.original_text:
Vodafone shall, when it wishes to procure from Supplier in this Category, agree a Work Order with Supplier.  To proceed with the WO, Vodafone shall issue a PO referencing the WO. No commitment is entered into until there is both: (i) an agreed WO; and (ii) an accepted PO. 
Supplier shall respond to each PO within 3 Business Days of receipt, either by: (i) accepting it; or (ii) rejecting it. If Supplier does not respond to a PO within 3 Business Days of receipt, the PO will be deemed accepted by Supplier unless Supplier can reasonably demonstrate that the PO was not issued by Vodafone in accordance with all of the applicable provisions of this Agreement. Upon acceptance (or deemed acceptance) of the PO the content of the WO referenced by the PO shall be deemed automatically accepted. If the reference number of the WO uploaded to the attachment portal is missing from the PO, the PO must be rejected or will be deemed accepted by the Supplier. Subject to this clause 5.2, Supplier shall not be entitled to reject any PO that has been issued in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. 
General principles: 
Each PO and Work Order shall be prepared in accordance with the Price Book and one of the Pricing Models. Each PO/Work Order shall be prepared accordingly. Supplier shall accept each PO issued by Vodafone in accordance with all of the applicable provisions of this Agreement.
Supplier shall not be entitled to charge for: (i) expenses or disbursements save as in accordance with the  VPC Supplier Policy A4 Supplier Expenses; (ii) time spent travelling except actual time spent undertaking work in the period of travel; (iii) time associated with new members of the team familiarising themselves with a piece of work in the event that any team members are replaced during a piece of work; (iv) time spent undergoing training or education; (v) time spent performing administrative tasks that are part of Supplier’s internal business or operations; (vi) time spent billing, time recording or related issues; or (vii) time spent remedying any defective work, except in each case with the prior written consent of the Category Manager.
Prices are inclusive of all costs and expenses relating to the licenses, media, transfer, delivery, supply, performance of or otherwise relating to the Services, Deliverables and Documentation.
If any items or details are not expressly stated in the Requirements or the Specifications, but are required for the effective, safe and efficient use of the Services, Deliverables or Documentation, Supplier shall include such items or details in or with the Services, Deliverables or Documentation and such items and details shall be deemed included in the price notwithstanding such omission.
Supplier shall provide a breakdown of the price for each element of the Services including, where possible, any third party products or services and details of the grade and day rate of each relevant individual. Supplier shall provide forecasting and work in progress statements in relation to the Services as requested by Vodafone.
The Parties shall carry out an annual review of pricing. Any change shall come into effect on the date agreed between the Parties. Where an invoice received after the date of a change to the price in the Price Book relates in whole or in part to the period before such change then Supplier shall adjust the invoice accordingly to pass on the benefit of any reduction or discount to Vodafone, but shall not be entitled to pass on increases in the price for the period.
clauses.summary: No relevant standard clause found for type 'Payment' or similarity too low (0.00).

clauses.original_text:
Supplier shall invoice for the price only: (i) in [insert agreed currency] (ii) in accordance with any relevant invoicing milestones; (iii) after meeting any relevant performance milestones; (iv) after the undertaking of any relevant ATP and the satisfaction of any relevant Assurance Criteria; and (v) on receipt of a services receipt notice. 
Supplier shall include on its invoice references identifying: (i) the WO; (ii) the PO; (iii) ATPs undertaken and confirmation of the satisfaction of any relevant Assurance Criteria; and (iv) any other information specified by the Category Manager.
Supplier shall, unless requested otherwise by Vodafone, issue invoices electronically via Vodafone’s chosen eInvoicing solution and send paper copies, together with any supporting documentation reasonably required by Vodafone, to Vodafone at [insert details of Vodafone address to which paper copies must be sent] or such other address notified by Vodafone. 
Subject to receipt of a valid invoice and compliance by Supplier with the terms of this Agreement, Vodafone will pay the amount of such invoice (including any corresponding VAT which is properly chargeable) to Supplier within the Payment Period.
Vodafone will make payments by electronic transfer of funds in [insert agreed currency,] and Supplier shall give credits in [insert agreed currency,] within 10 Business Days of the need for a credit being identified. 
Vodafone may withhold from payment that part of any invoice which it reasonably disputes and set off and withhold any debt or sum owing to Vodafone by Supplier. Vodafone may choose a credit note in lieu of a corrected invoice.
clauses.summary: No relevant standard clause found for type 'Payment' or similarity too low (0.00).

clauses.original_text:
Supplier shall: (i) deliver the Documentation DDP (in accordance with Incoterms 2010) on the delivery date agreed with Vodafone during Normal Business Hours to the delivery address; (ii) ensure that receipt of Documentation is signed for at the delivery address; (iii) issue advance shipment notices/despatch notes to Vodafone; (iv) accompany all deliveries with a list all of the Documentation (including unique identification numbers), the PO number and such other information as reasonably requested by Vodafone. Software shall be delivered electronically unless otherwise agreed between the Parties and deemed delivered to Vodafone when all necessary access codes have been provided and it is made available for download.
Title to anything due to pass to Vodafone under this Agreement shall pass to Vodafone on creation, irrespective of payment.
Supplier shall transfer the Documentation to Vodafone with full title guarantee and shall not retain any title to or have any pledge, lien or other security interest over any Documentation.
Supplier shall ensure that all packaging contains clearly identifiable and proper markings consistent with Vodafone’s written instructions and all Applicable Laws and Standards and is secure and tamper proof to ensure that the contents reach the delivery address in undamaged condition.
clauses.summary: No relevant standard clause found for type 'Payment' or similarity too low (0.00).

clauses.original_text:
Supplier shall ensure and conclusively demonstrate to Vodafone that the Services, Documentation and Deliverables meet the Assurance Criteria using the process of any agreed ATP.
Supplier shall: (i) conduct each ATP at locations specified by Vodafone (acting reasonably) in timescales agreed by Vodafone; (ii) permit Vodafone (together with its invitees) to witness and participate in each ATP; (iii) provide all necessary test environments, equipment and labour required for each ATP; (iv) provide Vodafone with a copy of any ATP results and outputs mapped against the Assurance Criteria; and (v) classify, prioritise and resolve faults detected during an ATP in accordance with each ATP.
Vodafone may reject any matter (in whole or part) which either: (i) does not meet the Assurance Criteria; or (ii) is non-compliant with the Requirements, the Specifications or the PO/Work Order.
Supplier shall, if requested by Vodafone re-perform the Services as many times as necessary in order to meet the Assurance Criteria and be compliant with the Requirements, the Specifications and the PO/Work Order.  If Supplier fails to do so on any single occasion, Vodafone shall be entitled to terminate the PO as if the breach was not capable of remedy.   
Supplier shall reimburse Vodafone all reasonable costs and expenses suffered or incurred as a result of the rejection of any Services, Documentation or Deliverables within 10 Business Days of such rejection.
Any Warranty Period shall not commence until the Assurance Criteria are met using the process of any agreed ATP.
Nothing in the operation of the Assurance Criteria or the ATP shall operate so as to transfer risk in the quality or scope of the Documentation or Deliverables to Vodafone.
clauses.summary: No relevant standard clause found for type 'Payment' or similarity too low (0.00).

clauses.original_text:
Supplier shall: (i) perform the Services in accordance with the Agreement and each PO and Work Order; (ii) perform the Services with adequate numbers of appropriately skilled personnel and with due care and diligence; (iii) perform the Services to the highest professional standards and in accordance with good industry practice; (iv) ensure that any individuals named in a PO or Work Order are fully involved throughout the performance of the Services; (v) operate in accordance with the SLAs; (vi) comply with the Requirements and the Specifications and ensure that there is no inconsistency between the Requirements, the Specifications, the Deliverables and the Documentation; (vii) comply with all Applicable Law and Standards; (viii) provide all Deliverables and Documentation and training in English and such other languages as are specified in the PO and Work Order and ensure that all Deliverables and Documentation are fit for the purpose held out by Supplier and compliant with the Requirements, Specifications and Assurance Criteria. 
On the occasion of any breach of Supplier’s performance obligations and without in any way limiting other remedies available to Vodafone, Supplier shall (at Vodafone’s option) either: (i) perform those Services again within 10 Business Days: or (ii) provide such additional Services as are necessary to remedy the breach within 10 Business Days; and in either case Supplier shall pay all reasonable costs relating to the provision of additional items that are required to remedy the breach including Vodafone obtaining services from a third party in place of the Services where Supplier fails to remedy the breach.  
Supplier shall provide the Specific Software, Supplier Standard Software, and Documentation in accordance with this Agreement, each PO and Work Order and ensure that there is no inconsistency between the Requirements and the Specifications. 
Supplier Software and Documentation Warranties: 
Supplier warrants that all Supplier Software and Documentation shall: (i) comply with the Requirements and the Specifications; (ii) be fit for any purpose held out by Supplier; (iii) be new and, remain free from defects and errors in design, materials and workmanship for the duration of the Warranty Period; (iv) comply with all Applicable Law and Standards for the duration of the Warranty Period); and (v) be compatible with any Supplier Standard Software and Documentation previously supplied.
Supplier shall: (i) (at Vodafone’s option) either repair/correct or replace and redeliver any Specific Software, Supplier Standard Software or Documentation which  during the Warranty Period is in breach of a Specific Software, Supplier Standard Software and Documentation Warranty; and (ii) ensure and demonstrate that any repaired, corrected or replaced Specific Software, Supplier Standard Software or Documentation complies with the Specific Software, Supplier Standard Software and Documentation Warranties and matches the original Specific Software, Supplier Standard Software or Documentation in all respects whilst correcting the breach. 
Supplier shall also ensure that any Specific Software or Supplier Standard Software supplied to Vodafone successfully interworks meaning that, save as set out in the Requirements or the Specifications, the Specific Software or Supplier Standard Software (as relevant): (i) when run on the Vodafone network or with a Vodafone service does not change any data or behaviour of the Vodafone network or any Vodafone service; and (ii) when not run on the Vodafone network or with a Vodafone service, shows the same behaviour as when run with the Vodafone network or a Vodafone service.
Supplier shall pay all reasonable costs relating to: (i) the correction or replacement of Specific Software, Supplier Standard Software or Documentation; (ii) the provision of additional items that are required to remedy the breach of warranty; and (iii) Vodafone obtaining services from a third party in place of the Services or correcting any defect or failure, should Supplier have failed so to correct.
Services Warranties:
Supplier warrants that all Services shall: (i) comply with the Requirements and the Specifications; (ii) be performed by adequate numbers of appropriately skilled personnel, with due care and diligence and that any Key Personnel will be fully involved throughout the performance of the Services; (iii) be performed to the highest professional standards, in accordance with good industry practice; (iv) comply with all Applicable Law and Standards; and (v) be performed in accordance with the SLAs. 
On the occasion of any breach of a Services warranty and without in any way limiting other remedies available to Vodafone, Supplier shall either (at Vodafone’s option): (i) perform those Services again; or (ii) provide such additional Services as are necessary to remedy the breach of the Services warranties (all within 7 Business Days). 
Service Credits:
Vodafone is entitled to service credits as set out in the relevant SLA.
The Service Credits shall be calculated on a quarterly basis. This shall be provided by supplier as credit or be set off against subsequent invoices.
LATE/NON DELIVERY
Supplier shall achieve the Key Milestones. If at any time Supplier believes that a delivery date agreed with Vodafone may not be met it shall promptly inform Vodafone in writing, including its estimation of impact on timetable, and submit and implement comprehensive proposals to mitigate the delay, for agreement by Vodafone. 
Subject to the following provision, Supplier shall pay to Vodafone liquidated damages for late delivery of the Key Milestones. Such liquidated damages shall be calculated and payable at the LD Rate, up to the LD Cap, in the manner set out in the relevant Work Order and are payable 10 Business Days after falling due.          
Where there is any act or omission on the part of Vodafone, the effect of which is to materially prejudice the ability of Supplier to perform its obligations, then provided Supplier immediately notifies Vodafone in writing as soon as it becomes reasonably apparent to Supplier that this will impact Supplier’s ability to achieve a Key Milestone, Supplier will be entitled to a fair and reasonable extension of the time to achieve the Key Milestone.
Without prejudice to VPC Supplier Policy A6 Business Continuity, neither Party shall be responsible for failure to fulfil any obligation for so long as, and to the extent to which, the fulfilment of such obligation is impeded by a Force Majeure Event, provided that the Party subject to the Force Majeure Event: (i) has promptly notified the other Party of any circumstances which may result in failure to perform its obligations; (ii) could not have avoided the effect of the Force Majeure Event by taking precautions which, having regard to all the matters known to it before the Force Majeure Event occurred, it ought reasonably to have taken, but did not; and (iii) uses its best endeavours to minimise the adverse consequences that any failure in performance of its obligations might have, and to return the performance of such obligations to normal as soon as possible.
clauses.summary: No relevant standard clause found for type 'Payment' or similarity too low (0.00).

clauses.original_text:
Supplier Software: 
Supplier grants (or procures the grant of) to Vodafone (from the moment delivered to Vodafone, VGC or a VGC customer )  a licence to use Supplier Software in the course of Vodafone’s and each VGC’s business and for any purposes reasonably incidental thereto including use by their customers on the following terms: (i) royalty-free (save as set out in the Price Book), non-exclusive, worldwide, perpetual; (ii) irrevocable (except for material breach by Vodafone or any VGC); (iii) sub-licensable and transferable to any VGC (and sub-licensable by any VGC to any other VGC); (iv) sub-licensable to a third party supplier and outsourcer (to the extent needed to enable the delivery of services to Vodafone or any VGC); (v) transferable to any compatible platform; and (vi) with rights to copy and store for backup purposes and otherwise as reasonably necessary. Where it is intended in the Specifications that Supplier Standard Software should be used by customers, a VGC that has been granted a sub-licence by Vodafone shall have the right to sub-licence Supplier Software (or the applicable part of it) to its customers.
Except as stated in this clause, Vodafone (and its sub-licensees) shall have no right to copy (other than as reasonable for making a back-up), adapt, reverse engineer, decompile, disassemble or modify the Supplier Software in whole or in part except: (i) as permitted by law; (ii) to the extent that such action is legitimately required for the purposes of integrating the operation of Supplier Software with the operation of other software or systems used by Vodafone; and/or (iii) after the occurrence of an event entitling access to the source code pursuant to an Escrow Agreement.
Third Party Software integrated into Supplier Standard Software: Where Supplier makes use of Third Party Software within Supplier Software such that it cannot fully and effectively operate independently of the Third Party Software Supplier shall grant (or procure the grant of) to Vodafone a licence in relation to such Third Party Software on the same terms as are set out above in relation to Supplier Standard Software.
Third Party Software integrated into Specific Software: Without Vodafone’s prior express written consent, Supplier shall not embed any Third Party Software within any Specific Software or use it in the creation of Specific Software or create Specific Software such that it cannot fully and effectively operate independently of Third Party Software.  Where Vodafone gives such prior express written consent (or Supplier fails to advise Vodafone in advance), Supplier shall grant (or procure the grant of) to Vodafone a licence in relation to such Third Party Software on the same terms as are set out above in relation to Supplier Software.
Third Party Software and open source warranty: Supplier warrants and represents that:
it is and shall remain in compliance with any Third Party IPR Conditions;
if the Third Party IPR Conditions place any obligations upon Vodafone, any VGCs or their customers, Supplier shall, prior to delivery of any relevant Service, provide Vodafone with reasonable notice of any steps or obligations that Vodafone, the VGCs or any of their customers are required to take in order to comply with the Third Party IPR Conditions and shall obtain the prior written consent of the Vodafone’s legal department; 
if any Third Party IPR Conditions encumber or otherwise have any material adverse impact upon the Intellectual Property Rights of Vodafone, any VGC or their customers, Supplier shall, prior to delivery of any Service, obtain the prior written consent of Vodafone legal department expressly confirming that Vodafone and the relevant VGCs accept such Third Party IPR Conditions.
Where Supplier is in breach of the warranties set out above, any subsequent failure by Vodafone or a VGC to comply with the Third Party IPR Conditions shall be at Supplier’s risk and subject to the IPR indemnities set out in this Agreement.
clauses.summary: No relevant standard clause found for type 'Payment' or similarity too low (0.00).

clauses.original_text:
All Foreground IPR shall be owned by Vodafone with effect from creation irrespective of payment, and Supplier hereby assigns, or shall procure assignment, by way of future assignment all Foreground IPR to Vodafone. In the event that such Intellectual Property Rights cannot be legally transferred in any country then, to the extent possible in such country, Supplier hereby grants or shall procure the grant to Vodafone of an irrevocable, exclusive, perpetual, worldwide, royalty-free, transferrable, licence, with the right to sub-licence, to use Intellectual Property Rights in the Foreground Material for any purpose, which shall also include the exclusive right to enforce and recover any damages.
All Intellectual Property Rights in any Requirements, Specifications, software and any other material provided by or on behalf of Vodafone to Supplier under a PO/Work Order or otherwise shall remain vested in Vodafone or its third party licensors.
Each Party retains ownership of its own Background IPR.
Supplier hereby grants and shall procure that all other Supplier Group Companies (if applicable) grant to Vodafone a royalty-free, non-exclusive, worldwide, perpetual, irrevocable (except for material breach by Vodafone), sub-licensable and transferable to any VGC, third party supplier and outsourcer, licence to use Supplier’s Background IPR: (i) for use of any Services, Deliverables and Documentation in the course of Vodafone’s and any VGC’s business including use by their direct and indirect customers and for any purposes reasonably incidental thereto; (ii) to commercially exploit any Services, Deliverables and/or Documentation for the purpose for which the Services, Deliverables and/or Documentation were supplied, including for use by customers; and (iii) to allow any third party to use Supplier’s Background IPR to use and/or produce the Foreground Material.  
Where the Supplier knowingly incorporates any third party material, technology or software in any Documentation or Service, Supplier shall (unless otherwise agreed in writing) procure the grant of a license to Vodafone under any third party Intellectual Property Rights in such third party technology or software no less onerous than the license provided under clause 13.4.
Vodafone grants to Supplier a licence to use Vodafone’s Background IPR strictly as necessary to provide the Services, and Deliverables and Documentation (however this licence shall not apply to the Vodafone Marks or Vodafone Brand Materials).
