clauses.original_text:
If a third party alleges that the Documentation, Deliverables or Services provided by or on behalf of Supplier infringes any Intellectual Property Rights (the “Claim”) then Supplier shall indemnify Vodafone and VGC (including their respective officers and employees) for all costs, losses, claims and liabilities associated with these circumstances and, if the quiet enjoyment of such Documentation or Services is prevented promptly secure the right for Vodafone to continue using the Documentation or Services or replace or modify the Documentation or Services to make it non-infringing (without degrading its performance or quality).  
In such circumstances Vodafone shall: (i) promptly notify Supplier in writing of the Claim; (ii) subject to clause 14.4, not make any admission, compromise or settle the Claim without the prior written consent of Supplier, not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed; (iii) subject to clause 14.5, allow Supplier, in its discretion, to decide what action, if any, to take and to control and conduct the Claim; and (iv) provide Supplier, at Supplier’s cost, with all assistance as it may reasonably require in the conduct of the Claim.
Supplier shall: (i) confirm acceptance of the indemnification and conduct of Claim within 5 Business Days of receipt of the notice given under 14.2(i); (ii) keep Vodafone reasonably informed of the conduct and development of the Claim; and (iii) not make any admission or settlement on behalf of Vodafone or any VGC without its/their prior written approval, not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed.
Vodafone may take any action, which is reasonably necessary if Supplier unreasonably refuses to take action or unreasonably delays in taking action in defending or settling any Claim.
If Vodafone reasonably determines that a Claim under clause 14.1 exceeds or may exceed the scope of the indemnity under that clause (including if the Claim extends beyond the relevant Services or impacts other products or services), the Parties shall reasonably agree the management of such Claim. In the absence of agreement, the Parties shall have joint control over the management of such Claim.

clauses.original_text:
Except as provided in this clause, Supplier shall not use any Vodafone Marks and Supplier shall not use or register any confusingly similar devices, logos, trade names, trade mark or domain names incorporating the Vodafone Marks or any other distinctive element of the Vodafone Marks. 
Vodafone grants (or shall procure the grant of) to Supplier in the countries in which the Services will be performed by Supplier, a non-exclusive, royalty-free, non-sub-licensable, non-transferable, licence to use the Vodafone Marks (and any relevant Vodafone Brand Materials) only for such period and purpose as is necessary for performance of a PO/WO.
Supplier shall use the Vodafone Marks (and any relevant Vodafone Brand Materials) strictly in accordance with Vodafone’s written instructions and brand guidelines notified to Supplier.
Vodafone shall give Supplier reasonable notice of any changes to Vodafone Marks and any Vodafone Brand Materials. Supplier shall implement all changes to its use of the Vodafone Marks and Vodafone Brand Materials within a reasonable time.
Nothing will afford Supplier any right, title or interest in respect of any of the Vodafone Marks apart from the right of Supplier to use the Vodafone Marks as provided in this clause. Any use of the Vodafone Marks will be for the benefit of the owner of the Vodafone Marks only. Any goodwill in the Vodafone Marks that may have been acquired by Supplier through its use of the Vodafone Marks will automatically be transferred to Vodafone Group Plc or such other company as is specified by Vodafone Group Plc for this purpose without any compensation to Supplier.
Supplier will not undertake and will not authorise any practice that may be detrimental to the Vodafone Marks or the Vodafone Brand Materials or goodwill or reputation of any Vodafone Group Company or to the Documentation, Deliverables or Services or may result in the rights of any Vodafone Group Company in the Vodafone Marks or Vodafone Brand Materials becoming diluted.
Supplier grants (or shall procure the grant of) to Vodafone a non-exclusive, royalty-free, transferable, sub-licensable, worldwide perpetual licence to use the Supplier Marks for the purpose of promoting distributing, selling and using the Documentation and Deliverables in accordance with the terms of this Agreement including the right to promote, distribute and sell the Documentation and Deliverables direct or through third party distribution channels.

clauses.original_text:
Save as otherwise expressly stated, Supplier’s maximum liability to each VGC for all Actions relating to procurement under this Agreement for this Category in each 12month period from the date of this Agreement (excluding any liquidated damages or service credits paid or payable by Supplier) shall be limited to the greater of INR 450,000,000 for the relevant VGC or 200% of the aggregate value of all PO/Work Orders issued in relation to this Category for the relevant VGC during that period.
Save as otherwise expressly stated, Vodafone’s maximum liability for all Actions relating to procurement under this Agreement for this Category in each 12month period from the date of this Agreement shall be limited to 100% of the aggregate value of all PO/Work Orders (to the extent to which such value relates to VGCs that are the subject of the Actions) issued in relation to this Category during that period and to which the Actions relate.
Direct Losses shall be recoverable under this Agreement. However, save as otherwise stated in this Agreement, neither Supplier nor Vodafone shall be liable for any Indirect or Consequential Losses.   
Nothing in this Agreement (including clauses 16.1, 16.2 and 16.3 of these Category Terms), excludes or limits liability in relation to: (i) Supplier’s liability for physical damage to property; (ii) Supplier’s liability for repudiatory breach, wilful default and wilful abandonment; (iii) Supplier’s liability for its obligations in relation to the Processing of Personal Data under this Agreement; (iv) Supplier’s liability if a third party alleges that the Documentation, Deliverables or Services provided by or on behalf of Supplier infringes any Intellectual Property Rights; (v) either Party’s liability for breach of confidentiality provisions; (vi) either Party’s liability for death or personal injury resulting from its negligence; (vii) either Party’s liability for fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation; (viii) either Party’s liability to the other under this Agreement in relation to tax, bribery or corruption or Transfer Regulations; (ix) either Party’s liability which cannot be excluded by Applicable Law; or (x) invoiced amounts properly due and payable by Vodafone to Supplier.  
HARDWARE:
The Supplier:
will supply the Hardware by or before the date stated in the PO/SOW and in accordance with the Specifications as stated by Vodafone in the relevant PO/SOW and this Agreement.
will deliver the Hardware to the place stated in the PO/SOW and unloaded in accordance with any directions given by Vodafone.
will ensure that the title to the Hardware, free of encumbrances and all other adverse interests, will pass to Vodafone upon the Hardware coming into the possession of Vodafone or its employees or agents. 
warrants that it is able to provide title to the Hardware to Vodafone in accordance with this clause.
must install and configure the Hardware and provide training to Vodafone's personnel to the extent specified in the PO/SOW. Without limiting its obligations under this Agreement, the Supplier must ensure that the Hardware is supplied, delivered, installed, fully integrated, configured and properly interfaced with Vodafone's System
must complete its own commissioning tests of all Hardware, and on the successful completion of those tests, must give Vodafone written notice that such tests have been successfully completed.
Vodafone will provide the Supplier with all reasonable assistance required by the Supplier to facilitate the Supplier's delivery and installation of the Hardware.

clauses.original_text:
Vodafone will conduct the Acceptance Tests on the Hardware which is susceptible to Acceptance Testing.
Vodafone will conduct the Acceptance Tests on the Hardware referred to in the above clause promptly after the Supplier notifies Vodafone in writing that such Hardware is ready for Acceptance Testing.
The Supplier must assist Vodafone, where requested by Vodafone in writing to the Supplier, to conduct the Acceptance Tests. Such assistance as is provided by the Supplier to Vodafone shall be at the Supplier’s cost and expense, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the parties.
Vodafone must notify the Supplier whether or not the Hardware has passed the Acceptance Tests provided that Vodafone will not unreasonably withhold or delay notification to the Supplier that the Hardware in question has passed the Acceptance Tests.
If an item of Hardware has passed the Acceptance Tests, Vodafone will notify the Supplier in writing regarding acceptance of such Hardware item.
An item of Hardware will not be considered to have been accepted by Vodafone until a written communication is provided by Vodafone to the Supplier for the Hardware item, regardless of whether or not Vodafone has used the item in a production environment.
An item of Hardware is deemed to have been accepted by Vodafone from the date of written acceptance communication sent by Vodafone to the Supplier.
If in the reasonable opinion of Vodafone, an item of Hardware fails an Acceptance Test, then:
Vodafone will promptly issue to the Supplier a written notification of such failure specifying the aspects of the item of Hardware which has failed the Acceptance Test;
subject to the remainder of this clause 18, Vodafone will request the Supplier to make such corrections and modifications that are necessary to enable the Hardware to pass the Acceptance Test and be ready for re-testing at an agreed time, but no later than five Business Days from the date of the written notification of failure, unless otherwise agreed in writing between the parties; and
the Supplier must, at its own expense, comply with Vodafone’s request and must notify Vodafone when such corrections and modifications have been made to the item of Hardware. Upon notification by the Supplier, Vodafone will then commence re-testing of the item of Hardware in accordance with the Acceptance Test procedures as soon as reasonably practicable.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, subject to Vodafone’s consideration of any explanation provided by the Supplier, Vodafone may at its discretion, provide a written consent to:
waive the requirement for the Acceptance Test in question to be satisfactorily completed;
conditionally accept the item of Hardware, subject to the Supplier agreeing to deliver a workaround or to otherwise rectify any deficiency within a timeframe agreed by the parties; or
subject to Vodafone having provided the Supplier with at least one opportunity to conduct further tests pursuant to clause 18.8.3, reject the Hardware concerned, whereupon the Supplier will be in default of this Agreement. Without limiting any other remedy which may be available in these circumstances, Vodafone may require the removal of the rejected item of Hardware.

The Supplier warrants and represents to Vodafone that:
the Hardware will perform and function in accordance with the Specifications;
the function and performance of Vodafone’s System will not be materially and adversely affected to the point of unacceptable performance following the installation and integration of any Hardware;
the use of the Hardware by Vodafone in accordance with this Agreement will not infringe the Intellectual Property Rights of any third party; and
no Virus will be introduced into Vodafone’s System as a result of the supply by the Supplier of any Hardware which contains a virus or as a result of any wilful or negligent act or omission by the Supplier in providing a Service.
Without limiting any other right of Vodafone, the Supplier will promptly rectify any defect in any item of Hardware, at no charge to Vodafone, if the Supplier becomes aware of the defect during the Warranty Period.
Where the Supplier supplies Hardware that has been procured from a third party, the Supplier assigns to Vodafone, to the extent practicable and to the extent permitted by law, the benefits of the warranties and representations given by the third party.
This assignment does not in any way relieve the Supplier of the obligation to comply with warranties and representations offered directly by the Supplier to Vodafone under this Agreement.

clauses.original_text:
No failure or delay by a Party to exercise any right or remedy provided under this Agreement or by law, or a single or partial exercise of such right or remedy, shall constitute a waiver of that or any other right or remedy, nor shall it preclude or restrict the further exercise of that or any other right or remedy. 
DISPUTES, GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION
In the event of a dispute arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, either Party may call a meeting for the purpose of resolving such dispute or difference by service of not less than 5 Business Days' formal written notice and each Party agrees to procure that its designated representative(s) from its management team shall attend all such meetings. The members of the meeting shall endeavour in good faith to resolve such dispute. If any dispute referred to such meeting is not resolved at that meeting, then either Party, by formal written notice to the other, may refer the dispute to designated senior officers who shall co-operate in good faith to resolve the dispute as amicably as possible within 10 Business Days of service of such formal written notice. If such senior officers fail to resolve the dispute in the allotted time, then this dispute resolution procedure shall be deemed exhausted.
Damages alone may not be an adequate remedy for breach by Supplier and accordingly Vodafone shall be entitled to seek the remedies of injunction, specific performance or other equitable relief for any threatened or actual breach. 
This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of India. Each Party irrevocably submits to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Ahmedabad, Gujarat, India over any dispute, controversy or claim (including any question regarding its existence, validity or termination) arising under or in connection with this Agreement. Each Party has the right to file any action necessary in any court of competent jurisdiction to seek specific performance, an injunction, or other forms of emergency relief to restrain the other as a remedy for any actual or threatened breach.

clauses.original_text:
The Parties hereby undertake and agree to maintain the confidentiality of the Confidential Information and undertake not to disclose such Confidential Information to any third party except with the prior written consent of the other Party, unless such disclosure is required under law or upon receiving an order of a governmental, judicial or regulatory authority. The Parties further undertake to take the same steps to maintain the confidentiality of the Confidential Information as it would to protect its own confidential information.
Each Party agrees to hold secret and protect the other Party's Confidential Information and use that degree of care that it uses or would use with respect to its own proprietary and confidential information to keep the Confidential Information secret.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, either Party may disclose Confidential Information of the other Party which is: (i) already publicly known, (ii) discovered or created by the receiving Party without reference to the Confidential Information of the disclosing Party, as shown in records of receiving Party, (iii) otherwise known to the receiving Party through no wrongful conduct of the receiving Party, (iv) required to be disclosed by law or court order, provided that Party to whom such order is issued provides the other Party reasonable advance notice of its intended disclosure. Each Party hereby acknowledges that disclosure of the Confidential Information by it or breach of the provisions contained herein may give rise to irreparable injury to the other Party and such breach or disclosure may be inadequately compensable in money damages. Accordingly, each Party may seek injunctive relief against the breach or threatened breach of the foregoing undertakings.
Neither Party shall disclose the terms of this Agreement to any third party other than its affiliates and their legal counsel and accountants without the other Party's prior written consent.
The confidentiality obligations in respect of each such Confidential Information shall survive for a period of two years from the date of expiry / termination of the Agreement, except if required under Applicable Law for a longer period.

Fullerton India Credit Company Limited, a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 1956 and having its registered office at Megh Towers, 3rd Floor, Old No. 307, New No. 165, PH Road, Maduravoyal, Chennai, Tamil Nadu – 600 095 and its corporate office at Floor 6, B Wing, Supreme Business Park, Powai, Mumbai - 400076 (hereinafter referred to as  “FICCL” which term shall so far as the context admits be deemed to mean and include its  successors and assigns) of the ONE PART;
AND
THE PERSONS as more particularly described in Schedule I (hereinafter referred to as the “Service Provider”) of the OTHER PART;
FICCL and the Service Provider shall hereinafter be collectively referred to as “Parties” and individually as “Party”.
WHEREAS:
The Service Provider is engaged in providing services to various entities and organizations, in the ordinary course of its business and has offered to provide specialized Services to FICCL more particularly described in Schedule II (hereinafter referred to as “Services”); 
FICCL has agreed to enter into an arrangement with the Service Provider so as to obtain Services (as defined below), on the terms and conditions as contained in this Agreement. 
NOW THIS AGREEMENT WITNESSETH AS FOLLOWS:
SERVICES: 
The Service Provider shall provide specialized Services to FICCL more particularly described in Schedule II (hereinafter referred to as “Services”). 
FICCL may initiate a request for the Services by executing an order (each, an "Order") specifying the Services desired. The Service Provider shall provide Services at/pertaining to places/offices/ branches mentioned in the Schedule IV attached hereto. Any addition/ deletion to the list of locations contained in Schedule IV may be done in writing with mutual consent of the Parties. The terms and conditions of this Agreement shall apply to and govern all Orders accepted by Service Provider hereunder, except that Orders may include other terms and conditions which are inconsistent with the terms and conditions of this Agreement or which are mutually agreed to in writing by FICCL and Service Provider.
FICCL may propose changes to the scope, nature or time schedule of the Services being performed under this Agreement. The Parties will mutually agree in writing to any proposed changes, including adjustments to fees and expenses as a result of any changes to the Services.
The Service Provider warrants to FICCL that the materials and services to be delivered or rendered hereunder will be of the kind and quality designated, and shall meet specifications or performance level as mutually agreed between the Parties from time to time. The performance of each individual Service will be monitored. The benchmarks, targets and metrics to be used in the measurement of performance levels will be as mutually agreed between the Parties from time to time. Service review meetings will be held on periodic basis to monitor the service and performance level. Reports on actual service levels achieved will be provided to FICCL within ten working days after the end of each month. The said reports will cover each service component delivered and the performance achieved compared with target. 
Service Provider acknowledges and agrees that this Agreement does not constitute an exclusive agreement between FICCL and Service Provider nor does FICCL commit or guarantee any volume of availment of Services or rupee amount hereunder.
TERM:
This Agreement is effective from the date as specified in Schedule I attached hereto (“Effective Date”).
This Agreement shall continue in effect for a period as specified in Schedule I hereunder (the "Initial Term"), unless earlier terminated pursuant to the provision contained in this Agreement or unless extended by FICCL at its option for further period as mutually agreed between the parties (“Extended Period”) following the expiration of the Initial Term or extended on a month-to-month basis in accordance with sub-section hereof. FICCL shall notify Service Provider 1 (one) month before the expiration of the Initial Term, of its intent to extend the Initial Term. The Initial Term and the Extended Period, if any, together shall hereinafter be referred to as the "Term". In the event FICCL exercises the option to extend the Term, the charges/ fees for the Extended Period shall remain the same unless mutually agreed between the Parties.
After expiration of the Initial Term, in the event the option to extend has not been exercised by FICCL, and in the event this Agreement is not extended by written agreement of the Parties and is not otherwise terminated as provided herein, this Agreement shall continue in full force and effect on a month-to-month basis till the date of execution of any document for extension of the Term or until terminated by Parties on no less than 30 (thirty) days' prior notice. During such continuation of the Agreement the terms and conditions herein recorded shall be valid, subsisting and remain binding on both Parties.
SERVICES FEE AND BILLING:
In consideration of said Services to be provided by the Service Provider, FICCL shall pay charges/fees (“Charges”) as specified and in the manner mentioned in the Schedule III hereunder. The Charges for the Services shall not be subject to change during the Term of this Agreement unless expressly provided for in this Agreement. Invoices shall be consolidated and submitted by Service Provider on a monthly basis and shall be due and payable not later than the 30th day from the date of receipt of the invoice by FICCL, subject to deduction of taxes as per applicable laws. There will be no late payment service charge of any kind. FICCL may, upon notice to Service Provider, withhold payment for Services that fail to meet the minimum performance standards as stipulated from time to time by FICCL and/or question any items invoiced to FICCL. Such non-payment shall not constitute a default or breach of this Agreement. In the event of any dispute between FICCL and Service Provider with respect to the invoiced Services or other related matters, FICCL shall pay the undisputed amount and FICCL and Service Provider shall promptly seek to resolve the disputed matters.
Service Provider shall be responsible for and pay all taxes on Goods and Services, levies, duties, assessments and deductions of every nature required by law in connection with the provision of Services under this Agreement. 
All invoices shall be numbered and dated and Service Provider agrees not to repeat the invoice number for at least a 7 (seven) year period. In addition to statutory requirements, each invoice shall contain, at a minimum, the following information:
The time period covered by the invoice;
An itemized listing of Services provided and the costs associated therewith by FICCL;
Sub-totals;
Taxes on Goods and Services wherever applicable; and 
Additional information reasonably requested by FICCL from time to time.

clauses.original_text:
Both Parties represent that they have expertise in the areas and desires to provide certain services to the Other Party and such services will be detailed in a Work Order (format of which is attached as Schedule A), which will be given by the Party to the Other Party on a case to case basis ("Services"): and both the Parties have agreed to enter into a formal service agreement effective from 
Each Party, in reliance on Other Party's representations set forth herein, desires to engage Other Party as an independent Company, and not as an employee, to perform the Services;
NOW. THEREFORE, in consideration of their mutual covenants herein, and intending to be legally bound, the parties hereby agree as follows:
1.    SCOPE OF SERVICES.
1.1 Services and Deliverables. Each Party will perform the Services described on a Work Order in accordance with the timetable and milestones set forth in each Work Order. All Services, deliverables. Confidential Information, works of authorship, inventions and trade secrets made, conceived or developed by each Party under or in connection with a Work Order, or otherwise for Other Party prior to termination of this Agreement, shall be considered "Work Product" for purposes of this Agreement. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary. Each Party may require Other Party at any time to deliver to Other Party any Work Product that is completed or in progress. The deliverables to be made to the Other Party by each Party as per the Work Orders are referred as "Deliverable/s".
1.2 Changes to the Services. If the Services mentioned in a Work Order changes. Each Party will notify Other Party, as soon as practicable, of any resulting changes to the fees and delivery time. Such changes will be subject to mutual agreement, and either Party may terminate that Work Order rather than agree to such changes and in that event will be obligated to pay only for services performed and expenses incurred prior to termination. If one party requests any changes to Services after other Party has accepted the Services in accordance with Section 1,3. the Parties will agree for revised Work Order describing the changes, the Fee for such changes and the applicable Term.
1.3 Acceptance. The Services and the Deliverables shall be subject to acceptance as to form and content by each Party. Either Party shall, within ten (10) days of receipt of each Deliverable, give Other Party written notice of Customer's acceptance or rejection of the Deliverable. If each Party fails to timely provide such notice. Such Party shall be deemed to have accepted the Deliverable. If each Party rejects a Deliverable as not in conformance with the Work Order. Such Party may either request Other Party to modify the Deliverable to so conform or terminate this Agreement pursuant to Section 5. If one Party requests modification the other Party shall act diligently to complete such modification.
1.4 Standards of Performance. The Services shall be performed in a workmanlike and professional manner by employees of Parties having a level of skill in the relevant area commensurate with the requirements of the project. Parties will provide any training, tools, supplies or other resources necessary to perform the Services. Each Party will ensure that its employees at all times observe security and safety policies of other Party.
1.5 Parties’ Employees: The parties specifically agree that the services of the employees (if any) designated as Designated Employees in a Work Order are essential to the satisfactory performance by each Party of the Services hereunder. If any of such employees becomes unavailable to perform the Services called for hereunder. Each Party shall ensure that substitute employees acceptable to Other Party are made available within ten (10) days thereafter or within such time frame agreed upon by the other Party, to provide the Services. Either Party may at any time request by written notice the removal of any employee(s) of Other Party deemed by each Party to be unsatisfactory, and upon any such request Other Party shall use all reasonable efforts to promptly replace such employee(s) with a substitute employee(s) having appropriate qualifications. Each Party shall have sole responsibility for the payment or withholding of all required central, state and local income taxes, unemployment, worker's compensation and disability insurance, Social Security and other similar taxes in respect of itself and its employees. Each Party shall be responsible for compliance of all Labour laws with respect to the Designated Employees, Each party shall be compliant with all salary obligations, declarations to the competent administration and shall not commit any illegal hiring out of personnel.
1.6 Audits: The Parties agree that each Party shall be entitled to perform at any time any audit at the other Party's offices and place of performance of the Services, to verify that the other Party performs in strict compliance with die Agreement and relevant Work Order. Each party shall assist the other Party to this purpose and provide the latter with all necessary supporting documents
2. FEES. EXPENSES AND PAYMENT
2.1 Fees and payment. Billing shall be made by each party and fee paid by other party shall be as provided in the Work Orders.
2.2 Payment. Payment terms shall be as provided in the Work Orders.
3. PARTIES’   REPRESENTATIONS, WARRANTIES, COVENANTS ANDINDEMNIFICATION
3.1 Representations, Warranties and Covenants. Each Party represents, warrants and/or covenants, as tile context may require, as follows:
(a) Each Party shall obtain the necessary assignments, contracts and releases with or from all parties whose names, likenesses, testimonials, scripts, or similar materials or rights are used as part of a Deliverable, except where each Party undertakes in writing to do so.
() Each Party's entering into and performance of the Services called for by this Agreement do not and shall not violate any applicable law, rule or regulation, or any contract of each party with any other party.
3.2 Indemnification. Parties will indemnify, defend and hold each other harmless from and against any and all claims, demands and actions, and any liabilities, damages and expenses (including court costs and attorney’s fees) resulting there from, caused by or relating to any breach of the foregoing representations, warranties or covenants, or any negligence or intentional misconduct of either party in connection with this Agreement.

clauses.original_text:
4.1 Ownership. The Parties acknowledge and agree that the Work Product is being performed or created at the instance of each party who shall have the unlimited right to supervise, control and direct other party as to all aspects of the creation of the Work Product and that all Work Product will be deemed a work made for hire under the relevant copyright laws and/or an invention owned by each party under the patent laws as appropriate. To the extent the each party has paid the other Party for the same, all rights in and to the Work Product and all material submitted by each Party to other Party as part of the Work Product or part of the process of creating the Work Product, including but not limited to computer programs, files, renderings, sketches, schematics, photographs, notes and drawings, will be the property of each party or whomsoever the each party represents.
4.2 Assignment. Each Party hereby assigns, irrevocably and in perpetuity, to the fullest extent permitted by law under any interpretation of the relationship between the parties, all its right, title and interest and to the Work Product to the other Party to the extent Work Product has been paid for by each Party. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, this Agreement shall operate as an irrevocable assignment in perpetuity by each party to other party of all possible rights under the patent laws in such Work Product, and in the event that a Work Product is determined not to be a work made for hire under the relevant copyright laws, this Agreement shall operate as an irrevocable assignment in perpetuity by each party to other party of the copyright in such Work Product, including all rights there under. Each Party shall take promptly upon request by other Party all actions and execute and deliver all documents, which may be required or helpful in other Party's opinion to fully vest, or to evidence such vesting, of the foregoing rights in other Party.

The contract shall be effective from the date above written and shall remain valid until unless terminated earlier as per the provisions under this contract.
5.2 Termination of Work Orders.
Either party may terminate a Work Order after giving one months' written notice of such termination to the other party. In ease of a material breach of contractual obligations by either party, a Work Order may be terminated by written notice specifying such breach effective 10 days after receipt unless the other party cures the breach within that period.

clauses.original_text: Either Party may terminate this Agreement if a Party defaults or breaches this Agreement and fails to cure such default or breach within 30 days after written notice of such default or breach. Upon any termination of this Agreement, each party shall pay for all efforts and costs incurred prior to the date of such termination and each party shall immediately deliver to other party all materials, data and records of any nature and in any medium, including Confidential Information (as hereinafter defined), received from either party or developed by either party in connection with Services or Deliverables. Termination of this Agreement or of any Work Order shall not affect the obligations of either Party under Sections 3, 4. 6. 7 or 8.

clauses.original_text: For purposes of this Agreement, "Confidential Information" means any confidential or proprietary information of either Party (including, without limitation, any software, drawings, designs, techniques, methodology and data and any such customer lists or other trade secrets), which is disclosed to or learned by either party hereunder, or any Work Product made, conceived or developed by. Either Party hereunder. Either Party shall (i) not disclose the existence of this Agreement, (if) not use or disclose any Confidential Information for any purpose other than for the performance of Services; (iii) use reasonable methods to protect Confidential information from disclosure and exercise at least the same degree of care and precautions that it employs with respect to its own confidential information; (iv) disclose Confidential Information only to those of its employees or other Party who requires access to perform Services: and (v) take appropriate action by instruction, agreement or otherwise with each Party's employees or other persons allowed such access to satisfy the foregoing obligations. This Section shall not apply to any information which is or becomes publicly available through no fault of either party; is already in either Party's possession without restriction on disclosure when disclosed by either party; is independently developed by either party without use of Confidential Information: or is rightfully obtained from third parties without restriction on disclosure. Breach by either party of its obligations under this Section will cause either party irreparable damage for which remedies oilier than injunctive relief will be inadequate, and each party specifically agrees that in such event each party will be entitled to an injunction or similar equitable relief immediately upon request to a court of competent jurisdiction without having to show anything other than the fact of such breach. Nothing herein shall be construed as prohibiting either party from pursuing other remedies for breach.

clauses.original_text:
This Agreement shall be governed and construed by and in accordance with the laws of India and any action brought under this Agreement will, subject to the Arbitration Clause referred to below, be brought in the court of appropriate jurisdiction located in Bangalore, India.
Disputes between the parties in connection with or arising out of the existence, validity, construction, performance, and termination of this agreement may first be resolved amicably between them.  Should such an amicable settlement be not possible, the same may be settled by arbitration in accordance with the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996. The Arbitration Panel shall comprise of three Arbitrators. Each Party shall nominate one Arbitrator and third/presiding Arbitrator shall be nominated/appointed by both the said Arbitrators by mutual consensus. Such arbitration shall be held at Bangalore subject to the jurisdiction of the courts in the city of Bengaluru and the arbitration proceedings shall be conducted in English Language. The decision of the Arbitrator shall be final and binding on both the parties.

AND

clauses.original_text:
“Agreement” shall mean this Agreement, including all Order Form(s) and any amendments agreed in writing by mutual consent of the Parties from time to time.
“Confidential Information” shall mean and include, but is not restricted to all non-public information of either Party that is technical and commercial concerning business, books of record and account, data systems, software, services, any materials, trade secrets, know-how, formulae, processes, algorithms, ideas, strategies, inventions, data, network configurations, system architecture designs, flow charts, drawings, proprietary information, personal data, business and marketing plans, financial and operational information, and all other non-public information, material or data relating to the current and/ or future business and operations, wages related information provided by the disclosing party  (“Disclosing Party”) to the other Party (“Receiving Party”) pursuant to this Agreement including the existence and terms and conditions of this Agreement , or any other information which may come to the knowledge of the Receiving Party. Confidential Information shall not include information which as evidenced by records: (a) is or becomes a part of the public domain through no breach of its confidentiality obligations by of the Receiving Party; (b) was in the Receiving Party’s lawful possession prior to the disclosure and had not been obtained by the Receiving Party either directly or indirectly from the Disclosing Party; (c) is lawfully disclosed to the Receiving Party by a third party entitled to disclose such information,  without restriction on disclosure; or (d) is independently developed by the Receiving Party or its Representatives without reference to the Confidential Information. 
“Corrupt Act” refers to any act consisting of soliciting, authorizing, offering, promising or granting any financial or other benefit (including any payment, loan, gift or transfer of an object of value) for the purpose of inducing a private individual or government official to carry out his duties dishonestly or in a manner that breaches his professional, legal or contractual obligations and/or obtain or retain business with the Customer in a dishonest or unwarranted manner.
“Delivery Date” means the date(s) specified in the Order Form by which the Reseller is required to deliver the Software’s.
“Delivery Location” means the location(s) specified in the Order Form at which the Reseller is required to deliver the Software’s.
“Order Form” shall mean an order in written form issued by SG GSC and accepted by the Reseller with respect to any requirement for the Software’s under this Agreement.
“Original Equipment Manufacturer” or “OEM” shall mean the original manufacturer / owner of the Software supplied by the Reseller under this Agreement.
“Personal Information” or “Personal Data” shall mean any information that relates to a natural person, which, either directly or indirectly, independently or in combination with other information is capable of identifying such person. 
"Software" shall mean any library, utility, tool, or other computer or program code, in object (binary) or source-code form, as well as the related documentation. Software includes the products delivered electronically, pre-installed on an appliance, or locally installed on hardware systems, and Software accessed through the internet or other remote means (such as websites, portals and "cloud-based" solutions).

clauses.original_text:
The Reseller shall supply the Software’s to SG GSC from time to time as may be required by SG GSC. 
SG GSC shall place the order for the Software by issuing an Order Form in writing. A template/Sample of the Order Form is provided as Annexure – A in this Agreement.
Each Order Form shall include the name and description of the Software’s, specifications, brand name or the OEM’s name, quantity, price, Delivery Date, Delivery Location, and any other relevant details.
Each Order Form will be deemed to have been accepted by the Reseller if the Reseller does not reject it, in writing and with specific reason for such rejection, within three (3) days of receipt or if the Reseller ships or delivers the Software, as the case may be.
SG GSC may revise or amend any Order Form upon written notice to the Reseller at any time before the scheduled delivery, as applicable, at no cost to SG GSC, except that if requested changes materially increase or decrease the cost to provide the Software’s, the Parties will negotiate an appropriate adjustment to their obligations under the Order Form. The Reseller will not unreasonably withhold or delay agreement to any such changes requested by SG GSC.

The Reseller is authorized by the OEM to grant SG GSC a non-exclusive, perpetual, irrevocable, royalty-free license of the Software identified in applicable Order Form. 
Subject to the terms and conditions of the Agreement, the Reseller on behalf of the OEM, grants to SG GSC a non-exclusive, perpetual, irrevocable, royalty-free license to use the Software in the numbers as specified in applicable Order Form.
SG GSC may use the Software in executable format for its own use, and may translate or modify the Software or incorporate them into other Software. SG GSC may not, however, transfer or sublicense the Software to any third party, in whole or in part, in any form, whether modified or unmodified.
SG GSC may make copies of the Software in executable code form as necessary for use by SG GSC and for backup or archive purposes.

clauses.original_text:
The term of the Agreement shall commence from 20th Aug 2020 (“Effective Date”) and valid for a period of three (03) years (i.e.,19th Aug 2023), unless terminated by the Parties in accordance with the terms of this Agreement (“Term”). This Agreement may be renewed for further period by mutual consent of the Parties in writing.
SG GSC may terminate this Agreement at any time, for convenience upon giving thirty (30) days prior written notice to the Reseller. Unless otherwise specified, all existing Order Form(s) shall be automatically terminated.
Either Party may terminate this Agreement, including any Order Form, forthwith by written notice to the other Party if:
there is a breach by the other Party of any provision of the Agreement which expressly entitles the Party not in breach to terminate this Agreement; or
there is a material or persistent breach by the other Party of any terms and conditions of the Agreement, which is not remediable, or
there is a material breach by the other Party of any terms and conditions of the Agreement, which is remediable has not been remedied within thirty (30) days of the service of written notice to the defaulting Party specifying the breach and requiring it to be remedied; or
the other Party becomes insolvent, bankrupt or reorganized under the bankruptcy laws; or an insolvency proceeding has been initiated against the other party;
the other Party passes a resolution for winding up (save for the purpose of amalgamation or reconstruction and where the amalgamated or reconstructed company agrees to adhere to this Agreement) or has received a notice for winding up and the Court has passed an order to wind up the company; or  
If the other Party is in breach of its anti-corruption and conflict of interest obligations hereunder or if it has reasonable grounds to believe that the other Party or any of its agents, intermediaries or controlled persons has committed a Corrupt Act.
a receiver has been appointed or an order of attachment before or after judgment has been passed against the other Party or substantial assets have eroded; or
the Force Majeure Event continues for more than thirty (30) consecutive days.
SG GSC may cancel and/or terminate any Order Form, in whole or in part, in the event of any of the following reasons without any further liability:
delay in delivery of Software beyond the agreed date of delivery as stated in the PO.
the Software supplied by the Reseller do not confirm to the specifications agreed in Order Form; or
breach of any other obligations by the Reseller.
Upon termination of this Agreement, SG GSC shall pay for the Software supplied by the Reseller prior to the date of such termination.

clauses.original_text:
Unless otherwise specified, the charges or the fees payable for the Software provided herein are exclusive of all applicable taxes including Goods and Services Tax (“GST”), as required under the relevant legislation at the then prevailing rates. SG GSC shall bear such taxes and cesses (if any) payable thereon. However, as per Integrated Goods and Services Tax Act, 2017 (“IGST” Act), supply of goods and services to a SEZ unit are considered to be zero rated supply. Hence, SG GSC being a Special Economic Zone unit (“SEZ unit”), GST is not chargeable on the Software provided to SG GSC. Notwithstanding anything contrary stated herein, SG GSC shall not be under any obligation to make any payment to the Reseller until the receipt of the tax invoice with applicable taxes.
In the event of any discrepancy in data uploaded by the Reseller on the GSTN portal or any error in the invoice submitted by the Reseller, the Reseller shall rectify the same within two (2) days from the date of notification by SG GSC by accepting corrections and if required by issuing invoices/ debit notes/ revised invoices/ credit notes as per the prescribed format, containing all the information as is required for the SG GSC to avail refund or input tax credit (if any). 
If any amount of credit, refund or any other benefit is denied or delayed by the Government to SG GSC or any penalty, interest  imposed on SG GSC due to any non-compliance by the Reseller, including but not limited to failure to correctly upload details of supply on GSTN portal, failure to issue invoice within the specified timeline, failure to pay GST to the appropriate authority etc. the Reseller shall be liable to reimburse the loss, penalty or interest which may be incurred by SG GSC on the aforesaid account. SG GSC shall withhold the subsequent payments to the Reseller and adjust such amount against amount payable to the Reseller.
All payments shall be made to the Reseller after withholding applicable taxes under the Income Tax Act, 1961. If any such amount is deducted, SG GSC shall issue a tax deduction at source (“TDS”) certificate to the Reseller with respect to aforesaid deductions. 
The Reseller shall continuously maintain a high GST compliance rating score as per the GST laws. 
INSTALLATION, TRAINING AND IMPROVEMENTS 
The Reseller shall, if mutually agreed between the Reseller and SG GSC, install the Software on SG GSC's server on the date agreed between the Parties hereto. At the time of such installation, Reseller shall provide SG GSC with appropriate documentation for the Software reasonably acceptable to SG GSC and a sufficient number of user manuals.
At the time of installation of the Software and for no additional consideration, the Reseller shall provide relevant documentation, user manual, support and walkthrough for the Product and if mutually agreed between the Reseller and SG GSC, Reseller shall train such number of employees of SG GSC as may be determined by SG GSC in the use of the Software at SG GSC's facility, in line with the OEM’s training instructions in such cases.
Any improvements or modifications made by the OEM to the Software shall be promptly provided by the Reseller to SG GSC and shall be automatically included in this Agreement.

During the term of each Order Form, the Reseller shall at no additional cost provide Support to SG GSC with respect to the Software, which shall include:
Providing Support patches, updates, fixes to correct problems experienced by Users of the Software
Correct any defects or replace any of the Licensed Software which is found to be in substantial non-conformance with the Software specifications
Provide enhancements as they become available, to the Software
Provide reasonable remote technical assistance and consultation to SG GSC with respect to use the Software.

Except for the rights granted to SG GSC herein, all right, title, copyright, and interest in the Software, its modifications and error corrections will be and remain the property of the OEM.
If the Software is or is likely to be held infringing any third party intellectual property right, the Reseller, at its expense and option, shall either (a) procure the right for SG GSC to continue using the Software, (b) replace the Software with a non-infringing software, (c) modify the Software to make the product non-infringing or (d) refund SG GSC the fees paid for the Software. However, the Reseller shall not be responsible if the claim of infringement is caused by SG GSC in (i) modifying the Software which is not authorized by the Reseller; and (ii) SG GSC’s use of the Software in combination with any Software not provided by the Reseller.

clauses.original_text:
Each Party agrees to: (a) use the Confidential Information solely for the purpose of performing its obligations under this Agreement; (b) not to disclose any Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party to any third party without prior written consent of the Disclosing Party; (c) limit the dissemination of the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information to only those of the Receiving Party's officers, and employees (“Representatives”) who require access to such information to perform their functions in connection with the purpose for which the Confidential Information is disclosed and to the attorneys and financial advisors on a strict ‘need to know’ basis; (d) to ensure that each person or entity who is permitted to receive or have access to the Confidential Information is bound by a confidentiality obligation consistent with this Agreement; (e) to exercise the same degree of care with respect to the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information as it uses for its own confidential information of like importance, but no less than reasonable care; and (f) to return to the Disclosing Party, or if such return is not possible destroy, Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party at source which will be incapable of being recovered through normal or laboratory means upon receipt of a written request from the Disclosing Party without retaining any copy thereof.
Either Party shall have a right to disclose the Confidential Information to the legal / regulatory authorities pursuant to a binding court order or government regulation, provided that if permitted under law, the Receiving Party provides a notice to the Disclosing Party, in order for the Disclosing Party to obtain a protective order. If the Disclosing Party is unable to obtain a protective order, the Confidential Information may be disclosed only to the extent necessary under law.
Either Party is not permitted to discuss the other Party’s affairs with any member of the press and other news media without written authorization from the appropriate authorized representative of such other Party. Each Party acknowledges and agrees that any breach of the confidentiality obligations set forth in this Clause shall cause the other party irreparable harm for which monetary damages would be inadequate. Accordingly, in the event of such a breach, the Disclosing Party may seek injunctive or other equitable relief to enforce this Agreement in addition to any available legal remedies.
All Confidential Information disclosed by the Disclosing Party hereunder is provided "AS IS" and without warranty of any kind. All Confidential Information shall remain the property of the Disclosing Party. Nothing contained in this Clause or any disclosure pursuant to this Agreement shall be construed as granting any license or right under any intellectual property right, whether present or future.
This obligation to keep information confidential by both Parties shall survive determination, termination or expiration of this Agreement.

The Reseller shall defend, indemnify, protect, save and hold harmless SG GSC from and against all claims, losses, costs, damages, expenses, action suits, proceedings, liabilities and arising from and relating to or resulting directly or indirectly from (i) breach of any terms and conditions, representations or warranties provided under this Agreement; (ii) SG GSC’s use of the licensed Software along with its documentation as per the specifications provided by the Reseller; (iii) non-payment to the Developer of the procured Software from the Reseller; (vii) for any gross negligent acts of or omission, willful misconduct, misrepresentation, fraud on part of the Reseller or its agents, employees, or sub-contractors in the performance of any of its obligations (viii) any statutory non-compliance.
It is hereby clarified that all claims relating to infringement of intellectual property rights connected with the use of the Software under this Agreement shall be addressed to the Reseller directly. In such event, the Reseller shall be responsible for coordinating with the OEM and thereby defending and indemnifying SG GSC.

clauses.clause_title: 6.4 To protect and preserve the goodwill and image of ANSYS Software, Sub-Distributor shall
clauses.original_text:
(a) conduct business in a manner that reflects favorably at all times on ANSYS Software and the 
reputation of ANSYS; (b) avoid deceptive, misleading, or unethical practices that are or might be detrimental to ANSYS, ANSYS Software, or the public, including any disparagement of ANSYS or ANSYS Software; (c) make no false or misleading representations with regard to ANSYS or ANSYS Software; (d) refrain from publishing or employing any misleading or deceptive advertising material; and (e) refrain from making any representations, warranties, or guarantees with respect to the specifications, features, or capabilities of ANSYS Software that are inconsistent with the literature distributed by ANSYS, including all warranties and disclaimers contained in such literature. 
7.The relationship of ANSYS India and Sub-Distributor established by this Agreement is that of independent contractors, and nothing contained in this Agreement shall be construed to: (a)give either party the power to direct and control the day-to-day activities of the other;
(b)constitute the parties as partners, joint ventures, co-owners or otherwise as participants in a joint or common undertaking;
(c)constitute the Sub-Distributor as an agent of ANSYS; or
(d)allow Sub-Distributor to create or assume any obligation on behalf of ANSYS for any purpose whatsoever.
8.Termination.
8.1 This Agreement shall continue in force unless terminated earlier under the provisions of this Agreement. This Agreement shall automatically terminate in the event that the Distribution Agreement is terminated or in the event that the sub-distribution agreement between Distributor and Sub-Distributor is terminated.
8.2 This Agreement may be terminated without administrative or judicial resolution by either party for any reason or no reason, by giving the other party written notice ninety (90) days in advance. 
8.3 In the event of any breach of this Agreement by Sub-Distributor, ANSYS may terminate the Agreement immediately. 
8.4 In the event of termination of this Agreement, any rights that Sub-Distributor may have to sub-distribute ANSYS Software shall also immediately terminate notwithstanding any term in the sub-distribution agreement between Distributor and Sub-Distributor to the contrary. 
9.The rights and obligations of the parties under this Agreement shall not be governed by the UN Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods; rather such rights and obligations shall be governed by and construed under the laws of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, without reference to conflict of laws principles. The federal and state courts within the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania shall have jurisdiction to adjudicate any dispute arising out of this Agreement. ANSYS expressly reserves the right to file actions for injunctive relief before any competent judicial or administrative tribunal of the Geographic Region. Sub-Distributor hereby expressly consents to: (a) the personal jurisdiction of these federal and state courts within Pennsylvania; and 
(b)service of process being effected upon it by registered mail sent to the address set forth at the beginning of this Agreement. Parties acknowledge that ANSYS, Inc. is the intended third-party
beneficiary of this Agreement.
10.Any obligations and duties which by their nature extend beyond the expiration or termination of this Agreement shall survive any expiration or termination and remain in effect.
BY SIGNING BELOW WITH THE INTENT TO BE LEGALLY BOUND, EACH PARTY HAS

CYBLE INFOSEC INDIA PRIVATE LIMITED, a company incorporated in India bearing Corporate Identity Number U72900MH2020FTC350426 and having its registered office at A 602, Rustomjee Central Park, Andheri Kurla Road Chakala, Andheri East, Mumbai -40009 Maharashtra, India (hereinafter referred to as the “CYBLE”, which expression shall unless expressly provided to the contrary herein be deemed to mean and include its Affiliates, successors and assigns) of the FIRST PART;
AND
SOFTCELL TECHNOLOGIES GLOBAL PRIVATE LIMITED, a company incorporated in India bearing Corporate Identity Number U74999MH2018PTC313645 and having its registered office at 303 B-Wing, Commercial-1 Kohinoor City, Kirol Road, Kurla (W) Mumbai – 400070 Maharashtra, India (hereinafter referred to as the “Partner”, which expression shall unless expressly provided to the contrary herein be deemed to mean and include its successors and permitted assigns) of the SECOND PART.
CYBLE and the Partner are wherever the context so requires, hereinafter collectively referred to as the “Parties” and individually as “Party”
WHEREAS:
The Partner is a company is engaged in the business of selling cyber-security products and services.
CYBLE is a company engaged in the business of developing and selling cyber security products and services.
The Partner has approached CYBLE for being appointed as its authorised reseller to advertise, promote, market and distribute the Products (defined hereinafter) and render Services (defined hereinafter) to End Users within the Territory (defined hereinafter) on a non-exclusive basis and CYBLE has agreed to the same on the terms and conditions appearing herein after. 
NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants herein contained, the Parties mutually agree to the following terms:

clauses.original_text:
“Affiliate(s)” shall mean any corporation, firm, partnership or other entity that controls, is controlled by or is under common control with a Party. For purposes of this definition, “control” shall mean the ownership of at least fifty percent (50%) of the voting share capital of such entity or any other comparable equity or ownership interest.   
“Agreement” shall mean this agreement and any and all schedules, annexures and exhibits attached to it or incorporated in it by reference.
“Branding” shall have the meaning ascribed to in Clause 6.3 of the Agreement.
“Confidential Information” shall mean all non-public information, of a Party which is accessible by or is available to the other Party directly or indirectly, whether in writing, oral, graphic, visual or any other tangible, intangible or electronic form including, without limitation, any and all information relating to such Party’s and/or its client’s (whether past, present, or future), financial data, financial results and projections, costs and prices, details of suppliers, retainers, employees and consultants (past, present or prospective), technologies, technical and business strategies, business and marketing plans, marketing and sales techniques, pricing and other strategies, computer programs, software tools, source codes, object codes, protocols, product descriptions, development schedules, product positioning, choices of product names, trade secrets or know how, customer information and Intellectual Property (defined later) as well as any such information not generally known to third parties or received from others that such Party is reasonably expected to treat as confidential;
“Deliverables” shall mean the Products and Services. 
“Effective Date” shall be deemed to be day of 2024, for all intent and purposes in relation to this Agreement.
“End User(s)” shall mean any person or entity using the Deliverables solely for its own usage.
“EULA” or “End User License Agreement” shall mean an agreement directly executed between CYBLE and the End User governing the terms of use of the Product and Services.
“Initial Term” shall have the meaning ascribed to in Clause 10.1 of the Agreement.
“Intellectual Property” shall mean all patents, trademarks, copyrights, designs (including but not limited to registered designs and design rights), trade names, service marks, service names, trade dress, logos and corporate names, both primary and secondary, geographical indications, technology, concepts, creations, discoveries, inventions, improvements, know how, trade or business secrets, service marks, tools, devices, models, moral rights, methods, procedures, processes, systems, principles, algorithms, works of authorship, flowcharts, drawings, books, papers, models, sketches, source codes, formulae, teaching techniques, electronic codes, proprietary techniques, research projects, computer programming code, databases, software programs, data, documents, instruction manuals, records, memoranda, notes, user guides, customer lists, and all confidential information, whether in written, verbal, or machine-readable form, whether registered or not, and whether or not copyrightable or patentable including (a) proposals, financial and accounting data, business and marketing plans, customer and supplier lists, sales targets, sales statistics, market share statistics, marketing surveys and reports, marketing research and any advertising or other promotional material and related information and any databases (electronic or otherwise) containing any of the foregoing; (b) all upgrades, improvements and modifications; and (c) all rights arising from, underlying or relating to (a) and (b) including the right to use, transfer, license, improve and modify the same and all such items of Intellectual Property.
“Partner Discount” means the percentage discount on the Price List available to the Partner for resale to End Users directly or through authorized resellers and annexed hereto as Schedule 5 (Partner Discount).
“Price List” shall mean the then current list price for CYBLE Product(s) & Services provided by CYBLE.
“Product(s)” shall mean CYBLE’s proprietary products listed in Schedule 1 (Description of Products) consisting of (i) software 
“Purchase Order” shall have the meaning ascribed to in Clause 5.1 
“Renewal Term” shall have the meaning ascribed to in Clause 11.1 of the Agreement.
“Sales Target” shall mean the minimum annual sales target required to be achieved by the Partner as detailed in Schedule 4 (Sales Target and Territory).
“Services” shall mean the services to be rendered by CYBLE to the End User in respect of the Products and as more particularly detailed in Schedule 2 (Scope of Services) attached hereto.
“Term” shall have the meaning ascribed to in Clause 11.1 of the Agreement.
“Territory” shall mean the geographic regions specified in Schedule 4 (Sales Target and Territory).
“Trademark” shall mean the registered and unregistered trademarks owned by CYBLE.

clauses.original_text:
CYBLE appoints the Partner as an independent, non-exclusive authorized reseller of the Deliverables in the Territory and the Partner hereby accepts such appointment whereby the Partner shall undertake to market, promote and resell the Deliverables within the Territory for use by End Users who shall be bound by the EULA accompanying the Product. 
Partner shall not have the right to authorize or appoint any dealers, sub-resellers, agents, representatives, sub-contractors, or other third parties to advertise, promote, resell, or distribute the Products within the Territory. The Partner shall not without the prior written consent of CYBLE supply the Deliverables to any person or entity located outside the Territory; or who the Partner knows or ought to reasonably suspect intends to market or resell the Deliverables outside the Territory, whether directly or indirectly.
Without limiting the generality of the foregoing CYBLE reserves the right to advertise, promote, market and distribute the Deliverables, and to appoint third parties to advertise, promote, market and distribute the Deliverables, worldwide, including in the Territory. Further, CYBLE reserves the right, in its sole discretion, at any time and from time to time, to add/delete/modify/substitute the Deliverables it offers  
Without limiting the foregoing restrictions, the Partner shall not: (i) use the Deliverables, documentation, Intellectual Property including Trademark and any other material provided by CYBLE other than as permitted under this Agreement; (ii) remove or destroy any proprietary markings or legends or any encrypted license keys or similar security devices placed upon or contained within the Deliverables; (iii) reverse engineer, decompile, disassemble or otherwise attempt to discover the source code, architecture, underlying ideas, user interface techniques or algorithms of the Deliverables by any means whatsoever; (iv) remove or tamper with in any manner whatsoever, the EULA or any notices or trademarks placed in the Deliverables or in the documentation accompanying the Deliverables. (v) incorporate or embed the Deliverables, in whole or in part, into another product or other computer software code, or integrate the software with any other product without obtaining the prior written consent from CYBLE; (vi) reproduce or otherwise develop the Deliverables, (vii) provide license, lend, or use the Deliverables for timesharing; or (viii) allow the removal, alteration, covering or obscuring of any copyright notice or any other notice or mark that appears on the Deliverables, documentation accompanying the Deliverables or on any copies, or any media

clauses.original_text:
Purchase Orders. The Deliverables shall be made available to the End Users in accordance with the Price List. Partner acknowledges that CYBLE shall have the sole discretion to update, modify or revise the Price List from time to time. The Partner shall place orders on CYBLE for the Deliverables detailing (i) the Deliverables (ii) place of delivery (iii) total price as per the Price List (iv) any other relevant details (“Purchase Orders”) which shall become binding on the Parties upon its acceptance by CYBLE. 
The terms and conditions of this Agreement shall exclusively govern the terms of supply of Product and Services and shall override any conflicting, terms contained in the Purchase Order. 
Partner Discount. The Partner shall be entitled to avail Partner Discount in accordance with Schedule 5 (Partner Discount) on the Purchase Orders so placed under this Agreement which shall form part of the consideration receivable by the Partner under this Agreement subject to the Partner achieving the Sales Target during the Term.
Invoices. The Partner shall be liable to pay to CYBLE such amount for the Deliverables as shall be calculated by applying the Partner Discount to the Price List. The difference between the Price List amount and the amount paid by the Partner to CYBLE shall be the consideration for the distribution activities rendered by the Partner under this Agreement  
Payment. All payments shall be made within thirty (30) days of receipt of Purchase invoices. The Partner agrees and acknowledges that the Partner shall be entitled to adjust any amount payable under the invoice on account of any counterclaim, set-off, adjustment or otherwise. In addition to the legal recourse available to CYBLE, on account of non-payment of the invoice amounts on due date by the Partner, the Partner shall be liable pay penal interest at the rate of % p.a., or the maximum interest rate permitted under applicable law. 
Taxes: All payments to be made by the Partner to CYBLE under this Agreement are exclusive of taxes and Partner shall be solely liable to make payment towards all applicable direct and indirect taxes (including, without limitation, sales, use, excise, foreign exchange tax, stamp tax (or other contract approval or verification payment), value added, withholding and other similar taxes) and all customs duties and tariffs now or hereafter claimed or imposed by any governmental authority on the Deliverables under this Agreement.

clauses.original_text:
Partner Personnel. Partner will employ competent and experienced sales personnel and CYBLE certified solution architects/pre-sales and support staff (as detailed in Clause 6.3 below (Training).  The Partner will diligently follow-up in good faith on leads notified to the Partner by CYBLE and will keep CYBLE advised of general market and other developments that may affect the Deliverables, as well as information on competitive services and activities which come to its attention.  
Training. The Partner so appointed shall be responsible for installing or supporting the Deliverables during resale/post-sale activities for End Users must attend and participate in CYBLE’s virtual, product training course. The Parties acknowledge that CYBLE’s certification course is mandatory for Partner and any Partner Personnel so appointed who classify as solution architects, pre-sales or support engineers
Marketing Materials; Branding.

Partner shall provide CYBLE with advance copies of all advertising and marketing materials to be used by Partner in connection with the Deliverables for prior written approval by CYBLE.; The Partner shall not make any representations or warranties (whether written or oral) regarding the Deliverables which are inconsistent with the Deliverables and documentation, or EULA or any marketing materials provided or approved by CYBLE.
CYBLE hereby grants the Partner a non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable, limited right to reproduce and display the CYBLE Trademark solely for promotional, advertising and marketing of the Deliverables within the Territory (“Branding”), subject to CYBLE’s usage instructions made available from time to time by CYBLE. Additionally, before its first use of specific Branding permitted under the preceding sentence, Partner must receive CYBLE’s formal written approval. The Partner shall take no action that might derogate from CYBLE or its Affiliates any rights in, or the goodwill associated with, Branding, or modify, alter or obfuscate the Branding or use the Branding in a manner that disparages CYBLE and/or its Affiliates or its Deliverables, or portrays any CYBLE and/or its Affiliates or its Deliverables in a false, competitively adverse or poor light.  Partner shall properly attribute and designate the Branding as being owned or the property of the applicable CYBLE and/or its Affiliates or its licensors. Any goodwill generated by Partner’s use of Branding will inure solely to the applicable CYBLE and/or its Affiliates.  Except as licensed in this clause, Partner shall not use any Branding.
This Agreement shall not be construed as granting any right to the Partner to use CYBLE’s or any of its Affiliates' Intellectual Property including Trademarks or otherwise refer to CYBLE or its Affiliates in any marketing, promotional or advertising materials or activities save as expressly set out herein. 
Sales Forecasts and Sales Target. Partner shall upon request from CYBLE provide a quarterly sales forecast within thirty (30) days of the beginning of each calendar quarter during the Term. If the most recent forecast becomes materially inaccurate at any time, Partner will promptly provide CYBLE with updated information. The Partner shall at all times be responsible to achieve the Sales Target failing which CYBLE shall have the right to terminate this Agreement for cause as per Clause 11.3.  
Approvals. Partner shall obtain and maintain, at its own expense, any governmental consents, authorizations, approvals, filings, permits, or licenses required for it to export or import and resale of the Deliverables, without limitation, all consents of and filings with any governmental body.
Feedback. Partner shall provide prompt written notification of any comments (including any suggested modifications, design changes, or improvements of the Deliverables) or complaints about the Deliverables including those made by End Users, and of any problems with the Deliverables that the Partner becomes aware of. Such written notification shall be deemed to be the sole property of CYBLE and shall be considered CYBLE’s Confidential Information hereunder.

clauses.original_text:
Each Party hereby represents, warrants and covenants to the other Party that:  

Existence and Power. Such Party: (a) is duly organized, validly existing and in good standing under the laws of the state or province in which it is organized, (b) has the power and authority and the full legal right, power and authority to own and operate its property and assets, and to carry on its business as it is now being conducted, and (c) is in compliance with all requirements of Applicable Laws.   
Authorization and Enforcement of Obligations. Such Party: (a) has the power and authority and the legal right to enter into this Agreement and to perform its obligations hereunder and (b) has taken all necessary action on its part to authorize the execution and delivery of this Agreement and the performance of its obligations hereunder.  
Execution and Delivery. This Agreement has been duly executed and delivered on behalf of such Party, and constitutes a legal, valid, binding obligation, enforceable against such Party in accordance with its terms.
Consents. All necessary consents, approvals and authorizations of all Regulatory Authorities and other persons required to be obtained by such Party in connection with the Agreement have been obtained. 
No Conflict. The execution and delivery of this Agreement and the performance of such Party’s obligations hereunder: (a) do not conflict with or violate any requirement of Applicable Laws; and (b) do not materially conflict with or constitute a material default or require any consent under, any current contractual obligation of such Party.
Legal or Equitable Action. Such Party is not a party to, nor as of the Effective Date, to each Party’s knowledge, is it threatened with, any legal or equitable action or proceeding before any court, arbitrator, administrative agency or other tribunal which is reasonably likely to adversely affect its ability to execute and deliver this Agreement or fully and timely perform its covenants, duties and obligations described in this Agreement.

clauses.original_text:
Term. This Agreement shall become binding on the Parties from the Effective Date and shall continue for three (3) years “Initial Term”), and thereafter, shall automatically renew for additional 1 (one) year term (each, a “Renewal Term”) (the Initial Term and all Renewal Terms are collectively, the “Term”). Either Party may elect to not renew the Agreement for the Renewal Term by giving the other Party a prior written notice of its intention to not renew at least 60 (sixty) days before the expiry of the Initial Term or the then existing Renewal Term, failing which the Agreement shall stand renewed.

Termination at Will. shall have the right to terminate this Agreement at any time during the Term without assigning any reason whatsoever, by giving at least 0 (ty) days prior written notice to the other Party.
Termination for Cause. Either Party shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement upon thirty (90) days’ prior written notice to the other Party in the event of a material breach of any provision of this Agreement by the other Party if the notifying Party requires cure and such breach is not cured within thirty (30) days after the breaching Party’s receipt of notice of such breach (however, if the breach is capable of being cured and such breaching Party is working diligently to cure such breach the period for cure shall be extended for an additional thirty (30) days).   
Termination for Insolvency. Either Party may immediately terminate this Agreement upon the filing or institution of insolvency, bankruptcy, reorganization (in connection with any insolvency), liquidation or receivership proceedings, or upon an assignment of a substantial portion of the assets for the benefit of creditors by the other Party, or in the event a receiver or custodian is appointed for such other Party’s business, or if a substantial portion of such other Party’s business is subject to attachment or similar process; provided, however, that in the case of any involuntary bankruptcy proceeding or the attachment of a substantial portion of a Party’s assets, such right to terminate shall only become effective if the proceeding or attachment is not dismissed within one hundred and eighty (180) days after the admission thereof.
