clauses.clause_title: Both parties mutually agree that personnel assigned to perfo...
clauses.original_text:
Both parties mutually agree that personnel assigned to perform the Services shall be competent and possess the necessary qualifications. The other party shall exercise exclusive control and direction over these personnel, thereby bearing sole responsibility for all associated liabilities and expenses. 
In the execution of this Agreement, the party's personnel will adhere to the standard workplace policies of both parties. The utilization of temporary employees by the party necessitates prior written consent from the other Party. 
Personnel assigned to provide services under this Agreement shall retain their status as employees of the respective party. Their assignment to provide services to another party shall not result in their becoming employees of the respective party. 
The party shall ensure that the personnel assigned to perform services receive all requisite training. 
Both parties acknowledge that the party and its employees are ineligible for and shall not be entitled to participate in any employee benefit plans offered by either Customer or any party. These benefit plans encompass but are not limited to, pension, profit-sharing, retirement, deferred compensation, welfare, insurance, disability, bonuses, vacation pay, severance pay, and similar programs. clauses.clause_title: Both Parties shall maintain the confidentiality of any sensi...
clauses.original_text:
Both Parties shall maintain the confidentiality of any sensitive information shared during the provision of services. Further confidentiality obligations may be outlined in separate non-disclosure agreements, if necessary. 
All Confidential Information made available hereunder, including copies thereof, shall be returned or destroyed upon the first of:  a) completion of the Services or  
request by any party or Customer. Party may retain, however, subject to the terms of this Section 11, copies of Confidential Information required for compliance with Party’s legal or regulatory obligations and its internal quality assurance requirements. 
Nothing in this Agreement shall prohibit or limit either party’s use of information (including, but not limited to, ideas, concepts, know-how, techniques, and methodologies)  
previously known to it without obligation of confidence,  
independently developed by it,  
acquired by it from a third party which is not, to its knowledge, under an obligation of confidence with respect to such information, or  
which is or becomes publicly available through no breach of this Agreement. 
In the event Party receives a subpoena or other validly issued administrative or judicial process requesting Confidential Information be disclosed, Party shall provide prompt notice to another party, as applicable, of such subpoena or other process. Party shall thereafter be entitled to comply with such subpoena or other process, only to the extent required by law; provided that any disclosure subject to this Section 11 shall not affect the confidential nature of the Confidential Information so disclosed as between the parties hereto.

This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of India. Any disputes or claims arising under or in connection with this Agreement shall be resolved in the courts of Indian Law. 
The Bribery & Corruption Laws and Regulations  
all Data Privacy Laws applicable in the Territory, and party represents and warrants that  o the Services and Deliverables will be in accordance with the applicable 
SOW and shall conform to the Customer’s and party’s requirements, o Parties shall perform the Services professionally and diligently,  
all export laws, rules, regulations and orders of the Indian Laws and all foreign jurisdictions.  
In entering into this Agreement and carrying out its responsibilities under it, Parties warrants and represents that it has not paid, offered or authorized, and will not pay, offer or promise to pay, or authorize the payment of, directly or indirectly, any amounts of money or anything of value to any third party, including, in particular, but not limited to, any government official or employee or any political party or candidate for political office for the purpose of influencing any act or decision of such official or of the government to obtain or retain business, or direct business to any person. Parties agree to notify and/or register with relevant government agencies in the Territory of its appointment hereunder as necessary to carry out its activities under this Agreement. Without limiting the foregoing,both parties agrees that it will not: 
make any payment to any of  customers or to any employees of party’s customers;  
without Party’s prior written consent, use any of its fees paid to it by another party to pay for travel of any customers or individuals employed by party’s customers;  
provide gifts or entertainment to any party’s customers other than is customary for relationship building and such gestures in compliance with the laws of the Territory and  India. 
parties also agree that it will not, directly or indirectly, pay any money to any employee or to any immediate family member of any employee for any reason.  
In furtherance of Party’s obligations, Party assures that, unless express written prior authorization is obtained from another party, Party will not: 
export, directly or indirectly, Software or any ancillary technology provided hereunder (“Articles”) outside of the Territory or to a region embargoed under 
Indian law, either separately or as part of a system; 
provide in any way Articles to or perform Services for a Restricted Party 
(described below); and/or  
provide in any way Articles to or perform Services for a third party if Party has reason to believe that they may be used in a Restricted Activity (described below). 
Party shall provide another party with full information, certifications and other documentation required by one party to ensure that Party has complied with all export restrictions and requirements.

The duration of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall, unless terminated earlier or renewed pursuant to Section 15, conclude on the 31st day of December 2024. 
Either party may, by delivering written notice at least thirty (30) days in advance, and explicitly specifying the grounds for such notice, terminate this Agreement in its entirety due to a material violation of a term or condition in a Statement of Work or this Agreement (as the situation may dictate). The party in violation must remedy said breach within the aforementioned thirty (30) day period; otherwise, termination shall become effective. 
Both parties may, by means of written notice, terminate this Agreement and/or any Statements of Work at their discretion and without providing any rationale, upon thirty (30) days' prior written notice. This termination shall be effective upon notification, except when it arises as a result of the termination of the Prime Contract, in which case no notice is requisite for the termination, and it shall take effect immediately.

Principal-to-principal agreement
This Agreement has been entered into on a principal-to-principal basis and nothing contained in this Agreement shall be deemed to constitute a joint venture, partnership, or agency relationship between Service Provider and PAGEIND. Each Party hereto shall not represent as an agent of the other under any circumstances and at any place and at any point of time and shall fulfil its obligations strictly in terms of this Agreement as between two independent principals in commercial transactions and none of the terms and conditions of this Agreement or their context shall be read or meant to be otherwise.

As consideration for the Services rendered by the Service Provider hereunder, Service Provider shall be paid a fee for the Services in the manner as particularly described in “Schedule 2” (“Service Fee”). 
The Service Provider shall raise and submit a valid invoice to the Bank in respect of the Service Fee within 7 (seven) days from the end of the month in which Services were rendered. The Bank shall pay the undisputed invoices within 30 (thirty) working days of receipt of a valid undisputed invoice.  In case of any disputed invoice, the Parties shall work in good faith to reconcile such dispute, and upon reconciliation Service Provider shall raise a fresh invoice which shall be settled along with the invoice raised by it in the subsequent month. 
Payments by the Bank under the Agreement shall be subject to deductions of tax (where applicable) at the rate prescribed from time to time under the Income Tax Act, 1961.

“Confidential Information”  shall mean any information and documents shared by the Bank with the Service Provider and/or any information and documents comes in to possession of the Service Provider/Representatives and/or any other information which is developed by the Service Provider/Representatives for the Bank, which is including but not limited to confidential information and proprietary information concerning the Bank, its affiliates, subsidiaries, group companies, holding companies including and without limitation; Intellectual Property, trade secrets, secret information, technical processes, finances, software, software language codes, username and passwords, transaction information, data processing methodology, custom developed applications, dealings and method of dealings with the clients or the customers  and its employees together with any  information  relating to Bank’s suppliers, employees, agents, distributors, and customers (including personal information and/or personal sensitive information)and relationships of special trust and confidence with the clients or customers and employees.
The Service Provider shall use the Confidential Information solely for purposes of this Agreement, and shall not disclose to any third party without the prior written consent of the Bank.
The Service Provider agrees and undertakes to ensure that in case Service Provider share any Confidential Information with its affiliates, group companies, associates, subsidiaries, holding company and their respective employees and professional advisors (“Representatives”) and such Representatives shall be bound by the confidentiality obligations under this Agreement and they shall use the Confidential Information only for the purpose of this Agreement.
The Service Provider also agrees that it shall share Confidential Information with the Representatives only to such extent as may be necessary for the performance of the Service Providers obligations under this Agreement. The Service Provider shall inform the confidential nature of Confidential Information to the Representatives and the Service Provider shall ensure that such Representatives shall execute a confidentiality and non-disclosure agreement containing restrictions as stringent as those contained herein to protect the Confidential Information of the Bank.
The Service Provider shall take all measures to protect the confidentiality and security of the Confidential Information and avoid the unauthorized use, disclosure, publication, or dissemination of the Confidential Information; provided, however, that such measures shall be no less stringent than measures taken to protect its own confidential and proprietary information but in no event less than reasonable degree of care.  The Service Provider shall be responsible for breach of any provision of this Agreement by its Representatives. The Service Provider shall and shall ensure that its Representatives shall keep all Confidential Information confidential at all times during the Term and after termination of this Agreement.
The Service Provider agrees and understands that the title to the Confidential Information and Intellectual Property shall always remain with the Bank, and this Agreement shall not be construed to grant to the Service Provider any patents, licenses or similar rights to such Confidential Information and Intellectual Property.
The Service Provider confirms and undertakes that it shall ensure that confidentiality of customer information, if any, shared by the Bank during the course of availing the Service shall be maintained during the Term and even after this Agreement expires or gets terminated. The Service Provider shall be fully liable and responsible in case of breach of security and leakage of customers information.

clauses.original_text:
The Service Provider shall itself perform its obligations under this Agreement and shall not assign, transfer, or sub-contract any of its rights and obligations in relation to all or part of the Services or related thereto. The Service Provider shall appoint sub-contractors and/or assign or transfer any of the rights and obligations under this Agreement with prior written consent of the Bank.  The Service Provider shall at all times remain responsible and liable to the Bank for all the actions of the agents, sub-agents/sub-contractors, assignee, or transferee, as the case may be, with no dilution or diminution of service, controls, penalties, etc.
Notwithstanding anything contrary contained in the terms of this Agreement, Service Provider shall ensure that such agents, sub-agent, sub-contractor, assignee or transferee etc. shall be bound by the terms of this Agreement. For the purpose of this clause and notwithstanding any such written consent being given by the Bank, the Service Provider shall remain liable for the acts and omissions of any delegate it has delegated its activities to i.e. sub agent, sub-contractor, agent etc. If such delegation is as a result of operation of any laws, then Bank shall have an option on such delegation to immediately terminate this Agreement at its discretion. The Service Provider shall be responsible and liable for the performance and risk management practices of its sub-contractors. 
The Bank shall be entitled to assign/transfer part/ all of its rights and benefits under this Agreement/this Agreement to any Person or entity without any prior notice or intimation to the Service Provider. However, the Service Provider shall not transfer or assign this Agreement and/or any obligations or rights under this Agreement to any third party without prior written consent of the Bank.
BUSINESS CONTINUITY PLAN (“BCP”)
The Service Provider hereby confirms that it has developed and established a robust framework for documenting, maintaining and testing business continuity and recovery procedures and the same are tested periodically and agrees to test such business continuity and recovery plan jointly with the Bank and shall ensure that the Service to the Bank would not be adversely affected in any manner on account of any factors including system breakdowns which may cause disruption in the normal functions of the Service Provider.
The Service Provider hereby agrees and understands that Services to be performed under this Agreement shall continue to be offered under ordinary circumstances. In the event of any difficulty in performing the required Services, Service Provider shall make best efforts to make alternative arrangements to ensure that the required Services are continued to be performed.
The Service Provider shall review and test its BCP on an annual basis and notify the Bank of any substantial changes to its BCP. The test shall validate the functionality and effectiveness of the BCP, including but not limited to the feasibility of the recovery time objectives, recovery point objectives and resumption operation capacities.
Following each test the Service Provider shall confirm to the Bank the functionality and effectiveness of the BCP. The Service Provider shall promptly notify the Bank of any test findings that may affect the Service Provider’s performance of its Services. The Service Provider shall promptly implement remedial measures or actions to address the test findings, including those required by the Bank.
Upon the Bank’s request, the Service Provider shall participate in the Bank’s business continuity and disaster recovery exercises in respect of the Services to be provided by the Service Provider.
The Service Provider shall, on request, provide copies of results of any independent assessments of such Business Continuity Plan to the Bank.

clauses.original_text:
The Service Provider hereby agrees to have stringent security practices, control processes and checks in respect of provision of Services under this Agreement.
The Service Provider shall monitor on regular basis and disclose any breaches in the security practices/processes and controls to the Bank
14.3  The Bank shall have the right to continuous monitoring and assessment of the Service Provider, its security practices and control processes so that any necessary corrective measure can be taken promptly undertaken. 
The Service Provider will promptly report to the Bank if a virus is introduced in the software or in any Services provided by the Service Provider, and take all precautions and remedial actions to remove the virus from software site/ Services provided and to remediate the affected systems or data. 
If required by the Bank,  will be provided by the Service Provider to the Bank. 
14.6 The Service Provider shall isolate and clearly identify the Banks customer information, documents, records and assets to protect the confidentiality of the information and shall ensure that such information, data etc. shall not comingle with any other data/information etc. of third parties. It shall also ensure to comply with all Applicable Laws including data privacy law in relation to the customer data and the Confidential Information.  The Service Provider shall store all the Banks data including the customer data in India.
14.7  The Bank has the right to immediately notify any regulator or legal authority, in the event of any leakage of customer information, confidential data/Confidential Information or other relevant records by/originating from the Service Provider and/or its personnel.
14.8 The Service Provider shall keep the consumer data of the Bank confidential during the Term and after termination of this Agreement. In addition to security requirements mentioned in this Agreement, the Service Provider shall ensure that there shall be adequate security mechanism to protect any consumer and other data provided by/received from the Bank and/or any consumer data which comes in to knowledge of the Service Provider during the term of this Agreement for the purpose of providing Services under this Agreement.
AUDIT, CONTROL AND MONITORING
15.1     Internal Monitoring: The Service Provider shall develop and implement internal control procedures to ensure compliance with the provisions of this Agreement.
15.2  The Service Provider shall at all times have in place, and regularly test, security arrangements which are reasonably sufficient to: 
protect the integrity and security of Confidential Information and any other information of   the Bank which includes but not limited to Banks customer personal details and sensitive personal  data having regard to such of the Service Provider’s and the Bank’s obligations under Applicable Laws and regulations as may be notified to the Service Provider in writing from time to time;
ensure that such information is used for purposes of discharging the Service Provider’s obligations under this Agreement only; and
ensure that no unauthorized persons have access to such information/Confidential Information while it is in the possession or under the control of the Service Provider.
Service Provider shall notify the Bank in writing of any adverse development that could significantly impact its respective obligations under this Agreement, and of any expected delay in the performance of such obligations, or any matter likely to impede such performance, or result in non-compliance or breach of this Agreement.
15.4  Audit and Inspection: The RBI and/or legal/ regulatory authority of the Bank, RBI including NPCI shall be entitled to inspect or audit directly and/or through its external/internal auditors, employees etc. the books, transaction records/transactions, operations, systems, Relevant Premises, Relevant Personnel, Relevant Records, software, IT infrastructure,  and the business records and/or any other information of the Service Provider and/or the sub-contractors which pertains to provision of the Services. The Service Provider shall and shall ensure that the sub-contractor shall permit the RBI, Bank/legal/regulatory authority including NPCI its internal/external auditors, employees etc., the Bank’s regulators and regulators’ officials to inspect, examine and audit and to take copies of the Service Provider’s operations, books, transaction records/transactions,  systems, Relevant Premises, Relevant Personnel, Relevant Records, software, the business records audit reports, reviews, findings and/or any other information, which pertain to provision of the Services under this Agreement. The Bank would give prior written notice of  () days for such audit. However, no such notice shall be required from legal/regulatory authority, RBI including NPCI. The Service Provider shall and shall ensure that its sub-contractor shall also cooperate in good faith with the Bank for such audit and inspection and to correct any practices which are found to be deficient as a result of any such audit within a reasonable time after receipt of the Banks audit/ inspection report from Bank, RBI, legal/regulatory authority including NPCI.  
The Service Provider shall immediately comply with any request from the Bank and/or any regulatory/legal authority/RBI including NPCI, to submit any reports on the security and control environment of the Service Provider and its sub-contractor in relation to the Services (including without limitation reports on confidentiality, security adequacy and compliance in respect of the operations of the Service Provider and its sub-contractor). The Service Provider shall obtain certifications in relation to the cloud and other software related services as and when requested by the Bank to ensure that the Bank is in compliance with the legal / regulatory authority. 
For the purpose of this Clause 15:
“Relevant Premises” means any premises in the possession or control of the Service Provider or agents or any sub-contractor from which the Services are delivered (in whole or in part) or in which records relating to the services are kept.
“Relevant Personnel” means all employees, staff, other workers, agents, sub-contractors and consultants of the Service Provider or any sub-contractor who are engaged in the provision of the Services from time to time. 
“Relevant Records” shall include but not limited to any information and documents in relation to this Agreement, Confidential Information, systems and software, transaction information, any records in relation to this Agreement in soft and hard form, any digitized information. 
The scope of audit under this clause shall include without limitation the Service Provider’s and sub-contractor’s security environment (both physical and IT), control environment, incident management process (for material breaches, security disruptions or other material issues), and compliance with risk management requirements set out in this Agreement (including without limitation, the Service Provider’s BCP (as defined above).
15. In the performance of its duties under this Agreement, both Parties shall act in conformity with and in compliance with the requirements of all Applicable Laws, rules and regulations to which either is subject. Notwithstanding any provisions herein, the Service Provider shall ensure compliance with all Applicable Laws, legal and statutory requirements and any revisions thereof and develop and implement internal control procedures to ensure compliance with the provisions herein.

In this Agreement: 
The headings are used for convenience and ease of reference only and shall not affect the construction or interpretation of any provisions of this Agreement.
Unless the context otherwise requires, reference to the singular includes a reference to the plural and vice versa.
Unless the context specifies otherwise, references to recitals, clauses and annexures shall be deemed to be references to the recitals, clauses and annexures of this Agreement. All annexures shall form part and parcel of this Agreement.
References to any enactment are to be construed as referring also to any amendment or re-enactment thereof (whether before or after the date of this Agreement) and to any rules, regulations or orders made under it.

clauses.original_text:
“Affiliate” shall mean with respect to either Party, any Person controlling, controlled by or under common control of such Party. For the purpose of this definition of Affiliate, “control” together with grammatical variations when used with respect to any Person, shall mean the power to direct the management and policies of such Person, directly or indirectly, and “Person” shall mean a company, corporation, a partnership, trust or any other entity or organization or other body.
“Agreement” shall mean this agreement and shall include all Annexures, SOWs annexed hereto and any amendments made thereto in writing by mutual consent of the Parties from time to time.
“Business Day” shall mean a day on which KMBL is open for business. 
“Confidential Information” shall mean any/all materials, documents, applications, ideas, data, details, software’s, systems, writings, statements business/customer/supplier information or other information and trade secrets, personal data/sensitive personal information/personally identifiable information of KMBL customers/employees, research and development, processes, tangible information relating to either Party, its Affiliates, products and services or their respective business affairs, financial information etc., which is not in the public domain and is disclosed by a Party or its Affiliate or representatives to the other Party or accessed by a Party for the purpose of this Agreement. 
“Fee” shall mean the fee payable by KMBL to the Service Provider towards the Services offered and Software provided under this Agreement and vide the Scope of Work/s to be executed covering the specific Service.
“Relative/s” shall mean and include any or all of the following persons: 
Spouse
Father
Mother (including step-mother)
Son (including step-son)
Son's Wife
Daughter (including step-daughter)
Daughter's Husband
Brother (including step-brother)
Brother's wife
Sister (including step-sister)
Sister's husband
Brother (including step-brother) of the spouse
Sister (including step-sister) of the spouse
“Services” shall broadly refer to the services already agreed to be provided from time to time or any other service/s to be provided by Service Provider to KMBL as are to be detailed and mutually agreed in the Scope of Work/s from time to time in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.
“Senior Officer” shall mean any employee of KMBL in the grade M6 and above.
“Substantial Interest” means:
(i) in relation to a company, the holding of a beneficial interest by an individual or his Relative(s), whether singly or taken together, in the shares thereof, the amount paid upon which exceeds five lakhs of rupees or ten per cent of the paid-up capital of the company, whichever is less;
(ii) in relation to a firm, means the beneficial interest held therein by an individual or his Relative(s), whether singly or taken together, which represents more than ten per cent of the total capital subscribed by all the partners of the said firm.

clauses.original_text: Service Provider has a right to resell software MoveIT Automation and Tranfers owned by [Progress Software Corporation] as more specifically elaborated in Annexure A of the Agreement  (“Software”). KMBL hereby agrees to engage the Service Provider and the Service Provider agrees to resell the Software to KMBL and undertakes to perform the Services subject to such modifications as the Parties may agree from time to time and stipulate in writing, together with all other obligations, representations, warranties, functions and duties contained herein. Service shall be provided during the Term of this Agreement, in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement and more particularly described in the Annexure A/Scope of Work (“SOW”) to this Agreement. Each such Scope of Work shall be incorporated hereto and made a part hereof. In the event of a conflict between any terms of this Agreement and a SOW, terms of the SOW shall prevail but only for that particular SOW. Changes within the scope of Services set forth in a SOW shall be made only in writing and executed by authorized representatives of both Parties. Time is of the essence in this Agreement.

clauses.original_text:
In consideration of the Services to be rendered by the Service Provider in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, KMBL agrees to pay the Service Provider the Fees set out in the respective SOW. 
The Fee for additional/new Services or increase in Fee, if any, shall be mutually agreed between the Parties in writing. Unless otherwise agreed in the SOW, all the Fees shall be payable within thirty (30) days by KMBL from date of receipt of invoice from the Service provider.
Service Provider should raise a valid GST tax invoice on KMBL quoting KMBL’s GST number, for the Fees agreed under this Agreement as per the applicable GST law(s) and regulations within the prescribed time limit. Under no circumstances, Service Provider shall raise a separate invoice/debit note/or any document to recover the GST amount any time after a GST tax invoice is issued for the corresponding period.
All payments shall be made by KMBL to the Service Provider as per the undisputed invoice raised by the Service Provider. KMBL shall not make any payment directly to any of the employees of the Service Provider. 
.
KMBL may deduct or withhold any taxes that it is obligated to withhold from any Fee payable to Service Provider under this Agreement, and payment to Service Provider as reduced by such deductions or withholdings of tax will constitute full payment and settlement to Service Provider of such Fee. Service Provider should provide KMBL with any forms, documents, or certifications, including Permanent Account Number as may be required to satisfy KMBL’s withholding tax obligations with respect to any Fee payable under this Agreement. KMBL shall withhold taxes and deposit the same as per provisions of applicable withholding tax laws on the payments to be made to the Service Provider unless an exemption certificate or reduced rate certificate is produced.
Service Provider shall be solely liable for the payment of all direct taxes, duties, fines, cesses, levies, penalties, etc., by whatever name called, as may become due and payable by Service Provider under the applicable laws in force from time to time in relation to the Services rendered pursuant to this Agreement.
To avoid double taxation of GST on KMBL for third party cost/out of pocket expenses, the Service Provider shall ensure that the GST ITC credit on third party cost/out of pocket expenses is passed on to KMBL. Service Provider should raise back-to-back invoice on actuals for third party cost/out of pocket expenses in such manner which enables KMBL to take GST ITC credit on media cost/out of pocket expenses on actuals. 
The Service Provider shall raise a valid GST tax invoice at the end of each period for which it is due and payable. Unless otherwise agreed by KMBL under a particular SOW, KMBL shall make the payment within a period of thirty (30) days from the date of receipt of undisputed invoice by KMBL. 
Service Provider shall remit the GST so charged to KMBL, to the appropriate government authority and comply with GST requirements and reporting obligations in all material respects. Service Provider shall ensure that the details mentioned in the GST invoice is uploaded on the GST network correctly and the GST returns are filed and GST is paid to government within the due dates prescribed under the GST law(s) and regulations. In case of any non-compliance thereof including delayed payment of GST or delayed filing of return or delay/non-upload of the invoice details correctly or otherwise, as a result of which GST credit is denied to KMBL and interest, penalty and other cost is imposed on KMBL, then Service Provider shall be liable to pay such amount together with interest/penalty and any other cost to KMBL. Service Provider agrees and consents KMBL to recover such GST credit loss, interest, penalty and other cost imposed on KMBL, from any payment which will be due to Service Provider under this Agreement.

If and to the extent applicable:
Upon receipt of the Work by KMBL, KMBL  the Work and inform the Service Provider of the same, within such time, as mutually agreed by and between the Parties. For the purpose of this clause; “Work” means the deliverables, products and Services specified under this Agreement. 
KMBL may: (i) return/reject the non-confirming Work to the Service Provider; or (ii) require the Service Provider to repair or replace, at no cost, the non-conforming Work in the event the same fails to meet the requirements of KMBL as may be specified in this Agreement/SOW. KMBL’s payment to Service Provider for Work prior to KMBL’s rejection of such Work as non-conforming will not be deemed as acceptance by KMBL.
In the event KMBL returns or rejects the non-conforming Work then Service Provider shall refund the amount received from KMBL prior to such rejection/return within 30 (thirty) days of intimation of such rejection or return.
KMBL may at its discretion accept a credit note instead of the refund.
Inspection methods, standards employed and other details shall be separately agreed mutually by and between KMBL and the Service Provider in the applicable SOW/PO.

MONITORING, OVERSIGHT AND REVIEW

clauses.original_text:
The Service Provider hereby represents and warrants that it is a corporation duly incorporated, validly existing and in good standing under the laws of the jurisdiction in which it is incorporated. The Service Provider undertakes to take all necessary steps to comply with the provisions of applicable laws, regulations, policies and guidelines issued by any competent regulatory/statutory authority in relation to its obligations under this Agreement, from time to time, and shall provide all information and records of the transactions under the scope of this Agreement to KMBL as and when required by KMBL.
The Service Provider represents and warrants that the OEM has appointed the Service Provider as an authorized reseller for providing services as mentioned in the Annexure A of this Agreement and related subsequent SOWs, if any and in case this warranty is false, the same shall amount to material breach. The Service Provider also represents and warrants to keep applicable approvals, licenses, authorizations, material consents, permits valid throughout the Term of this Agreement and to promptly inform KMBL in writing about any expiry, non-renewal, modification, suspension, revocation, termination or any adverse action by relevant authority which will affect the Services or which may otherwise disqualify or restrain the Service Provider in providing Services to KMBL. Further the Service Provider also undertakes to furnish proof of all such approvals, licenses, authorizations, material consents, permits and their validity from time to time as may be required by KMBL in connection with the Services.
The Service Provider represents and warrants that it has the capacity and authority to execute this Agreement and that the execution and delivery of this Agreement, the consummation of the transactions contemplated hereby, or the fulfillment of or compliance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement, do not conflict with or result in a breach of or a default under any of the terms, conditions or provisions of any legal restriction (including, without limitation, any judgment, order, injunction, decree or ruling of any court or governmental authority) or any covenant or agreement or instrument to  which the Parties are now a party or its constituent document.
The Service Provider represents and warrants that it has the necessary skill, knowledge, experience, expertise, adequate capital and competent personnel, system and procedures, infrastructure, equipment and capability to perform its obligations in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. The Service Providers represents and warrants that it has all the necessary legitimate rights, licenses and/or authorization as regards software, tools, techniques, applications, third party components used by it for providing the Services rendered under this Agreement.
The Service Provider represents and warrants that the persons signing this Agreement on behalf of the Service Provider have been duly authorized to sign, execute and deliver this Agreement and to bind the Parties hereto.
The Service Provider agrees, represents and warrants that no officer/director/employee of KMBL or immediate family member thereof has received or will receive anything in value of any kind from or has a business relationship with the Service Provider or its officers/directors/employees/agents in connection with this Agreement.
Parties agree that any representation and warranties pertaining to the Software shall be provided as per EULA (End User license agreement) that may be executed between KMBL and the OEM.
Service Provider represents and warrants that all information supplied by Service Provider is complete, truthful, and accurate, and that it shall not obtain on KMBL’s behalf or provide to KMBL any information which is not legally available or which is procurement-sensitive, proprietary, or classified where there is reason to believe that possession of such information is unauthorized, illegal, or unethical.
Service Provider represents and warrants that it shall conduct the pre-employment screening exercises/background verification for employees/personnel assigned to perform its functions contemplated under this Agreement. The Service Provider warrants that it shall not engage any person with a criminal record to provide directly or indirectly the Services under this Agreement. Further as and when requested by KMBL, Service Provider shall provide background verification reports within a reasonable period to KMBL.
.
The Service Provider will give prompt written notice to KMBL in the event that, at any time during the Term of this Agreement, it has failed to comply with or has breached any of its warranties hereunder. In the event it has not so complied or has breached any of its warranties herein, KMBL shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement forthwith without any notice and there shall not be any liability upon KMBL for such termination. 
THE SERVICES AND SOFTWARE ARE PROVIDED ON ‘AS IS’ BASIS.  EXCEPT THE REPRESENTATIONS PROIVDED ABOVE, THE SERVICE PROVIDER MAKES NO IMPLIED WARRANTIES INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE OR USE, OR WARRANTIES OF ANY DELIVERABLES OR SERVICES, OR THE APPROPRIATENESS OF KMBL’S OR ANY THIRD-PARTY SPECIFICATIONS.

clauses.original_text:
Service Provider  shall depute some employees/personnel as key persons (”Key Person”) who, on the basis of their knowledge and experience, are of great importance to the proper fulfillment of Service Provider  obligations and KMBL’s requirements.
Service Provider  shall make the Key Person/other identified Service Provider employees/personnel available as required by KMBL, for as long as may be necessary during the Term of this Agreement for providing the Services hereunder.
In the event of removal or reassignment by Service Provider of Service Provider employees/personnel/Key Person, Service Provider shall give 30 (thirty) days prior written notice to KMBL and provide an equivalent replacement to KMBL within the aforementioned timeline. Vendor must ensure that such removal/reassignment should not affect the performance of Services hereunder.
All Key Person/duly authorized personnel/representatives/employees/agents/contractors of Service Provider deputed to provide Services under this Agreement shall be covered under the terms and conditions of this Agreement. Although, Service Provider shall continue to be primarily liable for breaches committed under this Agreement.
Where KMBL demands replacement of a Key Person/other identified Service Provider employees/personnel, if in the opinion of KMBL, the performance or conduct of the resource is or has been unsatisfactory, Service Provider shall replace the Key Person/other identified Service Provider employees/personnel  with a person approved by KMBL as per clause 14.3 of the Agreement.
Service Provider employees/personnel assigned to provide Services under this Agreement shall continue to be Service Provider employees at all times. Hence, Service Provider shall discharge all its obligations as an employer under applicable labor and industrial laws, regulations, rules and ordinances; whether Central or State Government, Body or Authority with respect to its employees/personnel who are assigned to provide Services for KMBL under this Agreement. Service Provider shall also discharge all its financial obligation towards these employees/personnel including but not limited to wages and any other statutory or contractual amounts and benefits to which these employees/personnel are entitled to.
COVENANTS, DUTIES AND OBLIGATIONS OF THE SERVICE PROVIDER
The Service Provider undertakes and assures that the Service Provider, its employees, staff or the personnel while performing its functions on the premises of KMBL shall strictly adhere to the security/access instruction/restrictions and code of conduct/guidelines prescribed by KMBL from time to time.
Service Provider may be provided access to premises of KMBL and allowed use of the equipment or facilities for fulfilling its obligations in terms of this Agreement. The Service Provider agrees not to claim any right, title and interest of any nature whatsoever in the office and/or the equipment or facilities provided by KMBL, at any point of time during the currency of this Agreement or after its expiry/termination.  
The Service Provider, at the requirement of KMBL, shall provide a list (with photograph and other details, including but not limited to bio-data, residence proof, identity proof, previous employment details) of individuals, employees, agents, contractors, representatives or personnel/persons assigned to perform the Services under this Agreement on behalf of the Service Provider and shall immediately notify KMBL in writing of any changes in the list. As and when the foregoing details are updated, Service Provider shall provide the same to KMBL.
The Service Provider shall depute its duly authorized personnel to assist KMBL on a regular basis, meet regularly with KMBL’s personnel to discuss, monitor and review the progress and performance of the Services. KMBL shall have access to the Service Provider at all times for day-to-day queries/clarifications and information that KMBL may seek.
Service Provider shall not deal with any third party in a manner that would result in a conflict of interest or be detrimental to the interest of KMBL.
The Service Provider shall ensure that its employees/personnel shall at all times conduct themselves within the parameters prescribed by KMBL and shall not commit, abet or permit the commission of any illegal act while working in the course of this Agreement and in the event of any illegal act being committed or abetted, Service Provider shall be liable for all consequences thereof and KMBL, shall not be liable either directly or indirectly.
The Service Provider shall carry out its responsibilities in accordance with recognized professional standards and ethics. The Service Provider shall exercise all reasonable care and diligence in the performance of its obligations under this Agreement.
The Service Provider shall remain fully responsible for all acts of its contractors/sub-contractors/employees/agents/personnel/representatives at all times. Nothing in this Agreement shall create any contractual or other relationship between KMBL and such contractors/sub-contractors/employees/agents/personnel/representatives or any obligation on the part of KMBL towards such contractors/sub-contractors/employees/agents/personnel/representatives.
The Service Provider shall comply with and maintain all the registers and records required to be maintained under, various Labour enactments and rules framed there under with respect to its employees.
Service Provider shall be solely responsible to redress any industrial/labour dispute, instituted by it’s employees/personnel either directly or indirectly, against KMBL or any of its directors, officers or Affiliates in respect of or in connection with this Agreement or otherwise.
It is, hereby, clarified that:
The persons deployed by the Service Provider to discharge its obligations under this Agreement shall be its responsibility for all purposes and KMBL shall not be held liable in any manner in respect thereof.
None of the employee/personnel of the Service Provider are/shall be stationed permanently at KMBL’s premises and they shall visit KMBL’s premises only as and when any Service is required as mentioned in this Agreement.
The Service Provider and its employee/personnel are not providing this Service exclusively to KMBL, but are also attending to other customers for same/similar services.
The Service Provider shall procure from its employees/personnel, as KMBL may require, an undertaking/non-disclosure agreement to not disclose to any third party any Confidential Information or information concerning the business of KMBL, and take such steps at Service Provider’s own expense as KMBL, may direct in order to enforce or restrain any breach of the terms of any such undertaking.
Neither the Service Provider nor its representatives/employees/personnel shall, at any time, use or attempt to use KMBL’s Trade Mark/Name or Logo for any purpose including for the purpose of this Agreement unless authorized by KMBL, in writing. 
It is further expressly clarified and agreed that in case of death or bodily injury to any employee/personnel appointed by Service Provider while carrying out any of the obligations under this Agreement, the Service Provider shall be solely responsible for any monetary compensation payable to its employees/personnel.  
The Service Provider or any person connected with it will not represent KMBL in any court, tribunal or commission of enquiry or in any other forum whatsoever without the prior written permission of KMBL. It shall not have any authority to enter into any agreement, compromise, arrangement or understanding on behalf of KMBL or create binding obligations on KMBL. Service Provider shall make no statement, representation or claim and shall give no warranty to any person in respect of the business of KMBL which may give the impression that it has such powers or authority or that it is the agent of KMBL, save as may be specifically authorized in writing by KMBL.
KMBL shall have a right to immediately notify Reserve Bank of India or other statutory/regulatory authorities in the event of any breach of security and leakage of Confidential Information or any personal data/sensitive personal information/personally identifiable information. Further, the Service Provider agrees that in the event there are any requirements emanating from change in applicable law or as may be directed or required by the RBI, Government of India or the Bank, at any future point in time, the Bank shall prescribe and intimate the same to the Service Provider and upon the happening of the same, such prescription shall automatically be deemed to be applicable and mandatory to the Service Provider.
The Service Provider shall provide Services in compliance with the applicable laws (including but not limited Information Technology Act, 2000 and rules made thereunder, as amended, modified or substituted from time to time). 
The Service Provider shall ensure that, at all times during the Term of this Agreement, while its employees, staff or the personnel are at the KMBL’s premises, they shall;
act diligently, ethically, soberly and honestly;
not consume alcohol/be under the influence of alcohol/any intoxicant.
not take or use any drug, unless prescribed by a medical practitioner or lawfully available without prescription and used in accordance with directions.
comply with all occupational health or safety policies of KMBL including (but not limited to) those relating to a smoke free environment.
not be engaged or involved in any business apart from the provision of the Services whilst on KMBL’s premises or otherwise performing the Services on behalf of the KMBL.
not to commit any criminal offence and not otherwise breach any law or regulation which could adversely affect the interests of the KMBL or the provisions of the Services.
not to sexually harass any person or unlawfully engage in discriminatory behavior.
not to represent in any way that they are the employees of KMBL.
carry and display at all times appropriate identification and 
not otherwise act in any manner which could disrupt or adversely affect KMBL’s business, reputation, interests or goodwill.
The Service Provider shall immediately notify KMBL, in writing, of any event which may result in or which may give reason to believe that there may be a work stoppage, slowdown, labour dispute, strike, any labour disruption or other impediments or disruptions in the due performance of the obligations of the Service Provider under this Agreement. The Service Provider shall forthwith submit report of the events to KMBL, and the Service Provider agrees that notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement in the event of any of the eventualities mentioned hereinabove KMBL shall have a right to terminate this Agreement forthwith.
The Service Provider shall ensure that KMBL customer’s information, documents, records and assets in the possession of the Service Provider can be clearly identified and isolated.

To ensure the authenticity and integrity of its personnel, the Service Provider confirms that all personnel who are assigned to perform onsite services for KMBL have been subjected to a rigorous background check and screening which includes all of the following:
Confirmation of prior work experience
Confirmation of academic record and professional qualifications 
Verification through character references provided, both personal and business 
Confirmation of identity through government issued identification  
Verification of criminal antecedents through police authorities 
The Service Provider shall not allow any person who fails any of the above background checks to perform Services for KMBL. The Service Provider shall also certify that all its personnel/employees who have access to KMBL’s systems/Data/Confidential Information and/or stationed at KMBL premises, if any, have read, understood and agreed to abide by  policies and guidelines provided by KMBL .

clauses.original_text: The Service Provider shall not without prior written approval/consent of KMBL, use any sub-contractor for undertaking all or part of the Services. The Service Provider shall ensure that he enters into written contract with his sub-contractor and the sub-contractor is also bound by similar obligations including, confidentiality, information security and reporting, Data privacy, Data localization, Data retention and Purging etc., as undertaken by the Service Provider under this Agreement. Further, upon request, copy of the subcontractor agreement shall be furnished to KMBL. The Service Provider shall remain primarily liable and obligated to KMBL for the timely and proper performance of all of the Service Provider’s obligations notwithstanding any sub-contracting. In order to enable KMBL to monitor and assess the activities of the sub-contractor, the Service Provider shall furnish a detailed report, of the performance of services sub-contracted, to KMBL at such intervals as may be mutually agreed between KMBL and the Service Provider. Further, the Service Provider shall make requisite arrangements with sub-contractors to enable KMBL to inspect/audit the books, records and information of the sub-contractor in relation to its performance of services sub-contracted to it by the Service Provider.

clauses.original_text:
Service Provider shall maintain all Confidential Information, obtained or disclosed to it and/or its/his/her personnel/ employee/ staff may come to know or receive under the Agreement, whether orally or in writing or electronic form, in strict confidence and shall not disclose it to any person, individual or entity. 
All communications between the Parties or any of them and all information and other material supplied/ sent to or received by the Service Provider from KMBL and/or any information concerning the business transaction coming to the knowledge of Service Provider and/or the confidential relationship between the Parties under the Agreement shall be kept confidential by the Service Provider and by the employee, staff, personnel engaged by the Service Provider, unless it is absolutely essential for the Service Provider to disclose them on need with the prior specific approval of KMBL which disclosed the Confidential Information at issue. 
Service Provider agrees to indemnify and keep KMBL indemnified, against all or any consequences arising out of any breach of this undertaking by the Service Provider and/or its employees and shall immediately reimburse KMBL, on demand, all damages, loss, cost, expenses or any charges that KMBL may suffer, incur or pay in connection therewith. 
.
Service Provider shall segregate and keep separately all information, documents, records and assets pertaining to KMBL’s customers in order to isolate and clearly identify the Bank’s customer information, documents, records and assets to protect the confidentiality of such information. 
Service Provider shall disclose all security breaches that may arise in the course of the Services to KMBL, in a prompt manner.
Service Provider shall ensure that its employees, staff, personnel shall keep the Confidential Information secret at all times and shall not disclose at any time, in whole or in part, to any person or use or permit the usage, for any manner incompatible or inconsistent with that authorized by KMBL for performing its obligations hereunder. 
Service Provider shall take all necessary action to protect the Confidential Information against misuse, loss, destruction, deletion and alteration and shall limit access to the Confidential Information to only such of its employee, staff, personnel who need to know the same to fulfill such Service Provider’s obligations. 
The Service Provider irrevocably agrees and undertakes that it shall not and ensure that its employee, staff, personnel shall not:
have made or make nor retain any copy or record howsoever created (including duplicate copy, photocopy, facsimile, magnetic copy, etc.) of any of the Confidential Information disclosed or submitted other than as may be required for the performance of the Service Provider obligations under this Agreement; 
use or permit the use of the Confidential Information in any way which may be harmful to or against the best interests of KMBL or its customers;
Commercially exploit the Confidential Information nor use the Confidential Information for economic or other benefits, either directly or indirectly. 
The Service Provider shall ensure that its employee, staff, personnel are aware of the confidential nature of all such Confidential Information. The Service Provider shall not be absolved from its obligation to maintain confidentiality as agreed hereunder and hereby agrees to notify KMBL promptly of any unauthorized or improper use or disclosure of the Confidential Information.
Employees, staff or the personnel of the Service Provider shall not attempt to access or allow access to, any data, files or programs within the information systems environment to which they are not entitled under this Agreement. If such access is attained or attempted or if the Service Provider suspects or becomes aware of any breach of data integrity, systems integrity or other practices identified which may compromise the integrity of data, processes and procedures, the Service Provider will immediately report such incident to KMBL, describe in detail any accessed materials and return to KMBL any copied or removed materials.
The Service Provider shall ensure that all its Employees, staff or the personnel engaged by it to render Services under this Agreement are aware of the confidentiality of the confidential information. The Service Provider shall be liable for any breach of confidentiality either by the Service Provider, or any of its Staff, ex-employees, agent/s or representative/s.
Confidential information of KMBL shall not be disclosed to third parties (save to the extent supported by the documentary evidence, that the same is in the public domain, was in Service Provider’s possession prior to disclosure, was independently developed by the Service Provider, is received by Service Provider from a third party without any confidentiality obligations) without receiving KMBL’s prior written consent unless otherwise required by Law or by a court of competent jurisdiction or any governmental or regulatory authority in which event the Service Provider shall immediately notify KMBL so that KMBL may take protective measure against such disclosure.
No license to a Party’s Confidential Information is either granted or implied by the disclosure of such Confidential Information.

KMBL shall retain its Intellectual Property Rights in any computer programs, data, software, hardware or other material which constitute preexisting proprietary items of KMBL and which are submitted by KMBL to the Service Provider for the provision of the Services under this Agreement, with respect to which no right, title or interest will be transferred or be deemed to be transferred from KMBL to the Service Provider.
The Service Provider shall retain its Intellectual Property Rights in  the Services including which constitute preexisting proprietary items of the Service Provider and which are submitted by the Service Provider to KMBL for the provision of the Services, with respect to which no right, title or interest will be transferred or be deemed to be transferred from the Service Provider to KMBL. clauses.original_text:
Service Provider hereby agrees and covenants to indemnify and keep harmless KMBL at all times against any or all claims, liabilities, damages, losses, costs, charges, expenses, proceedings and actions against KMBL by reason of -
Any criminal, or fraudulent act, gross negligence, or misfeasance by Service Provider or its employees, staff, personnel, sub-contractors, Affiliates and/or
Any breach of confidentiality obligations contained herein.
.
.

All indemnities shall survive expiry or termination of this Agreement. 
Notwithstanding anything contained herein, the Parties shall not be liable for any indirect, special, punitive, consequential or incidental damages (including, without limitation, revenue, profits, business) under this Agreement.
DUE DILIGENCE, RIGHT TO AUDIT AND INSPECTION
The Service Provider shall maintain necessary accounts, records and statements of its operations in connection with Services provided under this Agreement. Copies of such accounts, records and statements of its operations in connection with Services provided under this Agreement will have to be furnished by the Service Provider upon request received from KMBL or the regulators of KMBL, including the Reserve Bank of India. Access shall be given to KMBL and its regulators including the Reserve Bank of India to all the data, documents, accounts, records, operations, and information given to, stored or processed by the Service Provider in connection with the Services provided to KMBL, within a reasonable time.
Service Provider agrees that the regulators of the KMBL including the Reserve Bank of India and the external and internal auditors of KMBL will have the right to inspect/audit the books, records, data, audit trails, logs, systems and information of the Service Provider (except any internal pricing data or other customer data) in relation to the Services provided under this Agreement and to obtain copies of any audit or review reports and findings made on the Service Provider in connection with the Services performed for KMBL. Service Provider shall render all necessary assistance and co-operation in this regard. KMBL shall provide reasonable notice before conducting audit and such audit shall be conducted within business hours of the Service Provider. 
The Service Provider agrees to make complete disclosure to KMBL of any third party components that are included in the product/application/deliverables licensed/provided under this Agreement in the format annexed as Annexure B to this Agreement. Further, the Service Provider agrees and undertakes to make such disclosures during the continuance of this Agreement as and when any third party component is added/embedded in the product/application/deliverables during any maintenance or upgrade or any other activity. For the purpose of due diligence, KMBL may require the Service Provider to furnish copies of the licenses acquired by the Service Provider from such third party component owners/licensors. This due diligence may either be conducted by KMBL or an external auditor authorized by KMBL for the purpose. The Service Provider shall ensure that it has observed and has included the third party component as per the terms and conditions applicable for usage of such third party component as prescribed under the license obtained from the owner of the component or prescribed by the owner otherwise. The Service Provider shall ensure that the licenses of such third party components shall be kept valid and subsisting during the Term of this Agreement. The Service Provider undertakes to procure appropriate licenses for any third party component, which may be open source/free at the time of deployment along with the product/application/deliverables but subsequently becomes subject matter of a license. In all such events, the Service Provider shall procure appropriate license from the owner of the third party component within 15 (fifteen) days from the date of becoming aware of such requirement for usage of the third party component and furnish details to KMBL in the format as contained in Annexure B to this Agreement. 
KMBL's audit and due diligence rights shall survive the expiration or termination of this Agreement.

clauses.original_text:
Without prejudice to any other rights and remedies available under this Agreement or law, either Party may, forthwith terminate this Agreement upon occurrence of any one or more of the following events:
If  either Party breaches the terms and conditions of this Agreement or fails to perform and observe any of its obligations under this Agreement and such breaches are not remedied or cured within 30 (thirty) days from the receipt of a written notice from other Party.

If a petition for insolvency is filed against either Party and such petition is not dismissed within 90 (ninety) 90 days after filling and/or if the Service Provider makes an arrangement for the benefit of its creditors or, if the court receiver is appointed as receiver of all/any of Service Provider’s properties.
If any of the representations made by the Service Provider in the Agreement is/are found to be false or wrong or misleading.
On the occurrence of any event or condition which, in KMBL’s opinion, constitutes or could constitute a Material Adverse Effect. “Material Adverse Effect” means the effect or consequence of any event or circumstance, which is or is likely to be (i) adverse to the ability of any Party to perform or comply with any of their respective obligations under this Agreement; (ii) prejudicial to the business, operations or financial condition of either of the Party; (iii) prejudicial to the validity, legality or enforceability of this Agreement or (d) adverse in the opinion of KMBL on the performance of the Agreement.
if any order/judgement/directive/indictment of any statutory or judicial body/authority has been passed against the Service Provider which may materially affect the Services being provided hereunder.
If there is a reorganization, merger, acquisition or related activity due to which there is a change in ownership of the Service Provider.
.
Notwithstanding anything herein contained, either Party may upon 60 (sixty) days written notice, terminate this Agreement for convenience without assigning any reason/s thereof.

After expiry of such period, Service Provider shall return and purge all Confidential Information of KMBL.

clauses.original_text:
Parties shall not be liable for any failure or delay in performance of its obligations resulting directly or indirectly from causes beyond its reasonable control due to act of God, war declared, terrorism, civil or political disturbance, lock-outs, floods, fire, pandemic and other exceptional unforeseeable/unavoidable circumstances (“Force Majeure”).   
In the event of any delay, non-performance due to the aforesaid Force Majeure event occurs, the Service Provider shall promptly notify the other in writing of the reasons for the delay and the likely duration of the delay, whereby the performance of the Service Provider’s obligations shall be suspended during the period that the conditions specified in the aforesaid clause persist and Service Provider shall be granted an extension of time at KMBL’s discretion for performance equal to the period of the delay. If the Force Majeure event persists for more than 30 (thirty) days then shall have the right to terminate this Agreement without any notice..

Any dispute, controversy or claims arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the breach, termination or invalidity thereof, shall be first settled by mutual discussion and the matters may be escalated as per the escalation matrix mentioned in Annexure C. If this fails, then unresolved issues shall be settled by arbitration in accordance with the provisions of the Indian Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996.
Any unresolved disputes or claims which may arise out of or in connection with the Agreement shall be referred to arbitration before sole arbitrator mutually appointed by Parties in accordance with Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996 or any statutory modification or re-enactment thereof for the time being in force. 
The seat and venue of arbitration shall be exclusively at Mumbai and the language of Arbitral proceedings shall be English. 
The award of the arbitrator shall be final, conclusive and binding upon the Parties. Each Party shall bear their respective costs of arbitration, unless agreed otherwise in writing.

clauses.original_text:
Subject to the arbitration clause, the Parties agree that this Agreement and all rights and obligations of the Parties hereunder shall be governed, construed and interpreted exclusively under the laws of India, and shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Mumbai.
INFORMATION SECURITY, DATA PROTECTION AND REPORTING OF INCIDENTS
The Service Provider will safeguard and protect KMBL's/it’s customers’/its employees personal data and information against unauthorized access, accidental loss, improper use and unlawful disclosure, as required by applicable data protection law.
The Service Provider agrees to use commercially reasonable efforts to ensure the Services are configured or operated in a manner so that Services and the systems as well as all KMBL's/it’s customers’/its employees personal data and information shared or being processed or stored remain at all times secure from unauthorized access or intrusion or interference. The Service Provider shall ensure that there are adequate physical and cyber security measures in places where KMBL's/it’s customers’/its employees personal data and information are accessed, processed, stored or transmitted irrespective of whether such place is housed at the Service Provider’s premises or in the premises of a third party. The Service Provider agrees that it will adopt and enforce, and agrees to require any applicable third party to adopt and enforce any information security requirement that KMBL may deem advisable in order to facilitate reasonable security processes and procedures.
Incidents
The Service Provider acknowledges that it or its sub-contractors may be subjected to cyber incidents that result in or could result in misuse / compromise / damage / destruction / loss of
information assets of KMBL and/or 
the physical infrastructure and/or environment hosting the information assets of KMBL;
in terms of confidentiality, integrity and availability which may include but not be limited to malware/ransomware attack, data/business information loss/leakage/compromise, card data leakage including bin-attack, DoS attack, skimming attacks, parameter manipulation/man-in-the-middle type of incidents; email phishing, spoofing, attacks or any new type of attack.
Further The Service Provider or its sub-contractors may suffer incidents that are not a cyber-incident, but deficiencies;
in the Service Provider’s internal systems/applications/IT processes (including reconciliation exercise associated with payment ecosystem) that are exploited by internal staff/third party/customers/others that results into loss for KMBL and/or its customers. The deficiencies also include customer service disruptions due to non-availability of information technology systems of the Service Provider; beyond 4 hours of downtime between 8 am and 8 pm or beyond 8 hours of downtime otherwise.
The cyber incidents and the deficiencies are hereafter collectively referred as “Incidents”. 
The term ‘information asset/s’ includes KMBL's/it’s customers’/its employees personal data and information, sensitive personal data, Confidential Information of KMBL and any medium on which such data or information is stored in physical or electronic form.
To the extent an Incident is directly and solely attributable to or is a direct result of the actions of the Service Provider, the Service Provider agrees to be responsible to KMBL, in respect of third party claims in relation to costs, expenses, damages and liabilities arising out of an Incident.
The Service Provider is aware that KMBL being a regulated entity has various obligation to comply under guidelines issued by RBI from time to time with respect to its cyber security framework. These guidelines inter alia include reporting of Incidents that compromise or attempts to compromise the confidentiality or integrity of data/information stored/processed in the information assets of the Service Provider. As per the extant guidelines KMBL is bound to report Incident’s within 2 to 6 hours to RBI. 
To enable KMBL to fulfill its reporting obligations, the Service Provider agrees and undertakes to provide information about the Incidents to KMBL, in electronic form and in the format shared with the Service Provider. A sample copy of the format is annexed as Annexure D.  The Service provider agrees and undertakes to report the Incident in the prescribed format by email addressed to incident.itsecurity@kotak.com within 3 hours of occurrence/detection/ becoming aware of the Incident. The Service Provider further agrees and undertakes to provide complete support and any other information relating to the Incident to enable KMBL to fulfil its reporting obligations. The Service Provider agrees and understands that reporting of an Incident shall be construed to be valid only when KMBL receives the report in the prescribed format and with at least all mandatory fields marked with an asterisk (*) completely filled in as demonstrated in the prescribed format.

clauses.clause_title: SECURITY TESTING (APPLICABLE FOR ONLY DIGITAL PAYMENT APPLICATIONS)
clauses.original_text:
The Vendor shall conduct security testing such as Vulnerability Assessment (VA) and Penetration Testing (PT) and Source-Code Review of their digital payment application to ensure that the application is secure for processing transactions while preserving confidentiality and integrity of the data that is stored and transmitted through it. Such testing should comply with OWASP standards.
Source-Code Review should include a process which ensures that the product/version/module/application functions in the manner that it is intended to, addressing known flaws/threats due to insecure coding and that the product/version/module/application is free of known vulnerabilities, malwares and any covert channels in the Source-Code.
The internal/external VA shall be conducted at least on a half-yearly basis and PT and Source-Code Review shall be conducted at least on a yearly basis during the subsistence of this Agreement. 
In addition to the above, internal/external VA/PT shall be conducted as and when any major change is performed in the application or infrastructure or when any new application or infrastructure is introduced.
Upon completion of VA/PT/Source-Code Review, Vendor shall submit a detailed report of the findings for the scope of systems catering to KMBL. Thereafter, identified vulnerabilities must be rectified by Vendor in a time-bound manner as may be mutually agreed with the Bank. Cost of such rectification shall be borne by the Vendor. Service Provider shall submit a final closure report post remediation of vulnerabilities.
If the Vendor fails to carry out the testing and assessments as aforesaid, it shall be treated as a material breach of this Agreement and the Vendor shall also be liable to pay a penalty in the form of service credits. Each day of default or part thereof in compliance will add 1 day of free service credits in favour of the Bank. If the default continues for a period more than 30 days, each day of default or part thereof beyond the period of 30 days will add 2 days of free service credits in favour of the Bank and if the default continues beyond that; the Bank will be entitled to levy penalty at such amount per day of default which will be equivalent to twice the cost of Service Charges proportionate for the period of default.
The Service Provider shall impart cyber security training and awareness (via dedicated training, awareness mailers etc.) to its employees/personnel assigned for working on KMBL’s scope of operations and maintain results of the same periodically. The Service Provider shall further ensure that such employees/personnel are also made aware of applicable law, policies, regulations and procedures related to cyber security including but not limited to the same prescribed by the RBI.

In the event, the Agreement is terminated for any reason whatsoever, Service Provider shall for a period of 90 (ninety) days following the date of termination (“Wind Down Period”) provide the Services to KMBL as per the terms of the Agreement and provide assistance and support to the KMBL for the proper transition of Services from the Service Provider to the KMBL or any third party nominated by the KMBL (“New Service Provider”). 
During the Wind Down Period, the relationship of the Parties shall continue to be governed by this Agreement. In the event, the transition of Services is completed before the expiry of the Wind Down Period and in any other case upon the completion of the Wind Down Period, the Parties shall stand fully discharged and be fully released of all their obligations under the Agreement.  
COMPLIANCE WITH LAWS: 
The Service Provider hereby represents and warrants that it is a corporation   duly incorporated, validly existing and in good standing under the laws of the jurisdiction in which it is incorporated. The Service Provider undertakes to take all necessary steps to comply with the provisions of applicable laws, regulations, policies and guidelines issued by any competent regulatory authority in relation to its obligations under this Agreement, from time to time, and shall provide all information and records of the transactions under the scope of this agreement to the KMBL as and when required by KMBL.

This Agreement shall be signed in duplicate, each of which shall be deemed to be an original.
IN WITNESS WHEREOF the Parties hereto have executed this Agreement on the date first written herein above.
