clauses.original_text:
Code of Conduct for Service Providers
This Code of Conduct for Service Providers (“Code”) focuses on three pillars: Labour Practices, Ethics and Anti-Corruption and Environmental Stewardship.

This Code is in addition to the terms and conditions agreed by the Service Provider under the Service Agreement (“Agreement”) with Kotak Mahindra Bank Limited (“KMBL”). In the event of a conflict or inconsistency between this Code and the Agreement with KMBL, terms of the Agreement will prevail, unless agreed otherwise in writing. 
Labour Practices

Service Provider shall align its business operations in compliance with the national labour laws. Service Provider must ensure:
Adherence to applicable domestic and local labour laws regarding wages, working hours, forced labour, human trafficking and child labour. 
Provision of a work environment free from victimization, discrimination and harassment. 
No discrimination based on origin, religion, race, gender, age, sexual orientation or economic or educational background.
Compliance with applicable occupational, health and safety standards. 
Provision of a whistle blower/vigil mechanism that protects confidentiality and provides protection to employees. 
Commitment to be a fair and just employer that is inclusive and “equal-for-all” in all aspects.
Ethics and Anti-Corruption

Service Provider must comply with the laws of the jurisdiction in which it operates. Further, Service Provider must follow the below mentioned guidelines: 
Service Provider must be conscious and implement adequate steps to prevent conflict of interest in the business conducted with KMBL.
Service Provider is not allowed to provide any gifts, favours, business courtesies or entertainment to KMBL, including its employees or other personnel to gain advantage or influence over KMBL in relation to the services provided by them. 
Service Provider should adhere to all regulations applicable in its area of business regarding bribery and corruption. Service Provider must notify KMBL in the event of regulatory scrutiny linked to breaches of anti-bribery and anti-corruption practices.
Service Provider must not partake in any activities that violate anti-money laundering laws. Service Provider must strive to support KMBL to prevent the use of its products, services and facilities for money laundering or other criminal activity, including the financing of terrorism.
Service Provider must commit to safeguarding confidential information of KMBL and ensure data security. 
Service Provider must not make any public statements or media releases without prior written permission from KMBL. 
In case the Service Provider gains insider information regarding KMBL or any other issuer, it shall be bound by the prevailing regulations with respect to trading in securities and shall not be involved in the purchase and sale of the securities issued by the respective companies. 
Environmental Stewardship

Service Provider is encouraged to have an environmental policy that articulates the Service Provider’s approach to environmental conservation. Service Provider is encouraged to be committed to:
Ensuring compliance with all the rules and environmental regulations in the jurisdiction that it works in. 
Use resources efficiently while conducting business to minimise its anti-environmental footprint. 
Adopt internationally accepted practices for resource efficiency and waste management even where they are not mandated by any regulations.
Conserve water by adopting a water management system that embeds water efficiency in business processes. 
Establish systems to monitor, measure and report on its energy consumptions and greenhouse gas emissions (direct and indirect).
Aim to provide products and services that reduce the negative impact on the environment.
Take up initiatives to reduce its greenhouse gas emissions. Service Provider can focus on improving their operational efficiencies and establish a system to measure the emissions in its supply chain.

“Confidential Information”  shall mean any information and documents shared by the Bank with the Service Provider and/or any information and documents comes in to possession of the Service Provider/Representatives and/or any other information which is developed by the Service Provider/Representatives for the Bank, which is including but not limited to confidential information and proprietary information concerning the Bank, its affiliates, subsidiaries, group companies, holding companies including and without limitation; Intellectual Property, trade secrets, secret information, technical processes, finances, software, software language codes, username and passwords, transaction information, data processing methodology, custom developed applications, dealings and method of dealings with the clients or the customers  and its employees together with any  information  relating to Bank’s suppliers, employees, agents, distributors, and customers (including personal information and/or personal sensitive information)and relationships of special trust and confidence with the clients or customers and employees.
The Service Provider shall use the Confidential Information solely for purposes of this Agreement, and shall not disclose to any third party without the prior written consent of the Bank.
The Service Provider agrees and undertakes to ensure that in case Service Provider share any Confidential Information with its affiliates, group companies, associates, subsidiaries, holding company and their respective employees and professional advisors (“Representatives”) and such Representatives shall be bound by the confidentiality obligations under this Agreement and they shall use the Confidential Information only for the purpose of this Agreement.
The Service Provider also agrees that it shall share Confidential Information with the Representatives only to such extent as may be necessary for the performance of the Service Providers obligations under this Agreement. The Service Provider shall inform the confidential nature of Confidential Information to the Representatives and the Service Provider shall ensure that such Representatives shall execute a confidentiality and non-disclosure agreement containing restrictions as stringent as those contained herein to protect the Confidential Information of the Bank.
The Service Provider shall take all measures to protect the confidentiality and security of the Confidential Information and avoid the unauthorized use, disclosure, publication, or dissemination of the Confidential Information; provided, however, that such measures shall be no less stringent than measures taken to protect its own confidential and proprietary information but in no event less than reasonable degree of care.  The Service Provider shall be responsible for breach of any provision of this Agreement by its Representatives. The Service Provider shall and shall ensure that its Representatives shall keep all Confidential Information confidential at all times during the Term and after termination of this Agreement.
The Service Provider agrees and understands that the title to the Confidential Information and Intellectual Property shall always remain with the Bank, and this Agreement shall not be construed to grant to the Service Provider any patents, licenses or similar rights to such Confidential Information and Intellectual Property.
The Service Provider confirms and undertakes that it shall ensure that confidentiality of customer information, if any, shared by the Bank during the course of availing the Service shall be maintained during the Term and even after this Agreement expires or gets terminated. The Service Provider shall be fully liable and responsible in case of breach of security and leakage of customers information.

clauses.original_text:
The Service Provider shall itself perform its obligations under this Agreement and shall not assign, transfer, or sub-contract any of its rights and obligations in relation to all or part of the Services or related thereto. The Service Provider shall appoint sub-contractors and/or assign or transfer any of the rights and obligations under this Agreement with prior written consent of the Bank.  The Service Provider shall at all times remain responsible and liable to the Bank for all the actions of the agents, sub-agents/sub-contractors, assignee, or transferee, as the case may be, with no dilution or diminution of service, controls, penalties, etc.
Notwithstanding anything contrary contained in the terms of this Agreement, Service Provider shall ensure that such agents, sub-agent, sub-contractor, assignee or transferee etc. shall be bound by the terms of this Agreement. For the purpose of this clause and notwithstanding any such written consent being given by the Bank, the Service Provider shall remain liable for the acts and omissions of any delegate it has delegated its activities to i.e. sub agent, sub-contractor, agent etc. If such delegation is as a result of operation of any laws, then Bank shall have an option on such delegation to immediately terminate this Agreement at its discretion. The Service Provider shall be responsible and liable for the performance and risk management practices of its sub-contractors. 
The Bank shall be entitled to assign/transfer part/ all of its rights and benefits under this Agreement/this Agreement to any Person or entity without any prior notice or intimation to the Service Provider. However, the Service Provider shall not transfer or assign this Agreement and/or any obligations or rights under this Agreement to any third party without prior written consent of the Bank.
BUSINESS CONTINUITY PLAN (“BCP”)
The Service Provider hereby confirms that it has developed and established a robust framework for documenting, maintaining and testing business continuity and recovery procedures and the same are tested periodically and agrees to test such business continuity and recovery plan jointly with the Bank and shall ensure that the Service to the Bank would not be adversely affected in any manner on account of any factors including system breakdowns which may cause disruption in the normal functions of the Service Provider.
The Service Provider hereby agrees and understands that Services to be performed under this Agreement shall continue to be offered under ordinary circumstances. In the event of any difficulty in performing the required Services, Service Provider shall make best efforts to make alternative arrangements to ensure that the required Services are continued to be performed.
The Service Provider shall review and test its BCP on an annual basis and notify the Bank of any substantial changes to its BCP. The test shall validate the functionality and effectiveness of the BCP, including but not limited to the feasibility of the recovery time objectives, recovery point objectives and resumption operation capacities.
Following each test the Service Provider shall confirm to the Bank the functionality and effectiveness of the BCP. The Service Provider shall promptly notify the Bank of any test findings that may affect the Service Provider’s performance of its Services. The Service Provider shall promptly implement remedial measures or actions to address the test findings, including those required by the Bank.
Upon the Bank’s request, the Service Provider shall participate in the Bank’s business continuity and disaster recovery exercises in respect of the Services to be provided by the Service Provider.
The Service Provider shall, on request, provide copies of results of any independent assessments of such Business Continuity Plan to the Bank.

clauses.original_text:
The Service Provider hereby agrees to have stringent security practices, control processes and checks in respect of provision of Services under this Agreement.
The Service Provider shall monitor on regular basis and disclose any breaches in the security practices/processes and controls to the Bank
14.3  The Bank shall have the right to continuous monitoring and assessment of the Service Provider, its security practices and control processes so that any necessary corrective measure can be taken promptly undertaken. 
The Service Provider will promptly report to the Bank if a virus is introduced in the software or in any Services provided by the Service Provider, and take all precautions and remedial actions to remove the virus from software site/ Services provided and to remediate the affected systems or data. 
If required by the Bank,  will be provided by the Service Provider to the Bank. 
14.6 The Service Provider shall isolate and clearly identify the Banks customer information, documents, records and assets to protect the confidentiality of the information and shall ensure that such information, data etc. shall not comingle with any other data/information etc. of third parties. It shall also ensure to comply with all Applicable Laws including data privacy law in relation to the customer data and the Confidential Information.  The Service Provider shall store all the Banks data including the customer data in India.
14.7  The Bank has the right to immediately notify any regulator or legal authority, in the event of any leakage of customer information, confidential data/Confidential Information or other relevant records by/originating from the Service Provider and/or its personnel.
14.8 The Service Provider shall keep the consumer data of the Bank confidential during the Term and after termination of this Agreement. In addition to security requirements mentioned in this Agreement, the Service Provider shall ensure that there shall be adequate security mechanism to protect any consumer and other data provided by/received from the Bank and/or any consumer data which comes in to knowledge of the Service Provider during the term of this Agreement for the purpose of providing Services under this Agreement.
AUDIT, CONTROL AND MONITORING
15.1     Internal Monitoring: The Service Provider shall develop and implement internal control procedures to ensure compliance with the provisions of this Agreement.
15.2  The Service Provider shall at all times have in place, and regularly test, security arrangements which are reasonably sufficient to: 
protect the integrity and security of Confidential Information and any other information of   the Bank which includes but not limited to Banks customer personal details and sensitive personal  data having regard to such of the Service Provider’s and the Bank’s obligations under Applicable Laws and regulations as may be notified to the Service Provider in writing from time to time;
ensure that such information is used for purposes of discharging the Service Provider’s obligations under this Agreement only; and
ensure that no unauthorized persons have access to such information/Confidential Information while it is in the possession or under the control of the Service Provider.
Service Provider shall notify the Bank in writing of any adverse development that could significantly impact its respective obligations under this Agreement, and of any expected delay in the performance of such obligations, or any matter likely to impede such performance, or result in non-compliance or breach of this Agreement.
15.4  Audit and Inspection: The RBI and/or legal/ regulatory authority of the Bank, RBI including NPCI shall be entitled to inspect or audit directly and/or through its external/internal auditors, employees etc. the books, transaction records/transactions, operations, systems, Relevant Premises, Relevant Personnel, Relevant Records, software, IT infrastructure,  and the business records and/or any other information of the Service Provider and/or the sub-contractors which pertains to provision of the Services. The Service Provider shall and shall ensure that the sub-contractor shall permit the RBI, Bank/legal/regulatory authority including NPCI its internal/external auditors, employees etc., the Bank’s regulators and regulators’ officials to inspect, examine and audit and to take copies of the Service Provider’s operations, books, transaction records/transactions,  systems, Relevant Premises, Relevant Personnel, Relevant Records, software, the business records audit reports, reviews, findings and/or any other information, which pertain to provision of the Services under this Agreement. The Bank would give prior written notice of  () days for such audit. However, no such notice shall be required from legal/regulatory authority, RBI including NPCI. The Service Provider shall and shall ensure that its sub-contractor shall also cooperate in good faith with the Bank for such audit and inspection and to correct any practices which are found to be deficient as a result of any such audit within a reasonable time after receipt of the Banks audit/ inspection report from Bank, RBI, legal/regulatory authority including NPCI.  
The Service Provider shall immediately comply with any request from the Bank and/or any regulatory/legal authority/RBI including NPCI, to submit any reports on the security and control environment of the Service Provider and its sub-contractor in relation to the Services (including without limitation reports on confidentiality, security adequacy and compliance in respect of the operations of the Service Provider and its sub-contractor). The Service Provider shall obtain certifications in relation to the cloud and other software related services as and when requested by the Bank to ensure that the Bank is in compliance with the legal / regulatory authority. 
For the purpose of this Clause 15:
“Relevant Premises” means any premises in the possession or control of the Service Provider or agents or any sub-contractor from which the Services are delivered (in whole or in part) or in which records relating to the services are kept.
“Relevant Personnel” means all employees, staff, other workers, agents, sub-contractors and consultants of the Service Provider or any sub-contractor who are engaged in the provision of the Services from time to time. 
“Relevant Records” shall include but not limited to any information and documents in relation to this Agreement, Confidential Information, systems and software, transaction information, any records in relation to this Agreement in soft and hard form, any digitized information. 
The scope of audit under this clause shall include without limitation the Service Provider’s and sub-contractor’s security environment (both physical and IT), control environment, incident management process (for material breaches, security disruptions or other material issues), and compliance with risk management requirements set out in this Agreement (including without limitation, the Service Provider’s BCP (as defined above).
15. In the performance of its duties under this Agreement, both Parties shall act in conformity with and in compliance with the requirements of all Applicable Laws, rules and regulations to which either is subject. Notwithstanding any provisions herein, the Service Provider shall ensure compliance with all Applicable Laws, legal and statutory requirements and any revisions thereof and develop and implement internal control procedures to ensure compliance with the provisions herein.

Customer SaaS Subscription Agreement
SOCRadar Platform
Terms of Service Agreement
Welcome to the SOCRadar Platform.
This program allows you to access and use the SOCRadar Cyber Threat Intelligence Platform, documentation and content (individually and collectively the “Service”) through the website platform.SOCRadar.com and/or related websites for a limited period of time. The contractual terms of this Service (“TOS”) are between you and SOCRadar. You and SOCRadar may each be referred to as a “Party” and together as the “Parties”. If you use any of SOCRadar services, documentation or content you hereby agree to this TOS for the duration of the product evaluation program (“Term”). clauses.original_text:
Subject to the terms and conditions of this TOS, SOCRadar grants you a non-exclusive, non-transferable license, during the Term, to use and access the Service, solely in accordance with the published documentation for the Service, for your own internal-use purposes. You agree that you will not: 
(a) permit any third party to access and/or use the Service; 
(b) rent, lease, loan, or sell access to the Service to any third party; 
(c) interfere with, disrupt, alter, translate, or modify the Service or any part thereof, or create an undue burden on the Service or the networks or services connected to the Service; 
(d) reverse-engineer the Service (except to the extent that such restriction on reverse engineering is prohibited by law and then you shall provide SOCRadar with prompt written notice prior to any such action), use the Services to conduct, publish or disclose any competitive benchmarking tests or analysis; or access the Service to build a competitive product or service; or 
(e) introduce software or automated agents or scripts to the Service so as to produce multiple accounts, generate automated searches, requests and queries, or to strip or mine data from the Service. Service accounts and passwords may not be used by more than one individual user and you agree that you will not assist with or permit this. You shall not use the Services for any production purposes or use the Services except to evaluate such Services during the designated Term. SOCRadar reserves the right to immediately terminate any account access that SOCRadar reasonably determines has been used by an unauthorized third party or in violation of this TOS. 
OWNERSHIP. 
You agree the Service, all software, hardware, algorithms, all SOCRadar CTI as defined below, methodologies, and other technology used by SOCRadar to provide the Service, and all intellectual property and proprietary rights in all of the foregoing, is the exclusive property of SOCRadar and its suppliers. You hereby assign to SOCRadar any suggestions, ideas, enhancement requests, feedback, recommendations or other information provided by you related to the Service. All rights not expressly granted to you are reserved to SOCRadar. 
"SOCRadar CTI Data" means: 
(a) all information that is generated, collected, developed, produced, or created through the public-source search functions of the Service, including such information generated by previous searches that is stored in the SOCRadar digital risk and threat information platform; and 
(b) any analytical product that is produced by SOCRadar based on the information described in subsection (a). 
Subject to the terms and conditions of this TOS, SOCRadar hereby grants to you a non-exclusive, non-transferable license to access and download the SOCRadar using the Service, during the term of this TOS solely for your internal business purposes and under no circumstances may you distribute any SOCRadar CTI Data to any third parties. 
"Confidential Information" means: 
the SOCRadar CTI Data and any nonpublic information regarding the Service. You will not use any Confidential Information for any purpose not expressly permitted by this TOS. You will protect the Confidential Information from unauthorized use, access, or disclosure in the same manner as you protect your own confidential or proprietary information of a similar nature and with no less than reasonable care. You will be allowed to disclose the Confidential Information to the extent that such disclosure is 
(i) specifically approved in writing by SOCRadar, 
(ii) necessary in the course of legal proceedings for you to defend yourself or to enforce its rights under this TOS; or 
(iii) required by law or by the order of a court or similar judicial or administrative body, provided that you notify SOCRadar of such required disclosure promptly and in writing and cooperates with SOCRadar, at SOCRadar’ reasonable request and expense, in any lawful action to contest or limit the scope of such required disclosure. You will return to SOCRadar or destroy all tangible copies of Confidential Information in your possession or control and permanently erase all electronic copies of Confidential Information promptly upon the expiration or termination of this TOS, whichever occurs first, except to the extent necessary to permit you to exercise any license right to the SOCRadar CTI Data expressly surviving this TOS. 
DATA SECURITY. 
SOCRadar will use reasonable efforts to establish and maintain safeguards to protect the security and integrity of the Service and protect against the accidental or unauthorized access, use, alteration or disclosure of the content. Except with your consent or as otherwise permitted under this TOS, SOCRadar will not use the content other than to provide the Service. 
DATA PRIVACY. 
You and SOCRadar shall comply with applicable data protection laws and regulations. You agree not to submit any personal data to the Service except as required for your registration and use of the Service. 
WARRANTY DISCLAIMER. 
THE SERVICE AND THE SOCRadar CTI DATA ARE PROVIDED “AS IS,” AND SOCRadar MAKES NO (AND HEREBY DISCLAIMS ALL) WARRANTIES, REPRESENTATIONS, OR CONDITIONS, WHETHER WRITTEN, ORAL, EXPRESS, IMPLIED OR STATUTORY, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, SATISFACTORY QUALITY, TITLE, NONINFRINGEMENT, OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, WITH RESPECT TO THE USE, MISUSE, OR INABILITY TO USE THE SERVICE (IN WHOLE OR IN PART), THE SOCRadar CTI DATA, OR ANY OTHER PRODUCTS OR SERVICES PROVIDED TO YOU BY SOCRadar. SOCRadar DOES NOT WARRANT THAT SEARCHES PERFORMED BY THE SERVICE WILL REVEAL ANY OR ALL SECURITY THREATS OR PREDICT ANY OR ALL ATTACKS, THAT THE SOCRadar CTI DATA WILL BE ACCURATE OR COMPLETE, OR THAT OPERATION OF THE SERVICE SHALL BE UNINTERRUPTED OR ERROR-FREE. WITHOUT LIMITING THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING, SOCRadar DISCLAIMS ANY LIABILITY FOR, AND SHALL NOT BE RESPONSIBLE IN ANY WAY REGARDING, ANY THIRD-PARTY CONTENT, INFORMATION, MATERIALS, LINKS, FILES, OR SEARCH RESULTS THAT MAY BE ACCESSIBLE THROUGH THE SERVICE OR THE SOCRadar CTI DATA. 
LIMITATION OF LIABILITY. 
IN NO EVENT SHALL SOCRadar BE LIABLE TO YOU FOR ANY SPECIAL, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, OR ANY DAMAGES OR COSTS DUE TO ANY DIRECT OR INDIRECT LOSS OF PROFITS, DATA, USE OR GOODWILL, PERSONAL OR PROPERTY DAMAGE RESULTING FROM OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS TOS, THE SERVICE, OR THE USE OR INABILITY TO USE THE SERVICE, REGARDLESS OF THE CAUSE OF ACTION OR THE THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE), CONTRACT, OR OTHERWISE, EVEN IF SOCRadar HAS BEEN NOTIFIED OF THE LIKELIHOOD OF SUCH DAMAGES.
THE MAXIMUM AGGREGATE LIABILITY OF SOCRadar ARISING OUT OF OR IN ANY WAY CONNECTED TO THIS TOS WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE BUT EXCLUDING WILLFUL MISCONDUCT) OR OTHERWISE, SHALL NOT EXCEED ONE HUNDRED UNITED STATES DOLLARS (US$100). THE EXISTENCE OF ONE OR MORE CLAIMS UNDER THIS TOS WILL NOT INCREASE SOCRadar’ LIABILITY. 
TERM AND TERMINATION. 
Term. This TOS shall commence on the date of first access of the Services, and shall expire as stated on the website or in the web interface, unless extended by SOCRadar or terminated in accordance with its terms. 
Termination. 
Your access to the Service will automatically terminate when the TOS terminates or at any time as determined by SOCRadar in its sole discretion. Upon expiration or termination of this TOS, your access to the Service and license to the SOCRadar CTI Data shall be terminated. Notwithstanding the foregoing, any term or condition of this TOS which by its sense or nature should be deemed to survive such termination shall so survive. 
Suspension. 
SOCRadar may, with or without prior notice, suspend your access to the Services if SOCRadar reasonably concludes that you or users are using the Service in denial of service attacks or spamming; illegal activity; breach of the terms and conditions of this TOS; or actions causing immediate and material harm to SOCRadar or other third parties. You agree that SOCRadar will not be liable to you or any third party for any damages if SOCRadar exercises any of its rights as permitted by this Section 9.

clauses.original_text:
This Service Agreement (“Agreement”) is made on the day of execution (Execution Day) by and between: 
FNF India Private Limited, a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 1956 and having its registered office at Umiya Business Bay Tower 2, 6th, 7th and 8th Floor, Cessna Business Park, Outer Ring Road, Bengaluru – 560103, Karnataka, India (hereinafter referred to as “FNF India” which expression shall unless it be repugnant to the context be deemed to include its successors and assigns) of ONE PART; AND
Softcell Technologies Global Private Limited, a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 1956 and having its place of business at 1st  Floor, 16 Haudin Road, Ulsoor, Bengaluru -560042 (hereinafter referred to as “Service Provider” which expression shall unless it be repugnant to the context be deemed to include its permitted successors and assigns) of the OTHER PART. 
FNF India and Service Provider shall hereinafter collectively be referred to as “Parties” and individually as ‘Party”.
BACKGROUND:
Service Provider represents that it is an authorized partner of ManageEngine (ME),and has authority to resell ManageEngine software to FNF India.
Based on the representation made by the Service Provider, FNF India has purchased ME-SDP Software (ManageEngine ServiceDesk Plus) and technical support services through the Service Provider. 
FNF India has entered into a Software License Agreement dated January 20, 2023 for the subscription of the ME-SDP Software with Zoho Technologies Pvt. Ltd. (Zoho).
NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of mutual covenants and obligations by the parties it is agreed as follows:

matching_standard_clause.title: BY AND BETWEEN
matching_standard_clause.text:
1707 Advisors India Private Limited, a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 2013 having its registered office at 944, Block C, Sushant Lok Phase 1, Gurugram, Haryana, 122001 (hereinafter referred to as "Company/1707 India" (which expression shall unless excluded by or repugnant to the context mean and include its successors-in-interest and assigns) party ofthe First Part.
AND
Softcell Technologies Global Private Limited "Service Provider" a Company registered under the existing Companies Act and having its office at Office No. 201,202 and 226, 2nd Floor, DLF Tower B, Jasola District Center, New Delhi, South East Delhi, Delhi, 110025 (which expression shall unless excluded by or repugnant to the context mean and include its successors-in-interest and assigns) party of the Other Part.
The Company and the Service Provider are referred to in this Agreement individually as a "Party"
and collectively as the "Parties". WHEREAS:
The Service Provider is engaged in the business providing OEM Licenses to various companies;
the Company has been utilizing the services of the Service Provider and now desires to formalize the arrangement through a comprehensive Agreement; the Service Provider agrees to continue providing services to the Client, subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein.
NOW, THEREFORE, THIS AGREEMENT WITNESSETH and it is hereby agreed by and between the Parties here to as follows:

The words/phrases defined in this clause shall bear the same meaning throughout this Agreement, except as indicated otherwise expressly or by context.
Agreement: shall mean this agreement and any Annexure hereto and shall include any amendments and extension granted in near future.
Confidential Information: shall mean, but not limited to, any proprietary information, outcome of Services, deliverables, policies, plans, processes, finances, procurement requirements, or other business plans and information, either owned by FNF India or information received from others that FNF India is obligated to treat as confidential, or is disclosed by FNF India to the Service Provider either directly or indirectly in writing, orally or by drawings or inspection of parts or equipment or Service Provider comes to know during its performance of Services. Confidential Information does not include information which is (i) known to Service Provider at the time of disclosure as evidenced by written records of the Service Provider; or (ii) has become publicly known and made generally available through no wrongful act of the Service Provider; or (iii) has been rightfully received by the Service Provider from a third party who is authorized to make such disclosure.

clauses.original_text:
Subject to the terms and conditions specified in this Agreement, Service Provider agrees to provide Services as required from time to time in the manner and to the extent specified by FNF India so as to meet the objectives of this Agreement. The Scope of Services shall be adhered to as set out in the Scope of Services annexed hereto as Annexure A. The Escalation Matrix shall be set forth in Annexure B hereto.
Prices And Payment Terms
In connection with this Agreement below Purchase Order has been issued, the same is attached to this Agreement as Annexure C.
Purchase Order No.  POBNG22UBB2IT036 dated December 30, 2022, in favor of Softcell Technologies Global Private Limited.
FNF India shall have no obligation to pay Service Provider in the event that the Service Provider fails to: i) deliver the Services in a manner mutually agreed upon by the parties; or ii) adhere to the time schedule for delivering the Services, as may be specified by FNF India from time to time. This proviso is without prejudice to any other rights that FNF India may have under this Agreement. 
Payment Terms: The payment shall be released within thirty (30) days from the date of receipt of correct and undisputed invoice from the Service Provider and its acceptance by FNF INDIA.
The payment shall be made 100% against invoice and signoff of completion report.
TAX: Tax exemptions as applicable herein shall be ensured by providing proof of documentation by FNF India. 
Notwithstanding anything contrary stated herein in the Agreement, FNF India shall not be under any obligation to make any payment until the receipt of the tax invoice.
SERVICE LOCATION: Service Provider shall perform Services through the period of this Agreement, at the time and at place/s as mentioned herein - FNF India Private Limited, 6th,7th & 8th Floors, Umiya Business Bay Tower-2, Cessna Business Park, Kadubeesanahalli, Bellandur, Bangalore - 560103.

OBLIGATION OF THE SERVICE PROVIDER: The Service Provider shall,
Promptly comply with such instructions as may be issued from time to time by FNF India in connection with the performance of the Services. 
Ensure that at all time during the performance of the Services to abide by all applicable FNF India’s security rules, other policies, standards, guidelines and procedures. FNF India has the right at any time during the term of this Agreement at its sole discretion to require the Service Provider or its personnel to stop providing Service if it is in violation of this clause.
At all times act with appropriate propriety and discretion and in particular refrain from making any public statements, concerning the Services hereunder without the prior approval of FNF India.
Be responsible to ensure that the personnel assigned to participate in the performance of the Services abide by the provisions of this Agreement.
At its own cost, comply with all the applicable laws and regulations. Service Provider shall during the entire term of the Agreement have required insurance to cover the liability for all risks, including risk for personal injury or death and shall furnish a copy of the insurance policy as and when required by FNF India.
Be liable for all losses/damages caused by the misuse of FNF India’s property while performing the Services. Further the Service Provider shall be solely liable for any losses to its equipment while performing the Services.
Be liable for the misuse of the Confidential Information contained in the FNF India networks or data bases either by itself or third parties, who may have gained access to the FNF India networks or systems through the Service Provider. All information in such FNF India networks and/or databases shall be FNF India’s Confidential Information. 
Be solely responsible for payment of compensation and any other costs related to employment/engagement of Service Provider personnel including any amounts that may be due as prevailing wages under applicable law to Service Provider personnel assigned to perform Services. Service Provider shall furnish FNF India with a written declaration that payments of all statutory obligations to its personnel have been made. FNF India shall be liable to withhold payment of fees due to non-compliance by the Service Provider of this clause till such time as Service Provider complies with the same.
Ensure that its personnel do not carry out any other business while performing Services at any of the FNF India’s premises.

matching_standard_clause.title: OBLIGATION OF THE SERVICE PROVIDER
matching_standard_clause.text:
The Service Provider shall:
Regularly provide reports of the detail and frequency, as required by Company. Service Provider shall obtain such persons as may be indicated by Company from time to time, on all matters arising from or relating to this Agreement.
Promptly comply with such instructions as may be issued from time to time by Company in connection with the performance of the Services.
Ensure that at all time during the performance of the Services, shall abide by all applicable Company’s security rules, policies, standards, guidelines and procedures. Company has the right at any time during the term of this Agreement at its sole discretion to require the Service Provider or his personnel to stop providing Service, if the Vendor or its personnel deployed is in violation of this clause.
At all times, the Service Provider shall act with appropriate propriety and discretion and, in particular refrain from making any public statements, concerning the Services hereunder without the prior approval of Company.
Be responsible to ensure that the personnel assigned to participate in the performance of the Services abide by the provisions of this Agreement.
In the performance of all Services hereunder, Service Provider shall, at its own cost, comply with all the applicable laws and regulations.   During the term of this Agreement, Service Provider shall maintain insurance policies suitable to the nature of its business. , ().  In addition, the Service Provider shall not be permitted to reduce, or cancel the insurance policy without reasonable prior written notice to Company.  Upon request, Service Provider shall provide a certificate of insurance to Company.
Be liable for all losses/damages caused by the misuse to Company property while performing the Services. Further the Service Provider shall be solely liable for any losses to its equipment while performing the Services.
Be liable for the use of the Confidential Information contained in the Company networks or data bases by himself or third parties, who may have gained access to the Company networks or systems through him. All information in such Company networks and/or databases shall be Company’s Confidential Information.
Neither Service Provider nor any of its personnel employee/individuals shall be or shall be deemed to be employees of Company for any purpose whatsoever in confirmation with and without limitation on any application of the foregoing statement. Service Provider shall be solely responsible for payment of compensation and any other costs related to employment/engagement of Service Provider personnel including any amounts that may be due as prevailing wages under applicable law to Service Provider personnel assigned to perform Services. Service Provider shall furnish Company with a written declaration that payments of all statutory obligations to its personnel have been made.
Shall ensure that its personnel do not carry out any other business while providing Services from any Company premises.
Service Provider shall fully comply with all legislative regulatory or other government requirements in relation to its personnel including compliance with Contract Labor (Regulation and Abolition) Act 1970, Employee’s State Insurance Act 1948, Employees Provident Fund Act 1952 and Family Pension Fund 1971, Payment of Bonus Act, The Shops and Commercial Establishments Act, Maternity Benefits Act, Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act 2013, Payment of Gratuity Act, Minimum Wages Act, Payment of Wages Act and successive enactments and any other statute enactment as may be applicable from time to time. Service Provider shall maintain necessary registers/records as required under the aforesaid statutes and produce the same as and when required to do so by Company or Statutory Authorities. The Service Provider shall obtain separate code number for ESI and PF purposes and produce proof of such registration for Company’s verification and records.

matching_standard_clause.text: In the event that both parties participate in a client's Pre-Sales engagement and subsequently secure a project, both parties shall possess the entitlement to collaborate on the said project. The precise apportionment of work responsibilities shall be determined through a mutual agreement between the parties by having a separate SOW.

matching_standard_clause.text:

"EULA" shall mean the End User License Agreement issued by the respective OEM, governing the use of their proprietary software.

clauses.original_text:
Service Provider shall not, during the term of this Agreement use Confidential Information for any purpose whatsoever other than the performance of the Services on behalf of FNF India or disclose the same to any third party. Service Provider shall neither use nor disclose the Confidential Information to any third party after the term or termination of this Agreement. It is understood that the said Confidential Information shall remain the sole property of FNF India. Service Provider further agrees to take all reasonable precautions to prevent any unauthorized disclosure of such Confidential Information. All documents, statistics, reports, data and other information provided, created, obtained or made available to the Service Provider in connection with or by virtue of the Agreement, shall be treated as confidential by the Service Provider, and the Service Provider shall not be entitled to use or make copies of them for any purpose that is not related to the Agreement. Service Provider shall neither bring to FNF India nor include in the Services; the confidential information of any third party In the Services that it provides to FNF India. The foregoing confidentiality obligations will not apply to Confidential Information that (a) is already known to Service Provider prior to disclosure by FNF India; (b) is or becomes a matter of public knowledge through no fault of Service Provider; (c) is rightfully received from a third party by Service Provider without a duty of confidentiality; (d) is independently developed by Service Provider; (e) is disclosed under operation of law; or (f) is disclosed by Service Provider with the prior written approval of FNF India.
The Service Provider shall not directly or indirectly disclose to a third party the terms of this Agreement without prior written approval of FNF India.
In case the Service Provider is required by law to disclose Confidential Information, such requirement shall be intimated to FNF India reasonably prior to the disclosure.
The obligations under this clause shall survive termination or expiry of Agreement. 
INFORMATION SECURITY: Service Provider represents that it follows industry best practices as a means to prevent any compromise of its information systems, computer networks, or data files (Systems”) by unauthorized users, viruses, or malicious computer programs which could in turn be propagated via computer networks, email, magnetic media or other means. Service Provider agrees to immediately notify FNF India if the security of its Systems is breached or compromised in any way. Service Provider agrees to apply appropriate internal information security practices, including, but not limited to, using appropriate firewall and anti-virus software; maintaining said countermeasures, using current supported operating systems, and other applications with up-to-date virus definitions and security patches; and permitting only authorized users’ access to computer systems, and applications. Service Provider specifically agrees to use up-to-date anti-virus tools to remove known viruses and malware.
Service Provider further agrees to maintain, information security policies and programs consistent with industry guidelines and all applicable statutes, rules or regulations, that include commercially reasonable administrative, physical and technical safeguards designed to (i) protect the privacy, confidentiality, integrity and availability against any reasonably foreseeable threats or hazards to the FNF India’s Confidential Information and (ii) reasonably protect against accidental, unlawful or unauthorized access, copying, damage, destruction, disclosure, distribution, loss, manipulation, modification, processing, use, reuse, interception, or transmission of such Confidential Information.
This clause shall survive the termination of this Agreement for so long as Service Provider is in possession of the FNF India’s Confidential Information.
REPRESENTATION AND WARRANTIES:
Service Provider warrants providing the highest quality of services at cost effective levels with all due care, diligence and efficiency, in accordance with the highest standards of professional competence, organization and responsibility.
Service Provider warrants that by providing Services to FNF India it does not breach the Intellectual Property Rights of any third party. 
Service Provider warrants that if any software is required for providing Services it shall only use duly licensed software to perform Services. 
Service Provider warrants that it has obtained all the necessary permits, license, governmental permissions etc., in order to perform the Services herein.
Service Provider warrants that it shall not make any claims that the Service Provider is the employee of FNF India nor shall it be able to take part in any benefits or facilities that FNF India may provide to their employees. 
Service Provider further warrants that in the performance of all Services hereunder, Service Provider shall comply with all applicable laws and regulations.
All materials, equipment and goods used or supplied by the Service Provider in connection with this Agreement will be of satisfactory quality, sound in design and in conformance in all respects with the Specification;
SUB CONTRACTING: Service Provider shall not assign this contract or appoint a subcontractor, except with the prior express written consent from FNF India. Even after such permission has been given such assignment /subcontracting shall be subject to the third party entering into an agreement with Service Provider containing the same terms and conditions as this Agreement. Service Provider shall be responsible for ensuring that subcontractor/s comply with all the terms of this Agreement. Service Provider shall indemnify FNF India for any and all losses (including attorney’s fees) that occur due to non-compliance by the subcontractor of the terms of this Agreement. Notwithstanding the appointment of subcontractor including subcontractors approved by FNF India the Service Provider shall continue to be solely responsible for all the services provided by the subcontractor. 
RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE PARTIES:  Service Provider shall perform the Services hereunder as an independent Service Provider, and nothing contained in the terms of this Agreement shall be interpreted as establishing a relationship of agency, partnership or employment between the Parties. During the term of this Agreement or thereafter, Service Provider shall not represent to any third party as an employee of FNF India.

matching_standard_clause.title: CONFIDENTIALITY
matching_standard_clause.text:
“Confidential Information”  shall mean any information and documents shared by the Bank with the Service Provider and/or any information and documents comes in to possession of the Service Provider/Representatives and/or any other information which is developed by the Service Provider/Representatives for the Bank, which is including but not limited to confidential information and proprietary information concerning the Bank, its affiliates, subsidiaries, group companies, holding companies including and without limitation; Intellectual Property, trade secrets, secret information, technical processes, finances, software, software language codes, username and passwords, transaction information, data processing methodology, custom developed applications, dealings and method of dealings with the clients or the customers  and its employees together with any  information  relating to Bank’s suppliers, employees, agents, distributors, and customers (including personal information and/or personal sensitive information)and relationships of special trust and confidence with the clients or customers and employees.
The Service Provider shall use the Confidential Information solely for purposes of this Agreement, and shall not disclose to any third party without the prior written consent of the Bank.
The Service Provider agrees and undertakes to ensure that in case Service Provider share any Confidential Information with its affiliates, group companies, associates, subsidiaries, holding company and their respective employees and professional advisors (“Representatives”) and such Representatives shall be bound by the confidentiality obligations under this Agreement and they shall use the Confidential Information only for the purpose of this Agreement.
The Service Provider also agrees that it shall share Confidential Information with the Representatives only to such extent as may be necessary for the performance of the Service Providers obligations under this Agreement. The Service Provider shall inform the confidential nature of Confidential Information to the Representatives and the Service Provider shall ensure that such Representatives shall execute a confidentiality and non-disclosure agreement containing restrictions as stringent as those contained herein to protect the Confidential Information of the Bank.
The Service Provider shall take all measures to protect the confidentiality and security of the Confidential Information and avoid the unauthorized use, disclosure, publication, or dissemination of the Confidential Information; provided, however, that such measures shall be no less stringent than measures taken to protect its own confidential and proprietary information but in no event less than reasonable degree of care.  The Service Provider shall be responsible for breach of any provision of this Agreement by its Representatives. The Service Provider shall and shall ensure that its Representatives shall keep all Confidential Information confidential at all times during the Term and after termination of this Agreement.
The Service Provider agrees and understands that the title to the Confidential Information and Intellectual Property shall always remain with the Bank, and this Agreement shall not be construed to grant to the Service Provider any patents, licenses or similar rights to such Confidential Information and Intellectual Property.
The Service Provider confirms and undertakes that it shall ensure that confidentiality of customer information, if any, shared by the Bank during the course of availing the Service shall be maintained during the Term and even after this Agreement expires or gets terminated. The Service Provider shall be fully liable and responsible in case of breach of security and leakage of customers information.

clauses.original_text:
Service Provider will defend, indemnify and hold FNF India and its directors, officers and employees harmless from any loss, harm, costs, expenses or damages that may be incurred by FNF India (including any expense arising on account of a decision of a court or other authority that Service Provider is not an independent Service Provider) and/or any claims or suits against FNF India to the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, for any act, omission or negligence of the Service Provider,  due to any breach of the terms of this Agreement, property loss, damage, personal injury or death, sustained or caused, by Service Provider any of Service Provider’s employees, subcontractors or agents. Service Provider will pay any costs, damages, expenses and fees for such claims or suits and also reasonable attorney’s fees. FNF India reserves the right to retain counsel, at Service Provider’s expense, to participate in the defense and settlement of any such claim or suit. 
FNF India shall not be liable for any consequential, indirect, special or incidental damages for lost profit, business failure or loss arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, whether or not advised of the possibility of such damages. The total liability of FNF India under this Agreement on any account shall be limited to the amount that has already been paid by FNF India to Service Provider as specified in Annexure A of this Agreement prior to the occurrence of the incident or the actual damage whichever is lower.
FORCE MAJEURE: If either party is in breach of this Agreement or in default of its obligations hereunder because it fails to perform or observe any or all of the terms of this Agreement resulting directly or indirectly from causes beyond the reasonable control of such party, such as but not limited to, acts of God, civil or military authority, acts of the public enemy, war, riots, civil disturbances, insurrections, accidents, explosions, fires, earthquakes, floods, transportation embargos, epidemics, acts of government, its agencies or officers, or any other legitimate cause beyond the reasonable control of the Parties, the party whose performance is affected or is likely to get effected thereby, shall notify the other party as soon as possible of the occurrence of such cause and in any case within seven days of the occurrence of the event,  and the time allowed for performance by the affected party will be extended for the duration of such cause. However, if as a consequence of such cause, performance by a party under this Agreement shall be prevented for a period longer than two (2) months, then the other party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement after a month’s notice. The terms of termination under this condition will be with no liabilities or penalties.

matching_standard_clause.title: FORCE MAJEURE
matching_standard_clause.text: If either Party is prevented from performing any of its obligations hereunder (except for any monetary payments due hereunder) due directly or indirectly to fire; flood; accident; explosion; pandemic; epidemic; equipment or machinery breakdown; sabotage; strike; or any labour disturbance; civil commotions; riots’ invasions; wars (present or future); acts, restraints, requisitions, regulations, or directions or orders of any governmental entity; compliance with any request of any governmental entity; compliance with any request for material represented to be for purposes of (directly or indirectly) producing articles for national defence or national defence facilities; shortage of labour, fuel, power or raw materials; inability to obtain raw materials or supplies; failures of normal sources of supplies; inability to obtain or delays of transportation facilities; any act of God; any act of the other party or other causes (whether similar or dissimilar to the foregoing); in each case so long as such cause is beyond the reasonable control of such party (a “Force Majeure Event”), such non-performing party shall not be liable for breach of this Agreement with respect to such non-performance if and to the extent any such non-performance is due to a Force Majeure Event. Such non-performance will be excused for as long as such event shall be continuing; provided that, the non-performing party gives immediate written notice to the other party of the Force Majeure Event. Such non-performing Party shall exercise all reasonable efforts to eliminate the Force Majeure Event and to resume performance of its affected obligations as soon as practicable. In the event that, as a result of such Force Majeure Event, a Party does not perform all of its obligations hereunder for any period aggregating 90 (ninety) days within any 365 day period, the other Party may terminate this Agreement with 30 (Thirty) days prior written notice to the non-performing Party.

clauses.original_text:
The term of this Agreement is for from December 30, 2022, to December 29, 2023, unless terminated earlier. Unless explicitly agreed between the Parties in writing for extension, the Agreement will stand terminated at the end of the abovementioned term.
If at any time, the Service Provider is unable to perform or to complete the Services within the time and in a manner satisfactory to FNF India, FNF India may, at its option, either terminate the Agreement or grant Service Provider, at its sole discretion the postponement of the execution of the Services.
FNF India may terminate this Agreement immediately in the event the Service Provider becomes insolvent or bankrupt.
FNF India may, terminate this Agreement for convenience by giving a written notice of not less than thirty (30) days of such termination to Service Provider.
FNF India may, forthwith terminate this Agreement for cause if Service Provider has failed to comply with its other obligations, warranties or representations under this Agreement.
The Service Provider shall upon the termination of this Agreement for any reason, immediately deliver all inputs, including but not limited to all material, papers, software and hardware provided by FNF India to the Service Provider or acquired by Service Provider during the provision of Services. 
If this Agreement is terminated, FNF India liable only for payment on a pro rata basis, in accordance with the payment provisions of this Agreement, for the Services properly rendered by Service Provider prior to the Effective Date of termination. 
On termination of this Agreement, FNF India's obligations under this Agreement cease in its entirety except for the payment of Services as specified above. Nothing provided herein will diminish any liability of the Service Provider to FNF India accruing prior to the date termination or arising out of this Agreement. 
AUDIT AND DOCUMENT MAINTENANCE: FNF India will conduct audits of the Service Provider’s compliance with various laws including labor laws and for the provisions of services under this Agreement, when required. The Service Provider will cooperate as is necessary in such audits and will provide all necessary books and records to establish such compliance.
For the purpose of this clause, the Service Provider shall grant, where relevant, must ensure that its subcontractors grant to FNF India and its nominees or Auditors access as required by FNF India, to Service Provider’s premises and data, records, accounts and other financial material or material relevant to performance under this Agreement.
Service Provider will submit the copies of all preventive maintenance and break down maintenance service reports as and when required from time to time.
The Service Provider shall, during the term of the Agreement and for one (1) year after the discharge of this Agreement, (or such longer time as may be required by law)  keep and maintain accurate and complete accounts in respect of expenditures incurred under the Agreement in such form and detail as shall be satisfactory to FNF India for the purposes of making payment or settlement of accounts under the Agreement, and shall permit the duly authorized representatives of FNF India from time to time to inspect such records and accounts in relation to the expenditure.  
ANTI BRIBERY LAWS:
With respect to this Agreement, Service Provider covenants and agrees that neither Service Provider nor any of its directors, officers, agents, employees or other persons associated with or acting on behalf of Service Provider: (a) has used, or shall use any corporate funds for any unlawful contribution, gift, entertainment or other unlawful expense relating to political activity; (b) has made, or will make any direct or indirect unlawful payment to any government official or employee from corporate funds; or (c) has made, or will make any bribe, unlawful rebate, payoff, influence payment, kickback or other unlawful payment in connection with the business of Service Provider.
With respect to this Agreement, Service Provider covenants and agrees that neither Service Provider nor any of its directors, officers, agents, employees or other persons associated with or acting on behalf of Service Provider has violated, is in violation of, or will violate the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act of 1977 and any amendments thereto, or any other anti-bribery or anti-corruption laws. Service Provider covenants and agrees that the foreign governments or public international organizations, or instrumentalities of these entities, which are the subject of its representation hereunder, are and shall be the ultimate customers or beneficiaries of any FNF India services resulting from such representation.
Service Provider additionally covenants and agrees that it shall not retain any sub-agent, sub-Service Provider, or representative without the prior written consent of a senior executive officer of FNF India. Service Provider understands, acknowledges and agrees that FNF shall have an irrevocable right to immediately terminate this Agreement as a result of any breach by Service Provider of any such undertakings, representations, and agreements set forth herein.

matching_standard_clause.title: INDEMNITY
matching_standard_clause.text:
Service Provider hereby agrees and covenants to indemnify and keep harmless KMBL at all times against any or all claims, liabilities, damages, losses, costs, charges, expenses, proceedings and actions against KMBL by reason of -
Any criminal, or fraudulent act, gross negligence, or misfeasance by Service Provider or its employees, staff, personnel, sub-contractors, Affiliates and/or
Any breach of confidentiality obligations contained herein.
.
.

All indemnities shall survive expiry or termination of this Agreement. 
Notwithstanding anything contained herein, the Parties shall not be liable for any indirect, special, punitive, consequential or incidental damages (including, without limitation, revenue, profits, business) under this Agreement.
DUE DILIGENCE, RIGHT TO AUDIT AND INSPECTION
The Service Provider shall maintain necessary accounts, records and statements of its operations in connection with Services provided under this Agreement. Copies of such accounts, records and statements of its operations in connection with Services provided under this Agreement will have to be furnished by the Service Provider upon request received from KMBL or the regulators of KMBL, including the Reserve Bank of India. Access shall be given to KMBL and its regulators including the Reserve Bank of India to all the data, documents, accounts, records, operations, and information given to, stored or processed by the Service Provider in connection with the Services provided to KMBL, within a reasonable time.
Service Provider agrees that the regulators of the KMBL including the Reserve Bank of India and the external and internal auditors of KMBL will have the right to inspect/audit the books, records, data, audit trails, logs, systems and information of the Service Provider (except any internal pricing data or other customer data) in relation to the Services provided under this Agreement and to obtain copies of any audit or review reports and findings made on the Service Provider in connection with the Services performed for KMBL. Service Provider shall render all necessary assistance and co-operation in this regard. KMBL shall provide reasonable notice before conducting audit and such audit shall be conducted within business hours of the Service Provider. 
The Service Provider agrees to make complete disclosure to KMBL of any third party components that are included in the product/application/deliverables licensed/provided under this Agreement in the format annexed as Annexure B to this Agreement. Further, the Service Provider agrees and undertakes to make such disclosures during the continuance of this Agreement as and when any third party component is added/embedded in the product/application/deliverables during any maintenance or upgrade or any other activity. For the purpose of due diligence, KMBL may require the Service Provider to furnish copies of the licenses acquired by the Service Provider from such third party component owners/licensors. This due diligence may either be conducted by KMBL or an external auditor authorized by KMBL for the purpose. The Service Provider shall ensure that it has observed and has included the third party component as per the terms and conditions applicable for usage of such third party component as prescribed under the license obtained from the owner of the component or prescribed by the owner otherwise. The Service Provider shall ensure that the licenses of such third party components shall be kept valid and subsisting during the Term of this Agreement. The Service Provider undertakes to procure appropriate licenses for any third party component, which may be open source/free at the time of deployment along with the product/application/deliverables but subsequently becomes subject matter of a license. In all such events, the Service Provider shall procure appropriate license from the owner of the third party component within 15 (fifteen) days from the date of becoming aware of such requirement for usage of the third party component and furnish details to KMBL in the format as contained in Annexure B to this Agreement. 
KMBL's audit and due diligence rights shall survive the expiration or termination of this Agreement.

differences.original:
The term of this Agreement is for from December 30, 2022, to December 29, 2023, unless terminated earlier. Unless explicitly agreed between the Parties in writing for extension, the Agreement will stand terminated at the end of the abovementioned term.
If at any time, the Service Provider is unable to perform or to complete the Services within the time and in a manner satisfactory to FNF India, FNF India may, at its option, either terminate the Agreement or grant Service Provider, at its sole discretion the postponement of the execution of the Services.
FNF India may terminate this Agreement immediately in the event the Service Provider becomes insolvent or bankrupt.
FNF India may, terminate this Agreement for convenience by giving a written notice of not less than thirty (30) days of such termination to Service Provider.
FNF India may, forthwith terminate this Agreement for cause if Service Provider has failed to comply with its other obligations, warranties or representations under this Agreement.
The Service Provider shall upon the termination of this Agreement for any reason, immediately deliver all inputs, including but not limited to all material, papers, software and hardware provided by FNF India to the Service Provider or acquired by Service Provider during the provision of Services. 
If this Agreement is terminated, FNF India liable only for payment on a pro rata basis, in accordance with the payment provisions of this Agreement, for the Services properly rendered by Service Provider prior to the Effective Date of termination. 
On termination of this Agreement, FNF India's obligations under this Agreement cease in its entirety except for the payment of Services as specified above. Nothing provided herein will diminish any liability of the Service Provider to FNF India accruing prior to the date termination or arising out of this Agreement. 
AUDIT AND DOCUMENT MAINTENANCE: FNF India will conduct audits of the Service Provider’s compliance with various laws including labor laws and for the provisions of services under this Agreement, when required. The Service Provider will cooperate as is necessary in such audits and will provide all necessary books and records to establish such compliance.
For the purpose of this clause, the Service Provider shall grant, where relevant, must ensure that its subcontractors grant to FNF India and its nominees or Auditors access as required by FNF India, to Service Provider’s premises and data, records, accounts and other financial material or material relevant to performance under this Agreement.
Service Provider will submit the copies of all preventive maintenance and break down maintenance service reports as and when required from time to time.
The Service Provider shall, during the term of the Agreement and for one (1) year after the discharge of this Agreement, (or such longer time as may be required by law)  keep and maintain accurate and complete accounts in respect of expenditures incurred under the Agreement in such form and detail as shall be satisfactory to FNF India for the purposes of making payment or settlement of accounts under the Agreement, and shall permit the duly authorized representatives of FNF India from time to time to inspect such records and accounts in relation to the expenditure. 
ANTI BRIBERY LAWS:
With respect to this Agreement, Service Provider covenants and agrees that neither Service Provider nor any of its directors, officers, agents, employees or other persons associated with or acting on behalf of Service Provider: (a) has used, or shall use any corporate funds for any unlawful contribution, gift, entertainment or other unlawful expense relating to political activity; (b) has made, or will make any direct or indirect unlawful payment to any government official or employee from corporate funds; or (c) has made, or will make any bribe, unlawful rebate, payoff, influence payment, kickback or other unlawful payment in connection with the business of Service Provider.
With respect to this Agreement, Service Provider covenants and agrees that neither Service Provider nor any of its directors, officers, agents, employees or other persons associated with or acting on behalf of Service Provider has violated, is in violation of, or will violate the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act of 1977 and any amendments thereto, or any other anti-bribery or anti-corruption laws. Service Provider covenants and agrees that the foreign governments or public international organizations, or instrumentalities of these entities, which are the subject of its representation hereunder, are and shall be the ultimate customers or beneficiaries of any FNF India services resulting from such representation.
Service Provider additionally covenants and agrees that it shall not retain any sub-agent, sub-Service Provider, or representative without the prior written consent of a senior executive officer of FNF India. Service Provider understands, acknowledges and agrees that FNF shall have an irrevocable right to immediately terminate this Agreement as a result of any breach by Service Provider of any such undertakings, representations, and agreements set forth herein.

Current infrastructure study

Create five Business Rules to assign groups

Create and import CSV file for bulk account creation, modification
Test and Verify Bulk user creation using CSV import
Create 5 custom templates with the necessary attributes

Create the configuration for User creation through the HRMS
Create the configuration for User Modification through the HRMS 
Create the configuration for Enable Users through the HRMS 
Create the configuration for Disable Users through the HRMS 
Test and verify the AD Actions through the HRMS application
Create 5 different automation for AD Management Tasks 
Create a Role-Based Help Desk roles
Add a technician in AD manager Plus assign a help desk role
Configure Mail Server & SMS gateway (If available) 
Configure report scheduling
Sign Off
Endpoint Central:
Verify all prerequisite for Endpoint Central 
Creating of instance of Endpoint Central 
Configure mail server setting
AD integration with Endpoint Central 
Install agent on end points not more than 10
Configure 2 DS servers (If Required) 
Configure 2 IP scope (If Required) 
Create 2 replication policy (If Required) 
Create 2 deployment policy
Deploy 3 patches on 3 endpoints and verify
Create 1 Automatic Patch Deployment task
Create 1 Test & Approve Task 
Create Software repository
Create 2 Software package
Deploy 2 software package on 2 endpoint and verify
Configure schedule scan of endpoints
Showcase the inventory details fetching into the console
Configure alerts
Showcase Remote Control functionality not more than 5 endpoints
Schedule Report not more than 2 
AD integration with Mobile Device Manager Plus (if possible) 
To generate APNs certificate for enrolling iOS devices 
Enroll 5 BYOD/Corporate device (Android/iOS/Windows) into MDM with suitable enrolment method
Add two documents and files in Content Management and push them on the particular device/group
Initiate a remote view session on the device
Configure Geo-fencing policy for enrolled devices
To track the location of the enrolled device 
To remotely notify the users by creating announcement(Android/iOS) 
To block list the applications on enrolled device 
To configure the Battery Level Tracking for fetching the device battery percentage 
Create one OS Image 
Create OS image and driver repository
Create one deployment Template
Create 3 bootable media
Provide Steps to Configure DHCP server
Deploy Image on 3 system
Sign Off
OP Manager Plus:
Current infrastructure study 
Installation of Manage Engine Op Manager Plus 
Configure mail server setting
Install SSL certificate
Add SNMP v1/v2/v3 credential for network devices discovery
Add domain admin credentials for windows devices discovery
Discover or add 75 devices into Op Manager Plus for monitoring
Configure thresholds for 20 devices
Create two notification profiles
Create two groups if required
Create one business view if required
Configure one NOC view
Schedule two reports 
Dashboard

THIS AGREEMENT is made and entered on this the 8th day of January, 2021 by and between M/s. LAKSHMI ELECTRICAL CONTROL SYSTEMS LIMITED a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 1956, bearing CIN: L31200TZ1981PLC001124 and having registered office at 34-A, Kamaraj Road, Coimbatore 641 018 and having Admin office and Works at Arasur – 641 407 hereinafter referred to as “THE BUYER / LECS” and which includes its successors and assignees
AND
M/s. Softcell Technologies Global Private Limited, having its registered office at Mumbai and branch office at Chennai, represented by Mr Ravichandran MA, hereinafter referred to as “Supplier / Seller” and which includes its successors and assignees.
Whereas the buyer is a reputed manufacturer of Electrical Control Panels, Engineering Plastics, Tooling and its related accessories developed with its own infrastructure and other resources to conduct its business is willing to designate/appoint M/s. Softcell Technologies Global Private Limited as a supplier of the products, subject to compliance with the terms and conditions of this agreement as it may be amended from time to time throughout its term.
NOW THEREFORE in consideration of the mutual covenants contained in this agreement and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged.

The failure of any Party to enforce any term or provision hereof shall not be construed to be a waiver of such term or provision and shall in no way affect the right of such Party thereafter to enforce such term or provision or any term or provision hereof.
Amendments 
No modification, amendment or waiver of the terms and conditions of this Agreement shall be valid or binding unless made in writing and duly executed by the Parties. 
Principal-to-principal agreement
This Agreement has been entered into on a principal-to-principal basis and nothing contained in this Agreement shall be deemed to constitute a joint venture, partnership, or agency relationship between Service Provider and PAGEIND. Each Party hereto shall not represent as an agent of the other under any circumstances and at any place and at any point of time and shall fulfil its obligations strictly in terms of this Agreement as between two independent principals in commercial transactions and none of the terms and conditions of this Agreement or their context shall be read or meant to be otherwise. 
Assignment Service Provider shall NOT in any manner whatsoever transfer or otherwise assign this Agreement in whole or part, or any of its rights or obligations hereunder without the prior written consent of PAGEIND.Any attempt by Service Provider to transfer or assign any of its rights or obligations under this Agreement is voidable by PAGEIND and constitutes breach of this Agreement.
