clauses.original_text:
It is expected from time to time, that the supplier may receive certain confidential information from the Buyer in connection with the services (all such information is herein referred to as “CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION”)
Confidential information means all Technical and Non- Technical information provided by the Buyer to the Supplier, including but not limited to:
A) Patent and Patent applications
B) Trade Secret
C) Proprietary Information, ideas, knowhow and other resources which the buyer    Transfers to the supplier.
Supplier agrees to treat confidential information as confidential and agrees not to use the same or any part thereof except as may be required to prepare or submit a quotation pursuant to this Agreement or to perform any agreement with a buyer arising out of this agreement, and will not disclose the same or any part thereof to any third party without prior approval of the buyer.  Supplier may disclose the same to such third parties, including subcontractors and vendors, who are subjected in writing to an obligation of confidentiality and restricted use with respect to the same which is at least as restrictive as herein required by the Supplier. This non disclosure obligation of supplier shall continue to be in force for ever even after the termination of this agreement.

matching_standard_clause.title: DEFINITIONS
matching_standard_clause.text:
The words/phrases defined in this clause shall bear the same meaning throughout this Agreement, except as indicated otherwise expressly or by context.
Agreement: shall mean this agreement and any work order(s) entered into by and between the parties from time to time, and shall include any amendments and extensions granted in near future.
Confidential Information: shall mean, but not limited to, any proprietary information, outcome of Services, deliverables, policies, plans, processes, finances, procurement requirements, or other business plans and information, either owned by Company or information received from others that Company or indirectly in writing, orally or by drawings or inspection of parts or equipment or Service Provider comes to know during his/her performance of Services. Confidential Information does not include information which is (i) known to Service Provider at the time of disclosure as evidenced by written records of the Service Provider; or (ii) has become publicly known and made generally available through no wrongful act of the Service Provider; or (iii) has been rightfully received by the Service Provider from a third party who is authorized to make such disclosure.
Parties: shall mean Company and Service Provider.

agree that it shall not solicit or employ the personnel of who are involved in negotiations or rendering any services to the Supplier under this Agreement, for the term of this Agreement and a period of one year from the date from which such personnel cease to be involved in such negotiations/rendering services.

matching_standard_clause.text:
The Service Provider shall:
Regularly provide reports of the detail and frequency, as required by Company. Service Provider shall obtain such persons as may be indicated by Company from time to time, on all matters arising from or relating to this Agreement.
Promptly comply with such instructions as may be issued from time to time by Company in connection with the performance of the Services.
Ensure that at all time during the performance of the Services, shall abide by all applicable Company’s security rules, policies, standards, guidelines and procedures. Company has the right at any time during the term of this Agreement at its sole discretion to require the Service Provider or his personnel to stop providing Service, if the Vendor or its personnel deployed is in violation of this clause.
At all times, the Service Provider shall act with appropriate propriety and discretion and, in particular refrain from making any public statements, concerning the Services hereunder without the prior approval of Company.
Be responsible to ensure that the personnel assigned to participate in the performance of the Services abide by the provisions of this Agreement.
In the performance of all Services hereunder, Service Provider shall, at its own cost, comply with all the applicable laws and regulations.   During the term of this Agreement, Service Provider shall maintain insurance policies suitable to the nature of its business. , ().  In addition, the Service Provider shall not be permitted to reduce, or cancel the insurance policy without reasonable prior written notice to Company.  Upon request, Service Provider shall provide a certificate of insurance to Company.
Be liable for all losses/damages caused by the misuse to Company property while performing the Services. Further the Service Provider shall be solely liable for any losses to its equipment while performing the Services.
Be liable for the use of the Confidential Information contained in the Company networks or data bases by himself or third parties, who may have gained access to the Company networks or systems through him. All information in such Company networks and/or databases shall be Company’s Confidential Information.
Neither Service Provider nor any of its personnel employee/individuals shall be or shall be deemed to be employees of Company for any purpose whatsoever in confirmation with and without limitation on any application of the foregoing statement. Service Provider shall be solely responsible for payment of compensation and any other costs related to employment/engagement of Service Provider personnel including any amounts that may be due as prevailing wages under applicable law to Service Provider personnel assigned to perform Services. Service Provider shall furnish Company with a written declaration that payments of all statutory obligations to its personnel have been made.
Shall ensure that its personnel do not carry out any other business while providing Services from any Company premises.
Service Provider shall fully comply with all legislative regulatory or other government requirements in relation to its personnel including compliance with Contract Labor (Regulation and Abolition) Act 1970, Employee’s State Insurance Act 1948, Employees Provident Fund Act 1952 and Family Pension Fund 1971, Payment of Bonus Act, The Shops and Commercial Establishments Act, Maternity Benefits Act, Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act 2013, Payment of Gratuity Act, Minimum Wages Act, Payment of Wages Act and successive enactments and any other statute enactment as may be applicable from time to time. Service Provider shall maintain necessary registers/records as required under the aforesaid statutes and produce the same as and when required to do so by Company or Statutory Authorities. The Service Provider shall obtain separate code number for ESI and PF purposes and produce proof of such registration for Company’s verification and records.

differences.original:
The Supplier has to strictly adhere to the terms and conditions of the Buyer. The Buyer shall purchase the Products only based on the demand and it is not commitment on part of the Buyer to purchase the Products. Any forecast by the Buyer is only for planning purpose for procurement of raw materials. 
Even after the termination of this agreement, the provision relating to payment, confidential information shall be in force and both the parties are agreed to comply the same.
.
agree that it shall not solicit or employ the personnel of who are involved in negotiations or rendering any services to the Supplier under this Agreement, for the term of this Agreement and a period of one year from the date from which such personnel cease to be involved in such negotiations/rendering services. 
Supplier shall not approach any of the present or prospective customers of LECS, who has been exposed to the Supplier by LECS, either directly or through the Confidential Information provided under this Agreement, for a period of  years from the date of this Agreement, for providing products or services similar to the products or services which are currently evaluated in respect of business opportunities, without obtaining the prior written consent of the other party.
The Seller shall not, directly or indirectly, while acting as an agent or principal, utilise any Information/Moulds obtained from LECS under this Agreement to develop, distribute, sell or resell new products or provide new services competitive with the related products or services of LECS.
The Seller shall not manufacture or cause a third party to manufacture, sell, market, consign or deliver, directly or indirectly, products using  technology, tooling, drawings,  specifications or any other information supplied by LECS, except to LECS or to any of the entities nominated by LECS, unless LECS agrees in writing for any specific product.
LECS shall review the inventory status from time to time and discuss with the Supplier and inform the course of action based on the market demand.
The Supplier shall co-operate with LECS for monthly reconciliation of account balance. In case, of failure of reconciliation LECS shall not process the payment to the Supplier.
The Seller shall not use ‘LECS’ logo or any design which is deceptively similar thereto or any of its registered or unregistered trademarks either on the components to be supplied to LECS or any container or packing materials used for marketing of such components without prior and specific approval of LECS.

clauses.original_text:
Liaisons. Each Party will designate a liaison contact responsible for coordinating any cooperative efforts between the Parties which are contemplated by this Agreement and also to serve as the recipient of all inquiries from the Customer regarding each Party’s respective Products and Services. Either Party may change its liaison contact at any time upon prior written notice.
For LTIMindtree: 
[Name, Title, Contact Information]
For Alliance Partner: 
[Name, Title, Contact Information]
Responsibility. Except as otherwise agreed in writing, each Party will be responsible for only its own Products, Services and personnel and will have sole and complete control over the charges, terms and conditions for its Products and Services. Each Party will be solely responsible for negotiating agreements and fulfilling all orders, and shall contract directly with the Customer for its respective Products and Services. Notwithstanding the above, the Parties may agree in writing on a case-by-case basis to jointly provide Products and/or Services to Customers with one Party acting as the prime contractor and sub-contracting the relevant portion of the Products and Services to the other Party. 
Conduct. Each Party will conduct all business activities in a manner that does not disparage the good name, reputation, Products and Services of the other Party.
Updates. Each Party will use reasonable efforts to keep the other Party informed in a timely manner regarding any changes to such Party’s Products or Services.
Training. Each Party agrees to provide such training to the other Party’s personnel as is required to adequately market the relevant Party’s Products and Services. 
Technical Personnel. Each Party will provide the other Party reasonable access to its technical personnel as necessary to assist in the use and marketing of such Party’s Products as required for each Registered Opportunity.

matching_standard_clause.title: Both parties mutually agree that personnel assigned to perfo...
matching_standard_clause.text:
Both parties mutually agree that personnel assigned to perform the Services shall be competent and possess the necessary qualifications. The other party shall exercise exclusive control and direction over these personnel, thereby bearing sole responsibility for all associated liabilities and expenses. 
In the execution of this Agreement, the party's personnel will adhere to the standard workplace policies of both parties. The utilization of temporary employees by the party necessitates prior written consent from the other Party. 
Personnel assigned to provide services under this Agreement shall retain their status as employees of the respective party. Their assignment to provide services to another party shall not result in their becoming employees of the respective party. 
The party shall ensure that the personnel assigned to perform services receive all requisite training. 
Both parties acknowledge that the party and its employees are ineligible for and shall not be entitled to participate in any employee benefit plans offered by either Customer or any party. These benefit plans encompass but are not limited to, pension, profit-sharing, retirement, deferred compensation, welfare, insurance, disability, bonuses, vacation pay, severance pay, and similar programs. The party, to the maximum extent permitted by law, explicitly waives any and all rights to such benefits, regardless of whether they are currently available or may be introduced in the future. This acknowledgement, declaration, and waiver pertains to benefits, the respective party offers.  
Both the parties reserves the right, on reasonable notice, to request proof of compliance with the requirements of this Section.

clauses.original_text: Each Party agrees that during the term of this Agreement and for a period of one (1) year after the relevant individual’s last involvement with it, neither it nor its affiliates shall directly or indirectly solicit, attempt to solicit or induce, hire, recruit, employ, engage, any personnel of the other Party, or otherwise cause an employee or consultant of the other Party to terminate his or her employment, contractual or other relationship with the other Party in order to become an employee or consultant to or for LTIMindtree or Alliance Partner or either Party’s affiliates. For the purpose of the foregoing, “employee” or “consultant” shall mean any person who is presently employed or engaged by either Party or was employed or engaged by either Party in the twelve (12) months immediately preceding the solicitation or attempt to hire or hiring of such individual. The above prohibitions shall not apply to any change in employment status as arises by reason of operation of law (i.e., by reason of the operation of the Acquired Rights Directive or equivalent legislation).

matching_standard_clause.title: ANTI-CORRUPTION AND WHISTLEBLOWING
matching_standard_clause.text:
The Service Provider acknowledges and confirms to SG GSC that it has not and will not provide, promise or offer any illegitimate benefit to any person including any employee or officer of SG GSC in connection with the performance of obligations under this Agreement, or in order to have business from SG GSC pursuant to this Agreement. For avoidance of any doubt, illegitimate benefit means any benefit or advantage (whether in cash or kind) which is not legitimately due to the recipient, and includes any bribe or kickback.
The Service Provider shall report any possible acts of seeking bribery, illegitimate benefits and/or favors, illicit gratification, existence of conflict of interest, money laundering, corruption, violations of applicable law/policy or any other unlawful or unethical activity by the employees or representatives of SG GSC in dealing with Service Provider or in relation to the business activities of  SG GSC, which the Service Provider has knowledge or information of, via an email to GSC-Whistleblower@socgen.com. The identity of the Whistleblower/Service Provider will be kept secret and will not be disclosed without the consent of the Whistleblower/Service Provider.

For the purpose of the foregoing, “employee” or “consultant” shall mean any person who is presently employed or engaged by either Party or was employed or engaged by either Party in the twelve (12) months immediately preceding the solicitation or attempt to hire or hiring of such individual. The above prohibitions shall not apply to any change in employment status as arises by reason of operation of law (i.e., by reason of the operation of the Acquired Rights Directive or equivalent legislation).

matching_standard_clause.title: CONFIDENTIALITY
matching_standard_clause.text:
Each Party agrees to: (a) use the Confidential Information solely for the purpose of performing its obligations under this Agreement; (b) not to disclose any Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party to any third party without prior written consent of the Disclosing Party; (c) limit the dissemination of the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information to only those of the Receiving Party's officers, and employees (“Representatives”) who require access to such information to perform their functions in connection with the purpose for which the Confidential Information is disclosed and to the attorneys and financial advisors on a strict ‘need to know’ basis; (d) to ensure that each person or entity who is permitted to receive or have access to the Confidential Information is bound by a confidentiality obligation consistent with this Agreement; (e) to exercise the same degree of care with respect to the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information as it uses for its own confidential information of like importance, but no less than reasonable care; and (f) to return to the Disclosing Party, or if such return is not possible destroy, Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party at source which will be incapable of being recovered through normal or laboratory means upon receipt of a written request from the Disclosing Party without retaining any copy thereof.
Either Party shall have a right to disclose the Confidential Information to the legal / regulatory authorities pursuant to a binding court order or government regulation, provided that if permitted under law, the Receiving Party provides a notice to the Disclosing Party, in order for the Disclosing Party to obtain a protective order. If the Disclosing Party is unable to obtain a protective order, the Confidential Information may be disclosed only to the extent necessary under law.
Either Party is not permitted to discuss the other Party’s affairs with any member of the press and other news media without written authorization from the appropriate authorized representative of such other Party. Each Party acknowledges and agrees that any breach of the confidentiality obligations set forth in this Clause shall cause the other party irreparable harm for which monetary damages would be inadequate. Accordingly, in the event of such a breach, the Disclosing Party may seek injunctive or other equitable relief to enforce this Agreement in addition to any available legal remedies.
All Confidential Information disclosed by the Disclosing Party hereunder is provided "AS IS" and without warranty of any kind. All Confidential Information shall remain the property of the Disclosing Party. Nothing contained in this Clause or any disclosure pursuant to this Agreement shall be construed as granting any license or right under any intellectual property right, whether present or future.
This obligation to keep information confidential by both Parties shall survive determination, termination or expiration of this Agreement.

clauses.original_text:
General. Except as provided herein, this Agreement will not be construed to grant any license under any trade secret, patent, patent application, industrial design, trademark, copyright, mask work, confidential process, formula, plan, computer program, data or other valuable confidential information or know-how to either Party. Each Party will own and retain all of its right, title, and interest in and relating to its intellectual property rights in its Products and Services and Confidential Information, both currently used and that which it may be developed and used in the future.
Alliance Partner Product License. Alliance Partner grants LTIMindtree a non-exclusive, non-transferable (without right of sublicense), royalty-fee, restricted, non-revocable license during the terms of this Agreement to use the Alliance Partner Products and related documentation for the limited purpose of testing, evaluation and demonstrating Alliance Partner Products. Any internal use of the Products on a standalone basis, for LTIMindtree’ business operations is strictly prohibited by this Agreement and requires a separate agreement between the Parties. LTIMindtree shall not attempt to obtain or derive source code or any other information from or about the Alliance Partner Products through disassembly, decompiling, reverse engineering or other means. 
Trademark and Logo Usage. Each Party will have the non-transferable, non-exclusive, revocable license to use the other Party’s logo(s), trade name(s) and trademarks and the names of its Products (“Marks”) identified on Exhibit C, all in unmodified form, solely for identification purposes in performing the marketing activities described in this Agreement. All Marks must be reproduced on all copies of the Products and may not be altered or removed. The Party owning a Mark may modify, add or delete any such Marks upon thirty (30) days prior notice to the other Party. Each Party further agrees to ensure that all such use will comply with good trademark usage practices and the standards of display and trademark usage guidelines provided by the other Party and to take no action that would in any way infringe or interfere with the other Party’s rights in its Marks. Each Party agrees to cooperate fully with the other Party in facilitating the other Party’s monitoring and control of the nature and quality of the use of the other Party’s Marks. Neither Party will have any right, title or interest in the Marks of the other Party, which will remain its sole and exclusive property, and each Party will retain all goodwill insured through the use of their respective Marks and, thus, agrees to assign to the other Party any rights that such Party may acquire in the applicable Marks by operation of law or otherwise. At no time during or after the term of this Agreement will either Party challenge or assist others to challenge the other Party’s Marks or the registration thereof or attempt to register, use or permit the use of any trademarks, marks or trade names confusingly similar to those of the other Party.

matching_standard_clause.title: ACCESS TO THE SERVICE
matching_standard_clause.text:
Subject to the terms and conditions of this TOS, SOCRadar grants you a non-exclusive, non-transferable license, during the Term, to use and access the Service, solely in accordance with the published documentation for the Service, for your own internal-use purposes. You agree that you will not: 
(a) permit any third party to access and/or use the Service; 
(b) rent, lease, loan, or sell access to the Service to any third party; 
(c) interfere with, disrupt, alter, translate, or modify the Service or any part thereof, or create an undue burden on the Service or the networks or services connected to the Service; 
(d) reverse-engineer the Service (except to the extent that such restriction on reverse engineering is prohibited by law and then you shall provide SOCRadar with prompt written notice prior to any such action), use the Services to conduct, publish or disclose any competitive benchmarking tests or analysis; or access the Service to build a competitive product or service; or 
(e) introduce software or automated agents or scripts to the Service so as to produce multiple accounts, generate automated searches, requests and queries, or to strip or mine data from the Service. Service accounts and passwords may not be used by more than one individual user and you agree that you will not assist with or permit this. You shall not use the Services for any production purposes or use the Services except to evaluate such Services during the designated Term. SOCRadar reserves the right to immediately terminate any account access that SOCRadar reasonably determines has been used by an unauthorized third party or in violation of this TOS. 
OWNERSHIP. 
You agree the Service, all software, hardware, algorithms, all SOCRadar CTI as defined below, methodologies, and other technology used by SOCRadar to provide the Service, and all intellectual property and proprietary rights in all of the foregoing, is the exclusive property of SOCRadar and its suppliers. You hereby assign to SOCRadar any suggestions, ideas, enhancement requests, feedback, recommendations or other information provided by you related to the Service. clauses.original_text:
Indemnity. The Alliance Partner (the “Indemnifying Party”) will defend against or settle, and indemnify and hold LTIMindtree (the “Indemnified Party”) harmless from any third party claim, suit or other action (“Claim”) and pay any final judgments awarded in any judicial proceeding on the Claim, and pay any associated costs and the reasonable fees or attorneys, arising out of, or resulting from: (i) a Claim of infringement of any third party’s intellectual property rights; (ii) any unauthorized representations or warranties regarding the Indemnified Party’s Products or Services made by the Indemnifying Party; and (iii) any act or omission by the Indemnifying Party, its officers, directors, employees, agents or subcontractors that results in any loss of goodwill or reputation for the Indemnified Party. In the event of any such Claim, the Indemnified Party agrees to promptly notify the Indemnifying Party of the Claim and give the Indemnifying Party sole control and reasonably requested non-monetary assistance in the defence and settlement of the Claim.
Limitation. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Indemnifying Party will have no responsibility for any claim of infringement to the extent the claims arises solely from: (i) the unauthorized modification of the Indemnifying Party’s Products or materials used for marketing its Products and Services (“Marketing Materials”) by the other Party; (ii) compliance with or use of the Marketing Materials, specifications, instructions, technology or information of the other Party if such claim would have been avoided but for such compliance or use; (iii) use of the Product with products or services not supplied by the Indemnifying Party if such claim would have been avoided but for such use; or (iv) any marketing activities for the Products or Services by the other Party not in compliance with this Agreement. These terms state the sole remedy and the entire liability of each of the Parties to the other for third party intellectual property infringement through the marketing activities contemplated in this Agreement.

matching_standard_clause.title: 5. Indemnity
matching_standard_clause.text:
Each party (the "Indemnifying Party") agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the other party (the "Indemnified Party") from and against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, incurred by the Indemnified Party as a result of or in connection with the following:
5.1 Claim of Intellectual Property Infringement: Any claim that the Products infringe any patent, copyright, trademark, or other intellectual property right of any third party.
5.1.2 Any claim that the Indemnifying Party has breached any of its obligations under this Agreement.
5.2 Indemnification Procedure: In the event that the Indemnified Party becomes aware of any matter for which it may seek indemnification under this Section 5, the Indemnified Party shall promptly notify the Indemnifying Party in writing of the claim, providing all relevant details and supporting documentation.
5.2.2 The Indemnifying Party shall have the right to assume control of the defense, settlement, or compromise of any such claim, provided that the Indemnifying Party shall keep the Indemnified Party reasonably informed of the progress of such defense or settlement negotiations.
5.2.3 The Indemnified Party shall reasonably cooperate with the Indemnifying Party in the defense of such claim, at the expense of the Indemnifying Party.
5.3 Exceptions to Indemnification: The Indemnifying Party shall have no obligation to indemnify the Indemnified Party if the claim arises from:
a. The modification or alteration of the Products by anyone other than the Indemnifying Party without the prior written consent of the Indemnifying Party.
b. The combination, operation, or use of the Products with other products, equipment, or software not provided or approved in writing by the Indemnifying Party.
c. Compliance with the specifications, designs, or instructions provided by the Indemnified Party.
5.4 Settlement of Claims: The Indemnifying Party shall not settle any claim that results in liability or obligation for the Indemnified Party without the Indemnified Party's prior written consent, which shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed.
5.5 Limitation of Liability: The total liability of the Indemnifying Party under this Section 5 shall be limited to the amounts paid or payable by the Indemnified Party to settle or satisfy the third-party claim.

clauses.original_text:
Term. The term of this Agreement will be one (1) year from the Effective Date and will only be renewed when one Party gives the other Party notice of its intent to renew the Agreement at least thirty (30) days prior to the expiration of the then-current term, unless the Agreement is earlier terminated pursuant to Section 10.2 below.
Termination for Cause/Termination for Convenience. Either Party may terminate this Agreement following thirty (30) days written notice to the other of a material breach of this Agreement if such breach is not cured within such period. Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon notice to the other party if the (i) other Party becomes a direct competitor of the terminating Party; (ii) is acquired by a direct competitor of the terminating Party; or (iii) assigns this Agreement to a direct competitor of the terminating Party, as determined by the terminating Party in its sole discretion. LTIMindtree may terminate this Agreement for convenience by providing thirty (30) days written notice to Alliance Partner.
Consequences of Termination. Termination of this Agreement shall not affect any Registered Opportunity to the extent such Registered Opportunity has resulted in a contractual commitment to a Customer. Except as otherwise set forth in the preceding sentence, in the event of termination or expiration of this Agreement, each Party will immediately (i) cease all marketing activities hereunder and remove all related references to the other Party, its Products and Services and its Marks from its marketing and other materials and communication channels; and (ii) return any Products, software or hardware, if any, Marketing Materials, and Confidential Information provided by the other Party.
Termination Remedies Not Exclusive. The termination rights and obligations of the Parties set forth above in this Section 10 are not exclusive, but are in addition to any other rights and remedies available to the Parties, in law or in equity, for breach of this Agreement.

matching_standard_clause.title: TERM AND TERMINATION
matching_standard_clause.text:
Term. This Agreement shall become binding on the Parties from the Effective Date and shall continue for three (3) years “Initial Term”), and thereafter, shall automatically renew for additional 1 (one) year term (each, a “Renewal Term”) (the Initial Term and all Renewal Terms are collectively, the “Term”). Either Party may elect to not renew the Agreement for the Renewal Term by giving the other Party a prior written notice of its intention to not renew at least 60 (sixty) days before the expiry of the Initial Term or the then existing Renewal Term, failing which the Agreement shall stand renewed.

Termination at Will. shall have the right to terminate this Agreement at any time during the Term without assigning any reason whatsoever, by giving at least 0 (ty) days prior written notice to the other Party.
Termination for Cause. Either Party shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement upon thirty (90) days’ prior written notice to the other Party in the event of a material breach of any provision of this Agreement by the other Party if the notifying Party requires cure and such breach is not cured within thirty (30) days after the breaching Party’s receipt of notice of such breach (however, if the breach is capable of being cured and such breaching Party is working diligently to cure such breach the period for cure shall be extended for an additional thirty (30) days).   
Termination for Insolvency. Either Party may immediately terminate this Agreement upon the filing or institution of insolvency, bankruptcy, reorganization (in connection with any insolvency), liquidation or receivership proceedings, or upon an assignment of a substantial portion of the assets for the benefit of creditors by the other Party, or in the event a receiver or custodian is appointed for such other Party’s business, or if a substantial portion of such other Party’s business is subject to attachment or similar process; provided, however, that in the case of any involuntary bankruptcy proceeding or the attachment of a substantial portion of a Party’s assets, such right to terminate shall only become effective if the proceeding or attachment is not dismissed within one hundred and eighty (180) days after the admission thereof.

differences.original:
The term of this Agreement will be one (1) year from the Effective Date and will only be renewed when one Party gives the other Party notice of its intent to renew the Agreement at least thirty (30) days prior to the expiration of the then-current term, unless the Agreement is earlier terminated pursuant to Section 10.2 below.
Termination for Cause/Termination for Convenience. Either Party may terminate this Agreement following thirty (30) days written notice to the other of a material breach of this Agreement if such breach is not cured within such period. Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon notice to the other party if the (i) other Party becomes a direct competitor of the terminating Party; (ii) is acquired by a direct competitor of the terminating Party; or (iii) assigns this Agreement to a direct competitor of the terminating Party, as determined by the terminating Party in its sole discretion. LTIMindtree may terminate this Agreement for convenience by providing thirty (30) days written notice to Alliance Partner.
Consequences of Termination. Termination of this Agreement shall not affect any Registered Opportunity to the extent such Registered Opportunity has resulted in a contractual commitment to a Customer. Except as otherwise set forth in the preceding sentence, in the event of termination or expiration of this Agreement, each Party will immediately (i) cease all marketing activities hereunder and remove all related references to the other Party, its Products and Services and its Marks from its marketing and other materials and communication channels; and (ii) return any Products, software or hardware, if any, Marketing Materials, and Confidential Information provided by the other Party.
Termination Remedies Not Exclusive. The termination rights and obligations of the Parties set forth above in this Section 10 are not exclusive, but are in addition to any other rights and remedies available to the Parties, in law or in equity, for breach of this Agreement.

clauses.clause_title: LIMITATION OF LIABILITY AND FORCE MAJEURE
clauses.original_text:
EXCEPT FOR THE ALLIANCE PARTNER’S INDEMNITY OBLIGATIONS UNDER SECTION 9 OR ANY OTHER LIABILITY THAT CANNOT BE EXCLUDED BY APPLICABLE LAW, IN NO EVENT WILL EITHER PARTY’S TOTAL AND CUMULATIVE LIABILITY IN AGGREGATE TO THE OTHER PARTY UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, EXCEED $10,000. IN NO EVENT WILL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL OR INCIDENTAL DAMAGES, HOWEVER CAUSED, EVEN IF SUCH PARTY IS ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. LIMITATIONS OF LIABILITY WILL APPLY NOTWITHSTANDING ANY FAILURE OF ESSENTIAL PURPOSE OF ANY LIMITED REMEDY.
In the event that either Party is unable to perform any of its obligations under this Agreement as a result of natural disasters, epidemics or pandemics, quarantine, actions or decrees of governmental bodies, communication line failures not the fault of the affected Party, or any other delay or failure which arises from causes beyond a Party’s reasonable control (hereafter referred to as a “Force Majeure Event”), the Party whose performance has been so affected shall not be liable for such non-performance but shall promptly give notice to the other Party and shall use commercially reasonable efforts to resume performance as soon as possible. If the period of non-performance exceeds fifteen (15) days from the receipt of notice of the Force Majeure Event, the Party whose ability to perform has not been so affected may by giving written notice to terminate this Agreement.

matching_standard_clause.title: MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT
matching_standard_clause.text:
It shall and hereby undertakes to provide regular updates at such intervals as may be specified by the HDFC AMC with respect to the Services provided in terms of this Agreement. HDFC AMC shall carry out monitoring and assessment with the purpose of undertaking any necessary corrective measure including but not limited to termination of the Agreement. The minimum period required to execute such termination/provision shall be (   ) days before the execution of the termination. 
SERVICE PROVIDER hereby agrees to ensure that high standards of care in performing the Services are maintained by it at all times and the HDFC AMC has the right to intervene with appropriate measures to meet legal and regulatory obligations and require it to take such appropriate measures as the HDFC AMC may deem fit.
Force majeure
It is expressly agreed that neither Party shall be liable for any default, delay, lapse or inability to fulfill their commitments hereunder, occasioned in whole or in part due to reasons beyond their control like strikes, lock-out, fire, war, tempest, sabotage, change of law, act or regulation of Government, inability to secure Government authorization and / or approvals or any other act of God or any other cause beyond their reasonable control (“Force Majeure Event”).
The Party claiming the Force Majeure Event shall promptly notify the other Party in writing of its reasons for the delay or stoppage and its likely duration and shall take all reasonable steps to overcome the delay or stoppage.
Either Party may resume performance under the Agreement after the Force Majeure Event comes to an end.

clauses.original_text:
Any training to be provided to the Bank’s employees and or resources as part of the Services, the same shall be as per the provisions of the Work Order for increasing the efficacy of the staff and for implementation of the project as per the Work Order. The training shall be provided as may be agreed in the scope of work. 
4. SERVICE PROVIDER’S REPRESENTATIONS
4.1 The Service Provider hereby represents, warrants and confirms that:
It has full capacity, power and authority to enter into this Agreement and during the continuance of this Agreement, will continue to have full capacity, power and authority to carry out and perform the Service Provider’s obligations and has already taken and will continue to take all necessary and further actions, (including wherever applicable without limitation obtaining of necessary approvals/consents/licenses as are applicable under Applicable Law).
To its best knowledge, it has the necessary skills, knowledge, experience, expertise, required capital net worth, adequate and competent Service Provider’s Employees, Qualified Personnel, systems, equipment and procedures and capability to duly perform the Service Provider’s obligations in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.
The execution of this Agreement and providing Services and delivering Deliverables hereunder, does not and will not violate any Applicable Law and further, to its best knowledge, will not violate or breach any covenants, stipulations or conditions of any agreements or undertaking entered into by the Service Provider with any other Person.
It shall take all reasonable measures to ensure that information and the mode of transfer (within Service Provider’s area of influence) to and from the Bank’s materials is secure and it shall not use, analyse or access the Bank data traffic or any other data except for the limited purposes necessary for undertaking its contractual obligations as set out herein. The Services will be performed in a competent manner and substantially in accordance with any mutually agreed specifications. 
The Service Provider hereby acknowledges and accepts that the Bank has relied upon the above representations and warranties and have entered into this Agreement.
The Service Provider represents and warrants to the Bank that (i)  prior to delivery of any Deliverable or provision of any Service to the Bank, the Service Provider shall have obtained assignment or license of all right, title and interest in and to such deliverable, to the extent necessary for Service Provider to grant to the Bank the rights and licenses granted hereunder; (ii) the Service Provider has not received any written notice or claim, and is not otherwise aware, that any of the deliverables and the use thereof by the Bank and authorized users in accordance with this Agreement as contemplated hereunder, infringes or misappropriates, or would infringe or misappropriate the patent, copyright, trademark, trade secret or other Intellectual Property Rights of any third party;  and (iii) the Services performed by the Service Provider hereunder shall be of professional quality, consistent with generally accepted industry standards for the work of a similar nature.
It shall ensure that services provided under each Work Order will substantially conform to the agreed functional and technical specifications as is set out in the Work Oder and any other such agreed specificationsIt shall ensure that all Services provided to the Bank will not infringe or misappropriate any Intellectual Property rights of any Third Party.  
The Bank  agrees that the Service Provider shall not be liable for any claims of infringement arising from (a) combination of the Deliverable with any hardware, software, data, or other materials not provided and approved by the Service Provider; or (b) the Service Provider’s compliance with the Bank’s specifications, information, designs or requirements; or (c) the Bank’s use of Deliverables for purposes other than those specified under applicable SOW(s) or for any illegal purpose; or (d) the Bank’s failure to comply with the Service Provider’s instructions related to Deliverables.
It has no right, title, or interest in any and all Deliverables whether or not registrable under any statute for the time being in force, except otherwise agreed in writing by the Bank. 
It shall ensure that the resources deployed for rendering services are adequately trained for the required tasks as per the Work Order and any specific training requirements that Bank may require. The Service Provider shall develop and establish a robust framework for documenting, maintaining and testing business continuity and recovery procedures . The Service Provider shall periodically test the business continuity and recovery plan and shall occasionally conduct a joint testing and recovery exercises with the Bank.
4.2  The Service Provider agrees to be vigilant and to report all violations of information security and all suspected security events immediately to concerned teams in the Bank.
The Service Provider further represents, undertakes and agrees that it shall ensure (1) to comply with the provisions of Information Technology Act and the rules framed thereunder including Information Technology (Reasonable security practices and procedures and sensitive personal data or information) Rules, 2011; (b) to monitor the security practices, control processes and checks in respect of the confidential information on a regular basis; (c) to comply with the acceptable usage policy and any other policies as may be informed in writing to the Service Provider by the Bank from time to time, and ( d ) to disclose any breaches in the security practices, control processes and checks without undue delay to concerned employee of the Bank
4.3 The Service Provider represents and warrants that it will provide an integrity certificate from the original equipment manufacturer (OEM) that the OEM has all the necessary legitimate rights, licenses and/or authorization as regards software, Source Code, tools, techniques, used by it relating to the Services rendered under this agreement and for providing the Services and safe guarding the Confidential Information on a periodic basis and as requested by the Bank. 
4.4 The Service Provider agrees that as and when Service Provider is undertaking any incident management testing  internally or externally through any person/Agency/process/service/technology associated with the Bank,  the Service Provider shall inform the Bank and with prior consultation and approval of the Bank, the testing/demonstration shall be carried out by the Service Provider at least once a year or as and when  required by the Bank, any Statutory Body, Regulatory Body as the case may be. Such testing/demonstration of incident management should include, but not limited to, reporting and detecting security incidents involving the networks, systems and/or application used to provide services under the Purchase Order raised from time to time, processes and procedures for assessing the severity of the incident, identifying the cause of incident, redressing the cause to avoid future incidents, restoring normal operations and documenting the results of response post implementation of the redressal actions. Bank should be provided requisite details by the Service Provider within Seven working days from the date of conducting the test/demonstration.
4.5 Except As Otherwise Stated In This Clause, The Service Provider Makes No Warranties Of Any Kind Or Nature, Whether Express Or Implied, Including, But Not Limited To, Warranties Of Merchantability Or Fitness For A Particular Purpose Or Use, Or Warranties Of Any Deliverables Or Services, Or The Appropriateness Of The Bank’s Or Any Third-Party Specifications.  In Addition, The Service Provider Expressly Disclaims Any Warranty Or Liability With Respect To Design Or Latent Defects, Security Of Data, Or Compliance With Laws, Regulations, Or Other Official Government Releases Applicable To The Bank, Which Shall Be The Sole Responsibility Of The Bank.

matching_standard_clause.title: SUB-CONTRACTING AND ASSIGNMENT
matching_standard_clause.text:
The Service Provider shall itself perform its obligations under this Agreement and shall not assign, transfer, or sub-contract any of its rights and obligations in relation to all or part of the Services or related thereto. The Service Provider shall appoint sub-contractors and/or assign or transfer any of the rights and obligations under this Agreement with prior written consent of the Bank.  The Service Provider shall at all times remain responsible and liable to the Bank for all the actions of the agents, sub-agents/sub-contractors, assignee, or transferee, as the case may be, with no dilution or diminution of service, controls, penalties, etc.
Notwithstanding anything contrary contained in the terms of this Agreement, Service Provider shall ensure that such agents, sub-agent, sub-contractor, assignee or transferee etc. shall be bound by the terms of this Agreement. For the purpose of this clause and notwithstanding any such written consent being given by the Bank, the Service Provider shall remain liable for the acts and omissions of any delegate it has delegated its activities to i.e. sub agent, sub-contractor, agent etc. If such delegation is as a result of operation of any laws, then Bank shall have an option on such delegation to immediately terminate this Agreement at its discretion. The Service Provider shall be responsible and liable for the performance and risk management practices of its sub-contractors. 
The Bank shall be entitled to assign/transfer part/ all of its rights and benefits under this Agreement/this Agreement to any Person or entity without any prior notice or intimation to the Service Provider. However, the Service Provider shall not transfer or assign this Agreement and/or any obligations or rights under this Agreement to any third party without prior written consent of the Bank.
BUSINESS CONTINUITY PLAN (“BCP”)
The Service Provider hereby confirms that it has developed and established a robust framework for documenting, maintaining and testing business continuity and recovery procedures and the same are tested periodically and agrees to test such business continuity and recovery plan jointly with the Bank and shall ensure that the Service to the Bank would not be adversely affected in any manner on account of any factors including system breakdowns which may cause disruption in the normal functions of the Service Provider.
The Service Provider hereby agrees and understands that Services to be performed under this Agreement shall continue to be offered under ordinary circumstances. In the event of any difficulty in performing the required Services, Service Provider shall make best efforts to make alternative arrangements to ensure that the required Services are continued to be performed.
The Service Provider shall review and test its BCP on an annual basis and notify the Bank of any substantial changes to its BCP. The test shall validate the functionality and effectiveness of the BCP, including but not limited to the feasibility of the recovery time objectives, recovery point objectives and resumption operation capacities.
Following each test the Service Provider shall confirm to the Bank the functionality and effectiveness of the BCP. The Service Provider shall promptly notify the Bank of any test findings that may affect the Service Provider’s performance of its Services. The Service Provider shall promptly implement remedial measures or actions to address the test findings, including those required by the Bank.
Upon the Bank’s request, the Service Provider shall participate in the Bank’s business continuity and disaster recovery exercises in respect of the Services to be provided by the Service Provider.
The Service Provider shall, on request, provide copies of results of any independent assessments of such Business Continuity Plan to the Bank.

It has full capacity, power and authority to enter into this Agreement and during the continuance of this Agreement, will continue to have full capacity, power and authority to carry out and perform the Service Provider’s obligations and has already taken and will continue to take all necessary and further actions, (including wherever applicable without limitation obtaining of necessary approvals/consents/licenses as are applicable under Applicable Law).
To its best knowledge, it has the necessary skills, knowledge, experience, expertise, required capital net worth, adequate and competent Service Provider’s Employees, Qualified Personnel, systems, equipment and procedures and capability to duly perform the Service Provider’s obligations in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.
The execution of this Agreement and providing Services and delivering Deliverables hereunder, does not and will not violate any Applicable Law and further, to its best knowledge, will not violate or breach any covenants, stipulations or conditions of any agreements or undertaking entered into by the Service Provider with any other Person.
It shall take all reasonable measures to ensure that information and the mode of transfer (within Service Provider’s area of influence) to and from the Bank’s materials is secure and it shall not use, analyse or access the Bank data traffic or any other data except for the limited purposes necessary for undertaking its contractual obligations as set out herein. The Services will be performed in a competent manner and substantially in accordance with any mutually agreed specifications. 
The Service Provider hereby acknowledges and accepts that the Bank has relied upon the above representations and warranties and have entered into this Agreement.
The Service Provider represents and warrants to the Bank that (i)  prior to delivery of any Deliverable or provision of any Service to the Bank, the Service Provider shall have obtained assignment or license of all right, title and interest in and to such deliverable, to the extent necessary for Service Provider to grant to the Bank the rights and licenses granted hereunder; (ii) the Service Provider has not received any written notice or claim, and is not otherwise aware, that any of the deliverables and the use thereof by the Bank and authorized users in accordance with this Agreement as contemplated hereunder, infringes or misappropriates, or would infringe or misappropriate the patent, copyright, trademark, trade secret or other Intellectual Property Rights of any third party;  and (iii) the Services performed by the Service Provider hereunder shall be of professional quality, consistent with generally accepted industry standards for the work of a similar nature.
It shall ensure that services provided under each Work Order will substantially conform to the agreed functional and technical specifications as is set out in the Work Oder and any other such agreed specificationsIt shall ensure that all Services provided to the Bank will not infringe or misappropriate any Intellectual Property rights of any Third Party. 
The Bank  agrees that the Service Provider shall not be liable for any claims of infringement arising from (a) combination of the Deliverable with any hardware, software, data, or other materials not provided and approved by the Service Provider; or (b) the Service Provider’s compliance with the Bank’s specifications, information, designs or requirements; or (c) the Bank’s use of Deliverables for purposes other than those specified under applicable SOW(s) or for any illegal purpose; or (d) the Bank’s failure to comply with the Service Provider’s instructions related to Deliverables.
It has no right, title, or interest in any and all Deliverables whether or not registrable under any statute for the time being in force, except otherwise agreed in writing by the Bank. 
It shall ensure that the resources deployed for rendering services are adequately trained for the required tasks as per the Work Order and any specific training requirements that Bank may require. The Service Provider shall develop and establish a robust framework for documenting, maintaining and testing business continuity and recovery procedures . The Service Provider shall periodically test the business continuity and recovery plan and shall occasionally conduct a joint testing and recovery exercises with the Bank.
4.2  The Service Provider agrees to be vigilant and to report all violations of information security and all suspected security events immediately to concerned teams in the Bank.
The Service Provider further represents, undertakes and agrees that it shall ensure (1) to comply with the provisions of Information Technology Act and the rules framed thereunder including Information Technology (Reasonable security practices and procedures and sensitive personal data or information) Rules, 2011; (b) to monitor the security practices, control processes and checks in respect of the confidential information on a regular basis; (c) to comply with the acceptable usage policy and any other policies as may be informed in writing to the Service Provider by the Bank from time to time, and ( d ) to disclose any breaches in the security practices, control processes and checks without undue delay to concerned employee of the Bank
4.3 The Service Provider represents and warrants that it will provide an integrity certificate from the original equipment manufacturer (OEM) that the OEM has all the necessary legitimate rights, licenses and/or authorization as regards software, Source Code, tools, techniques, used by it relating to the Services rendered under this agreement and for providing the Services and safe guarding the Confidential Information on a periodic basis and as requested by the Bank. 
4.4 The Service Provider agrees that as and when Service Provider is undertaking any incident management testing  internally or externally through any person/Agency/process/service/technology associated with the Bank,  the Service Provider shall inform the Bank and with prior consultation and approval of the Bank, the testing/demonstration shall be carried out by the Service Provider at least once a year or as and when  required by the Bank, any Statutory Body, Regulatory Body as the case may be. Such testing/demonstration of incident management should include, but not limited to, reporting and detecting security incidents involving the networks, systems and/or application used to provide services under the Purchase Order raised from time to time, processes and procedures for assessing the severity of the incident, identifying the cause of incident, redressing the cause to avoid future incidents, restoring normal operations and documenting the results of response post implementation of the redressal actions. Bank should be provided requisite details by the Service Provider within Seven working days from the date of conducting the test/demonstration.
4.5 Except As Otherwise Stated In This Clause, The Service Provider Makes No Warranties Of Any Kind Or Nature, Whether Express Or Implied, Including, But Not Limited To, Warranties Of Merchantability Or Fitness For A Particular Purpose Or Use, Or Warranties Of Any Deliverables Or Services, Or The Appropriateness Of The Bank’s Or Any Third-Party Specifications. In Addition, The Service Provider Expressly Disclaims Any Warranty Or Liability With Respect To Design Or Latent Defects, Security Of Data, Or Compliance With Laws, Regulations, Or Other Official Government Releases Applicable To The Bank, Which Shall Be The Sole Responsibility Of The Bank.
differences.revised:
The Service Provider shall itself perform its obligations under this Agreement and shall not assign, transfer, or sub-contract any of its rights and obligations in relation to all or part of the Services or related thereto. The Service Provider shall appoint sub-contractors and/or assign or transfer any of the rights and obligations under this Agreement with prior written consent of the Bank. The Service Provider shall at all times remain responsible and liable to the Bank for all the actions of the agents, sub-agents/sub-contractors, assignee, or transferee, as the case may be, with no dilution or diminution of service, controls, penalties, etc.
Notwithstanding anything contrary contained in the terms of this Agreement, Service Provider shall ensure that such agents, sub-agent, sub-contractor, assignee or transferee etc. shall be bound by the terms of this Agreement. For the purpose of this clause and notwithstanding any such written consent being given by the Bank, the Service Provider shall remain liable for the acts and omissions of any delegate it has delegated its activities to i.e. sub agent, sub-contractor, agent etc. If such delegation is as a result of operation of any laws, then Bank shall have an option on such delegation to immediately terminate this Agreement at its discretion. The Service Provider shall be responsible and liable for the performance and risk management practices of its sub-contractors. 
The Bank shall be entitled to assign/transfer part/ all of its rights and benefits under this Agreement/this Agreement to any Person or entity without any prior notice or intimation to the Service Provider. However, the Service Provider shall not transfer or assign this Agreement and/or any obligations or rights under this Agreement to any third party without prior written consent of the Bank.
BUSINESS CONTINUITY PLAN (“BCP”)
The Service Provider hereby confirms that it has developed and established a robust framework for documenting, maintaining and testing business continuity and recovery procedures and the same are tested periodically and agrees to test such business continuity and recovery plan jointly with the Bank and shall ensure that the Service to the Bank would not be adversely affected in any manner on account of any factors including system breakdowns which may cause disruption in the normal functions of the Service Provider.
The Service Provider hereby agrees and understands that Services to be performed under this Agreement shall continue to be offered under ordinary circumstances. In the event of any difficulty in performing the required Services, Service Provider shall make best efforts to make alternative arrangements to ensure that the required Services are continued to be performed.
The Service Provider shall review and test its BCP on an annual basis and notify the Bank of any substantial changes to its BCP. The test shall validate the functionality and effectiveness of the BCP, including but not limited to the feasibility of the recovery time objectives, recovery point objectives and resumption operation capacities.
Following each test the Service Provider shall confirm to the Bank the functionality and effectiveness of the BCP. The Service Provider shall promptly notify the Bank of any test findings that may affect the Service Provider’s performance of its Services. The Service Provider shall promptly implement remedial measures or actions to address the test findings, including those required by the Bank.
Upon the Bank’s request, the Service Provider shall participate in the Bank’s business continuity and disaster recovery exercises in respect of the Services to be provided by the Service Provider.
The Service Provider shall, on request, provide copies of results of any independent assessments of such Business Continuity Plan to the Bank.

clauses.original_text:
5.1 The Service Provider hereby agrees, undertakes, and confirms as under:
The Service Provider shall, always, maintain and respect, and shall also procure its Employees and Qualified Personnel to maintain and respect, strict confidentiality of Confidential Information including all/any matters relating to the Services, Deliverables, and this Agreement. 
Without prior written permission of the Bank, the Service Provider and its Employee and Qualified Personnel shall not at any time use the name and/or trademark/logo of the Bank in any manner and for any purpose whatsoever.
The Services to be rendered and the Service Provider’s obligations to be performed pursuant to this Agreement shall be rendered and performed by the Service Provider, with utmost care and diligence and shall be of the highest quality and standards. If at any time the Bank is dissatisfied with the Services rendered by the Service Provider, the Bank shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement, provided that Service Provider is provided a cure period of 30 days. The Bank’s decision in this regard shall be final, absolute and binding on the Service Provider.
Any information handed over by the Bank to the Service Provider and/or its Employee or Qualified Personnel in terms of this Agreement or which comes into the hands of the Service Provider and/or its Employee or Qualified Personnel’s custody, power or possession pursuant to or in connection with this Agreement will remain the sole and absolute property of the Bank, and the Service Provider and /or its Employee or Qualified Personnel shall not have and also shall not claim any charge, claim, lien, right of retention, sale or set-off or other right, title or interest therein or thereon for any reason whatsoever. The Service Provider and/or its Employee or Qualified Personnel, shall not at any time use or attempt to use Bank’s logo/trademark or letterheads for any purpose whatsoever.
The Service Provider shall at all times be responsible for conducting periodic background verification checks on its Employee and Qualified Personnel and ensure that the Employee and Qualified Personnel deployed at the Bank’s facilities and/or its own premises shall have no adverse track record including any criminal complaints/ convictions. Service Provider shall promptly inform the Bank if it has any such knowledge of criminal complaints / convictions after deployment of its Employee and Qualified Personnel at the Bank premises/Project Sites/its own premises and make adequate arrangements for substitution of such Employee and Qualified Personnel. he Service Provider shall always be liable for all the actions of its Employee or Qualified Personnel and shall indemnify the Bank against all actions of its Employee and Qualified Personnel
Service Provider agrees to maintain its books and records reasonably relating to the services performed and invoices issued pursuant to this Agreement for a period of Five (5) years following the end of the calendar year in which the work was performed, and during that time and/or  may be required under Applicable Law whichever is higher , the Bank shall be entitled to access all books, records and information relevant to the Services available with the Service Provider. Upon request from the Bank, the Service Provider shall within 2 (two) business days of such request provide to the Bank access to all the books, records and information in connection with Services.
The Bank shall have a right, but not the obligation, to continuous monitor and assess the Services to be provided by the Service Provider under this Agreement and suggest corrective measures, if any, required to can be taken by the Service Provider.The Service Provider sall not without prior approval/consent of the Bank, use any sub-contractor for undertaking all or part of the Services.
The Bank and its authorized representatives shall have a right to periodically conduct audits on the Service Provider whether by its internal or external auditors, or by agents that are not the competitors of the Service Provider in conjunction with the services performed for the Bank with a prior written notice of ten(10) days. Such audit shall not disturb the normal business hours  of the Service Provider, such audit will exclude internal financial data, other customer data of the Service Provider. Incase of any surprise audit if insisted by any statutory/RBI authorities, the same shall be  provided by the Service Provider. 
Upon request by the Bank, the Service Provider shall allow RBI or persons authorized by it to access Bank’s documents, records of transactions, and other necessary information given to, stored or processed by the Service Provider within a reasonable time.
The Service Providers recognizes the right of RBI to cause an inspection to be made of a Service Provider and its books and account by one or more of its officers or employees or other persons.
The Service Provider shall preserve all the documents and data pertaining to the Services in accordance with the legal/regulatory obligation of the Bank in this regard.
The Service provider shall maintain at its cost worker’s compensation insurance coverage, commercial liability insurance coverage, medical insurance coverage, insurance coverage against physical loss or damage to Service provider’s equipment.
(l ) The Service Provider shall depute Qualified Personnel for the purpose of this agreement and the Service Provider shall ensure that Service Provider’s Employees and Qualified Personnel shall strictly adhere to their norms as required to fulfil the roles and responsibilities assigned to them to the satisfaction of the Bank. It is the sole responsibility of the Service Provider to ensure the safety of its staff and to follow the security norms, while they are performing their duties in the premises of the Bank and the Bank shall never be held responsible for any breach of terms, negligence occurred during its performance under this agreement. 
(m) In case the Services provided by Service provider’s Employees/Qualified Personnel are found not to be satisfactory, in such case the Bank shall inform the same to the Service Provider in writing specifying the reason and requesting to replace the employee or sub-contractor and the Service provider shall within 30 days  or any other period as may be mutually agreed, replace the existing staff with new qualified/experience staff.
(n) Unless otherwise specified in the Work Order, in the event any of Service Provider’s resource remain absent for  consecutive days in a month without the ervice rovider providing the Bank with an alternate resource of the same skillsets/competence and qualification in such cases, Bank  reserves its right to recover compensation @ pro-rata basis per day from the service provider as per the cost of implementation agreed as part of the proposal & SOW/Work Order for each day on which the resource is absent. Service Provider is also liable for all the commission/omission for the acts of the Qualified Personnel of service provider. 
The Service Provider shall provide access to Confidential Information of the Bank only to such Service Provider’s Employees who have executed a Non-Disclosure Agreement and further such access shall only be provided on 'need to know' basis i.e., limited to those areas where the information is required in order to perform the Services.
(p) To extent the Service Provider has any access to Bank’s information, the Service Provider shall isolate and clearly identify the Bank’s customer information, documents, records and assets to protect the confidentiality of the information. In instances, where Service Provider acts as an outsourcing agent for multiple banks, non banking financing services and financial institutions, maximum care shall be taken by it to build robust safeguards so that there is no intermingling of information/documents, records and assets.
If applicable and there are any Services provided on Service Provider’s environment, the Bank shall have a right to review and monitor the security practices and control processes of the Service Provider on a regular basis and require the Service Provider to disclose security breaches. The Service Provider shall provide Services in compliance with the Applicable laws and rules made thereunder, as amended, modified or substituted from time to time. 
(q) In the event that the Service Provider does not deliver the Services as per the specified time schedule due to default on its part, the Bank shall be entitled to procure the Services required under the Work Order from a Third Party without any cost to Service Provider.
(r) In the event that the Service Provider has knowledge or reasonable belief that anything prevents or is likely to prevent or threatens to prevent the timely performance of the Services or other obligations of Service Provider under this Agreement, it shall promptly notify the Bank of such an event or probable event.  The Bank shall in its sole discretion grant Service Provider a reasonable extension of time, if so requested by the Service Provider to complete additional or changed work in the event that Bank’s requirements materially change. 
(s) Service Provider shall for each Work Order designate a project manager, who will be principally responsible for coordinating and monitoring the performance of the Work Order.  Any change in the project manager shall be forthwith intimated to the Bank.  Upon such intimation, all communications would be made with such new project manager. 
(t) Service Provider shall assign and maintain qualified and trained software professionals or other professionals of high calibre to work on the Bank’s assigned projects on project need basis. If, for any reason, any individual is no longer available, or in the opinion of the Bank any individual / personnel assigned needs to be replaced, the service provider will be given a thirty days’ notice (30) to replace such individual/professional.  Service Provider will use reasonable endeavours to replace such  individual promptly by another person of equal competence within a mutually  agreed time frame. Service Provider will however, use reasonable endeavours to minimize changes in the Qualified Personnel to discharge Service Provider's obligations.
(u) Service Provider agrees that the Services and Deliverables shall meet the service level requirements as per the respective service level standards set out in the corresponding Work Order.
(v) All Services and Deliverables shall be rendered/delivered in accordance with the time schedule specified in the Work Order,  except to the extent delays are caused by Bank or any other factors including but not limited to Bank’s  delays providing any approvals, inputs, confirmations, information, force majeure event or any other reasons not attributable to Service Provider
A delay by Service Provider in the performance of Services or delivery of Deliverables to the satisfaction of the Bank due to reasons solely and directly attributable to Service Provider or its Qualified Personnel shall render Service Provider liable to imposition of liquidated damages as identified in the Work Order. This clause will be applicable only if liquidated damages are specifically identified in the Work Order. In any event, unless otherwise agreed in the Work Order, liquidated damages shall not exceed 5% of Work order value during one (1) year. The Service Provider shall comply with procedures to deal with deficiencies in compliance with the obligations undertaken under this Agreement as note by auditors, government regulators, and other internal or external agencies and provide relevant solutions, within the time frame notified and mutually discussed by with the Bank at no additional cost to the Bank. 
The Service Provider represents that the documentation shall contain a description of all the Deliverables and other materials and services (as applicable), shall be prepared and maintained in accordance with the applicable industry standards.
Service Provider shall not hold the Bank responsible for any judgements made by the Service Provider for arriving at any type of sizing or costing for any Work Order under this AgreementService Provider further agrees and recognizes that:The Bank shall control the authorization and access to Bank’s information, including access rights granted to the Service Provider’s Qualified Personnel;
The Service Provider ensure that the Qualified Personnel shall adhere to the Information Security Policy adopted by the Bank from time to time;
Service Provider is fully compliant (and undertakes and agrees to remain compliant) with the provisions of the Sexual Harassment of Women at the Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act, 2013 and the rules thereunder (as may be amended from time to time) and Service Provider shall extend this obligation to all its Qualified Personnel or individuals engaged for fulfilling the Services under this Agreement, and to that extent, shall enter into appropriate legally binding agreements with each such Qualified Personnel
in the performance of this Agreement, Service Provider and its respective director(s), officers(s), agents(s), employees(s), or any other persons(s) acting for or on behalf of the foregoing will comply strictly with all applicable anti-corruption laws and regulations. 
All terms and conditions, payment schedules, time frame for implementation and rendering Services and delivering Deliverables, expected service levels, etc. will remain unchanged unless explicitly communicated executed as an amendment by the Bank and the Service Provider in writing to the Service Provider. The Bank shall not be responsible for any judgements made by the Service Provider in respect to any aspect of the Services that are not documented in this Agreement..
The Bank reserves the right to interview any and all the Qualified Personnel to be deployed by the Service Provider on the Project Sites or onsite-long term projects and select then accordingly. 
Service Provider shall comply with its obligations under all applicable data protection laws in respect of the Services to be provided to the Bank under this Agreement. Service Provider agrees in respect of any such production data supplied to it by the Bank that it shall: (a) only act on instructions from the Bank regarding the processing of such data under this Agreement and shall ensure that appropriate technical and organizational measures shall be taken against unauthorized or unlawful processing of the data and against accidental loss or destruction of, or damage to, the data; and (b) comply with any reasonable request made by the Bank to ensure compliance with the measures contained in this clause.
.
If the issue/complaint received from the customer is of major/critical nature, the Service Provider shall solve the said issue on priority basis without causing any delay. However, if the Service Provider is not able to solve the complaint/issue immediately, in such case the same should be informed to the Bank and its customer and should ensure to solve within 7 days from the date of receipt of the complaint.
If the complaint received from the customer is not major but feels that the same may consume some time, in such case the Service Provider shall ensure to solve the complaint within 15 days from the date of receipt of the complaint and the Service Provider shall inform the same to the Bank and its customer via mail within 3 working days from the date of receipt of the complaint.
In case the customers of the Bank approaches the service provider directly for any issues pertaining to the services of the Service Provider, the Service Provider shall extend all its support and co-operation in this regard and ensures to solve the problem within the time limit as mentioned in the foregoing parasThe Service Provider shall inform/update the Bank in writing about the complaints received from Bank's customers and the solution provided by the Service Provider. The information shall contain, name of the customer, date of receipt of complaint, nature of complaint, time taken for solving (TAT), resolving date, status of the complaint etc. and the Service Provider shall submit the statement to the Bank on weekly basis via email id viz. -------- without fail.
Service Provider shall ensure to render services to the satisfaction of Bank's customer and in case the Bank's customer is not satisfied with the services rendered by the Service Provider, the Service Provider shall exclusively responsible for its acts and the Bank shall not be held responsible for whatsoever reasons for the acts of the Service Provider
