Service Provider is fully compliant (and undertakes and agrees to remain compliant) with the provisions of the Sexual Harassment of Women at the Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act, 2013 and the rules thereunder (as may be amended from time to time) and Service Provider shall extend this obligation to all its Qualified Personnel or individuals engaged for fulfilling the Services under this Agreement, and to that extent, shall enter into appropriate legally binding agreements with each such Qualified Personnel
in the performance of this Agreement, Service Provider and its respective director(s), officers(s), agents(s), employees(s), or any other persons(s) acting for or on behalf of the foregoing will comply strictly with all applicable anti-corruption laws and regulations. 
All terms and conditions, payment schedules, time frame for implementation and rendering Services and delivering Deliverables, expected service levels, etc. will remain unchanged unless explicitly communicated executed as an amendment by the Bank and the Service Provider in writing to the Service Provider. The Bank shall not be responsible for any judgements made by the Service Provider in respect to any aspect of the Services that are not documented in this Agreement..
The Bank reserves the right to interview any and all the Qualified Personnel to be deployed by the Service Provider on the Project Sites or onsite-long term projects and select then accordingly. 
Service Provider shall comply with its obligations under all applicable data protection laws in respect of the Services to be provided to the Bank under this Agreement. Service Provider agrees in respect of any such production data supplied to it by the Bank that it shall: (a) only act on instructions from the Bank regarding the processing of such data under this Agreement and shall ensure that appropriate technical and organizational measures shall be taken against unauthorized or unlawful processing of the data and against accidental loss or destruction of, or damage to, the data; and (b) comply with any reasonable request made by the Bank to ensure compliance with the measures contained in this clause.
In case the Bank notices any defects in the services or products delivered by the Service Provider, the Service Provider agrees and covenants to rectify the defects referred by the Bank directly from its end and the Service Provider shall inform the grievance and its solution to the Bank within 3 working days from the date of receipt of the complaint. The Service Provider shall render all type of support/services to Bank free of cost without raising any objection and ensures to rectify the errors/defects within above mentioned prescribed time.
If the issue/complaint received from the customer is of major/critical nature, the Service Provider shall solve the said issue on priority basis without causing any delay. However, if the Service Provider is not able to solve the complaint/issue immediately, in such case the same should be informed to the Bank and its customer and should ensure to solve within 7 days from the date of receipt of the complaint.
If the complaint received from the customer is not major but feels that the same may consume some time, in such case the Service Provider shall ensure to solve the complaint within 15 days from the date of receipt of the complaint and the Service Provider shall inform the same to the Bank and its customer via mail within 3 working days from the date of receipt of the complaint.
In case the customers of the Bank approaches the service provider directly for any issues pertaining to the services of the Service Provider, the Service Provider shall extend all its support and co-operation in this regard and ensures to solve the problem within the time limit as mentioned in the foregoing parasThe Service Provider shall inform/update the Bank in writing about the complaints received from Bank's customers and the solution provided by the Service Provider. The information shall contain, name of the customer, date of receipt of complaint, nature of complaint, time taken for solving (TAT), resolving date, status of the complaint etc. and the Service Provider shall submit the statement to the Bank on weekly basis via email id viz. -------- without fail.
Service Provider shall ensure to render services to the satisfaction of Bank's customer and in case the Bank's customer is not satisfied with the services rendered by the Service Provider, the Service Provider shall exclusively responsible for its acts and the Bank shall not be held responsible for whatsoever reasons for the acts of the Service Provider

clauses.original_text:
7.1 Charges/ Fees shall remain valid for the period specified in the corresponding Work Order.. Charges/ Fees exclude applicable GST and Bank shall pay to the Service Provider the applicable GST at prevailing rate.
7.2 Service Provider will raise valid and correct invoice on the Bank for the Services and or Deliverables. The Bank will pay the invoices with thirty (30) days from the date of receipt of the Invoice unless otherwise specified in the corresponding Work Order. The Bank will raise an objection/dispute relating to the Invoice, if any, within 5 days of receipt of the Invoice. However, Bank shall clear the undisputed amount within the agreed period of 30 days. Upon settlement of disputes with respect to any disputed invoices(s), Bank will make payment within 30 days of the settlement of the dispute.
7.3 The Service Provider understands and acknowledges that no payment other than the payments as per the agreed payment terms under this Agreement or Work Order shall be made by the Bank to the Service Provider.
All payments to Service Provider shall be subject to the deduction of applicable taxes at source and all payments shall be subject to the receipt of a valid and correct invoice from Service Provider. The Parties agree and acknowledge to comply with the GST requirements as set out hereinafter. 
In addition to other remedies available to the Service Provider, in case of non-payment of undisputed Fees by the Bank under this Agreement, the Service Provider shall be relieved of its obligations under this Agreement and shall have the right to suspend provision of Services until receipt of payment from the Bank. A continued breach of this obligation to pay the Fees under this Agreement beyond a period of forty-five (45) days shall constitute a material breach under this Agreement, for which, the Service Provider shall have the right to terminate this Agreement. 
Goods and Service Tax:
All Fees or charges payable by the Bank under this Agreement shall be exclusive of GST (unless Service Provider has opted for the composition scheme in which case the Fees or charges will be inclusive of GST). Further, for the purposes of this Agreement, GST shall include the Central Goods and Services Tax (‘CGST’), the State Goods and Services Tax (‘SGST’)/ Union Territories Goods and Service Tax (‘UTGST’) and/or the Integrated Goods and Services Tax (‘IGST’) as may be applicable.
In due compliance of its obligations, Service Provider shall remit the GST so charged (if any) from Bank, subject to a valid invoice/ debit note, to the appropriate government authority and file GST returns as prescribed, within the statutory timelines, mentioning all appropriate and relevant information on the GSTN platform, which enables Bank to claim timely credit (i.e., in its GST return for the month in which the invoice/ debit note is raised on Bank) of GST in the appropriate GST registration. In the event the credit of GST is not granted or denied to the Bank under its appropriate GST registration under applicable laws for non-payment of taxes charged to the Bank or on account of any non-compliance (including but not limited to non-filing of information, non-filing of returns, non-payment of appropriate GST to appropriate government/incorrect submission of information on the GSTN platform), then Service Provider shall rectify the said non-compliances/errors to ensure that Bank gets the credit in the subsequent month. In the event, the non-compliance/ error is not rectified by Service Provider as above, then the Bank shall have the right to set off such shortfall against the subsequent payments of the Fees or charges to Service Provider or recover the amount of GST charged to it along with the interest, penalty and/or any other cost from Service Provider. If Service Provider’s compliance rating falls below the prescribed limit, tax charged by Service Provider in the invoice would be paid by the Bank only after the credit is reflected on GSTN platform.
a(iii) The billing would be done at the end of the month. The payment of the fees by the Bank to the Service Provider shall be subject to deduction of applicable taxes under the Income Tax Act, 1961 or other applicable laws including GST, as applicable from time to time. The Bank will ensure that the payment is made to Service Provider within 14 days from   the date of invoice raised by Service Provider. In the invoice raised, Service provider shall specify details such as amount of monthly Fee; amount of GST tax if applicable; all shown separately; GST tax registration number; GST tax assesse code; category of taxable service if any and Service Provider  shall forward the invoice to the Bank on the intimated address and the Bank shall pay the said amount due only against the said invoice. Service Provider hereby undertakes to comply with timely uploading of invoice details in the GSTIN for the services provided to the Bank.
a(iv) If any advance payment is to be made by Service Provider, such advance payment will be made on the condition that Service Provider issues an advance receipt voucher quoting the GSTIN of the Bank and any other details as required by applicable laws within three (3) days of receipt of such advance payment. The Bank shall communicate and intimate to Service Provider, the details of invoices against which adjustment of advances paid by the Bank should be made.
a(v) If the Bank has already paid the Fees or charges and there is a decrease in such Fees or charges, then Service Provider will issue to the Bank a credit note for the differential amount. The credit note should be issued in accordance with applicable laws.
a(vi) If there is an increase in the Fee or charges due to provision of additional services/goods, then Service Provider will issue to the Bank a debit note for the differential amount. The debit note should be issued in accordance with applicable laws. 
a(vii) All invoices, credit notes and debit notes issued by Service Provider must set out the various taxes that are charged including but not limited to the GST. All invoices, debit notes and credit notes must be issued in accordance with the applicable laws and should be sent to the Bank within seven (7) days of its issue. If any invoice or debit note does not set out the taxes that are payable with respect to such invoice or debit note, then the Bank will not be required to pay any such taxes and such taxes will be borne by Service Provider.
Service Provider shall nominate a person who will be single point of contact for the Bank for all communication regarding any discrepancy on GSTN reporting by Service Provider.
a(viii) If any tax proceedings are initiated against either Party, in relation to the transaction contemplated under the Agreement, the other Party shall fully co-operate by furnishing all information as available on timely basis as may be required by such Party, including but not limited to confirmation of booking/accrual of expense.
A (ix) As and when there is any change in the GST rules, acts, regulations on input credit (which are available in public domain as on date of signing this Agreement), the Parties shall discuss the provisions relating to the same and may enter into a further amendment, if required, to address each other’s concerns in relation to such compliance.

clauses.original_text:
11.2.1 Either Party shall have a right to terminate this Agreement in the following events:
A Party commits a breach of any of its obligations set forth in this Agreement or in corresponding Work Order; and
(i) such breach is not cured within seven 30 days (unless otherwise agreed in corresponding Work Order) of receipt of written notice for cure;
(ii) such breach is not cured within mutually agreed timelines, if such breach is not of the type that could be cured within seven 30 business days. 
The Bank may terminate this Agreement or Work Order under the Agreement at any point of time without any cause after giving 30 days’ written notice to the Service Provider. In such event without prejudice to the rights of the Parties, upon termination of this Agreement, Bank shall pay to the Service Provider, within 30 (thirty) days of such termination all invoices outstanding till the effective date of termination; and will also pay in respect of Services rendered and Deliverables delivered to the effective date of termination.
Either Party shall have the immediate right to terminate this Agreement and or any Work Order upon written notice to the Service Provider in the event (i) that such Service Provider ceases to be in operations or ceases to do business in India, or (ii) the Services or any part thereof are not capable of being applied/ implemented/ rendered by the Bank pursuant to the Applicable Law.
If because of Force Majeure Event, the Service Providers is unable to render the Services for a continuous period of 30 (Thirty) days, either Party shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement and or corresponding Work Order immediately on completion of the 30 days period by written intimation to the other Party.
This Agreement shall deemed to have been terminated by the Parties with 15 days prior notice to the happening of the following events of default:
Either Party becomes unable to pay its debt as they fall due or otherwise enters into any compromise or arrangement with or for the benefit of its creditors or any class thereof or;
A liquidator or a receiver is appointed over all or a substantial part of the undertaking, assets or revenues of the dissolving Party
The dissolving Party is subject to an effective resolution for its winding up other than a voluntary winding up for the purpose of reconstruction or amalgamation 
The dissolving Party becomes subject to a court order for dissolution, winding up, or receiver is being appointed in respect of the assets of the dissolving Party which prejudicially affects the Services. 
Upon the termination or expiry of this Agreement:
The rights granted to the Service Provider shall immediately terminate;
Upon the Bank’s request in writing, Service Provider shall be under an obligation to transfer to the Bank or its designatee the Deliverables without any liens, security interest, charge, encumbrances upon receipt of payment for such Deliverables.
On the effective date of termination, Service Provider shall be entitled to receive payments in respect of the services already performed prior to termination.

clauses.original_text:
12.1 Service Provider shall forthwith cease to provide Services to the Bank and withdraw its Qualified Personnel upon the termination of this Agreement.  
12.2  Service Provider shall forthwith deliver to the Bank any and all Confidential Information including all copies thereof irrespective of storage or presentation medium, including all electronic and hard copies thereof, and any other material containing or disclosing any Confidential Information and shall erase from all of its computers and storage devices any electronically stored Confidential Information.
In the event of the termination of this Agreement for the default of the Service Provider, the Bank shall be entitled to procure similar services from a Third Party, at the risk, cost and consequences of Service Provider.
It is clarified that the specific inclusion of the above remedies in this Agreement does not preclude, bar, restrict or in any manner limit the availability of other remedies to the Bank available in the Applicable Law.
12.5 Service Provider shall provide to Bank and/or successor Service Provider assistance requested by Bank to effect the orderly transition of the Services, in whole or in part, to Bank or to successor Service Provider at no additional cost to the Bank. During the transition period, Bank and or successor Service Provider shall be provided access to the Bank’s data and information without alteration. There will be mutually agreeable transition costs payable by Bank to Service Provider and Service Provider shall duly perform the plan provided by Bank for the orderly transition of the terminated services from Service Provider to successor Service Provider; transfer the Bank Data to successor Service Provider; This Section shall survive the termination of this Agreement for a fixed period of time.

clauses.original_text:
13.1 Service Provider agrees that it shall at all times maintain and keep secret and privileged the Confidential Information and ensure that all the data provided under this Agreement is prevented and take utmost care and measures to prevent the data leakage. Service provider shall not disclose or divulge the same or any part thereof to any Third Party without the prior written consent of the Bank in that behalf.
Service Provider agrees to use the Confidential Information only for the purposes of this Agreement or otherwise as expressly permitted by this Agreement. 
Service Provider agrees not to make copies of any such Confidential Information or any part thereof except for the purpose of this Agreement.
Service Provider shall disclose the Confidential Information to only such employees to whom such disclosure is necessary for the performance of the obligations contained herein on a “need to know basis”.
If Service Provider is directed by court order, subpoena or other legal or regulatory request or similar process to disclose information recorded on any documents or any of the Confidential Information, Service Provider shall immediately notify Bank in writing, in sufficient details immediately upon receipt of such order, subpoena, legal or regulatory request or similar process, in order to permit Service Provider to make an application for an appropriate protection order.  A copy of the court order shall accompany such notice, subpoena, legal or regulatory request or similar process.
The Service Provider shall enter into a Non-Disclosure Agreement with any Third Party to whom it discloses or needs to disclose any Confidential Information.
The Service Provider’s obligations under this Agreement shall apply to the Bank mutatis mutandis with regards to any confidential information disclosed by Service Provider to the Bank.

clauses.original_text:
Neither Party shall be liable for any failure to perform any of its obligations) under this Agreement if the performance is prevented, hindered or delayed by a Force Majeure Event including but not restricted to pandemics, epidemics and lockdowns and in such case its obligations shall be suspended for so long as the Force Majeure Event continues. Each Party shall promptly inform the other of the existence of a Force Majeure Event and shall consult together to find a mutually acceptable solution. The Party claiming a Force Majeure Event shall in all instances and to the extent it is capable of doing so, use its best efforts to remove or remedy the cause thereof and minimize the economic damage arising therefrom.
However, the performance of the Party’s obligation which is restricted due to an Event of Force Majeure shall be temporarily suspended for the period during which the condition prevails. However, suspended performance of the Party’s obligation shall be without prejudice to any of its other obligations under this Agreement t. Should the Force Majeure Event extend beyond thirty (30) consecutive days either Party shall have the right to terminate the Agreement  or applicable Work Order subject to payment made by the Bank for the services delivered prior to such force majeure event. upon immediate written notice without any penalty.

clauses.original_text:
16.2.1 The Parties therefore agree that they will, at all times, act in good faith, and make all attempts to resolve all differences howsoever arising out of or in connection with this Agreement by discussion failing which, by arbitration. The Parties agree that the discussions shall be held in the spirit of resolution of the issues that have arisen between them with the intention of resolving the issues amicably at the earliest.  If the applicant is not satisfied with the outcome of the discussions, within fifteen (15) days from the receipt of the response, it shall resort to arbitration.
16.2.2 The Parties agree that in the event the Parties fail to resolve the dispute through the process detailed in clause 16.2.1 hereinabove, the dispute shall be referred to the arbitration before a single arbitrator appointed mutually by both the parties, all of the above in accordance with the rules of arbitration of the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996. The Arbitration proceedings shall be conducted in English language. The seat of arbitration will be at Mumbai, India and the arbitration will be subject to and be governed by the provisions of the Arbitration and Conciliation Act 1996 or any statutory amendment or re-enactment thereof, for the time being in force.  The decision of such arbitration shall be binding and conclusive upon the parties and may be enforced in any court of competent jurisdiction. The Parties to the arbitration shall equally share the costs and expenses of any such arbitration. Nothing in this paragraph shall prevent the parties from seeking injunctive relief from a Court of Law.

clauses.original_text:
16.10.1 It is expressly agreed by the Parties hereto that the provisions of Clauses 4,5,7.3,8,9,10, 11, 12,13,16.1,16.2,16.3, 16.4, 16.7, 16.8, 16.10,16.11,16.12, 16.13,16.14,16.18,16.20 and 16.21  shall survive the expiry or termination of this Agreement.
16.11 AUDITS. 
16.11.1 Audit and Inspection of Records. Service Provider agrees to maintain and make available to the Bank, during regular business hours, accurate books, accounting records relating to its work under this Agreement. Service Provider will permit Bank to audit, once in a year during the term, the hosting facility and systems. 
16.11.2 Audit of Service Provider’s Policies. Service Provider agrees to make available to Bank Service Provider’s policies, procedures and practices regarding Data Security if needed, and agrees that Bank reserves the rights, including but not limited to a site visit, scanning for malicious codes, and hiring a third party to perform security audit.
16.11.3 Information Security Audits. The Service Provider must contract with a third -party to perform a yearly Information Security Audits of their primary and backup data center. All findings must be remedied. Included must be an outside penetration/vulnerability test as well as putting the third party directly on the internal network for the third- party to provide internal penetration and vulnerability tests. 
16.11.4 The summary results of the audits must be shared with the Bank and if any  Auditor/s either internal or external including RBI raise any audit query pertaining to this Agreement, the same shall  be resolved/closed  by the Service Provider within 60 days or as specified by the Auditors from the date of  referring of such audit point to the Service Provider and ensure that the Audit point is  complied/closed within the prescribed time limit of 60 days without causing any further delay. If the Service Provider fails to comply with the audit point and/or close the audit point raised, Service provider shall be solely liable for non-compliance of the same with such non-conformities leading to penalty or termination of services. Service Provider indemnifies the Bank against any loss/damage incurred/to be incurred due to non-compliance of audit points raised by the Auditors and the Bank shall reserve it right to terminate the contract for non-fulfillment of its commitment. 
16.11.5Audit Findings. Service Provider shall implement reasonably required safeguards as identified by Bank or by any audit of Service Provider’s data privacy and information security program. 
16.12 ENTIRE AGREEMENT. 
16.12.1     This Agreement sets forth the entire Agreement between the Parties, and supersedesall other oral or written provisions.

matching_standard_clause.title: 16.10 SURVIVAL
matching_standard_clause.text:
16.10.1 It is expressly agreed by the Parties hereto that the provisions of Clauses 4,5,7.3,8,9,10, 11, 12,13,16.1,16.2,16.3, 16.4, 16.7, 16.8, 16.10,16.11,16.12, 16.13,16.14,16.18,16.20 and 16.21  shall survive the expiry or termination of this Agreement.
16.11 AUDITS. 
16.11.1 Audit and Inspection of Records. Service Provider agrees to maintain and make available to the Bank, during regular business hours, accurate books, accounting records relating to its work under this Agreement. Service Provider will permit Bank to audit, once in a year during the term, the hosting facility and systems. 
16.11.2 Audit of Service Provider’s Policies. Service Provider agrees to make available to Bank Service Provider’s policies, procedures and practices regarding Data Security if needed, and agrees that Bank reserves the rights, including but not limited to a site visit, scanning for malicious codes, and hiring a third party to perform security audit.
16.11.3 Information Security Audits. The Service Provider must contract with a third -party to perform a yearly Information Security Audits of their primary and backup data center. All findings must be remedied. Included must be an outside penetration/vulnerability test as well as putting the third party directly on the internal network for the third- party to provide internal penetration and vulnerability tests. 
16.11.4 The summary results of the audits must be shared with the Bank and if any  Auditor/s either internal or external including RBI raise any audit query pertaining to this Agreement, the same shall  be resolved/closed  by the Service Provider within 60 days or as specified by the Auditors from the date of  referring of such audit point to the Service Provider and ensure that the Audit point is  complied/closed within the prescribed time limit of 60 days without causing any further delay. If the Service Provider fails to comply with the audit point and/or close the audit point raised, Service provider shall be solely liable for non-compliance of the same with such non-conformities leading to penalty or termination of services. Service Provider indemnifies the Bank against any loss/damage incurred/to be incurred due to non-compliance of audit points raised by the Auditors and the Bank shall reserve it right to terminate the contract for non-fulfillment of its commitment. 
16.11.5Audit Findings. Service Provider shall implement reasonably required safeguards as identified by Bank or by any audit of Service Provider’s data privacy and information security program. 
16.12 ENTIRE AGREEMENT. 
16.12.1     This Agreement sets forth the entire Agreement between the Parties, and supersedesall other oral or written provisions.

clauses.original_text:
The Company and the Service Provider are, and at all times shall be, independent contractors in all matters relating to this Agreement. Neither this Agreement nor the cooperation of the Parties contemplated under this Agreement, shall be deemed or construed to create any partnership, joint venture and employer-employee or agency relationship between them.  Neither Party is, nor will either Party hold itself out to be, vested with any power or right to bind the other Party contractually or act on behalf of the other Party as a broker, agent or otherwise. The Service Provider agrees that Bank has engaged the Service Provider solely for the purposes and to the extent set forth in this Agreement and the Service Provider shall not be considered, under the provision of this Agreement  or otherwise, as having the status of a partner or agent of Bank or being entitled to share in any of the benefits to which Bank  may derive from the commercial exploitation of the Services and Deliverables.
Service Provider’s status with reference to the Bank is that of independent contractor, and Bank shall not be responsible to Service Provider or anyone engaged by Service Provider for any money or materials whatsoever except as specifically set forth in this Agreement. Bank shall not be held responsible or liable to the Service Provider or to any third person for any expense incurred by the Service Provider unless specifically set forth in this Agreement, nor will Bank be held responsible or liable to the Service Provider or to a third person for or on account of any of the Service Provider’s employees or agents. 
Service Provider shall discharge all obligations of an employer including, but not limited to, withholding and reporting of contributions, insurance deductions and requirements, and applicable taxes required by law and preparing and rendering of all reports required of an employer. All employees engaged by the Service Provider shall be in sole employment of the Service Provider and the Service Provider shall be solely responsible for the personnel engaged by the Service Provider and their salaries wages statutory payments, compliance with all local laws and labour legislations etc. Further, under no circumstances shall Bank be liable for any payment or claim or compensation (including but not limited to compensation on account of injury/death/termination) of any nature to the employees, performers, artist and personnel of the Service Provider or who are engaged during the production services with or without remuneration.
The parties expressly agree that Bank has the right to obtain materials from third parties similar to the material the Service Provider is required to deliver to Bank under the terms of this Agreement at any time and by any means.

clauses.clause_title: 16.19 AGGREGATE LIABILITY OF BANK AND SERVICE PROVIDER
clauses.original_text:
16.19.1 In no event Bank and the Service Provider shall be liable for any indirect, incidental or consequential damages and losses or loss of profit or loss of revenue.
16.19.2 Notwithstanding The Foregoing,  The Bank Agrees That The Service Provider’s Maximum Aggreagte Liability (Whether In Contract, Tort (Including Negligence)) Hereunder For All Direct Damages, Under Or In Connection With This Agreement, Regardless Of The Form Of Action, Shall Not Exceed The Total Amount Paid For Services Under The Applicable Work Order For Preceding Six (6) Months Under Which The Claim Arose. Notwithstanding The Foregoing, No Claim Against The Service Provider May Be Brought More Than One (1) Year After The Facts Giving Rise To Such Claim Have Arisen. The Foregoing Limitation Of Liability And Exclusions Of Damages In This Clause Form An Essential Basis Of This Agreement Between The Parties And Shall Apply Notwithstanding The Failure Of Essential Purpose Of Any Limited Remedy Herein.
16.20 NON-SOLICITATION. 
16.20.1The Parties herein further agree that during the term of the Agreement and for a period of 2 years thereafter Party’s shall not without the express written consent of the other Party, directly or indirectly:
recruit, hire, appoint or engage or attempt to recruit, hire, appoint or engage or discuss employment with or otherwise utilize the services of any Qualified Personnel or any other Person who has been an employee or associate or engaged in any capacity with the other Party (including any of its Affiliates sub-contractors, vendors, etc.) in rendering Services under the  Agreement; or   
induce any Person who shall have been associated with the other Party (including any of its Affiliates sub-contractors, vendors, Qualified Personnel etc.) at any time to terminate his/ her relationship with the other Party.
Circumvent the other Party and engage with any Person associated with the other Party in order to receive Services or Deliverables provided under this Agreement

clauses.original_text:
Any training to be provided to the Bank’s employees and or resources as part of the Services, the same shall be as per the provisions of the Work Order for increasing the efficacy of the staff and for implementation of the project as per the Work Order. The training shall be provided as may be agreed in the scope of work. 
4. SERVICE PROVIDER’S REPRESENTATIONS
4.1 The Service Provider hereby represents, warrants and confirms that:
It has full capacity, power and authority to enter into this Agreement and during the continuance of this Agreement, will continue to have full capacity, power and authority to carry out and perform the Service Provider’s obligations and has already taken and will continue to take all necessary and further actions, (including wherever applicable without limitation obtaining of necessary approvals/consents/licenses as are applicable under Applicable Law).
To its best knowledge, it has the necessary skills, knowledge, experience, expertise, required capital net worth, adequate and competent Service Provider’s Employees, Qualified Personnel, systems, equipment and procedures and capability to duly perform the Service Provider’s obligations in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.
The execution of this Agreement and providing Services and delivering Deliverables hereunder, does not and will not violate any Applicable Law and further, to its best knowledge, will not violate or breach any covenants, stipulations or conditions of any agreements or undertaking entered into by the Service Provider with any other Person.
It shall take all reasonable measures to ensure that information and the mode of transfer (within Service Provider’s area of influence) to and from the Bank’s materials is secure and it shall not use, analyse or access the Bank data traffic or any other data except for the limited purposes necessary for undertaking its contractual obligations as set out herein. The Services will be performed in a competent manner and substantially in accordance with any mutually agreed specifications. 
The Service Provider hereby acknowledges and accepts that the Bank has relied upon the above representations and warranties and have entered into this Agreement.
The Service Provider represents and warrants to the Bank that (i)  prior to delivery of any Deliverable or provision of any Service to the Bank, the Service Provider shall have obtained assignment or license of all right, title and interest in and to such deliverable, to the extent necessary for Service Provider to grant to the Bank the rights and licenses granted hereunder; (ii) the Service Provider has not received any written notice or claim, and is not otherwise aware, that any of the deliverables and the use thereof by the Bank and authorized users in accordance with this Agreement as contemplated hereunder, infringes or misappropriates, or would infringe or misappropriate the patent, copyright, trademark, trade secret or other Intellectual Property Rights of any third party;  and (iii) the Services performed by the Service Provider hereunder shall be of professional quality, consistent with generally accepted industry standards for the work of a similar nature.
It shall ensure that services provided under each Work Order will substantially conform to the agreed functional and technical specifications as is set out in the Work Oder and any other such agreed specificationsIt shall ensure that all Services provided to the Bank will not infringe or misappropriate any Intellectual Property rights of any Third Party.  The Service Provider shall ensure that if such an infringement and/or misappropriation is discovered at a later stage, the same will be governed as per the end user license agreement of original equipment manufacturer (“OEM”) which is embedded at Annexure B hereto (“EULA”).
The Bank  agrees that the Service Provider shall not be liable for any claims of infringement arising from (a) combination of the Deliverable with any hardware, software, data, or other materials not provided and approved by the Service Provider; or (b) the Service Provider’s compliance with the Bank’s specifications, information, designs or requirements; or (c) the Bank’s use of Deliverables for purposes other than those specified under applicable SOW(s) or for any illegal purpose; or (d) the Bank’s failure to comply with the Service Provider’s instructions related to Deliverables.
It has no right, title, or interest in any and all Deliverables whether or not registrable under any statute for the time being in force, except otherwise agreed in writing by the Bank. 
It shall ensure that the resources deployed for rendering services are adequately trained for the required tasks as per the Work Order and any specific training requirements that Bank may require. The Service Provider has the required business continuity and recovery procedures plans during the term of the Agreement. 
4.2  The Service Provider agrees to be vigilant and to report all violations of information security and all suspected security events immediately to concerned teams in the Bank.
The Service Provider further represents, undertakes and agrees that it shall ensure (1) to comply with the provisions of Information Technology Act and the rules framed thereunder including Information Technology (Reasonable security practices and procedures and sensitive personal data or information) Rules, 2011; (b) to monitor the security practices, control processes and checks in respect of the confidential information on a regular basis; (c) to comply with the acceptable usage policy and any other policies as may be informed in writing to the Service Provider by the Bank from time to time, and ( d ) to disclose any breaches in the security practices, control processes and checks without undue delay to concerned employee of the Bank
4.3 The Service Provider represents and warrants that it will provide an integrity certificate from the original equipment manufacturer (OEM) that the OEM has all the necessary legitimate rights, licenses and/or authorization as regards software, Source Code, tools, techniques, used by it relating to the Services rendered under this agreement and for providing the Services and safe guarding the Confidential Information on a periodic basis and as requested by the Bank. 
4.4 The Service Provider agrees that as and when Service Provider is undertaking any incident management testing  internally or externally through any person/Agency/process/service/technology associated with the Bank,  the Service Provider shall inform the Bank and with prior consultation and approval of the Bank, the testing/demonstration shall be carried out by the Service Provider at least once a year or as and when  required by the Bank, any Statutory Body, Regulatory Body as the case may be. Such testing/demonstration of incident management should include, but not limited to, reporting and detecting security incidents involving the networks, systems and/or application used to provide services under the Purchase Order raised from time to time, processes and procedures for assessing the severity of the incident, identifying the cause of incident, redressing the cause to avoid future incidents, restoring normal operations and documenting the results of response post implementation of the redressal actions. Bank should be provided requisite details by the Service Provider within Seven working days from the date of conducting the test/demonstration.
4.5 Except As Otherwise Stated In This Clause, The Service Provider Makes No Warranties Of Any Kind Or Nature, Whether Express Or Implied, Including, But Not Limited To, Warranties Of Merchantability Or Fitness For A Particular Purpose Or Use, Or Warranties Of Any Deliverables Or Services, Or The Appropriateness Of The Bank’s Or Any Third-Party Specifications.  In Addition, The Service Provider Expressly Disclaims Any Warranty Or Liability With Respect To Design Or Latent Defects, Security Of Data, Or Compliance With Laws, Regulations, Or Other Official Government Releases Applicable To The Bank, Which Shall Be The Sole Responsibility Of The Bank.

matching_standard_clause.title: SUB-CONTRACTING AND ASSIGNMENT
matching_standard_clause.text:
The Service Provider shall itself perform its obligations under this Agreement and shall not assign, transfer, or sub-contract any of its rights and obligations in relation to all or part of the Services or related thereto. The Service Provider shall appoint sub-contractors and/or assign or transfer any of the rights and obligations under this Agreement with prior written consent of the Bank.  The Service Provider shall at all times remain responsible and liable to the Bank for all the actions of the agents, sub-agents/sub-contractors, assignee, or transferee, as the case may be, with no dilution or diminution of service, controls, penalties, etc.
Notwithstanding anything contrary contained in the terms of this Agreement, Service Provider shall ensure that such agents, sub-agent, sub-contractor, assignee or transferee etc. shall be bound by the terms of this Agreement. For the purpose of this clause and notwithstanding any such written consent being given by the Bank, the Service Provider shall remain liable for the acts and omissions of any delegate it has delegated its activities to i.e. sub agent, sub-contractor, agent etc. If such delegation is as a result of operation of any laws, then Bank shall have an option on such delegation to immediately terminate this Agreement at its discretion. The Service Provider shall be responsible and liable for the performance and risk management practices of its sub-contractors. 
The Bank shall be entitled to assign/transfer part/ all of its rights and benefits under this Agreement/this Agreement to any Person or entity without any prior notice or intimation to the Service Provider. However, the Service Provider shall not transfer or assign this Agreement and/or any obligations or rights under this Agreement to any third party without prior written consent of the Bank.
BUSINESS CONTINUITY PLAN (“BCP”)
The Service Provider hereby confirms that it has developed and established a robust framework for documenting, maintaining and testing business continuity and recovery procedures and the same are tested periodically and agrees to test such business continuity and recovery plan jointly with the Bank and shall ensure that the Service to the Bank would not be adversely affected in any manner on account of any factors including system breakdowns which may cause disruption in the normal functions of the Service Provider.
The Service Provider hereby agrees and understands that Services to be performed under this Agreement shall continue to be offered under ordinary circumstances. In the event of any difficulty in performing the required Services, Service Provider shall make best efforts to make alternative arrangements to ensure that the required Services are continued to be performed.
The Service Provider shall review and test its BCP on an annual basis and notify the Bank of any substantial changes to its BCP. The test shall validate the functionality and effectiveness of the BCP, including but not limited to the feasibility of the recovery time objectives, recovery point objectives and resumption operation capacities.
Following each test the Service Provider shall confirm to the Bank the functionality and effectiveness of the BCP. The Service Provider shall promptly notify the Bank of any test findings that may affect the Service Provider’s performance of its Services. The Service Provider shall promptly implement remedial measures or actions to address the test findings, including those required by the Bank.
Upon the Bank’s request, the Service Provider shall participate in the Bank’s business continuity and disaster recovery exercises in respect of the Services to be provided by the Service Provider.
The Service Provider shall, on request, provide copies of results of any independent assessments of such Business Continuity Plan to the Bank.

differences.original:
Any training to be provided to the Bank’s employees and or resources as part of the Services, the same shall be as per the provisions of the Work Order for increasing the efficacy of the staff and for implementation of the project as per the Work Order. The training shall be provided as may be agreed in the scope of work. 
4. SERVICE PROVIDER’S REPRESENTATIONS
4.1 The Service Provider hereby represents, warrants and confirms that:
It has full capacity, power and authority to enter into this Agreement and during the continuance of this Agreement, will continue to have full capacity, power and authority to carry out and perform the Service Provider’s obligations and has already taken and will continue to take all necessary and further actions, (including wherever applicable without limitation obtaining of necessary approvals/consents/licenses as are applicable under Applicable Law).
To its best knowledge, it has the necessary skills, knowledge, experience, expertise, required capital net worth, adequate and competent Service Provider’s Employees, Qualified Personnel, systems, equipment and procedures and capability to duly perform the Service Provider’s obligations in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.
The execution of this Agreement and providing Services and delivering Deliverables hereunder, does not and will not violate any Applicable Law and further, to its best knowledge, will not violate or breach any covenants, stipulations or conditions of any agreements or undertaking entered into by the Service Provider with any other Person.
It shall take all reasonable measures to ensure that information and the mode of transfer (within Service Provider’s area of influence) to and from the Bank’s materials is secure and it shall not use, analyse or access the Bank data traffic or any other data except for the limited purposes necessary for undertaking its contractual obligations as set out herein. The Services will be performed in a competent manner and substantially in accordance with any mutually agreed specifications. 
The Service Provider hereby acknowledges and accepts that the Bank has relied upon the above representations and warranties and have entered into this Agreement.
The Service Provider represents and warrants to the Bank that (i)  prior to delivery of any Deliverable or provision of any Service to the Bank, the Service Provider shall have obtained assignment or license of all right, title and interest in and to such deliverable, to the extent necessary for Service Provider to grant to the Bank the rights and licenses granted hereunder; (ii) the Service Provider has not received any written notice or claim, and is not otherwise aware, that any of the deliverables and the use thereof by the Bank and authorized users in accordance with this Agreement as contemplated hereunder, infringes or misappropriates, or would infringe or misappropriate the patent, copyright, trademark, trade secret or other Intellectual Property Rights of any third party;  and (iii) the Services performed by the Service Provider hereunder shall be of professional quality, consistent with generally accepted industry standards for the work of a similar nature.
It shall ensure that services provided under each Work Order will substantially conform to the agreed functional and technical specifications as is set out in the Work Oder and any other such agreed specificationsIt shall ensure that all Services provided to the Bank will not infringe or misappropriate any Intellectual Property rights of any Third Party. The Service Provider shall ensure that if such an infringement and/or misappropriation is discovered at a later stage, the same will be governed as per the end user license agreement of original equipment manufacturer (“OEM”) which is embedded at Annexure B hereto (“EULA”).
The Bank  agrees that the Service Provider shall not be liable for any claims of infringement arising from (a) combination of the Deliverable with any hardware, software, data, or other materials not provided and approved by the Service Provider; or (b) the Service Provider’s compliance with the Bank’s specifications, information, designs or requirements; or (c) the Bank’s use of Deliverables for purposes other than those specified under applicable SOW(s) or for any illegal purpose; or (d) the Bank’s failure to comply with the Service Provider’s instructions related to Deliverables.
It has no right, title, or interest in any and all Deliverables whether or not registrable under any statute for the time being in force, except otherwise agreed in writing by the Bank. 
It shall ensure that the resources deployed for rendering services are adequately trained for the required tasks as per the Work Order and any specific training requirements that Bank may require. The Service Provider has the required business continuity and recovery procedures plans during the term of the Agreement. 
4.2  The Service Provider agrees to be vigilant and to report all violations of information security and all suspected security events immediately to concerned teams in the Bank.
The Service Provider further represents, undertakes and agrees that it shall ensure (1) to comply with the provisions of Information Technology Act and the rules framed thereunder including Information Technology (Reasonable security practices and procedures and sensitive personal data or information) Rules, 2011; (b) to monitor the security practices, control processes and checks in respect of the confidential information on a regular basis; (c) to comply with the acceptable usage policy and any other policies as may be informed in writing to the Service Provider by the Bank from time to time, and ( d ) to disclose any breaches in the security practices, control processes and checks without undue delay to concerned employee of the Bank
4.3 The Service Provider represents and warrants that it will provide an integrity certificate from the original equipment manufacturer (OEM) that the OEM has all the necessary legitimate rights, licenses and/or authorization as regards software, Source Code, tools, techniques, used by it relating to the Services rendered under this agreement and for providing the Services and safe guarding the Confidential Information on a periodic basis and as requested by the Bank. 
4.4 The Service Provider agrees that as and when Service Provider is undertaking any incident management testing  internally or externally through any person/Agency/process/service/technology associated with the Bank,  the Service Provider shall inform the Bank and with prior consultation and approval of the Bank, the testing/demonstration shall be carried out by the Service Provider at least once a year or as and when  required by the Bank, any Statutory Body, Regulatory Body as the case may be. Such testing/demonstration of incident management should include, but not limited to, reporting and detecting security incidents involving the networks, systems and/or application used to provide services under the Purchase Order raised from time to time, processes and procedures for assessing the severity of the incident, identifying the cause of incident, redressing the cause to avoid future incidents, restoring normal operations and documenting the results of response post implementation of the redressal actions. Bank should be provided requisite details by the Service Provider within Seven working days from the date of conducting the test/demonstration.
4.5 Except As Otherwise Stated In This Clause, The Service Provider Makes No Warranties Of Any Kind Or Nature, Whether Express Or Implied, Including, But Not Limited To, Warranties Of Merchantability Or Fitness For A Particular Purpose Or Use, Or Warranties Of Any Deliverables Or Services, Or The Appropriateness Of The Bank’s Or Any Third-Party Specifications. In Addition, The Service Provider Expressly Disclaims Any Warranty Or Liability With Respect To Design Or Latent Defects, Security Of Data, Or Compliance With Laws, Regulations, Or Other Official Government Releases Applicable To The Bank, Which Shall Be The Sole Responsibility Of The Bank.

clauses.original_text:
5.1 The Service Provider hereby agrees, undertakes, and confirms as under:
The Service Provider shall, always, maintain and respect, and shall also procure its Employees and Qualified Personnel to maintain and respect, strict confidentiality of Confidential Information including all/any matters relating to the Services, Deliverables, and this Agreement. 
Without prior written permission of the Bank, the Service Provider and its Employee and Qualified Personnel shall not at any time use the name and/or trademark/logo of the Bank in any manner and for any purpose whatsoever.
The Services to be rendered and the Service Provider’s obligations to be performed pursuant to this Agreement shall be rendered and performed by the Service Provider, with utmost care and diligence and shall be of the highest quality and standards. If at any time the Bank is dissatisfied with the Services rendered by the Service Provider, the Bank shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement, provided that Service Provider is provided a cure period of 30 days. The Bank’s decision in this regard shall be final, absolute and binding on the Service Provider.
Any information handed over by the Bank to the Service Provider and/or its Employee or Qualified Personnel in terms of this Agreement or which comes into the hands of the Service Provider and/or its Employee or Qualified Personnel’s custody, power or possession pursuant to or in connection with this Agreement will remain the sole and absolute property of the Bank, and the Service Provider and /or its Employee or Qualified Personnel shall not have and also shall not claim any charge, claim, lien, right of retention, sale or set-off or other right, title or interest therein or thereon for any reason whatsoever. The Service Provider and/or its Employee or Qualified Personnel, shall not at any time use or attempt to use Bank’s logo/trademark or letterheads for any purpose whatsoever.
The Service Provider shall at all times be responsible for conducting periodic background verification checks on its Employee and Qualified Personnel and ensure that the Employee and Qualified Personnel deployed at the Bank’s facilities and/or its own premises shall have no adverse track record including any criminal complaints/ convictions. Service Provider shall promptly inform the Bank if it has any such knowledge of criminal complaints / convictions after deployment of its Employee and Qualified Personnel at the Bank premises/Project Sites/its own premises and make adequate arrangements for substitution of such Employee and Qualified Personnel. To extent it is solely and directly attributable to the Service Provider, the Service Provider shall always be liable for all the actions of its Employee or Qualified Personnel and shall indemnify the Bank against all Grossly Negligent actions or Wilful Misconduct of its Employee and Qualified Personnel resulting into a third party claim in relation to bodily injury and tangible or real property damage For clarity, (i) Wilful Misconduct means reckless disregard towards its performance of the Services or any obligations by Service Provider by failing to exercise reasonable care to prevent a known danger that is likely to result in any financial damages, or injury to any person or loss or damage of tangible property, (ii) Gross Negligence shall mean blatant violation of a legal duty whether by an act or omission with respect of the rights of others, wilfully and with wanton disregard for harmful, avoidable and foreseeable consequence.
Service Provider agrees to maintain its books and records reasonably relating to the services performed and invoices issued pursuant to this Agreement for a period of Five (5) years following the end of the calendar year in which the work was performed, and during that time and/or  may be required under Applicable Law whichever is higher , the Bank shall be entitled to access all books, records and information relevant to the Services available with the Service Provider. Upon request from the Bank, the Service Provider shall within 2 (two) business days of such request provide to the Bank access to all the books, records and information in connection with Services.
The Bank shall have a right, but not the obligation, to continuous monitor and assess the Services to be provided by the Service Provider under this Agreement and suggest corrective measures, if any, required to can be taken by the Service Provider.The Service Provider sall not without prior approval/consent of the Bank, use any sub-contractor for undertaking all or part of the Services.
The Bank and its authorized representatives shall have a right to periodically conduct audits on the Service Provider whether by its internal or external auditors, or by agents that are not the competitors of the Service Provider in conjunction with the services performed for the Bank with a prior written notice of ten(10) days. Such audit shall not disturb the normal business hours  of the Service Provider, such audit will exclude internal financial data, other customer data of the Service Provider. Incase of any surprise audit if insisted by any statutory/RBI authorities, the same shall be  provided by the Service Provider. 
Upon request by the Bank, the Service Provider shall allow RBI or persons authorized by it to access Bank’s documents, records of transactions, and other necessary information given to, stored or processed by the Service Provider within a reasonable time.
The Service Providers recognizes the right of RBI to cause an inspection to be made of a Service Provider and its books and account by one or more of its officers or employees or other persons.
The Service Provider shall preserve all the documents and data pertaining to the Services in accordance with the legal/regulatory obligation of the Bank in this regard.
The Service provider shall maintain at its cost worker’s compensation insurance coverage, commercial liability insurance coverage, medical insurance coverage, insurance coverage against physical loss or damage to Service provider’s equipment.
(l ) The Service Provider shall depute Qualified Personnel for the purpose of this agreement and the Service Provider shall ensure that Service Provider’s Employees and Qualified Personnel shall strictly adhere to their norms as required to fulfil the roles and responsibilities assigned to them to the satisfaction of the Bank. It is the sole responsibility of the Service Provider to ensure the safety of its staff and to follow the security norms, while they are performing their duties in the premises of the Bank and the Bank shall never be held responsible for any breach of terms, negligence occurred during its performance under this agreement. 
(m) In case the Services provided by Service provider’s Employees/Qualified Personnel are found not to be satisfactory, in such case the Bank shall inform the same to the Service Provider in writing specifying the reason and requesting to replace the employee or sub-contractor and the Service provider shall within 30 days  or any other period as may be mutually agreed, replace the existing staff with new qualified/experience staff.
(n) Unless otherwise specified in the Work Order, in the event any of Service Provider’s resource remain absentwithout a prior written notice or intimation of such absence by the Service Provider to the Bank, for five (5)  consecutive days in a month without the Service Provider providing the Bank with an alternate resource of the same skillsets/competence and qualification. in such cases, Bank  reserves its right to recover compensation @ pro-rata basis per day from the service provider as per the cost of implementation agreed as part of the proposal & SOW/Work Order for each day on which the resource is absent. Service Provider is also liable for all the commission/omission for the acts of the Qualified Personnel of service provider. Furthermore, no liquidated damages or compensation or penalties will be levied in the event of the absence of the resource due to reasons such as death, illness, injury, or termination of their engagement or if the absence is planned as stated in the foregoing clause.
The Service Provider shall provide access to Confidential Information of the Bank only to such Service Provider’s Employees who have executed a Non-Disclosure Agreement and further such access shall only be provided on 'need to know' basis i.e., limited to those areas where the information is required in order to perform the Services.
(p) To extent the Service Provider has any access to Bank’s information, the Service Provider shall isolate and clearly identify the Bank’s customer information, documents, records and assets to protect the confidentiality of the information. In instances, where Service Provider acts as an outsourcing agent for multiple banks, non banking financing services and financial institutions, maximum care shall be taken by it to build robust safeguards so that there is no intermingling of information/documents, records and assets.
If applicable and there are any Services provided on Service Provider’s environment, the Bank shall have a right to review and monitor the security practices and control processes of the Service Provider on a regular basis and require the Service Provider to disclose security breaches. The Service Provider shall provide Services in compliance with the Applicable laws and rules made thereunder, as amended, modified or substituted from time to time. 
(q) In the event that the Service Provider does not deliver the Services as per the specified time schedule due to default on its part, the Bank shall be entitled to procure the Services required under the Work Order from a Third Party without any cost to Service Provider.
(r) In the event that the Service Provider has knowledge or reasonable belief that anything prevents or is likely to prevent or threatens to prevent the timely performance of the Services or other obligations of Service Provider under this Agreement, it shall promptly notify the Bank of such an event or probable event.  The Bank shall in its sole discretion grant Service Provider a reasonable extension of time, if so requested by the Service Provider to complete additional or changed work in the event that Bank’s requirements materially change. 
(s) Service Provider shall for each Work Order designate a project manager, who will be principally responsible for coordinating and monitoring the performance of the Work Order.  Any change in the project manager shall be forthwith intimated to the Bank.  Upon such intimation, all communications would be made with such new project manager. 
(t) Service Provider shall assign and maintain qualified and trained software professionals or other professionals of high calibre to work on the Bank’s assigned projects on project need basis. If, for any reason, any individual is no longer available, or in the opinion of the Bank any individual / personnel assigned needs to be replaced, the service provider will be given a thirty days’ notice (30) to replace such individual/professional.  Service Provider will use reasonable endeavours to replace such  individual promptly by another person of equal competence within a mutually  agreed time frame. Service Provider will however, use reasonable endeavours to minimize changes in the Qualified Personnel to discharge Service Provider's obligations.
(u) Service Provider agrees that the Services and Deliverables shall meet the service level requirements as per the respective service level standards set out in the corresponding Work Order.
(v) All Services and Deliverables shall be rendered/delivered in accordance with the time schedule specified in the Work Order,  except to the extent delays are caused by Bank or any other factors including but not limited to Bank’s  delays providing any approvals, inputs, confirmations, information, force majeure event or any other reasons not attributable to Service Provider
A delay by Service Provider in the performance of Services or delivery of Deliverables to the satisfaction of the Bank  and as per the terms of Work Order due to reasons solely and directly attributable to Service Provider or its Qualified Personnel shall render Service Provider liable to imposition of liquidated damages as identified in the Work Order. This clause will be applicable only if liquidated damages are specifically identified in the Work Order. In any event, unless otherwise agreed in the Work Order, liquidated damages shall not exceed 5% of Work order value during one (1) year. The Service Provider shall comply with procedures to deal with deficiencies in compliance with the obligations undertaken under this Agreement as note by auditors, government regulators, and other internal or external agencies and provide relevant solutions, within the time frame notified and mutually discussed by with the Bank at no additional cost to the Bank. 
The Service Provider represents that the documentation shall contain a description of all the Deliverables and other materials and services (as applicable), shall be prepared and maintained in accordance with the applicable industry standards.
Service Provider shall not hold the Bank responsible for any judgements made by the Service Provider for arriving at any type of sizing or costing for any Work Order under this AgreementService Provider further agrees and recognizes that:The Bank shall control the authorization and access to Bank’s information, including access rights granted to the Service Provider’s Qualified Personnel;
The Service Provider ensure that the Qualified Personnel shall adhere to the Information Security Policy adopted by the Bank from time to time;
Service Provider is fully compliant (and undertakes and agrees to remain compliant) with the provisions of the Sexual Harassment of Women at the Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act, 2013 and the rules thereunder (as may be amended from time to time) and Service Provider shall extend this obligation to all its Qualified Personnel or individuals engaged for fulfilling the Services under this Agreement, and to that extent, shall enter into appropriate legally binding agreements with each such Qualified Personnel
in the performance of this Agreement, Service Provider and its respective director(s), officers(s), agents(s), employees(s), or any other persons(s) acting for or on behalf of the foregoing will comply strictly with all applicable anti-corruption laws and regulations. 
All terms and conditions, payment schedules, time frame for implementation and rendering Services and delivering Deliverables, expected service levels, etc. will remain unchanged unless explicitly communicated executed as an amendment by the Bank and the Service Provider in writing to the Service Provider. The Bank shall not be responsible for any judgements made by the Service Provider in respect to any aspect of the Services that are not documented in this Agreement..
The Bank reserves the right to interview any and all the Qualified Personnel to be deployed by the Service Provider on the Project Sites or onsite-long term projects and select then accordingly. 
Service Provider shall comply with its obligations under all applicable data protection laws in respect of the Services to be provided to the Bank under this Agreement. Service Provider agrees in respect of any such production data supplied to it by the Bank that it shall: (a) only act on instructions from the Bank regarding the processing of such data under this Agreement and shall ensure that appropriate technical and organizational measures shall be taken against unauthorized or unlawful processing of the data and against accidental loss or destruction of, or damage to, the data; and (b) comply with any reasonable request made by the Bank to ensure compliance with the measures contained in this clause.
In case the Bank notices any defects in the products delivered by the OEM, the rectification will be carried out as per terms of the EULA .
If the issue/complaint received from the customer is of major/critical nature, the Service Provider shall solve the said issue on priority basis without causing any delay. However, if the Service Provider is not able to solve the complaint/issue immediately, in such case the same should be informed to the Bank and its customer and should ensure to solve within 7 days from the date of receipt of the complaint.
If the complaint received from the customer is not major but feels that the same may consume some time, in such case the Service Provider shall ensure to solve the complaint within 15 days from the date of receipt of the complaint and the Service Provider shall inform the same to the Bank and its customer via mail within 3 working days from the date of receipt of the complaint.
In case the customers of the Bank approaches the service provider directly for any issues pertaining to the services of the Service Provider, the Service Provider shall extend all its support and co-operation in this regard and ensures to solve the problem within the time limit as mentioned in the foregoing parasThe Service Provider shall inform/update the Bank in writing about the complaints received from Bank's customers and the solution provided by the Service Provider. The information shall contain, name of the customer, date of receipt of complaint, nature of complaint, time taken for solving (TAT), resolving date, status of the complaint etc. and the Service Provider shall submit the statement to the Bank on weekly basis via email id viz. -------- without fail.
Service Provider shall ensure to render services to the satisfaction of Bank's customer and in case the Bank's customer is not satisfied with the services rendered by the Service Provider, the Service Provider shall exclusively responsible for its acts and the Bank shall not be held responsible for whatsoever reasons for the acts of the Service Provider

matching_standard_clause.title: CONFIDENTIALITY
matching_standard_clause.text:
“Confidential Information”  shall mean any information and documents shared by the Bank with the Service Provider and/or any information and documents comes in to possession of the Service Provider/Representatives and/or any other information which is developed by the Service Provider/Representatives for the Bank, which is including but not limited to confidential information and proprietary information concerning the Bank, its affiliates, subsidiaries, group companies, holding companies including and without limitation; Intellectual Property, trade secrets, secret information, technical processes, finances, software, software language codes, username and passwords, transaction information, data processing methodology, custom developed applications, dealings and method of dealings with the clients or the customers  and its employees together with any  information  relating to Bank’s suppliers, employees, agents, distributors, and customers (including personal information and/or personal sensitive information)and relationships of special trust and confidence with the clients or customers and employees.
The Service Provider shall use the Confidential Information solely for purposes of this Agreement, and shall not disclose to any third party without the prior written consent of the Bank.
The Service Provider agrees and undertakes to ensure that in case Service Provider share any Confidential Information with its affiliates, group companies, associates, subsidiaries, holding company and their respective employees and professional advisors (“Representatives”) and such Representatives shall be bound by the confidentiality obligations under this Agreement and they shall use the Confidential Information only for the purpose of this Agreement.
The Service Provider also agrees that it shall share Confidential Information with the Representatives only to such extent as may be necessary for the performance of the Service Providers obligations under this Agreement. The Service Provider shall inform the confidential nature of Confidential Information to the Representatives and the Service Provider shall ensure that such Representatives shall execute a confidentiality and non-disclosure agreement containing restrictions as stringent as those contained herein to protect the Confidential Information of the Bank.
The Service Provider shall take all measures to protect the confidentiality and security of the Confidential Information and avoid the unauthorized use, disclosure, publication, or dissemination of the Confidential Information; provided, however, that such measures shall be no less stringent than measures taken to protect its own confidential and proprietary information but in no event less than reasonable degree of care.  The Service Provider shall be responsible for breach of any provision of this Agreement by its Representatives. The Service Provider shall and shall ensure that its Representatives shall keep all Confidential Information confidential at all times during the Term and after termination of this Agreement.
The Service Provider agrees and understands that the title to the Confidential Information and Intellectual Property shall always remain with the Bank, and this Agreement shall not be construed to grant to the Service Provider any patents, licenses or similar rights to such Confidential Information and Intellectual Property.
The Service Provider confirms and undertakes that it shall ensure that confidentiality of customer information, if any, shared by the Bank during the course of availing the Service shall be maintained during the Term and even after this Agreement expires or gets terminated. The Service Provider shall be fully liable and responsible in case of breach of security and leakage of customers information.
