matching_standard_clause.title: DEFINITIONS
matching_standard_clause.text:
“Agreement” shall mean this agreement including all SOW(s), PO(s) and any amendments agreed in writing by mutual consent of the Parties from time to time.
“Confidential Information” shall mean and include, but is not restricted to all non-public information of either Party that is technical and commercial concerning business, books of record and account, data systems, software, services, any materials, trade secrets, know-how, formulae, processes, algorithms, ideas, strategies, inventions, data, network configurations, system architecture designs, flow charts, drawings, proprietary information, personal data, business and marketing plans, financial and operational information, and all other non-public information, material or data relating to the current and/ or future business and operations, wages related information provided by the disclosing party  (“Disclosing Party”) to the other Party (“Receiving Party”) pursuant to this Agreement including the existence and terms and conditions of this Agreement , or any other information which may come to the knowledge of the Receiving Party. Confidential Information shall not include information which as evidenced by records: (a) is or becomes a part of the public domain through no breach of its confidentiality obligations by the Receiving Party; (b) was in the Receiving Party’s lawful possession prior to the disclosure and had not been obtained by the Receiving Party either directly or indirectly from the Disclosing Party; (c) is lawfully disclosed to the Receiving Party by a third party entitled to disclose such information,  without restriction on disclosure; or (d) is independently developed by the Receiving Party or its Representatives (as defined hereunder) without reference to the Confidential Information.
“Equipment’s” shall mean the list of equipment’s specified in each SOW for which the Service Provider shall carry out the Services.  
“Personal Data or Personal Information” shall mean any information relating to a natural person, which either directly or indirectly, independently or in collaboration with other information, is capable of identifying such person disclosed to or given access to the Service Provider for the purposes of providing the Services.
“Purchase Order” or “PO” shall mean an order in written form issued by SG GSC and accepted by the Service Provider with respect to any requirement for the Services under this Agreement.
“Service Location” shall mean the location(s) specified in each SOW at which the Equipment’s are located and the Service Provider is required to carry out the Services
“Services” shall mean broadly refer to services agreed to be provided by the Service Provider from time to time in accordance with the terms of this Agreement or under applicable SOW.
“SG Group” shall mean a unit formed by SG GSC’s parent company i.e. Societe Generale SA (SG) and a company where SG or SG GSC exercises management control or owns fifty percent (50%) or more of the shareholding in that company
“Statement of Work” or “SOW” shall mean an order in written form made and entered into between the Parties with respect to each PO under this Agreement.

The Agreement shall be valid and in force during the Term. The Tenure of the Agreement may be extended if mutually agreed to by the Parties in writing. 
Any transaction by way of completion of Services after the termination of this Agreement but initiated prior to the termination of this Agreement shall not be construed to be and shall not be an extension of this Agreement.

clauses.original_text:
Timely delivery of Services is the essence of this Agreement 
Vendor will inform Otis immediately of any inquiries, questions or issues raised by any authority or third party regarding and relating to Otis and no oral or written response shall be given without prior approval and vetting by Otis else the same shall not be binding on Otis.
Vendor shall maintain all records, accounts etc., required under applicable laws and shall provide all requisite information to Otis / any authority.
Vendor shall not subcontract or appoint any agent to fulfill its obligations under this Agreement without the prior written consent of Otis.
Vendor shall comply at all times, with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, judicial rulings, industry codes including child labor regulations and Vendor shall be responsible for all contractual and statutory obligations vis-à-vis its employees.

matching_standard_clause.title: ORDER
matching_standard_clause.text: The Parties shall from time to time execute an Order for the sale and purchase of the subscriptions to the Platform/Professional Services. The Company shall not be obligated to deliver any subscriptions to the Platform /Professional Services, unless the Order is accepted by the Company in writing. The Company reserves the right to accept or decline any Order, in whole or in part, at its own discretion and to cancel any accepted Order prior to the shipment and Customer shall not raise any objection to the same and also not have any claim against the Company on this account.

clauses.original_text:
In consideration of the Services rendered, Otis will pay the charges as per and in the manner detailed in Annexure 2. 
The Vendor shall periodically (as detailed in Annexure 2) raise a correct and complete commercially acceptable invoice in all respects supported by all necessary and relevant information and documents including acceptance certificate.
The invoicing shall be done in accordance with the applicable law so as to ensure that Otis is able to take all applicable tax credits. The Vendor shall indemnify and hold harmless Otis for any loss, demand, or penalty levied by any authority due to the infirmity in the invoice raised by the Vendor or any act or omission on its part including procedural lapses leading to denial of any input credit. Alternatively, Otis reserves the right to deduct such losses from Vendors invoice. 
Otis reserves the right to set-off, deduct, and/or withhold any amounts from out of the payments due and payable by Otis to Vendor under the terms of this Agreement or any other agreement in respect of which Vendor may be indebted or in default to Otis.
The Parties further acknowledge and agree that Otis has the right to re-negotiate the commercial at any point of time during the term of this Agreement. 
No expenses or fees owed by Otis to any Third Party (excluding expenses or fees owed by Otis to Vendor) including, without limitation, any Equipment Inspection and Licensing Fees, Jobsite Fee, lodging, or travel or the like, shall be paid on Otis’ behalf by such Vendor. Nor shall Vendor make any Improper Payment.
TAXES, LEVIES, DUTIES
The Vendor shall be responsible for compliance and payment of all taxes, duties, levies, cess, surcharge or any other charges that may be applicable on the Vendor or for the Services provided under this Agreement by whatsoever name called except Service Tax. Otis shall deduct tax at source as required under any law or regulation.

matching_standard_clause.title: FEES AND TAXES
matching_standard_clause.text:
In consideration of the Services to be rendered by the Service Provider in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, KMBL agrees to pay the Service Provider the Fees set out in the respective SOW. 
The Fee for additional/new Services or increase in Fee, if any, shall be mutually agreed between the Parties in writing. Unless otherwise agreed in the SOW, all the Fees shall be payable within thirty (30) days by KMBL from date of receipt of invoice from the Service provider.
Service Provider should raise a valid GST tax invoice on KMBL quoting KMBL’s GST number, for the Fees agreed under this Agreement as per the applicable GST law(s) and regulations within the prescribed time limit. Under no circumstances, Service Provider shall raise a separate invoice/debit note/or any document to recover the GST amount any time after a GST tax invoice is issued for the corresponding period.
All payments shall be made by KMBL to the Service Provider as per the undisputed invoice raised by the Service Provider. KMBL shall not make any payment directly to any of the employees of the Service Provider. 
.
KMBL may deduct or withhold any taxes that it is obligated to withhold from any Fee payable to Service Provider under this Agreement, and payment to Service Provider as reduced by such deductions or withholdings of tax will constitute full payment and settlement to Service Provider of such Fee. Service Provider should provide KMBL with any forms, documents, or certifications, including Permanent Account Number as may be required to satisfy KMBL’s withholding tax obligations with respect to any Fee payable under this Agreement. KMBL shall withhold taxes and deposit the same as per provisions of applicable withholding tax laws on the payments to be made to the Service Provider unless an exemption certificate or reduced rate certificate is produced.
Service Provider shall be solely liable for the payment of all direct taxes, duties, fines, cesses, levies, penalties, etc., by whatever name called, as may become due and payable by Service Provider under the applicable laws in force from time to time in relation to the Services rendered pursuant to this Agreement.
To avoid double taxation of GST on KMBL for third party cost/out of pocket expenses, the Service Provider shall ensure that the GST ITC credit on third party cost/out of pocket expenses is passed on to KMBL. Service Provider should raise back-to-back invoice on actuals for third party cost/out of pocket expenses in such manner which enables KMBL to take GST ITC credit on media cost/out of pocket expenses on actuals. 
The Service Provider shall raise a valid GST tax invoice at the end of each period for which it is due and payable. Unless otherwise agreed by KMBL under a particular SOW, KMBL shall make the payment within a period of thirty (30) days from the date of receipt of undisputed invoice by KMBL. 
Service Provider shall remit the GST so charged to KMBL, to the appropriate government authority and comply with GST requirements and reporting obligations in all material respects. Service Provider shall ensure that the details mentioned in the GST invoice is uploaded on the GST network correctly and the GST returns are filed and GST is paid to government within the due dates prescribed under the GST law(s) and regulations. In case of any non-compliance thereof including delayed payment of GST or delayed filing of return or delay/non-upload of the invoice details correctly or otherwise, as a result of which GST credit is denied to KMBL and interest, penalty and other cost is imposed on KMBL, then Service Provider shall be liable to pay such amount together with interest/penalty and any other cost to KMBL. Service Provider agrees and consents KMBL to recover such GST credit loss, interest, penalty and other cost imposed on KMBL, from any payment which will be due to Service Provider under this Agreement.

The Service Provider shall raise a valid GST tax invoice at the end of each period for which it is due and payable. Unless otherwise agreed by KMBL under a particular SOW, KMBL shall make the payment within a period of thirty (30) days from the date of receipt of undisputed invoice by KMBL. 
Service Provider shall remit the GST so charged to KMBL, to the appropriate government authority and comply with GST requirements and reporting obligations in all material respects. Service Provider shall ensure that the details mentioned in the GST invoice is uploaded on the GST network correctly and the GST returns are filed and GST is paid to government within the due dates prescribed under the GST law(s) and regulations. In case of any non-compliance thereof including delayed payment of GST or delayed filing of return or delay/non-upload of the invoice details correctly or otherwise, as a result of which GST credit is denied to KMBL and interest, penalty and other cost is imposed on KMBL, then Service Provider shall be liable to pay such amount together with interest/penalty and any other cost to KMBL. Service Provider agrees and consents KMBL to recover such GST credit loss, interest, penalty and other cost imposed on KMBL, from any payment which will be due to Service Provider under this Agreement.

Unless otherwise agreed in a particular SOW, all the Fees shall be payable by KMBL to the Service Provider within thirty (30) days from the date of receipt of undisputed invoice by KMBL . KMBL shall withhold or withhold any taxes that it is obligated to withhold from any Fee payable to Service Provider under this Agreement .

matching_standard_clause.title: FORCE MAJEURE
matching_standard_clause.text: The Parties shall not be liable for any failure to perform any of its obligations under this Agreement if the performance is prevented, hindered or delayed by or any event or circumstance is beyond the reasonable control of the performing party thereby impeding the ability of a Party to perform their obligations under this Agreement. ICICI Bank, however, reserves the right to terminate the Agreement in the even such event continues for more than 30 (thirty) days.

ICICI Bank, however, reserves the right to terminate the Agreement in the even such event continues for more than 30 (thirty) days.

clauses.original_text:
Vendor shall maintain proper books and records as they may relate to the performance under this Agreement. During the Term and for six months thereafter, Otis, at its sole expense, reserves the right, itself or through an external agency, to audit, inspect, and make copies or extracts of relevant financial statements, systems and processes and records (“Documents”) to the extent associated with Vendor’s performance under this Agreement. Audit will be done during normal business hours and with advance 1 week notice. Apart from providing access to the Documents, Vendor will also reply to any queries or clarifications relating thereto and shall maintain and preserve documentation and data pertaining to performance under this  Agreement and shall permit Otis, with sufficient access to its operating sites, personnel, and books and records (inspection and reproduction) for Otis or external agency appointed by Otis to examine the same, to monitor and/or verify:
the accuracy of the work of the Vendor in relation to Otis under this Agreement and 
Vendor’s compliance with the terms of the Agreement.
Otis shall always ensure confidentiality of the Documents and findings of the audits. Otis may share the relevant audit observations with its statutory Auditors, any internal committee of Otis including but not limited to the audit committee of the board of directors of Otis or UTC Group or any statutory authority.
In the event the audit findings relate, to overcharging, misrepresentations, unethical practice, fraud or breach of terms and conditions of the Agreement, Otis shall have all or any of the rights stated herein against the Vendor (a) to recover the overcharged amount; (b) to suspend/stop all the outstanding/future payments; (c) to terminate the agreement forthwith without prejudice to other rights under law and contract.

matching_standard_clause.title: INDEMNITY
matching_standard_clause.text:
Service Provider hereby agrees and covenants to indemnify and keep harmless KMBL at all times against any or all claims, liabilities, damages, losses, costs, charges, expenses, proceedings and actions against KMBL by reason of -
Any criminal, or fraudulent act, gross negligence, or misfeasance by Service Provider or its employees, staff, personnel, sub-contractors, Affiliates and/or
Any breach of confidentiality obligations contained herein.
.
.

All indemnities shall survive expiry or termination of this Agreement. 
Notwithstanding anything contained herein, the Parties shall not be liable for any indirect, special, punitive, consequential or incidental damages (including, without limitation, revenue, profits, business) under this Agreement.
DUE DILIGENCE, RIGHT TO AUDIT AND INSPECTION
The Service Provider shall maintain necessary accounts, records and statements of its operations in connection with Services provided under this Agreement. Copies of such accounts, records and statements of its operations in connection with Services provided under this Agreement will have to be furnished by the Service Provider upon request received from KMBL or the regulators of KMBL, including the Reserve Bank of India. Access shall be given to KMBL and its regulators including the Reserve Bank of India to all the data, documents, accounts, records, operations, and information given to, stored or processed by the Service Provider in connection with the Services provided to KMBL, within a reasonable time.
Service Provider agrees that the regulators of the KMBL including the Reserve Bank of India and the external and internal auditors of KMBL will have the right to inspect/audit the books, records, data, audit trails, logs, systems and information of the Service Provider (except any internal pricing data or other customer data) in relation to the Services provided under this Agreement and to obtain copies of any audit or review reports and findings made on the Service Provider in connection with the Services performed for KMBL. Service Provider shall render all necessary assistance and co-operation in this regard. KMBL shall provide reasonable notice before conducting audit and such audit shall be conducted within business hours of the Service Provider. 
The Service Provider agrees to make complete disclosure to KMBL of any third party components that are included in the product/application/deliverables licensed/provided under this Agreement in the format annexed as Annexure B to this Agreement. Further, the Service Provider agrees and undertakes to make such disclosures during the continuance of this Agreement as and when any third party component is added/embedded in the product/application/deliverables during any maintenance or upgrade or any other activity. For the purpose of due diligence, KMBL may require the Service Provider to furnish copies of the licenses acquired by the Service Provider from such third party component owners/licensors. This due diligence may either be conducted by KMBL or an external auditor authorized by KMBL for the purpose. The Service Provider shall ensure that it has observed and has included the third party component as per the terms and conditions applicable for usage of such third party component as prescribed under the license obtained from the owner of the component or prescribed by the owner otherwise. The Service Provider shall ensure that the licenses of such third party components shall be kept valid and subsisting during the Term of this Agreement. The Service Provider undertakes to procure appropriate licenses for any third party component, which may be open source/free at the time of deployment along with the product/application/deliverables but subsequently becomes subject matter of a license. In all such events, the Service Provider shall procure appropriate license from the owner of the third party component within 15 (fifteen) days from the date of becoming aware of such requirement for usage of the third party component and furnish details to KMBL in the format as contained in Annexure B to this Agreement. 
KMBL's audit and due diligence rights shall survive the expiration or termination of this Agreement.

clauses.original_text:
Parties agree not to disclose any Confidential Information to any third party and to use Confidential Information only as strictly required for performance under this Agreement. All such Confidential Information is and shall remain the exclusive property of the disclosing Party.
This obligations applies to a Party’s employees, agents, sub-contractors, consultants, assignees who have access to Confidential Information. 
Exclusions: Obligation shall not apply to the extent any such information: (a) was in the public domain at the time it was disclosed or has become in the public domain through no fault of the receiving Party; (b) which the receiving Party can prove, was known to it, without restriction, at the time of disclosure; (c) is disclosed by the receiving Party with the prior written approval of the disclosing Party; (d) becomes known to the receiving Party, without restriction, from a source other than the disclosing Party without breach of any confidentiality agreement by the receiving Party and otherwise not in violation of the disclosing Party's rights.
Either Party may disclose the terms and conditions of this Agreement as required by any law, court or other governmental body including stock exchanges. 
Injunctive Relief: The Parties acknowledge that monetary damages may not be a sufficient remedy for unauthorized disclosure of any confidential information / materials and that the Parties shall be entitled, without waiving any other rights or remedies, to such injunctive or equitable relief as may be deemed proper.
At written request of the disclosing Party, the receiving Party shall either return or destroy the Confidential Information and provide a certificate from an authorized signatory to this effect, provided that it may retain such Confidential Information which it needs to do in furtherance to any legal obligation provided the retained information is kept subject to provisions of this clause. 
This Clause shall survive the termination of this Agreement.

matching_standard_clause.title: CONFIDENTIALITY
matching_standard_clause.text:
The Parties hereby undertake and agree to maintain the confidentiality of the Confidential Information and undertake not to disclose such Confidential Information to any third party except with the prior written consent of the other Party, unless such disclosure is required under law or upon receiving an order of a governmental, judicial or regulatory authority. The Parties further undertake to take the same steps to maintain the confidentiality of the Confidential Information as it would to protect its own confidential information.
Each Party agrees to hold secret and protect the other Party's Confidential Information and use that degree of care that it uses or would use with respect to its own proprietary and confidential information to keep the Confidential Information secret.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, either Party may disclose Confidential Information of the other Party which is: (i) already publicly known, (ii) discovered or created by the receiving Party without reference to the Confidential Information of the disclosing Party, as shown in records of receiving Party, (iii) otherwise known to the receiving Party through no wrongful conduct of the receiving Party, (iv) required to be disclosed by law or court order, provided that Party to whom such order is issued provides the other Party reasonable advance notice of its intended disclosure. Each Party hereby acknowledges that disclosure of the Confidential Information by it or breach of the provisions contained herein may give rise to irreparable injury to the other Party and such breach or disclosure may be inadequately compensable in money damages. Accordingly, each Party may seek injunctive relief against the breach or threatened breach of the foregoing undertakings.
Neither Party shall disclose the terms of this Agreement to any third party other than its affiliates and their legal counsel and accountants without the other Party's prior written consent.
The confidentiality obligations in respect of each such Confidential Information shall survive for a period of two years from the date of expiry / termination of the Agreement, except if required under Applicable Law for a longer period.

clauses.original_text:
Vendor hereby indemnifies, hold harmless & undertakes to defend Otis, its affiliates and their respective employees, officers and directors against any claim by a third party including but not limited to damages, costs, expenses as a result of such claim  as well as form any other losses suffered with regard to; (a) breach of the terms and conditions of this Agreement by the Vendor;(b) taxes/charges/cess/levies (and interest or penalties assessed thereon) against Otis that are obligations of Vendor or if any tax benefit in the hands of Otis is denied due to any act or omission of the Vendor; (c)any damages for bodily injury (including death) and damage to real property and tangible personal property caused by Vendor; (d) any claim or action by or on behalf of Vendor’s personnel or statutory authority, both contractual and statutory based employment with the Vendor; (g) misconduct, negligence or wrongful acts of omission and commission of employees of Vendor, and/or its subcontractors.
Vendor hereby confirms that he is not suspended or debarred from doing business with the Government and/or in India and  is not on the denied party list of U.S. Government. Vendor shall notify Otis promptly if Vendor is: (i) suspended, debarred, or proposed for suspension or debarment from doing business with the applicable Government and/or in India, or (ii) the Vendor is listed or is proposed to be listed by the U.S. Government in any "denial orders," as a "blocked person,” as a "specially designated national,” or as a "specially designated terrorist" for U.S. export administration purposes (collectively, “Debarment”). Vendor shall indemnify and hold Otis harmless against any loss or damage suffered by Otis as a result of Vendor’s Debarment.

matching_standard_clause.title: COMPLIANCE WITH REGULATIONS
matching_standard_clause.text:
Service Provider agrees that at all times and at its own expense to (i) strictly comply with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, Governmental orders and applicable codes of practice, now or hereafter in effect, relating to its performance of this Agreement, (ii) pay all fees and other charges required by such laws, rules and regulations, codes and orders; and (iii) maintain in full force and effect all licenses, permits, authorizations, registration and qualifications necessary to perform its obligations under this Agreement. In this regard, the Service Provider shall ensure that the right of Company for continued Services relating to the recruitment of the Employee (if agreed between the Parties) is not hindered, interfered with or in any manner obstructed.
Service Provider shall fully comply with all laws, rules and regulations, as may be applicable from time to time. The Service Provider shall also maintain necessary registers/records as required under the applicable statutes and produce the same as and when required by Company. The Service Provider shall provide proof of compliance, including disbursal of statutorily payable amounts, to Company immediately upon such compliance. Such compliance shall be done within the dates prescribed by law.
In the event, the Service Provider fails to obtain any such approvals, licenses and permits or is in non-compliance with such laws, rules, regulations, Governmental orders and applicable codes of practice or commits any default under such approvals, licenses and permits, and Company suffers any loss, damage or any prejudice whatsoever due to such failure, non-compliance or default, the Service Provider shall be liable to indemnify and hold Company harmless from all such losses, damage and prejudice suffered by Company including but not limited to providing legal counsel at the expense of the Service Provider.

clauses.original_text:
This Agreement may be terminated without cause, by Otis, without liability, by giving one month's notice in writing to Vendor.
Either party may terminate this Agreement forthwith after giving notice thereof to the other party, in the event of the following:(a) insolvency of the other Party; (b) if the other party enters into an arrangement or composition with its creditor(s) or if a Receiver of the other party’s property or any part thereof, is appointed; (c) if a resolution is passed to wind-up the other Party’s business or if a Receiver is appointed for any part of the other Party’s property;(d) failure of the other party to obtain or maintain any critical business license; (a) prosecution for any criminal offence of the other Party’s partner, director.
In such circumstance, Otis shall be: (a) relieved of its obligation to make further payments to the Vendor; and (b) entitled to recover damages arising from such breach
Additionally, Otis shall have the sole right to terminate or suspend this Agreement or any portion thereof  forthwith by giving notice if the appointment or continuance of Vendor is likely to result, at the sole decision of Otis, in loss of goodwill or reputation of Otis. 
This Agreement shall be terminated if either party is unable to fulfill its obligations hereunder for a continuous period of 60 days from the notice date so given by the affected party, for any reason arising out of the happening and occurrence of Force Majeure events.
In addition to above, termination rights, if: 
The Vendor or any of its directors, officers, or employees becomes for any reason persona non-grata in jurisdiction where work is performed or to any Government, Government Official; or
The Vendor fails or refuses to cooperate with any Otis audit or investigation;
In such circumstance, Otis shall be: (a) relieved of its obligation to make further payments to the Vendor; and (b) entitled to recover damages arising from such breach.

matching_standard_clause.title: CHANGE OF CONTROL
matching_standard_clause.text:
In the event of a change of Control of the Service Provider during the Term, the Service Provider shall promptly seek prior written approval from ICICI Bank. 
Notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement, if ICICI Bank is of the opinion that such change of Control has an adverse effect on the operations of ICICI Bank, then ICICI Bank has the right to terminate this Agreement immediately.

differences.original:
Otis shall not be liable for loss of goodwill, anticipated profits or any other claims or losses.
Upon the End Date the provisions of this Agreement shall, to the extent stated or necessarily implied, survive the termination thereof.
Termination of this Agreement for whatever cause shall be without prejudice to any rights or obligations of any Party hereto in respect of this Agreement which have arisen prior to such termination or expiration.

clauses.original_text:
The Parties will conduct all its dealings in a very ethical manner and with the highest business standards and Parties shall co-operate with the other for investigations including information sharing. 
Vendor has been supplied with a copy of the UTC Code of Ethics annexed herein as Annexure 4. Vendor agrees to comply with the same and shall provide a standard annual certificate annexed herein as Annexure 3. Vendor shall not offer or pay any improper payments or other consideration prohibited under the code.
Vendor agrees to comply with UTC Code on EH&S (to the extent applicable).
Vendor agrees to meet the requirements from the UTC Supplier Code of Conduct annexed herein as Annexure 5, including:
Complying at all times with applicable law, including laws prohibiting collusion, conflicts of interests, corruption, and unfair competition; 
Refraining (directly or indirectly) at all times from offering, promising, attempting to provide, or providing:
any Corrupt Payment; or
any Otis/ UTC employee or Government Official, any ownership or financial interest  in the Vendor;
Promptly and accurately recording in its Books and Records all transactions and expenses related to its work for Otis/ UT
Vendor represents that it is not a denied party under any Indian, US or international sanctions regime. It shall notify Otis immediately if it breaches this representation. Otis has a right to suspend or terminate this Agreement in event of breach of this representation.

matching_standard_clause.title: SECURITY TESTING (APPLICABLE FOR ONLY DIGITAL PAYMENT APPLICATIONS)
matching_standard_clause.text:
The Vendor shall conduct security testing such as Vulnerability Assessment (VA) and Penetration Testing (PT) and Source-Code Review of their digital payment application to ensure that the application is secure for processing transactions while preserving confidentiality and integrity of the data that is stored and transmitted through it. Such testing should comply with OWASP standards.
Source-Code Review should include a process which ensures that the product/version/module/application functions in the manner that it is intended to, addressing known flaws/threats due to insecure coding and that the product/version/module/application is free of known vulnerabilities, malwares and any covert channels in the Source-Code.
The internal/external VA shall be conducted at least on a half-yearly basis and PT and Source-Code Review shall be conducted at least on a yearly basis during the subsistence of this Agreement. 
In addition to the above, internal/external VA/PT shall be conducted as and when any major change is performed in the application or infrastructure or when any new application or infrastructure is introduced.
Upon completion of VA/PT/Source-Code Review, Vendor shall submit a detailed report of the findings for the scope of systems catering to KMBL. Thereafter, identified vulnerabilities must be rectified by Vendor in a time-bound manner as may be mutually agreed with the Bank. Cost of such rectification shall be borne by the Vendor. Service Provider shall submit a final closure report post remediation of vulnerabilities.
If the Vendor fails to carry out the testing and assessments as aforesaid, it shall be treated as a material breach of this Agreement and the Vendor shall also be liable to pay a penalty in the form of service credits. Each day of default or part thereof in compliance will add 1 day of free service credits in favour of the Bank. If the default continues for a period more than 30 days, each day of default or part thereof beyond the period of 30 days will add 2 days of free service credits in favour of the Bank and if the default continues beyond that; the Bank will be entitled to levy penalty at such amount per day of default which will be equivalent to twice the cost of Service Charges proportionate for the period of default.
The Service Provider shall impart cyber security training and awareness (via dedicated training, awareness mailers etc.) to its employees/personnel assigned for working on KMBL’s scope of operations and maintain results of the same periodically. The Service Provider shall further ensure that such employees/personnel are also made aware of applicable law, policies, regulations and procedures related to cyber security including but not limited to the same prescribed by the RBI.

clauses.original_text:
Any and all disputes, controversies and conflicts (‘Disputes’) arising out of this Agreement, its enforcement, execution or validity, between the Parties or arising out of or relating to or in connection with this Agreement or the performance or non-performance of the rights and obligations set forth herein or the breach, termination, invalidity or interpretation thereof shall be referred for arbitration in accordance with the terms of the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996 or any amendments thereof. 
Prior to arbitration, the Parties shall attempt to settle the dispute/s through mutual negotiation and discussions for 30 days. 
The place of arbitration shall be Mumbai and the language used in the arbitral proceedings shall be English. Arbitration shall be conducted by a sole arbitrator jointly appointed by the Parties.
The arbitral award shall be in writing and shall be final and binding on each party.
During pendency of arbitration, Parties shall continue to perform their respective obligations.

matching_standard_clause.title: 7. GOVERNING LAW, JURISDICTION & ARBITRATION
matching_standard_clause.text:
This Agreement shall be governed and construed by and in accordance with the laws of India and any action brought under this Agreement will, subject to the Arbitration Clause referred to below, be brought in the court of appropriate jurisdiction located in Bangalore, India.
Disputes between the parties in connection with or arising out of the existence, validity, construction, performance, and termination of this agreement may first be resolved amicably between them.  Should such an amicable settlement be not possible, the same may be settled by arbitration in accordance with the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996. The Arbitration Panel shall comprise of three Arbitrators. Each Party shall nominate one Arbitrator and third/presiding Arbitrator shall be nominated/appointed by both the said Arbitrators by mutual consensus. Such arbitration shall be held at Bangalore subject to the jurisdiction of the courts in the city of Bengaluru and the arbitration proceedings shall be conducted in English Language. The decision of the Arbitrator shall be final and binding on both the parties.

Preamble
The principal intends to award, under laid down organizational procedures, contract/s for hiring of Agency for IT Projects- Milestone basis. The principal values full compliance with all relevant laws of the land, rules, regulations, economic use of resources and of fairness / transparency in its relations with its Bidder(s) and / or Contractor(s). 
In order to achieve these goals, the principal will appoint an Independent External Monitor (IEM), who will monitor the tender process and the execution of the contract for compliance with the principles mentioned above. 
Section 
1 – Commitments of the Principal 
(1) The principal commits itself to take all measures necessary to prevent corruption and to observe the following principles: - 
No employee of the principal, personally or through family members, will in connection with the tender for, or the execution of a contract, demand, take a promise for or accept, for self or third person, any material or immaterial benefit which the person is not legally entitled to. 
The principal will, during the tender process treat all Bidder(s) with equity and reason. The principal will in, before and during the tender process, provide to all Bidder(s) the same information and will not provide to any Bidder(s) confidential / additional information through which the Bidder(s) could obtain an advantage in relation to the tender process or the contract execution. 
The principal will exclude from the process all known prejudiced persons.
(2) If the Principal obtains information on the conduct of any of its employees which is a criminal offence under the IPC/PC Act, or if there be a substantive suspicion in this regard, the principal will inform the Chief Vigilance Officer and in addition can initiate disciplinary actions.
Section 2 – Commitments of the Bids/Contractor(s) 
(1)The Bidder(s)/Contractor(s) commit themselves to take all measures necessary to prevent corruption. He commits himself to observe the following principles during his participation in the tender process and during the contract execution. 
The Bidder(s)/Contractor(s) will not, directly or through any other person or firm, offer, promise, or give to any of the Principal’s employees involved in the tender process or the execution of the contract or to any third person any material or other benefit which he/she is not legally entitled to, in order to obtain in exchange any advantage of any kind whatsoever during the tender process or during the execution of the contract. 
The Bidder(s)/Contractor(s) will not enter with other Bidders into any undisclosed agreement or understanding, whether formal or informal. This applies to prices, specifications, certifications, subsidiary contracts, submission or non-submission of bids or any other actions to restrict competitiveness or to introduce cartelization in the bidding process. 
The Bidder(s)/Contractor(s) will not commit any offence under the relevant IPC/PC Act; further the Bidder(s) / Contractor(s) will not use improperly, for purposes of competition or personal gain, or pass on to others, any information or document provided by the principal as part of the business relationship, regarding plans, technical proposals, and business details, including information contained or transmitted electronically. 
The Bidder(s)/Contractor(s) of foreign origin shall disclose the name and address of the Agents / representatives in India, if any. Similarly, the Bidder(s)/Contractor(s) of Indian Nationality shall furnish the name and address of the foreign principals, if any. Further details as mentioned in the “Guidelines on Indian Agents of Foreign Bidders” shall be disclosed by the Bidder(s) / Contractor(s). Further, as mentioned in the Guidelines all the payments made to the Indian agent/representative must be in Indian Rupees only. 
The Bidder(s)/Contractor(s) will, when presenting his bid, disclose any and all payments he has made, is committed to, or intends to make to agents, brokers, or any other intermediaries in connection with the award of the contract. 
(2) The Bidder(s) / Contractor(s) will not instigate third persons to commit offences outlines above or be an accessory to such offences. 
Section 3 – Disqualification from tender process and exclusion from future contract 
If the Bidder(s) / Contractor(s), before award or during execution has committed a transgression through a violation of Section 2 of integrity pact, above or in any other form such as to put his reliability or credibility in question, the Principal is entitled to disqualify the Bidder(s) / Contractor(s) from the tender process or take action as per the procedure mentioned in the “Guidelines on Banning of business dealing”. 
Section 4 – Compensation for Damages
(1) If the Principal has disqualified the Bidder(s) from the tender process prior to the award according to Section 3 of integrity pact, the principal is entitled to demand and recover the damages equivalent to Earnest Money Deposit / Bid Security. 
(2) If the Principal has terminated the contract according to Section 3 of integrity pact, or if the principal is entitled to terminate the contract according to Section 3 of integrity pact, the principal shall be entitled to demand and recover from the Contractor liquidated damages of the Contract value or the amount equivalent to Performance Bank Guarantee.

matching_standard_clause.title: SERVICE PROVIDER RESOURCES
matching_standard_clause.text:
Service Provider  shall depute some employees/personnel as key persons (”Key Person”) who, on the basis of their knowledge and experience, are of great importance to the proper fulfillment of Service Provider  obligations and KMBL’s requirements.
Service Provider  shall make the Key Person/other identified Service Provider employees/personnel available as required by KMBL, for as long as may be necessary during the Term of this Agreement for providing the Services hereunder.
In the event of removal or reassignment by Service Provider of Service Provider employees/personnel/Key Person, Service Provider shall give 30 (thirty) days prior written notice to KMBL and provide an equivalent replacement to KMBL within the aforementioned timeline. Vendor must ensure that such removal/reassignment should not affect the performance of Services hereunder.
All Key Person/duly authorized personnel/representatives/employees/agents/contractors of Service Provider deputed to provide Services under this Agreement shall be covered under the terms and conditions of this Agreement. Although, Service Provider shall continue to be primarily liable for breaches committed under this Agreement.
Where KMBL demands replacement of a Key Person/other identified Service Provider employees/personnel, if in the opinion of KMBL, the performance or conduct of the resource is or has been unsatisfactory, Service Provider shall replace the Key Person/other identified Service Provider employees/personnel  with a person approved by KMBL as per clause 14.3 of the Agreement.
Service Provider employees/personnel assigned to provide Services under this Agreement shall continue to be Service Provider employees at all times. Hence, Service Provider shall discharge all its obligations as an employer under applicable labor and industrial laws, regulations, rules and ordinances; whether Central or State Government, Body or Authority with respect to its employees/personnel who are assigned to provide Services for KMBL under this Agreement. Service Provider shall also discharge all its financial obligation towards these employees/personnel including but not limited to wages and any other statutory or contractual amounts and benefits to which these employees/personnel are entitled to.
COVENANTS, DUTIES AND OBLIGATIONS OF THE SERVICE PROVIDER
The Service Provider undertakes and assures that the Service Provider, its employees, staff or the personnel while performing its functions on the premises of KMBL shall strictly adhere to the security/access instruction/restrictions and code of conduct/guidelines prescribed by KMBL from time to time.
Service Provider may be provided access to premises of KMBL and allowed use of the equipment or facilities for fulfilling its obligations in terms of this Agreement. The Service Provider agrees not to claim any right, title and interest of any nature whatsoever in the office and/or the equipment or facilities provided by KMBL, at any point of time during the currency of this Agreement or after its expiry/termination.  
The Service Provider, at the requirement of KMBL, shall provide a list (with photograph and other details, including but not limited to bio-data, residence proof, identity proof, previous employment details) of individuals, employees, agents, contractors, representatives or personnel/persons assigned to perform the Services under this Agreement on behalf of the Service Provider and shall immediately notify KMBL in writing of any changes in the list. As and when the foregoing details are updated, Service Provider shall provide the same to KMBL.
The Service Provider shall depute its duly authorized personnel to assist KMBL on a regular basis, meet regularly with KMBL’s personnel to discuss, monitor and review the progress and performance of the Services. KMBL shall have access to the Service Provider at all times for day-to-day queries/clarifications and information that KMBL may seek.
Service Provider shall not deal with any third party in a manner that would result in a conflict of interest or be detrimental to the interest of KMBL.
The Service Provider shall ensure that its employees/personnel shall at all times conduct themselves within the parameters prescribed by KMBL and shall not commit, abet or permit the commission of any illegal act while working in the course of this Agreement and in the event of any illegal act being committed or abetted, Service Provider shall be liable for all consequences thereof and KMBL, shall not be liable either directly or indirectly.
The Service Provider shall carry out its responsibilities in accordance with recognized professional standards and ethics. The Service Provider shall exercise all reasonable care and diligence in the performance of its obligations under this Agreement.
The Service Provider shall remain fully responsible for all acts of its contractors/sub-contractors/employees/agents/personnel/representatives at all times. Nothing in this Agreement shall create any contractual or other relationship between KMBL and such contractors/sub-contractors/employees/agents/personnel/representatives or any obligation on the part of KMBL towards such contractors/sub-contractors/employees/agents/personnel/representatives.
The Service Provider shall comply with and maintain all the registers and records required to be maintained under, various Labour enactments and rules framed there under with respect to its employees.
Service Provider shall be solely responsible to redress any industrial/labour dispute, instituted by it’s employees/personnel either directly or indirectly, against KMBL or any of its directors, officers or Affiliates in respect of or in connection with this Agreement or otherwise.
It is, hereby, clarified that:
The persons deployed by the Service Provider to discharge its obligations under this Agreement shall be its responsibility for all purposes and KMBL shall not be held liable in any manner in respect thereof.
None of the employee/personnel of the Service Provider are/shall be stationed permanently at KMBL’s premises and they shall visit KMBL’s premises only as and when any Service is required as mentioned in this Agreement.
The Service Provider and its employee/personnel are not providing this Service exclusively to KMBL, but are also attending to other customers for same/similar services.
The Service Provider shall procure from its employees/personnel, as KMBL may require, an undertaking/non-disclosure agreement to not disclose to any third party any Confidential Information or information concerning the business of KMBL, and take such steps at Service Provider’s own expense as KMBL, may direct in order to enforce or restrain any breach of the terms of any such undertaking.
Neither the Service Provider nor its representatives/employees/personnel shall, at any time, use or attempt to use KMBL’s Trade Mark/Name or Logo for any purpose including for the purpose of this Agreement unless authorized by KMBL, in writing. 
It is further expressly clarified and agreed that in case of death or bodily injury to any employee/personnel appointed by Service Provider while carrying out any of the obligations under this Agreement, the Service Provider shall be solely responsible for any monetary compensation payable to its employees/personnel.  
The Service Provider or any person connected with it will not represent KMBL in any court, tribunal or commission of enquiry or in any other forum whatsoever without the prior written permission of KMBL. It shall not have any authority to enter into any agreement, compromise, arrangement or understanding on behalf of KMBL or create binding obligations on KMBL. Service Provider shall make no statement, representation or claim and shall give no warranty to any person in respect of the business of KMBL which may give the impression that it has such powers or authority or that it is the agent of KMBL, save as may be specifically authorized in writing by KMBL.
KMBL shall have a right to immediately notify Reserve Bank of India or other statutory/regulatory authorities in the event of any breach of security and leakage of Confidential Information or any personal data/sensitive personal information/personally identifiable information. Further, the Service Provider agrees that in the event there are any requirements emanating from change in applicable law or as may be directed or required by the RBI, Government of India or the Bank, at any future point in time, the Bank shall prescribe and intimate the same to the Service Provider and upon the happening of the same, such prescription shall automatically be deemed to be applicable and mandatory to the Service Provider.
The Service Provider shall provide Services in compliance with the applicable laws (including but not limited Information Technology Act, 2000 and rules made thereunder, as amended, modified or substituted from time to time). 
The Service Provider shall ensure that, at all times during the Term of this Agreement, while its employees, staff or the personnel are at the KMBL’s premises, they shall;
act diligently, ethically, soberly and honestly;
not consume alcohol/be under the influence of alcohol/any intoxicant.
not take or use any drug, unless prescribed by a medical practitioner or lawfully available without prescription and used in accordance with directions.
comply with all occupational health or safety policies of KMBL including (but not limited to) those relating to a smoke free environment.
not be engaged or involved in any business apart from the provision of the Services whilst on KMBL’s premises or otherwise performing the Services on behalf of the KMBL.
not to commit any criminal offence and not otherwise breach any law or regulation which could adversely affect the interests of the KMBL or the provisions of the Services.
not to sexually harass any person or unlawfully engage in discriminatory behavior.
not to represent in any way that they are the employees of KMBL.
carry and display at all times appropriate identification and 
not otherwise act in any manner which could disrupt or adversely affect KMBL’s business, reputation, interests or goodwill.
The Service Provider shall immediately notify KMBL, in writing, of any event which may result in or which may give reason to believe that there may be a work stoppage, slowdown, labour dispute, strike, any labour disruption or other impediments or disruptions in the due performance of the obligations of the Service Provider under this Agreement. The Service Provider shall forthwith submit report of the events to KMBL, and the Service Provider agrees that notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement in the event of any of the eventualities mentioned hereinabove KMBL shall have a right to terminate this Agreement forthwith.
The Service Provider shall ensure that KMBL customer’s information, documents, records and assets in the possession of the Service Provider can be clearly identified and isolated.

clauses.original_text:
Section 5 – Previous transgression 
(1) The Bidder declares that no previous transgressions occurred in the last three years with any other Company in any country conforming to the anti-corruption approach or with any Public Sector Enterprise in India that could justify his exclusion from the tender process. 
(2) If the Bidder makes incorrect statement on this subject, he can be disqualified from the tender process or action can be taken as per the procedure mentioned in “Guidelines on Banning of business dealings”. 
Section 6 – Equal treatment of all Bidders / Contractors / Subcontractors 
(1) The Bidder(s) / Contractor(s) undertakes(s) to demand from his subcontractors a commitment in conformity with this Integrity Pact. 
(2) The principal will enter into agreements with identical conditions as this one with all Bidders and Contractors. 
(3) The principal will disqualify from the tender process all bidders who do not sign this Pact or violate its provisions. 
Section 7 – Criminal charges against violating Bidder(s) / Contractor(s) / Subcontractor(s) 
If the Principal obtains knowledge of conduct of a Contractor or Subcontractor, or of an employee or a representative or an associate of a Bidder, Contractor or Subcontractor which constitutes corruption, or if the principal has substantive suspicion in this regard, the principal will inform the same to the Chief Vigilance Officer. 
Section 8 – Pact Duration 
(1) Pact becomes effective on signing & submission with bid by bidder 
(2) For the successful bidder, the Integrity Pact ends after 10 months from last payment made to the successful bidder 
(3) For unsuccessful bidders, valid for six months after award of contract 
If any claim is made / lodged during this time, the same shall be binding and continue to be valid despite the lapse of this pact as specified above, unless it is discharged / determined by Purchaser.

matching_standard_clause.title: RELATED COMPANIES & AFFILIATES
matching_standard_clause.text:
Affiliates/Related Companies of the Company including any affiliates or subsidiaries of the Company may use the Services(s)/deliverable(s) delivered by the Service Provider under this Agreement, subject to the terms of the Agreement.
Provided that the Parties may amend or alter the list of ABC Companies from time to time, by amending the provisions. 
If any ABC Company wish to use the Service(s)/ deliverable(s) delivered by Service Provider pursuant to this Agreement, such ABC Company may do so subject to the other provisions of this Agreement. 
Each ABC Company shall directly make payment to Service Provider for the use of the Service(s)/ deliverable(s) as per the “Consideration” clause as Clause 3 in the Agreement and in accordance with the SoW as agree upon and executed between the Service Provider & ABC Company. 
This Agreement shall be deemed to automatically apply to the Service Provider and such ABC Company with such ABC Company taking the place of the Company hereunder (and exercising and being subject to the Company's rights and obligations).
If an ABC Company disputes the application of this Agreement to itself, any use by such ABC Company of the application(s)/deliverable(s) or Services delivered by the Service Provider shall be and shall be automatically deemed to be invalid use thereof Unless otherwise agreed by the concerned Parties in writing, the expiry or termination of this Agreement between the Service Provider and the Company shall not affect the term of such independent SoW signed between the Service Provider and such Related Companies.

(3) The principal will disqualify from the tender process all bidders who do not sign this Pact or violate its provisions. 
Section 7 – Criminal charges against violating Bidder(s) / Contractor(s) / Subcontractor(s) 
If the Principal obtains knowledge of conduct of a Contractor or Subcontractor, or of an employee or a representative or an associate of a Bidder, Contractor or Subcontractor which constitutes corruption, or if the principal has substantive suspicion in this regard, the principal will inform the same to the Chief Vigilance Officer. 
Section 8 – Pact Duration 
(1) Pact becomes effective on signing & submission with bid by bidder 
(2) For the successful bidder, the Integrity Pact ends after 10 months from last payment made to the successful bidder 
(3) For unsuccessful bidders, valid for six months after award of contract 
If any claim is made / lodged during this time, the same shall be binding and continue to be valid despite the lapse of this pact as specified above, unless it is discharged / determined by Purchaser.
differences.revised:
Affiliates/Related Companies of the Company including any affiliates or subsidiaries of the Company may use the Services(s)/deliverable(s) delivered by the Service Provider under this Agreement, subject to the terms of the Agreement.
Provided that the Parties may amend or alter the list of ABC Companies from time to time, by amending the provisions. 
If any ABC Company wish to use the Service(s)/ deliverable(s) delivered by Service Provider pursuant to this Agreement, such ABC Company may do so subject to the other provisions of this Agreement. 
Each ABC Company shall directly make payment to Service Provider for the use of the Service(s)/ deliverable(s) as per the “Consideration” clause as Clause 3 in the Agreement and in accordance with the SoW as agree upon and executed between the Service Provider & ABC Company. 
This Agreement shall be deemed to automatically apply to the Service Provider and such ABC Company with such ABC Company taking the place of the Company hereunder (and exercising and being subject to the Company's rights and obligations).
If an ABC Company disputes the application of this Agreement to itself, any use by such ABC Company of the application(s)/deliverable(s) or Services delivered by the Service Provider shall be and shall be automatically deemed to be invalid use thereof Unless otherwise agreed by the concerned Parties in writing, the expiry or termination of this Agreement between the Service Provider and the Company shall not affect the term of such independent SoW signed between the Service Provider and such Related Companies.

clauses.original_text:
Softcell Technologies Global Private Limited, a company having its registered office at303 B-Wing, Commercial-1 Kohinoor City, Kirol Road, Kurla (W) Mumbai - 400070 Maharashtra, India(hereinafter referred to as “Softcell”or “Channel Partner”, which expression shall, unless it be repugnant or contrary to the context or meaning thereof, mean and include its, successors and assigns) of the THIRD PART; 

HDFC ERGO General Insurance Company Limited,Softcelland CloudSEK are hereinafter individually referred to as the “Party” and collectively as the “Parties”.      

WHEREAS, 

CloudSEK is an AI-driven Digital Risk Management Protection enterprise engaged in the business of providing SaaS-based products to helps its clients assess their security posture. 

HDFC ERGO General Insurance Company Limited is registered with with the Insurance Regulatory & Development Authority under the Insurance Act, 1938 (4 of 1938) (hereinafter referred to as the “Act”) as ageneral insurance company, and accordingly is engaged in the business of general insurance and related activities, providing a comprehensive range of general insurance products. 

Softcell works in the areas of IT Security, IT Infrastructure, Cloud and Engineering Services, including reselling of software licenses and hardware and implementation services  and has made representations to CloudSEK that it possesses requisite expertise and that it has extensive and close contacts/business relations with various business/commercial/merchant establishments in the authorized territory (as defined below) and wishes to use the said business contacts/relations together with its infrastructure, expertise and personnel to secure customers for CloudSEK’ s software solutions (“Products”) and related services, by marketing the Products and providing related services in order to exploit the full potential for the software products and services (the “Purpose”).  

CloudSEK therefore proposes to appoint the Channel Partner for the Purpose mentioned above, in the territory of Maharashtra (“Authorised Territory”) 

Service Provider has represented to HDFC ERGO that it has the necessary authorizations to provide the Services vide its CloudSEK XVigil the Platform under SaaS model along with necessary infrastructure and authorization for providing Support Services. Further, Softcell has represented to HDFC ERGO that it has the necessary authorization from the Service Provider to generate invoice(s) and receive payment for the Services rendered by the Service Provider. The responsibility of providing services will rest with CloudSEK, to provide the CloudSEK Services vide the Platform under SaaS model along with the necessary authorizations required for providing Support Services. It is hereby clarified that Services to be delivered to End User Client are under the direct control and supervision of the Service Provider only. 

Based on the afore-mentioned representations and the representations hereunder in this Agreement provided by the Service Provider and HDFC ERGO has agreed to appoint the Service Provider for providing Services (as defined in Annexure I – Part B - CloudSEK’s XVigil Statement of Work (SOW) and Service Level Agreement) and also with the engagement of Softcell by Service Provider for generating invoices and receiving payment for Services, processing of financial transaction through them for the Services delivered by CloudSEK on the terms and conditions contained in this Agreement. 

NOW IT IS HEREBY AGREED BY AND BETWEEN THE PARTIES HERETO AS FOLLOWS:

matching_standard_clause.title: BY AND BETWEEN
matching_standard_clause.text:
Fullerton India Credit Company Limited, a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 1956 and having its registered office at Megh Towers, 3rd Floor, Old No. 307, New No. 165, PH Road, Maduravoyal, Chennai, Tamil Nadu – 600 095 and its corporate office at Floor 6, B Wing, Supreme Business Park, Powai, Mumbai - 400076 (hereinafter referred to as  “FICCL” which term shall so far as the context admits be deemed to mean and include its  successors and assigns) of the ONE PART;
AND
THE PERSONS as more particularly described in Schedule I (hereinafter referred to as the “Service Provider”) of the OTHER PART;
FICCL and the Service Provider shall hereinafter be collectively referred to as “Parties” and individually as “Party”.
WHEREAS:
The Service Provider is engaged in providing services to various entities and organizations, in the ordinary course of its business and has offered to provide specialized Services to FICCL more particularly described in Schedule II (hereinafter referred to as “Services”); 
FICCL has agreed to enter into an arrangement with the Service Provider so as to obtain Services (as defined below), on the terms and conditions as contained in this Agreement. 
NOW THIS AGREEMENT WITNESSETH AS FOLLOWS:
SERVICES: 
The Service Provider shall provide specialized Services to FICCL more particularly described in Schedule II (hereinafter referred to as “Services”). 
FICCL may initiate a request for the Services by executing an order (each, an "Order") specifying the Services desired. The Service Provider shall provide Services at/pertaining to places/offices/ branches mentioned in the Schedule IV attached hereto. Any addition/ deletion to the list of locations contained in Schedule IV may be done in writing with mutual consent of the Parties. The terms and conditions of this Agreement shall apply to and govern all Orders accepted by Service Provider hereunder, except that Orders may include other terms and conditions which are inconsistent with the terms and conditions of this Agreement or which are mutually agreed to in writing by FICCL and Service Provider.
FICCL may propose changes to the scope, nature or time schedule of the Services being performed under this Agreement. The Parties will mutually agree in writing to any proposed changes, including adjustments to fees and expenses as a result of any changes to the Services.
The Service Provider warrants to FICCL that the materials and services to be delivered or rendered hereunder will be of the kind and quality designated, and shall meet specifications or performance level as mutually agreed between the Parties from time to time. The performance of each individual Service will be monitored. The benchmarks, targets and metrics to be used in the measurement of performance levels will be as mutually agreed between the Parties from time to time. Service review meetings will be held on periodic basis to monitor the service and performance level. Reports on actual service levels achieved will be provided to FICCL within ten working days after the end of each month. The said reports will cover each service component delivered and the performance achieved compared with target. 
Service Provider acknowledges and agrees that this Agreement does not constitute an exclusive agreement between FICCL and Service Provider nor does FICCL commit or guarantee any volume of availment of Services or rupee amount hereunder.
TERM:
This Agreement is effective from the date as specified in Schedule I attached hereto (“Effective Date”).
This Agreement shall continue in effect for a period as specified in Schedule I hereunder (the "Initial Term"), unless earlier terminated pursuant to the provision contained in this Agreement or unless extended by FICCL at its option for further period as mutually agreed between the parties (“Extended Period”) following the expiration of the Initial Term or extended on a month-to-month basis in accordance with sub-section hereof. FICCL shall notify Service Provider 1 (one) month before the expiration of the Initial Term, of its intent to extend the Initial Term. The Initial Term and the Extended Period, if any, together shall hereinafter be referred to as the "Term". In the event FICCL exercises the option to extend the Term, the charges/ fees for the Extended Period shall remain the same unless mutually agreed between the Parties.
After expiration of the Initial Term, in the event the option to extend has not been exercised by FICCL, and in the event this Agreement is not extended by written agreement of the Parties and is not otherwise terminated as provided herein, this Agreement shall continue in full force and effect on a month-to-month basis till the date of execution of any document for extension of the Term or until terminated by Parties on no less than 30 (thirty) days' prior notice. During such continuation of the Agreement the terms and conditions herein recorded shall be valid, subsisting and remain binding on both Parties.
SERVICES FEE AND BILLING:
In consideration of said Services to be provided by the Service Provider, FICCL shall pay charges/fees (“Charges”) as specified and in the manner mentioned in the Schedule III hereunder. The Charges for the Services shall not be subject to change during the Term of this Agreement unless expressly provided for in this Agreement. Invoices shall be consolidated and submitted by Service Provider on a monthly basis and shall be due and payable not later than the 30th day from the date of receipt of the invoice by FICCL, subject to deduction of taxes as per applicable laws. There will be no late payment service charge of any kind. FICCL may, upon notice to Service Provider, withhold payment for Services that fail to meet the minimum performance standards as stipulated from time to time by FICCL and/or question any items invoiced to FICCL. Such non-payment shall not constitute a default or breach of this Agreement. In the event of any dispute between FICCL and Service Provider with respect to the invoiced Services or other related matters, FICCL shall pay the undisputed amount and FICCL and Service Provider shall promptly seek to resolve the disputed matters.
Service Provider shall be responsible for and pay all taxes on Goods and Services, levies, duties, assessments and deductions of every nature required by law in connection with the provision of Services under this Agreement. 
All invoices shall be numbered and dated and Service Provider agrees not to repeat the invoice number for at least a 7 (seven) year period. In addition to statutory requirements, each invoice shall contain, at a minimum, the following information:
The time period covered by the invoice;
An itemized listing of Services provided and the costs associated therewith by FICCL;
Sub-totals;
Taxes on Goods and Services wherever applicable; and 
Additional information reasonably requested by FICCL from time to time.

clauses.original_text:
CloudSEK hereby appoints the Channel Partner to render the Services as mentioned in Annexure I – Part A to this Agreement (“Services”) within the Authorised Territory and the Channel Partner hereby accepts the appointment. 
The Channel Partner agrees that, the Products will be marketed and promoted only as 
Products owned by CloudSEK, bearing the CloudSEK brand and in no event will the Channel Partner represent that the Product is that of its own or associated with it. All rights and title in and to the Products and Documentation, including all Intellectual Property Rights inherent 
therein, belong exclusively to CloudSEK and/or its licensors.  No rights are granted to Channel Partner or to the End User Client other than as expressly set forth in this Agreement. 
Even though the Channel Partner collects license fees paid by HDFC ERGO, on behalf of CloudSEK, this Agreement does not in any manner result in the Channel Partner being appointed as an agent of CloudSEK. The Channel Partner shall not in any event make any representations, promises or undertakings on behalf of CloudSEK, that would bind CloudSEK, unless CloudSEK agrees to the same in writing in each specific circumstance that requires the Channel Partner to make any such representations, promises or undertakings.  
The Channel Partner shall ensure and duly inform HDFC ERGO that any engagement between 
Service Provider and HDFC ERGO shall be subject to the standard licensing terms of CloudSEK.  
The Channel Partner shall clarify to HDFC ERGO that the license to the Product will be activated only upon CloudSEK duly receiving payment in relation to the same from the Channel Partner. The Channel Partner agrees and acknowledges in this regard that the Channel Partner shall be solely responsible and liable in the event any claims arise out of or in relation to a Product license not being activated for an End User Client on account of CloudSEK not receiving payment from the Channel Partner. CloudSEK shall not in any manner be held responsible or liable for the same. 
Upon the End User Client entering into the license agreement with CloudSEK, CloudSEK may from time to time require Channel Partner to provide certain additional services/ undertake certain duties in relation to the said End User Client on mutually agreed terms.  
The Channel Partner shall as part of the Services, be responsible for collecting any fees payable by the End User Client  in relation to the Products and services duly remitting the same to CloudSEK within 7 (seven) days from the receipt of the fees from the End User Client. 
The obligations of CloudSEK shall be set out in Annexure I. 
It is clarified herein that CloudSEK’s engagement of the Channel Partner is non-exclusive in nature and notwithstanding anything set forth in this Agreement, the Channel Partner hereby agrees and acknowledges that CloudSEK may appoint one or more channel partners for the Purpose within the Authorised Territory. 
Except to the extent such restrictions are prohibited under applicable law, Client and Channel Partner shall not, nor allow a third party to, decompile, disassemble, or otherwise reverse engineer the Products or any software made available in connection with the Products.  Channel Partner and Client may not use the Products or any CloudSEK’s Confidential Information that it may acquire in connection with this Agreement to develop, have developed, assist in the development of, support, or invest in, directly or indirectly, any product which has, entirely or partially, the same functions as any of the Products or which would be in direct or indirect competition with any of the Products.  CloudSEK remains the owner and grantor of the Products and Services, the provider of the Products and Services, and any EUSA/ EULA is made directly between CloudSEK and the End User Client. 
Client shall not maintain more than one Account for their organization/business entity. Every organization is permitted to use and maintain only a single Account. Client may access the Platform and Services using a single user Account via multiple access points or as multiple user/accounts as per the plan chosen by them. Client may allow Client employees (Subusers) 
to access the Platform via Client Account on Client behalf. Client shall ensure that Client Account is used by personnel only from Client organization or authorized by their organization to access such account.  

Client agrees not to provide any access to Client Account to any third-party vendors without CloudSEK’s approval 

Client shall not use our Services for any unauthorized, illegal or fraudulent purpose nor shall Client violate any laws application to Client jurisdiction. Client shall not modify, adapt or hack the Service or modify another website so as to falsely imply that it is associated with CloudSEK. Client shall not resell the Service to any third party as a private label or with the inclusion of a mark-up fee without our expressed written consent. 

CloudSEK reserves the right to make changes to the functionality or the documentation of the Platform and the provision of Services from time to time. CloudSEK shall perform all necessary server management and maintenance services with respect to the Platform at no additional cost to Client. 

CloudSEK shall provide service to client with a system availability of 99% during each calendar month. CloudSEK may take the Service offline for scheduled maintenance and would provide client the schedule/notification of the same 24-48 hours prior (This scheduled maintenance time will not be counted as system availability). CloudSEK shall use reasonable efforts to make the Services available to Client, at all times through the Platform. However, as the Services are provided over the Internet, data and cellular networks, the quality and availability of the same may be affected by factors outside CloudSEK’s control. Therefore, CloudSEK shall not be liable for non-availability of the Services time scenarios as mentioned above which is outside of CloudSEK’s control. CloudSEK may try and restore access to the Platform and Services on a best reasonable and commercially viable basis. 

In case CloudSEK suspects or becomes aware of any breach of data integrity, systems integrity or other practices identified which may compromise the integrity of data, processes and procedures, of the Client, CloudSEK will within 24 to 48 hours report such incident to the Client.

matching_standard_clause.title: RELATED COMPANIES & AFFILIATES
matching_standard_clause.text:
Affiliates/Related Companies of the Company including any affiliates or subsidiaries of the Company may use the Services(s)/deliverable(s) delivered by the Service Provider under this Agreement, subject to the terms of the Agreement.
Provided that the Parties may amend or alter the list of ABC Companies from time to time, by amending the provisions. 
If any ABC Company wish to use the Service(s)/ deliverable(s) delivered by Service Provider pursuant to this Agreement, such ABC Company may do so subject to the other provisions of this Agreement. 
Each ABC Company shall directly make payment to Service Provider for the use of the Service(s)/ deliverable(s) as per the “Consideration” clause as Clause 3 in the Agreement and in accordance with the SoW as agree upon and executed between the Service Provider & ABC Company. 
This Agreement shall be deemed to automatically apply to the Service Provider and such ABC Company with such ABC Company taking the place of the Company hereunder (and exercising and being subject to the Company's rights and obligations).
If an ABC Company disputes the application of this Agreement to itself, any use by such ABC Company of the application(s)/deliverable(s) or Services delivered by the Service Provider shall be and shall be automatically deemed to be invalid use thereof Unless otherwise agreed by the concerned Parties in writing, the expiry or termination of this Agreement between the Service Provider and the Company shall not affect the term of such independent SoW signed between the Service Provider and such Related Companies.
