Upon the End User Client entering into the license agreement with CloudSEK, CloudSEK may from time to time require Channel Partner to provide certain additional services/ undertake certain duties in relation to the said End User Client on mutually agreed terms. 
The Channel Partner shall as part of the Services, be responsible for collecting any fees payable by the End User Client  in relation to the Products and services duly remitting the same to CloudSEK within 7 (seven) days from the receipt of the fees from the End User Client. 
The obligations of CloudSEK shall be set out in Annexure I. 
It is clarified herein that CloudSEK’s engagement of the Channel Partner is non-exclusive in nature and notwithstanding anything set forth in this Agreement, the Channel Partner hereby agrees and acknowledges that CloudSEK may appoint one or more channel partners for the Purpose within the Authorised Territory. 
Except to the extent such restrictions are prohibited under applicable law, Client and Channel Partner shall not, nor allow a third party to, decompile, disassemble, or otherwise reverse engineer the Products or any software made available in connection with the Products. Channel Partner and Client may not use the Products or any CloudSEK’s Confidential Information that it may acquire in connection with this Agreement to develop, have developed, assist in the development of, support, or invest in, directly or indirectly, any product which has, entirely or partially, the same functions as any of the Products or which would be in direct or indirect competition with any of the Products. CloudSEK remains the owner and grantor of the Products and Services, the provider of the Products and Services, and any EUSA/ EULA is made directly between CloudSEK and the End User Client. 
Client shall not maintain more than one Account for their organization/business entity. Every organization is permitted to use and maintain only a single Account. Client may access the Platform and Services using a single user Account via multiple access points or as multiple user/accounts as per the plan chosen by them. Client may allow Client employees (Subusers) 
to access the Platform via Client Account on Client behalf. Client shall ensure that Client Account is used by personnel only from Client organization or authorized by their organization to access such account. 

Client agrees not to provide any access to Client Account to any third-party vendors without CloudSEK’s approval 

Client shall not use our Services for any unauthorized, illegal or fraudulent purpose nor shall Client violate any laws application to Client jurisdiction. Client shall not modify, adapt or hack the Service or modify another website so as to falsely imply that it is associated with CloudSEK. Client shall not resell the Service to any third party as a private label or with the inclusion of a mark-up fee without our expressed written consent. 

CloudSEK reserves the right to make changes to the functionality or the documentation of the Platform and the provision of Services from time to time. CloudSEK shall perform all necessary server management and maintenance services with respect to the Platform at no additional cost to Client. 

CloudSEK shall provide service to client with a system availability of 99% during each calendar month. CloudSEK may take the Service offline for scheduled maintenance and would provide client the schedule/notification of the same 24-48 hours prior (This scheduled maintenance time will not be counted as system availability). CloudSEK shall use reasonable efforts to make the Services available to Client, at all times through the Platform. However, as the Services are provided over the Internet, data and cellular networks, the quality and availability of the same may be affected by factors outside CloudSEK’s control. Therefore, CloudSEK shall not be liable for non-availability of the Services time scenarios as mentioned above which is outside of CloudSEK’s control. CloudSEK may try and restore access to the Platform and Services on a best reasonable and commercially viable basis. 

In case CloudSEK suspects or becomes aware of any breach of data integrity, systems integrity or other practices identified which may compromise the integrity of data, processes and procedures, of the Client, CloudSEK will within 24 to 48 hours report such incident to the Client.

Provided that the Parties may amend or alter the list of ABC Companies from time to time, by amending the provisions. 
If any ABC Company wish to use the Service(s)/ deliverable(s) delivered by Service Provider pursuant to this Agreement, such ABC Company may do so subject to the other provisions of this Agreement. 
Each ABC Company shall directly make payment to Service Provider for the use of the Service(s)/ deliverable(s) as per the “Consideration” clause as Clause 3 in the Agreement and in accordance with the SoW as agree upon and executed between the Service Provider & ABC Company.

If an ABC Company disputes the application of this Agreement to itself, any use by such ABC Company of the application(s)/deliverable(s) or Services delivered by the Service Provider shall be and shall be automatically deemed to be invalid use thereof Unless otherwise agreed by the concerned Parties in writing, the expiry or termination of this Agreement between the Service Provider and the Company shall not affect the term of such independent SoW signed between the Service Provider and such Related Companies.

Payment Term: Unless otherwise agreed to in writing between the parties, Fees and payment terms shall be agreed and documented between CloudSEK, Channel Partner and the Client and/or its Affiliate(s). All amounts associated with the Client’s Account are due in full and payable in advance on half yearly basis or as agreed upon based on the plan chosen by the Client or as mutually agreed upon between the Parties within thirty (30) days upon receipt of valid and undisputed invoice. In the event of early termination, Service Provider shall refund the fees paid in advance on pro-rata basis within 15 days from the date of termination. 
Payment Methods: Fees may be paid by the Client through methods or channels of payment provided by CloudSEK through its Services. 
The Channel Partner shall generate invoices that are complete in its particulars immediately upon a Business Opportunity being converted to an End User Client. 
The Channel Partner undertakes that it shall not in any event agree that licenses to the Products or the services will be provided to the End User Client at a price which is less than what is communicated to it by CloudSEK in this regard.

matching_standard_clause.title: INDEMNIFICATION
matching_standard_clause.text:
The Reseller shall defend, indemnify, protect, save and hold harmless SG GSC from and against all claims, losses, costs, damages, expenses, action suits, proceedings, liabilities and arising from and relating to or resulting directly or indirectly from (i) breach of any terms and conditions, representations or warranties provided under this Agreement; (ii) SG GSC’s use of the licensed Software along with its documentation as per the specifications provided by the Reseller; (iii) non-payment to the Developer of the procured Software from the Reseller; (vii) for any gross negligent acts of or omission, willful misconduct, misrepresentation, fraud on part of the Reseller or its agents, employees, or sub-contractors in the performance of any of its obligations (viii) any statutory non-compliance.
It is hereby clarified that all claims relating to infringement of intellectual property rights connected with the use of the Software under this Agreement shall be addressed to the Reseller directly. In such event, the Reseller shall be responsible for coordinating with the OEM and thereby defending and indemnifying SG GSC.

clauses.original_text:
For the Purpose of this Agreement, “Confidential Information” shall mean any and all information in any form (whether or not marked or identified as confidential) including, without limitation, names of the investors, details pertaining to employees, software, source code, trade secrets, the Products themselves, marketing information, business plans, services, clients, accounts, contracts and arrangements of CloudSEK and/or its clients, vendors and/or their respective associated companies, emanating, directly or indirectly, orally (which is subsequently recorded in writing within 7 days of such disclosure by the disclosing party) or in writing, in any medium whatsoever, from CloudSEK and/or its clients and/or their respective associated companies and/or the investors of  CloudSEK or which otherwise comes into the possession of Channel Partner or Client on account of its engagement with CloudSEK or which is accessed by Channel Partner or Client, by whatever means other than information (i) which are publically available or which is already legally in the possession of the receiving party without any duty of confidentiality; or(ii) that, at the date of this Agreement or subsequently becomes public otherwise than by reason of a breach by the receiving party or any of its employees, affiliates, group entities, employees of affiliates or group entities, or professional advisers, under the terms of this Agreement; or (iii) which is generally available to the public at or after the time of its disclosure by one Party to the other Party; or (iv) which is furnished by the disclosing Party to third parties without restriction or confidential obligation. 
Parties shall maintain strict confidentiality of all the Confidential Information disclosed to it whether before or after the Effective Date of this Agreement. Parties shall disclose the Confidential Information only to its employees, advisors/personnel (“Authorized 
Representatives”) who have a bona fide need to know the same for the Purpose(s) of this Agreement. Such Authorized Representatives who have access to the Confidential Information or any part thereof shall be subject to confidentiality obligations at least as onerous as those set out in this Agreement and in any case. The Parties acknowledge that it shall at all costs be responsible and liable for the breach of confidentiality obligations by any Authorized Representatives. Parties shall neither copy nor reproduce the Confidential Information, nor shall it disclose it to any third parties, nor allow third party access to it nor shall it use it for any other purpose except for the Purpose of performing its obligations under this Agreement. Subject to the foregoing, no such Confidential Information, including the provisions of this Agreement, shall be disclosed by Receiving Party without the prior written consent of Disclosing Party, except as required by a valid order of any competent court or any other regulatory authority provided that Receiving Party shall notify, to the extent permitted under applicable law, the Disclosing Party and shall co-operate with Disclosing Party in seeking a reasonable protective order. Further, the Parties shall disclose only that part of the Confidential Information as is mandated by such order of a court or regulatory body. 
Parties shall use at least the same degree of care in safeguarding the Confidential Information of Disclosing Party as it uses for its own information of like importance, which shall not be less than a reasonable degree of care. 

The Confidential Information will be safeguarded, and Parties shall take all necessary action to protect it against misuse, loss, destruction, alterations or deletions thereof. Any violation of the same will result in irreparable and unquantifiable losses to Disclosing Party and shall entitle Disclosing Party to injunctive relief and pursue any action available to it under law or equity. 
Parties shall immediately upon discovery of any unauthorised disclosure or suspected disclosure of Confidential Information, promptly inform Disclosing Party of such disclosure in writing and immediately return all such information, in whatsoever form, including any and all copies thereof. 
The Confidential Information, the derivative information and copies thereof, in whatever form shall at all times remain the property of CloudSEK /its End User Client(s) (as the case may be) and its disclosure shall not confer on Channel Partnerany rights, licenses  (including any intellectual property rights) over the Confidential Information whatsoever beyond those contained in this Agreement. 
Further, with respect to the security of HDFC ERGO’ Data including personal and sensitive information, the Service Provider and Channel Partnerhereby agrees to the following terms – 

i.  comply with all legal & regulatory requirements as per the Applicable Laws of 
India; ii. not share any HDFC ERGO’s data with any entity located in or outside India without seeking explicit written permission from HDFC ERGO; 
notify HDFC ERGO when the Data is shared with any of its affiliates, any Government agencies or any Regulatory body as per legal / regulatory requirement; 
not share HDFC ERGO’s Data with any third party without express written consent of HDFC ERGO; 
share VA/PT reports, SOC reports and logs as desired by HDFC ERGO’s for audit purposes.  
Maintain logs of its systems and applications that associated with the access, processing, storage, communication and/or transmission of HDFC ERGO’s data. 
Share logs of its systems and applications with HDFC ERGO within 2 working days from the date of request raised by HDFC ERGO. 

With respect to the Information shared for the purpose of this Agreement, theService 
Provider and Channel Partner shall ensure strict adherence to the Information Security 
obligations detailed in Schedule B and B(i), as amended from time to time.  Service Provider and Channel Partner hereby declares that it will take all safeguards to protect the interest of HDFC ERGO. 

The obligations regarding Confidential Information contained in this Agreement shall survive any expiry or termination of this Agreement.

matching_standard_clause.title: CONFIDENTIALITY
matching_standard_clause.text:
“Confidential Information”  shall mean any information and documents shared by the Bank with the Service Provider and/or any information and documents comes in to possession of the Service Provider/Representatives and/or any other information which is developed by the Service Provider/Representatives for the Bank, which is including but not limited to confidential information and proprietary information concerning the Bank, its affiliates, subsidiaries, group companies, holding companies including and without limitation; Intellectual Property, trade secrets, secret information, technical processes, finances, software, software language codes, username and passwords, transaction information, data processing methodology, custom developed applications, dealings and method of dealings with the clients or the customers  and its employees together with any  information  relating to Bank’s suppliers, employees, agents, distributors, and customers (including personal information and/or personal sensitive information)and relationships of special trust and confidence with the clients or customers and employees.
The Service Provider shall use the Confidential Information solely for purposes of this Agreement, and shall not disclose to any third party without the prior written consent of the Bank.
The Service Provider agrees and undertakes to ensure that in case Service Provider share any Confidential Information with its affiliates, group companies, associates, subsidiaries, holding company and their respective employees and professional advisors (“Representatives”) and such Representatives shall be bound by the confidentiality obligations under this Agreement and they shall use the Confidential Information only for the purpose of this Agreement.
The Service Provider also agrees that it shall share Confidential Information with the Representatives only to such extent as may be necessary for the performance of the Service Providers obligations under this Agreement. The Service Provider shall inform the confidential nature of Confidential Information to the Representatives and the Service Provider shall ensure that such Representatives shall execute a confidentiality and non-disclosure agreement containing restrictions as stringent as those contained herein to protect the Confidential Information of the Bank.
The Service Provider shall take all measures to protect the confidentiality and security of the Confidential Information and avoid the unauthorized use, disclosure, publication, or dissemination of the Confidential Information; provided, however, that such measures shall be no less stringent than measures taken to protect its own confidential and proprietary information but in no event less than reasonable degree of care.  The Service Provider shall be responsible for breach of any provision of this Agreement by its Representatives. The Service Provider shall and shall ensure that its Representatives shall keep all Confidential Information confidential at all times during the Term and after termination of this Agreement.
The Service Provider agrees and understands that the title to the Confidential Information and Intellectual Property shall always remain with the Bank, and this Agreement shall not be construed to grant to the Service Provider any patents, licenses or similar rights to such Confidential Information and Intellectual Property.
The Service Provider confirms and undertakes that it shall ensure that confidentiality of customer information, if any, shared by the Bank during the course of availing the Service shall be maintained during the Term and even after this Agreement expires or gets terminated. The Service Provider shall be fully liable and responsible in case of breach of security and leakage of customers information.

clauses.original_text:
For the Purpose of this Agreement "Intellectual Property Rights" shall mean all rights in intellectual property, including without limitation patents, patent applications, trade and service marks, trade names, rights in designs, moral rights, copyright, topography rights, database rights, trade secrets, methodologies and techniques or any other property rights that grant similar rights as the foregoing, whether registered or not, throughout the world. 
All rights, title, and interest including Intellectual Property Rights, to any deliverables, ideas, know-how, inventions, software, Products, documentation, marketing materials, processes or any other intellectual property shared by CloudSEK under this Agreement shall be exclusive property of CloudSEK. Enabling any business transaction by using any intellectual property by Client including but not limited to the Products, the marketing material or the documentation shall not entitle any rights to the Channel Partner or to the Client and permissions to use these Intellectual Property of CloudSEK shall not construed as assignment or transfer of these rights to Channel Partner or to the Client. 
CloudSEK hereby grants the Channel Partner and Clienta limited, non-transferable, non-sublicensable, revocable right to use its trademarks, tradename and service marks, CloudSEK Platform in solely connection with the Purpose, within the scope of this Agreement and for the sole benefit of CloudSEK, for the term of this Agreement in the Authorised Territory. d. Use of marketing materials 

The Channel Partnershall use the marketing material provided by CloudSEK, strictly in accordance with CloudSEK’s guidelines on usage and subject to the obligations under this Clause 4. 
Any advertising or marketing initiative shall be undertaken by the Channel Partner only after consultation with and prior approval of CloudSEK. Any development and/or use of marketing material by the Channel Partner will be subject to CloudSEK’s inspection and prior approval. 

All intellectual property rights in brands, content, concepts, solutions, visuals,  Logo and applications or any other property(in which intellectual property rights of whatever nature subsist) that are solely developed or approved by HDFC ERGO prior to or after the date of this Agreement (irrespective of the same being utilized by the Service Provider for the purpose of providing the Services under this Agreement), shall be owned by HDFC ERGO exclusively and neither the Service Provider nor any third party shall have any rights in respect of the same other 
than the limited license to utilize such, content, concepts, visuals, logo, solutions or applications or property solely for the purpose of this Agreement, with the prior written approval of HDFC ERGO. 

CHANNEL PARTNER’S REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES: 
The Channel Partner and the Client represents and warrants that: 
It has obtained all the necessary permissions, consents and approvals required under the relevant laws to enter into this Agreement and provide the Services, and that it and the authorised persons entering into the Agreement on its behalf are under no legal impediment in this regard. 
It is in possession of all infrastructural facilities and adequate qualified personnel required to provide the Services contemplated under this Agreement and all the Services contemplated under this Agreement shall be provided in a workmanlike and professional manner. 
In the performance of this Agreement, the Channel Partner shall adhere to the instructions and policies communicated by CloudSEK. 
It shall abide by its confidentiality obligations vis a vis CloudSEK’s Confidential Information. 
It shall ensure that all the information, data, documents and records sought by CloudSEK shall be provided to it within the time limit specified by CloudSEK. 
It shall not make any representations, warranties, guarantees or enter into any agreements or contracts binding on CloudSEK, or incur any liability on behalf of CloudSEK, without prior and express consent of CloudSEK. 
That, no conflict of interest exits or is likely to arise in the performance of its obligations under this Agreement. Where during the subsistence of this Agreement, a conflict of interest or a risk of conflict of interest arises; the Channel Partner shall immediately notify CloudSEK in writing of the said conflict of interest. In the event the Channel Partner notifies CloudSEK of any conflict of interest or potential conflict of interest or Channel Partner becomes aware of any conflict of interest CloudSEK and/or the Channel Partner shall have the right to terminate this contract automatically with immediate effect. 
It shall safeguard and promote the reputation of CloudSEK and refrain from engaging in harmful or disparaging conduct including but not limited to discourteous, deceptive, misleading, unauthorised and/or unethical practices, or in any conduct adversely affecting the reputation of CloudSEK. 
Comply with the standard operating procedure and policies of CloudSEK in relation to its interactions with Business Opportunities and End Customers vis a vis the Product and collection, storage and usage of personal data of such Business Opportunities and/or End User Client. 

CLIENT’S REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES: 
It has obtained all the necessary permissions, consents and approvals required under the relevant laws to enter into this Agreement and provide the Services, and that it and the authorised persons entering into the Agreement on its behalf are under no legal impediment in this regard. 
Client and its Authorized Users (i) shall not (a) modify, copy, display, republish or create derivative works based on the Products or CloudSEK materials; (b) reverse engineer the Products; (c) access or use the Products to build a competitive product or service, or copy any ideas, features, functions or graphics of the Products; (d) use the Products in any way prohibited by applicable law or that would cause either party to violate applicable law including but not limited to: (1) sending spam or other duplicative or unsolicited messages; (2) using the Products to send infringing, obscene, threatening, libellous, or other unlawful material; (3) using the Products to access blocked services; or (4) uploading to the Products or using the Products to send or store viruses, worms, time bombs, Trojan horses or other harmful or malicious code, files, scripts, agents or programs; (e) use the Products to run automated queries to external websites (since such websites may include CloudSEK IPs in their respective IP block lists); (f) interfere with or disrupt the integrity or performance of the Products or the data contained therein; (g) attempt to gain unauthorized access to the Products or its related systems or networks; (h) remove or alter any trademark, logo, copyright or other proprietary notices, legends, symbols or labels in the Products; (i) perform penetration or load testing on the Products or CloudSEK’s cloud without the prior written consent of CloudSEK and agreeing to certain conditions and requirements for such penetration or load testing; or (j) without the express prior written consent of CloudSEK, conduct any public benchmarking or comparative study or analysis involving the Products; and (ii) agree to (a) use the Products solely for its internal business purposes; and (b) only permit access to the Products by Authorized Users. 

Representations And Warranties  

While performing its obligation under this Agreement with integrity and honesty, each Party represents and warrants to the other Party as follows: 
It has taken all necessary internal, constitutional or corporate action to authorize the execution and consummation of this Agreement and it will furnish satisfactory evidence of the same upon request by the other Party. 
The execution, delivery and performance by such Party of this Agreement will not (a) violate, conflict with, result in a breach of or constitute (with or without notice or lapse of time or both) a default under any material agreement, indenture, mortgage or lease to which such Party is a party or by which it or its properties are bound; (b) constitute a violation by such Party of any laws or regulations applicable to it; (c) violate any provision of its articles of association or by-laws (or similar governing 
documents); or (d) violate any order, judgment, injunction or decree of any court, arbitrator or governmental body against or binding such Party. 
It does not require any consent, approval, authorization or permission of, any governmental or regulatory authority in connection with this Agreement or the transactions and activities contemplated hereby, and it represents that the application fee has been deposited with the relevant authorities.  
There are no actions, suits or proceedings pending or to the knowledge of such Party threatened against or affecting such Party that are reasonably likely to be adversely determined and that, if adversely determined, would have a material adverse effect on such Party’s ability to perform its obligations under this Agreement. 
It shall comply with all applicable laws and regulations including, without limitation, compliance with all licensing/registration and disclosure requirements of any governmental or industry regulatory body having jurisdiction over it. 

The Service Provider warrants and confirms that it will not make any payments/ deposits in the accounts of the employees of HDFC ERGO or associates deployed at HDFC ERGO through contractors for any reasons whatsoever.  The Service Provider acknowledge that breach of this clause shall be a material breach of this agreement and HDFC ERGO shall be entitled to terminate this agreement with immediate effect and all the dues of the Service Provider shall be forfeited.

matching_standard_clause.title: OBJECT
matching_standard_clause.text:
Rights Granted. Subject to payment by Channel Partner of the Cloud Environment Fee within the scheduled payment term, Channel Partner shall have the non-exclusive right, throughout the Territory, during the Term, and acting as an independent intermediary, to promote and advertise the Product to Prospects, for subsequent sale by OutSystems, in all commercial channels of distribution, including, without limitation, retail, direct response and direct mail.
Duties and Responsibilities. Channel Partner shall (a) conduct its business in a manner that always reflects favorably on the Product and the good name, goodwill and reputation of OutSystems; (b) avoid deceptive, misleading or unethical practices, that are or might be detrimental to OutSystems or the Product, including false or misleading representations with regard to OutSystems or the Product. Channel Partner shall not make any representations or warranties concerning prices, terms or delivery, specifications, features, capabilities or performance of the Product that are inconsistent with the Documentation, terms of payment, or conditions of sales except to the extent such representations are authorized in writing by OutSystems. Channel Partner furthermore shall: (i) be responsible for its employees’ and contractors’ compliance with this Agreement, including all applicable restrictions; (ii) use commercially reasonable efforts to promote and expand the Product sales in the Territory in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement and applicable laws and government regulations; (iii) review and fulfil the then-current requirements and benefits of the applicable category of Channel Partner as listed in the Channel Partner Program. Failure to meet any of these duties and responsibilities may result in the immediate termination for cause of this Agreement by OutSystems.
Branding Guidelines. Channel Partner shall follow and fully
comply with the Branding Guidelines in connection with the use of the Software by the End-Customer. OutSystems reserves the right to modify the Branding Guidelines from time to time and shall give the Channel Partner notice of any such modification. Within thirty (30) days of receipt of notice of any modifications to the Branding Guidelines, Channel Partner shall act to assure that all Promotional Materials and other promotional or marketing matters related with the Product comply with the Branding Guidelines.
Reserved Rights. All rights not specifically granted to Channel Partner hereunder are reserved by OutSystems.
CHANNEL PARTNER OBLIGATIONS / REFERRAL OF OPPORTUNITIES
Promotion and Advertising. Channel Partner shall use commercially reasonable efforts to promote the marketing and distribution of the Product in order to conclude the maximum Product sales in the Territory. Except as expressly set forth herein or otherwise agreed in writing by the Parties, Channel Partner shall be solely responsible for all costs and expenses related to the advertising, marketing and promotion of the Software and for performing its obligations hereunder. Channel Partner shall submit to OutSystems in advance, for OutSystems’ prior approval, any marketing and Promotional Materials developed by the Channel Partner related concerning the Product.
Referral of Opportunities. The Channel Partner shall notify OutSystems of the details of the Opportunity including, but not limited to, the description, timeline, budget, competition and the Prospect’s identification, sector, market and specific needs and/or demands, as the case may be, in accordance with the Opportunity registration feature located in the OutSystems Channel Partner center portal. OutSystems may, in its sole discretion, accept or reject any referred Opportunity, and Channel Partner acknowledges that OutSystems may reject any Opportunity for any reason, including, but not limited to: (i) existing opportunities with OutSystems customers (except those originating from a previous referral by Channel Partner); (ii) opportunities originated by OutSystems and with whom OutSystems is, or has been, in discussions; and (iii) opportunities that have already been the subject of a referral by another Channel Partner and that have been approved by OutSystems. If the Opportunity is accepted, Channel Partner receives a formal notification through the Outsystems Channel Partner center portal. Absence of such notification means that the Opportunity has not been accepted by OutSystems.
Pursuit of Accepted Opportunities. Upon acceptance of the Opportunity, the Channel Partner is expected to continue to engage with the Prospect to further promote OutSystems and the Product to the Prospect. Channel Partner agrees to work collaboratively with OutSystems at all times and, where requested by OutSystems, Channel Partner agrees to work the an OutSystems representative. Unless otherwise explicitly requested by Channel Partner, and confirmed by OutSystems, every Opportunity referral shall be deemed non-exclusive. Under certain circumstances, a Channel Partner may request exclusivity for a specific opportunity referral, and OutSystems reserves the right to extend exclusivity to the Opportunity referral. In the event that exclusivity of Opportunity is granted to Channel Partner, the exclusivity of the Opportunity referral will be for the duration of the Validity Period. Such exclusivity means that OutSystems agrees to pursue Software license sales in cooperation with Channel Partner and agrees not to accept Opportunity referrals from any other Channel Partner, except in the case of a public open tender or upon written request by Prospect to either Party.
Opportunities Outside of Territory. In the event a Channel Partner finds an Opportunity to refer a Prospect outside of the Channel Partner’s defined Territory, Channel Partner must obtain OutSystems’ prior written consent to engage with such a Prospect through an Accepted Opportunity registration. Channel Partner acknowledges that, in such a case, specific rules of the applicable Territory and/or OutSystems specific guidelines and directions shall apply and supersede any conflicting terms of this Agreement.
Becoming an End-Customer. If the Prospect of an Accepted Opportunity has: (a) not previously entered into an agreement with OutSystems; (b) not previously been accepted by OutSystems as an Accepted Opportunity being referred or introduced to OutSystems by any other person, entity or Channel Partner or directly engaged by OutSystems; and (c) not previously been documented as an End-Customer (as defined above); and (d) OutSystems finally enters into an agreement with the Prospect of such Accepted Opportunity, this Prospect shall be considered an End-Customer for the purposes of this Agreement and OutSystems shall pay the Partner Commission to Channel Partner as set forth in Section 4 of this Agreement and in accordance with the Channel Partner Program. End-Customers who (i) acquire a Subscription through an assignment or migration of an existing Subscription or (ii) purchase the Subscription through an Independent Software Vendor, shall not be considered as a new End-Customer and Channel Partner shall not be entitled to a Partner Commission.
Dispute of Referrals. In the event a referral of an Opportunity is registered by two or more Channel Partners, finders or other persons, OutSystems, in its sole discretion, shall determine which party is entitled to a fee, if any, based primarily upon each party’s contribution.
Channel Partner’s Warranties. Channel Partner warrants and represents that, for each Opportunity referred to OutSystems under this Agreement, Channel Partner has the authority to make the referral on behalf of the Prospect, and that neither Channel Partner, nor any of its directors, officers, or shareholders have a conflict of interests with the Prospect or with OutSystems or is in breach of any applicable policies in making the referral.
OutSystems Rights. Other than rights granted herein, Channel Partner acknowledges that nothing in this Agreement shall prevent or limit OutSystems from marketing and selling its Product, in whole or in part, directly or indirectly, in the Territory or outside the Territory, to any prospective customers, or from working with other representatives, resellers, distributors or other marketing agents, without any liability to Channel Partner.

differences.original:
For the Purpose of this Agreement "Intellectual Property Rights" shall mean all rights in intellectual property, including without limitation patents, patent applications, trade and service marks, trade names, rights in designs, moral rights, copyright, topography rights, database rights, trade secrets, methodologies and techniques or any other property rights that grant similar rights as the foregoing, whether registered or not, throughout the world. 
All rights, title, and interest including Intellectual Property Rights, to any deliverables, ideas, know-how, inventions, software, Products, documentation, marketing materials, processes or any other intellectual property shared by CloudSEK under this Agreement shall be exclusive property of CloudSEK. Enabling any business transaction by using any intellectual property by Client including but not limited to the Products, the marketing material or the documentation shall not entitle any rights to the Channel Partner or to the Client and permissions to use these Intellectual Property of CloudSEK shall not construed as assignment or transfer of these rights to Channel Partner or to the Client. 
CloudSEK hereby grants the Channel Partner and Clienta limited, non-transferable, non-sublicensable, revocable right to use its trademarks, tradename and service marks, CloudSEK Platform in solely connection with the Purpose, within the scope of this Agreement and for the sole benefit of CloudSEK, for the term of this Agreement in the Authorised Territory. d. Use of marketing materials 

The Channel Partnershall use the marketing material provided by CloudSEK, strictly in accordance with CloudSEK’s guidelines on usage and subject to the obligations under this Clause 4. 
Any advertising or marketing initiative shall be undertaken by the Channel Partner only after consultation with and prior approval of CloudSEK. Any development and/or use of marketing material by the Channel Partner will be subject to CloudSEK’s inspection and prior approval. 

All intellectual property rights in brands, content, concepts, solutions, visuals,  Logo and applications or any other property(in which intellectual property rights of whatever nature subsist) that are solely developed or approved by HDFC ERGO prior to or after the date of this Agreement (irrespective of the same being utilized by the Service Provider for the purpose of providing the Services under this Agreement), shall be owned by HDFC ERGO exclusively and neither the Service Provider nor any third party shall have any rights in respect of the same other 
than the limited license to utilize such, content, concepts, visuals, logo, solutions or applications or property solely for the purpose of this Agreement, with the prior written approval of HDFC ERGO. 

CHANNEL PARTNER’S REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES: 
The Channel Partner and the Client represents and warrants that: 
It has obtained all the necessary permissions, consents and approvals required under the relevant laws to enter into this Agreement and provide the Services, and that it and the authorised persons entering into the Agreement on its behalf are under no legal impediment in this regard. 
It is in possession of all infrastructural facilities and adequate qualified personnel required to provide the Services contemplated under this Agreement and all the Services contemplated under this Agreement shall be provided in a workmanlike and professional manner. 
In the performance of this Agreement, the Channel Partner shall adhere to the instructions and policies communicated by CloudSEK. 
It shall abide by its confidentiality obligations vis a vis CloudSEK’s Confidential Information. 
It shall ensure that all the information, data, documents and records sought by CloudSEK shall be provided to it within the time limit specified by CloudSEK. 
It shall not make any representations, warranties, guarantees or enter into any agreements or contracts binding on CloudSEK, or incur any liability on behalf of CloudSEK, without prior and express consent of CloudSEK. 
That, no conflict of interest exits or is likely to arise in the performance of its obligations under this Agreement. Where during the subsistence of this Agreement, a conflict of interest or a risk of conflict of interest arises; the Channel Partner shall immediately notify CloudSEK in writing of the said conflict of interest. In the event the Channel Partner notifies CloudSEK of any conflict of interest or potential conflict of interest or Channel Partner becomes aware of any conflict of interest CloudSEK and/or the Channel Partner shall have the right to terminate this contract automatically with immediate effect. 
It shall safeguard and promote the reputation of CloudSEK and refrain from engaging in harmful or disparaging conduct including but not limited to discourteous, deceptive, misleading, unauthorised and/or unethical practices, or in any conduct adversely affecting the reputation of CloudSEK. 
Comply with the standard operating procedure and policies of CloudSEK in relation to its interactions with Business Opportunities and End Customers vis a vis the Product and collection, storage and usage of personal data of such Business Opportunities and/or End User Client. 

CLIENT’S REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES: 
It has obtained all the necessary permissions, consents and approvals required under the relevant laws to enter into this Agreement and provide the Services, and that it and the authorised persons entering into the Agreement on its behalf are under no legal impediment in this regard. 
Client and its Authorized Users (i) shall not (a) modify, copy, display, republish or create derivative works based on the Products or CloudSEK materials; (b) reverse engineer the Products; (c) access or use the Products to build a competitive product or service, or copy any ideas, features, functions or graphics of the Products; (d) use the Products in any way prohibited by applicable law or that would cause either party to violate applicable law including but not limited to: (1) sending spam or other duplicative or unsolicited messages; (2) using the Products to send infringing, obscene, threatening, libellous, or other unlawful material; (3) using the Products to access blocked services; or (4) uploading to the Products or using the Products to send or store viruses, worms, time bombs, Trojan horses or other harmful or malicious code, files, scripts, agents or programs; (e) use the Products to run automated queries to external websites (since such websites may include CloudSEK IPs in their respective IP block lists); (f) interfere with or disrupt the integrity or performance of the Products or the data contained therein; (g) attempt to gain unauthorized access to the Products or its related systems or networks; (h) remove or alter any trademark, logo, copyright or other proprietary notices, legends, symbols or labels in the Products; (i) perform penetration or load testing on the Products or CloudSEK’s cloud without the prior written consent of CloudSEK and agreeing to certain conditions and requirements for such penetration or load testing; or (j) without the express prior written consent of CloudSEK, conduct any public benchmarking or comparative study or analysis involving the Products; and (ii) agree to (a) use the Products solely for its internal business purposes; and (b) only permit access to the Products by Authorized Users. 

Representations And Warranties  

While performing its obligation under this Agreement with integrity and honesty, each Party represents and warrants to the other Party as follows: 
It has taken all necessary internal, constitutional or corporate action to authorize the execution and consummation of this Agreement and it will furnish satisfactory evidence of the same upon request by the other Party. 
The execution, delivery and performance by such Party of this Agreement will not (a) violate, conflict with, result in a breach of or constitute (with or without notice or lapse of time or both) a default under any material agreement, indenture, mortgage or lease to which such Party is a party or by which it or its properties are bound; (b) constitute a violation by such Party of any laws or regulations applicable to it; (c) violate any provision of its articles of association or by-laws (or similar governing 
documents); or (d) violate any order, judgment, injunction or decree of any court, arbitrator or governmental body against or binding such Party. 
It does not require any consent, approval, authorization or permission of, any governmental or regulatory authority in connection with this Agreement or the transactions and activities contemplated hereby, and it represents that the application fee has been deposited with the relevant authorities. 
There are no actions, suits or proceedings pending or to the knowledge of such Party threatened against or affecting such Party that are reasonably likely to be adversely determined and that, if adversely determined, would have a material adverse effect on such Party’s ability to perform its obligations under this Agreement. 
It shall comply with all applicable laws and regulations including, without limitation, compliance with all licensing/registration and disclosure requirements of any governmental or industry regulatory body having jurisdiction over it. 

The Service Provider warrants and confirms that it will not make any payments/ deposits in the accounts of the employees of HDFC ERGO or associates deployed at HDFC ERGO through contractors for any reasons whatsoever. The Service Provider acknowledge that breach of this clause shall be a material breach of this agreement and HDFC ERGO shall be entitled to terminate this agreement with immediate effect and all the dues of the Service Provider shall be forfeited.

matching_standard_clause.title: PROGRESS REPORTS AND MEETINGS
matching_standard_clause.text:
KMBL retains the right to seek information required to support the systems/applications under the Service Provider’s scope from any resource of the Service Provider engaged in providing Services herein. 
Further the Service Provider shall provide KMBL with necessary status reports and any other reports in the format requested by KMBL from time to time concerning the Services, during the Term of this Agreement. 
MONITORING, OVERSIGHT AND REVIEW
KMBL reserves the right to periodically oversee/monitor the operations and performance of Services under this Agreement. 
Without prejudice to any other rights that KMBL may have, KMBL reserves the right to review this arrangement/Agreement as and when required from time to time.

clauses.original_text:
Either party hereby agrees to indemnify and hold harmless indemnified party, its directors, officers and employees against any and all liability, claims, suits, losses, costs and legal fees caused by, arising out of, or resulting from: (a) breach of its confidentiality obligations under this Agreement; (b) claims by third parties for misrepresentation by the indemnifying party in relation to the Products and/or its features and functionalities; (c) breach of Intellectual Property Rights ; (d) or any negligent act or omission of the indemnifying partyin the performance and/or failure to perform under this Agreement including the negligent acts or omission of any other person appointed by theindemnifying partyfor the Purpose of this Agreement; (e) damage to property, death or personal injury, attributable to the indemnifying party or its personnel; and (f) its failure to comply with applicable legislations and regulations. 
; Channel Partner to indemnify and hold harmless CloudSEK  for any claims arising on account of a license to a Product not being activated owing to the Channel Partner’s failure to make the requisite payments therefor to the End User Client. 
CloudSEK would indemnify Channel Partner and Client, incase of any claims with respect to the infringement of Third-Party intellectual property under the scope of this Agreement. 
The Channel Partner/Client and/or its personnel shall not directly or indirectly do anything detrimental to the promotion and/or sale of the Products & Services of CloudSEK and shall in no event make any disparaging statement in relation to the said Products and/or Services during the term of this Agreement and at any time after expiry or prior termination of this Agreement. 
Limitation of Liability EXCEPT FOR GROSS NEGLIGENCE, FRAUD, OR INTENTIONAL MISCONDUCT, (I) IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY HAVE ANY LIABILITY FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, PUNITIVE, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO ANY LOST PROFITS, LOSS OF DATA, LOSS OF USE, COSTS OF PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR PRODUCTS, HOWEVER CAUSED, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT OR UNDER ANY OTHER THEORY OF LIABILITY AND WHETHER OR NOT SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES OR LOSS; AND (II) EACH PARTY’S AGGREGATE LIABILITY TO THE OTHER OR ANY THIRD PARTY (INCLUDING CUSTOMERS)

matching_standard_clause.title: INDEMNITY
matching_standard_clause.text:
Service Provider hereby agrees and covenants to indemnify and keep harmless KMBL at all times against any or all claims, liabilities, damages, losses, costs, charges, expenses, proceedings and actions against KMBL by reason of -
Any criminal, or fraudulent act, gross negligence, or misfeasance by Service Provider or its employees, staff, personnel, sub-contractors, Affiliates and/or
Any breach of confidentiality obligations contained herein.
.
.

All indemnities shall survive expiry or termination of this Agreement. 
Notwithstanding anything contained herein, the Parties shall not be liable for any indirect, special, punitive, consequential or incidental damages (including, without limitation, revenue, profits, business) under this Agreement.
DUE DILIGENCE, RIGHT TO AUDIT AND INSPECTION
The Service Provider shall maintain necessary accounts, records and statements of its operations in connection with Services provided under this Agreement. Copies of such accounts, records and statements of its operations in connection with Services provided under this Agreement will have to be furnished by the Service Provider upon request received from KMBL or the regulators of KMBL, including the Reserve Bank of India. Access shall be given to KMBL and its regulators including the Reserve Bank of India to all the data, documents, accounts, records, operations, and information given to, stored or processed by the Service Provider in connection with the Services provided to KMBL, within a reasonable time.
Service Provider agrees that the regulators of the KMBL including the Reserve Bank of India and the external and internal auditors of KMBL will have the right to inspect/audit the books, records, data, audit trails, logs, systems and information of the Service Provider (except any internal pricing data or other customer data) in relation to the Services provided under this Agreement and to obtain copies of any audit or review reports and findings made on the Service Provider in connection with the Services performed for KMBL. Service Provider shall render all necessary assistance and co-operation in this regard. KMBL shall provide reasonable notice before conducting audit and such audit shall be conducted within business hours of the Service Provider. 
The Service Provider agrees to make complete disclosure to KMBL of any third party components that are included in the product/application/deliverables licensed/provided under this Agreement in the format annexed as Annexure B to this Agreement. Further, the Service Provider agrees and undertakes to make such disclosures during the continuance of this Agreement as and when any third party component is added/embedded in the product/application/deliverables during any maintenance or upgrade or any other activity. For the purpose of due diligence, KMBL may require the Service Provider to furnish copies of the licenses acquired by the Service Provider from such third party component owners/licensors. This due diligence may either be conducted by KMBL or an external auditor authorized by KMBL for the purpose. The Service Provider shall ensure that it has observed and has included the third party component as per the terms and conditions applicable for usage of such third party component as prescribed under the license obtained from the owner of the component or prescribed by the owner otherwise. The Service Provider shall ensure that the licenses of such third party components shall be kept valid and subsisting during the Term of this Agreement. The Service Provider undertakes to procure appropriate licenses for any third party component, which may be open source/free at the time of deployment along with the product/application/deliverables but subsequently becomes subject matter of a license. In all such events, the Service Provider shall procure appropriate license from the owner of the third party component within 15 (fifteen) days from the date of becoming aware of such requirement for usage of the third party component and furnish details to KMBL in the format as contained in Annexure B to this Agreement. 
KMBL's audit and due diligence rights shall survive the expiration or termination of this Agreement.

Either party hereby agrees to indemnify and hold harmless indemnified party, its directors, officers and employees against any and all liability, claims, suits, losses, costs and legal fees caused by, arising out of, or resulting from: (a) breach of its confidentiality obligations under this Agreement; (b) claims by third parties for misrepresentation by the indemnifying party in relation to the Products and/or its features and functionalities; (c) breach of Intellectual Property Rights ; (d) or any negligent act or omission of the indemnifying partyin the performance and/or failure to perform under this Agreement including the negligent acts or omission of any other person appointed by theindemnifying partyfor the Purpose of this Agreement; (e) damage to property, death or personal injury, attributable to the indemnifying party or its personnel; and (f) its failure to comply with applicable legislations and regulations. 
; Channel Partner to indemnify and hold harmless CloudSEK  for any claims arising on account of a license to a Product not being activated owing to the Channel Partner’s failure to make the requisite payments therefor to the End User Client. 
CloudSEK would indemnify Channel Partner and Client, incase of any claims with respect to the infringement of Third-Party intellectual property under the scope of this Agreement. 
The Channel Partner/Client and/or its personnel shall not directly or indirectly do anything detrimental to the promotion and/or sale of the Products & Services of CloudSEK and shall in no event make any disparaging statement in relation to the said Products and/or Services during the term of this Agreement and at any time after expiry or prior termination of this Agreement. 
Limitation of Liability EXCEPT FOR GROSS NEGLIGENCE, FRAUD, OR INTENTIONAL MISCONDUCT, (I) IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY HAVE ANY LIABILITY FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, PUNITIVE, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO ANY LOST PROFITS, LOSS OF DATA, LOSS OF USE, COSTS OF PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR PRODUCTS, HOWEVER CAUSED, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT OR UNDER ANY OTHER THEORY OF LIABILITY AND WHETHER OR NOT SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES OR LOSS; AND (II) EACH PARTY’S AGGREGATE LIABILITY TO THE OTHER OR ANY THIRD PARTY (INCLUDING CUSTOMERS)
differences.revised:
Service Provider hereby agrees and covenants to indemnify and keep harmless KMBL at all times against any or all claims, liabilities, damages, losses, costs, charges, expenses, proceedings and actions against KMBL by reason of -
Any criminal, or fraudulent act, gross negligence, or misfeasance by Service Provider or its employees, staff, personnel, sub-contractors, Affiliates and/or
Any breach of confidentiality obligations contained herein.
.
.

All indemnities shall survive expiry or termination of this Agreement. 
Notwithstanding anything contained herein, the Parties shall not be liable for any indirect, special, punitive, consequential or incidental damages (including, without limitation, revenue, profits, business) under this Agreement.
DUE DILIGENCE, RIGHT TO AUDIT AND INSPECTION
The Service Provider shall maintain necessary accounts, records and statements of its operations in connection with Services provided under this Agreement. Copies of such accounts, records and statements of its operations in connection with Services provided under this Agreement will have to be furnished by the Service Provider upon request received from KMBL or the regulators of KMBL, including the Reserve Bank of India. Access shall be given to KMBL and its regulators including the Reserve Bank of India to all the data, documents, accounts, records, operations, and information given to, stored or processed by the Service Provider in connection with the Services provided to KMBL, within a reasonable time.
Service Provider agrees that the regulators of the KMBL including the Reserve Bank of India and the external and internal auditors of KMBL will have the right to inspect/audit the books, records, data, audit trails, logs, systems and information of the Service Provider (except any internal pricing data or other customer data) in relation to the Services provided under this Agreement and to obtain copies of any audit or review reports and findings made on the Service Provider in connection with the Services performed for KMBL. Service Provider shall render all necessary assistance and co-operation in this regard. KMBL shall provide reasonable notice before conducting audit and such audit shall be conducted within business hours of the Service Provider. 
The Service Provider agrees to make complete disclosure to KMBL of any third party components that are included in the product/application/deliverables licensed/provided under this Agreement in the format annexed as Annexure B to this Agreement. Further, the Service Provider agrees and undertakes to make such disclosures during the continuance of this Agreement as and when any third party component is added/embedded in the product/application/deliverables during any maintenance or upgrade or any other activity. For the purpose of due diligence, KMBL may require the Service Provider to furnish copies of the licenses acquired by the Service Provider from such third party component owners/licensors. This due diligence may either be conducted by KMBL or an external auditor authorized by KMBL for the purpose. The Service Provider shall ensure that it has observed and has included the third party component as per the terms and conditions applicable for usage of such third party component as prescribed under the license obtained from the owner of the component or prescribed by the owner otherwise. The Service Provider shall ensure that the licenses of such third party components shall be kept valid and subsisting during the Term of this Agreement. The Service Provider undertakes to procure appropriate licenses for any third party component, which may be open source/free at the time of deployment along with the product/application/deliverables but subsequently becomes subject matter of a license. In all such events, the Service Provider shall procure appropriate license from the owner of the third party component within 15 (fifteen) days from the date of becoming aware of such requirement for usage of the third party component and furnish details to KMBL in the format as contained in Annexure B to this Agreement. 
KMBL's audit and due diligence rights shall survive the expiration or termination of this Agreement.

clauses.suggested_revision: KMBL hereby agrees and covenants to indemnify and keep harmless KMBL at all times against any and all claims, liabilities, damages, losses, costs, charges, expenses, proceedings and actions arising out of, arising out of, or resulting from: (a) any criminal, or fraudulent act, gross negligence, or misfeasance by Service Provider or its employees, staff, personnel, sub-contractors, Affiliates .
clauses.summary: Customer clause matches standard clause 'INDEMNITY' (type: Payment) with similarity 0.90. Key difference: replace - 'Either party hereby agrees to indemnify and hold harmless in...' vs. 'Service Provider hereby agrees and covenants to indemnify an...'

clauses.clause_title:
5. Expectations from HDFC ERGO/Client 

CloudSEK assumes that Client will assign a SPOC for CloudSEK to route/ alert the threats to them
clauses.original_text:
CloudSEK assumes that Client will white list CloudSEK’s IPs for the platform to monitor and report public-facing Infrastructure vulnerabilities. Further details in terms of which IPs to whitelist and how would be shared with Client during on boarding 
Client is required to arrange for reasonable access to relevant individuals and documents associated with the project and shall be responsible for both the completeness and accuracy of the information supplied to CloudSEK 

6. CloudSEK’s Responsibilities 

•  CloudSEKwillensurethatallServicesaspertheagreedscopeandareprovidedfollowingtheagreedtimefr ameandisofaprofessionalstandard 

CloudSEK’s Platform and Services Commercials 

The Commercials shall be as per the Proposal No. STGPL/MUM/2022-23/270123 dated December 12th, 2022 shared with the Client via Softcell and the terms and conditions of such shall be governed by the terms and conditions of this Master Service Provider Agreement dated 31st January, 2023. 



Commercial–Terms and Conditions 
The pricing is in Indian Rupees and is quoted based on the assumption of a 3 Year Purchase Order, The quoted price/year to be paid annually in advance. 
*The proposed XVigil V10 License is for 800 keyword, wherein keywords are the total sum of HDFC ERGO General Insurance Company Limited’s Primary domain, associated sub-domains, associated IPs, Watchwords and VIP Users email IDs. 
*The proposed XVigil V10 License is for HDFC ERGO General Insurance Company Limited as a Brand and all the primary domains for monitoring must relate to the HDFCERGO General Insurance Company Limited as a Brand only. 
*This count is for the keywords which will be monitored on an ongoing basis, pertaining to all the HDFC ERGO General Insurance Company Limited’s primary domains as per XVigil configuration on the date of submission of the renewal proposal, Keywords used for adhoc scans will not be counted against this list. 
Term: The initial term of Customer’s subscription to the products will begin on the start date or effective Date as set forth in the Agreement and will continue for theperiod of time stated in the commercial or the respective Order form. 
No cancellation for convivence shall be applicable for the period of the contract. 
Termination for Material Breach: Either party may terminate this Agreement and/or any Order form: (i) if the other party is in material breach of any of the terms and conditions of this Agreement and does not cure such material breach within thirty (30) days of receiving notice; or (ii) if the other party becomes the subject of a petition in bankruptcy or any proceeding relating to insolvency, receivership, liquidation or assignment for the benefit of creditors. 
Termination for any reason or cause shall be valid only upon 90days prior written notice to CloudSEK, the pre-paid amount/fee(s), if any, shall be refunded on 50% pro- rata basis for the remaining Term of the Agreement. 
***Advanced Support Package constitutes of Access to Knowledge base 24x7, Email and Ticketing 24x7, 
Business hours on call support 8x5, XVigil alert analysis, Customer Feedback and Product suggestion, Client Connect and Integrations (Refer the slide 14 titled “Advanced Support – Terms & Conditions” for detailed support SLA). 
CloudSEK’s Invoice will be raised at the beginning of the renewal contract which has to be paid within 30 days from the submission of the CloudSEK’s Invoice. 
**Only the compensation for takedowns has been considered. Any additional fees/payments/costs if incurred due to the complicated nature of takedowns and demands involvement of legal consultation/paperwork for takedowns will be charged separately to clients on actuals. 
**If this limit exceeds per year, additional packages can be purchased. 
**50% of unavailed/unused takedowns can be added to the service to be used the next year, free of cost, provided that the service is renewed. 
T&C table needs to be mentioned as the same in the PO. 
Incidental expenses like travel, purchase of online resources etc. to be on actuals and borne by HDFC ERGO General Insurance Company Limited. 
Taxes will be on actuals and extra. 
Reimbursement expenses if any to be paid on receipt by HDFC ERGO General Insurance Company Limited. • HDFC ERGO General Insurance Company Limited permits CloudSEK to conduct a joint PR exercise post renewal. The purpose of the Joint PR would be to highlight how CloudSEK is actively working to improve the security posture of HDFC ERGO General Insurance Company Limited and how committed HDFC ERGO General Insurance Company Limited is about it’s security posture leveraging CloudSEK Xvigil. 
Quote/Proposal validity – The Quote/Proposal would be valid for 30 days from the date of Quote/Proposal submission. 

Advanced Support Terms and Conditions:  

Access to XVigil Product Knowledgebase 24x7 – Access to online help, manuals, and documentation to assist users on General Product Information, FAQs, Advisories, Initial Set up (Asset Management and configuration), and Release notes. 
Email and Ticketing 24x7 - As part of Customer Support, CloudSEK offers a web-based customer support portal (CloudSEK Care), where client can log issues/tickets 24x7, view the status of their open issues/tickets 24x7, and the current resolution status of those issues/tickets 24x7. Response/Resolution would be done only during Business hours. 
On Call Support – Call a central CloudSEK client service number 8x5, on-call support would be dependent on the support package opted/procured by the client which currently is 8x5. 
CloudSEK XVigil Alert Analysis – Analysis of specific threats/alert reported by CloudSEK XVigil platform, This would be done on a best effort basis and during support hours only which is currently 8x5. Alert Analysis request to be raised via tickets only. 
Customer feedback & Product Suggestions – Share service or product-related feedback using CloudSEK support portal (CloudSEK Care) / Mail. 
Client Connect – Remote client connect would be organized by the CloudSEK point of contact. Connect would be on a Quarterly basis and during support hours only which is currently 8x5 and would be mutually discussed and agreed. 
Integrations – CloudSEK offers Threat intelligence feeds using STIX and TAXII. Integration feasibility, coverage, and methodology to be checked and confirmed by CloudSEK for any integration request. 


Period of this Engagement 

This engagement will commence as per the SOW Effective Date specified above and may be extended based on the CloudSEK Information Security Pvt. Ltd. and Client’s consent. 

Terms of Trade 

The terms of payment and other commercials terms are strict to be followed as mentioned in the proposal, and or in the Statement of Work (SOW) and Service Level Agreement. 
An itemized account of all charges, costs, and disbursements will be provided on the invoice. 
The Service Provider acknowledges that under the GST regime, credit for the GST towards services 
availed by HDFC ERGO would be allowed to HDFC ERGO provided the Service Provider has paid full tax (GST) to the respective Government/s.  The Service Provider hereby confirms that the Service Provider will provide a valid tax Invoice containing all details as prescribed under GST Rules,  deposit the applicable GST, including the amount/s collected from HDFC ERGO and file the requisite returns as per the applicable GST laws within the stipulated time under law in force for the time being.  
Service Provider confirm to abide by the GST law, both Central and State and the rules notified there 
under and shall deposit the GST collected from HDFC ERGO with the Government of India within the stipulated time under law in force for the time being.  
The Service Provider acknowledges the fact that HDFC ERGO shall receive the input tax credit of the GST charged on the invoice post filing of the correct GST returns basis which the amount shall appears in the credit ledger of HDFC ERGO on the GST portal. 
In the event, input tax credit does not appear in the credit ledger of HDFC ERGO, HDFC ERGO shall 
provide a notice/ email to the Service Provider along with a copy of the document, if any, indicating the denial or delay of any credit, refund or other benefit and provide a time period of 30 days allowing the Service Provider to present documents indicating the fulfillment of its duties under this clause. Further that if the credit in respect of GST paid by HDFC ERGO to the service provider is denied due to any of the reasons / grounds listed in Section 38 of the Central GST Act, the payment for the GST component will be withheld, till the time HDFC ERGO is permitted to avail Input Tax Credit. 
For HDFC ERGO General Insurance Company Ltd  For CloudSEK Information Security Private Limited 



By:  

Its:   Its: Co-Founder and CEO 


Date:

Annexure B

matching_standard_clause.title: FEES
matching_standard_clause.text:
In consideration of the sale of subscriptions to the Platform or provision of Professional Services, the Customer shall pay the Fees as more specifically elaborated in applicable Order (“Fees”). 
Except as otherwise specified in the Order, the Consideration is non-refundable. Such Consideration shall be exclusive of applicable taxes. The Customer is responsible for delivery charges and all taxes related to this purchase and the import of the Products, if applicable, including but not limited to all GST, import taxes/customs/duties and any other similar taxes imposed by any governmental entity. [LegaLogic Comment for Softcell: Kindly validate if the Consideration will be exclusive of all applicable taxes.]
Unless expressly otherwise agreed in the applicable Order, the Customer shall be obligated to pay full payment of each invoice raised by the Company, in advance, within a period of fifteen (15) days from the receipt of invoice. In the event, the Customer fails to make the payment within the aforesaid due date, the Purchaser shall be liable to pay an interest of 1% per month or any amount prescribed by applicable laws, whichever is higher on the amounts due till the date of actual payment. In addition to the above, the Company shall also be entitled to withhold the delivery of the Products in respect of which the invoices are outstanding and/or withhold the delivery of any other Order., the Customer shall also be responsible for all collection costs and/or legal expenses necessitated by delay or default in payment of the price by the Customer.  [LegaLogic Comment for Softcell: We have inserted a 15 days’ period considering the payment period agreed with Cyble i.e. 30 days from the date of receipt of invoice. We suggest atleast 15 days buffer shall be kept.]
The Customer will not setoff or offset against the Company’s invoices, any amounts that the Customer claims are owed to it by the Company under this Agreement and the Customer waives any right it may have to offset, setoff, or withhold payment of the Fees.
