clauses.original_text:
In case the Service Provider has any access to HDFC ERGO’s IT systems or Data or Customer Information, the Service Provider shall be bound by the following obligations: 

Service Provider shall adhere to the prevailing Information Security Policy of the Company as updated by the Company on its website from time to time.  Service Provider further warrants that its collection, access, use, storage, process, disposal and disclosure of information does and will comply with all Applicable Laws, including but not limited  to the applicable local and data protection laws.  
Security Certifications: Service Provider shall ensure that all its products and services being offered to Company under this Agreement shall comply with the applicable industry security standards and Service Provider shall take all measures to implement any changes to the said standards from time to time as may be necessary to remain in compliance with the Applicable Laws or standards with respect to the same, at Service Provider’s sole cost and expense.  Service Provider shall provide the Company promptly on such demand by the Company, with copies of the relevant documents and the certificate(s) failing which the Company shall be at liberty to terminate this agreement with 15 days notice. 
Service Provider declares, assures and undertakes to abide by the relevant security standards/ regulations/ requirements/guidelines which would be applicable to the transactions contemplated under this Agreement, including, without limitation, (a) regulatory provisions, if any, as may be applicable from time to time, and (b) undertake security measures and resultant hardware/ software upgrade, upgrade of Service 
Provider’s systems and procedures with a view to ensuring compliance with the Applicable Compliance requirements . 
Service Provider shall ensure compliance with all applicable including but not limited to regulations issued by Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India, Information Technology Act, Information Technology (Reasonable Security Practices and procedures and sensitive personal data or information) Rules, 2011 as amended from time to time and any applicable subsequent Law that may get notified. Service Provider shall 
be responsible for obtaining and keeping current all necessary licenses, approvals, consents, permits, and authorizations/assignments required by applicable law or by its Third-Party suppliers/contractors for it to perform the Services. The Company shall be not be responsible for any fees and taxes associated with obtaining such licenses, approvals, consents, permits, and authorizations. Service Provider shall at all times comply with all the requirements of Annexure “B(i)”, as may be applicable, at Service Provider’s sole cost and expense. 
Service Provider shall at all times remain in compliance with the requirements as specified under the Security Standards, as defined in Annexure B(i), including being aware at all times of changes to guidelines there under and implementing all procedures as may be necessary to remain in compliance with the ISO security standards in each case, at Service Provider’s sole cost and expense.  
Audit: Company shall be entitled to audit/ scrutinize / assess security records and security mechanisms adopted by Service Provider to ensure compliance of Service Provider’s obligations under this Agreement at such intervals or times as company may deem appropriate and Service Provider and shall render complete assistance to company or the authorized agent or its representatives as appointed by company in this regard and Service Provider shall bear all the costs and expenses related to the same, solely upon discovery of a discrepancy. The Security Assessment may require the Service Provider to complete a security questionnaire, answer follow-up questions, and provide the company access to evidence of related security controls. The Service Provider will return to the Company completed security questionnaires within Ten (10)calendar days of request. Where applicable, the Service Provider will make available to the Company security representative any independent security audits or certifications (e.g., ISO, SSAE 16 SOC report, etc.). The Service Provider shall take the required corrective measures and perform corrections at their sole cost and expense or as may be required by law, for the time being in force to close all assessment / audit points or observations, if any, within the agreed timelines or within the statutory timelines, whichever is earlier. Service Provider shall provide Company with a copy of the certificate in evidence of such closure of audit observations. Service Provider shall maintain the logs of all Company transactions for at least one (1) year or as prescribed by the law. 
Notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement, the Service Provider agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless company from and against any claims, actions, damages or losses in relation to or as a result of breach by Vendor or its employees, contractors, agents, etc. of the aforesaid obligations with respect to data security and security certifications. 
Hardware, Software, License, Documentation 
The Service Provider shall keep the Company indemnified against any liability, damage, fine, penalty, costs or any other consequential loss on account of violation of the copyright/ License compliance/ Intellectual Property Rights of any Third Party or its Service Provider in respect of the Hardware, Firmware, Software, Applications, processes and all other components used by the Service Provider in providing the services. 
The Service Provider shall maintain and provide relevant Documentation and all records produced in connection with the implementation of this contract and any other necessary documents reasonably requested / required by Company to: 
Comply with applicable laws 
To support audits (Internal, external, customer, statutory, etc) 

9. DATA PROTECTION, (if applicable)  
The Parties acknowledge that, in respect of all Personal Data (as defined in Annexure B (i)  processed by the Service Provider for the purpose of the provision of Supplies/Services under this Agreement, Company alone as data controller shall determine the purposes for which and the manner in which such personal data will be processed by the Service Provider.  
The Service Provider must ensure that its Personnel/subcontractors who collect, use, disclose, store or handle Personal Information are aware of the Service Provider's obligations under or in connection with this Agreement in relation to such activities or practices. 
Other than at Company's request, or where required by law to provide the Supplies/Services, the Service Provider shall not disclose or allow access to any personal data to a person placed by the Service Provider under the same obligations as contained in this condition who is employed or engaged by the Service Provider or within the control of the Service Provider in the performance of the Contract.  
The Service Provider shall not use personal data for any purpose other than the provision of the Supplies/Services and shall return any personal data to company immediately upon request at any time providing such return does not prevent the Service Provider from fulfilling its obligations under this Agreement. The Service 
Provider shall retain personal data no longer than is necessary for the provision of the Supplies/ services, in accordance with the relevant Data Protection Legislation and such instructions as Company may provide from time to time. Upon expiry or premature termination of this Contract for whatever reason, the Service Provider shall immediately return to company all personal data and certify that no copies have been made or retained by the Service Provider / business partner or any third party acting on its behalf when authorised by the Company. 

The Service Provider shall:  
process personal data only on the instructions of Company and to the extent necessary for the performance of this Agreement; and  
not modify, amend or alter the contents of the personal data except as required or permitted by this Agreement or with Company’s prior written consent; and  
implement the appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect personal data against accidental or unlawful destruction or accidental loss, alteration, unauthorized disclosure or access, and against all other unlawful forms of processing, and provide to the Company a written description of the measures taken when requested by the Company; and  
keep all personal data secure and confidential, act only on company's instructions with respect to it, and comply with such further reasonable requirements from time to time of company for the security of it; and  
ensure that, of the Service Provider’s staff/personnel, only those of the Contract Personnel who need to have access to the personal data are granted access to the personnel data only for the purposes of the performance of this Agreement and the Contract Personnel are informed of the confidential nature of the personal data and comply with the obligations set out in this condition; and  
notify the Company forthwith, and in any event, no later than 12 hours from the time it comes to the Service Provider’s attention, that personal data transferred by the Company to the Service Provider has been the subject of accidental or unlawful destruction or accidental loss, alteration, unauthorized disclosure or access, or any other unlawful forms of processing; and  
notify the Company in the event that it receives a request or notice from any data subject to have access to that person’s personal data held by it and will provide Company with full co-operation and assistance in relation to any complaint or request including providing company with any relevant personal data it holds within the timescales provided by the request or notice or as otherwise required by company.  
in respect of transfer of personal data the following conditions shall apply:  

obtain Company’s prior written consent before transferring personal data to any Subcontractors in connection with the provision of the Supplies; 

prior to any transfer of personal data, enter into or procure that any Subcontractor delivering the Supplies/Services will enter into contracts for the transfer of personal data. In respect of personal data transferred by the Company to the Service Provider or acquired by the Service Provider from 
Company’s systems to a country outside of India shall be on the basis of the Data Protection Legislation issued by the Government of India, or such other data protection model contract terms as may be agreed between the Parties from time to time, except where the relevant Data Protection Legislation provides for a derogation from this requirement. 

Any breach of this condition by the Vendor shall be deemed to be a material breach of the Contract and the Vendor shall indemnify company from the against any costs, losses, damages, proceedings, claims, expenses or demands incurred or suffered by company which arise as a result of such breach.  
The Service Provider shall, upon Company giving reasonable notice, allow company or its nominated representatives such access to its premises, Information and records and those of its agents subsidiaries, as may be reasonably required by Company from time to time to check  the Service Provider’s and/or Contract Personnel’s compliance with this condition. 
Annexure “B (i)”

matching_standard_clause.title: CONFIDENTIALITY
matching_standard_clause.text:
“Confidential Information”  shall mean any information and documents shared by the Bank with the Service Provider and/or any information and documents comes in to possession of the Service Provider/Representatives and/or any other information which is developed by the Service Provider/Representatives for the Bank, which is including but not limited to confidential information and proprietary information concerning the Bank, its affiliates, subsidiaries, group companies, holding companies including and without limitation; Intellectual Property, trade secrets, secret information, technical processes, finances, software, software language codes, username and passwords, transaction information, data processing methodology, custom developed applications, dealings and method of dealings with the clients or the customers  and its employees together with any  information  relating to Bank’s suppliers, employees, agents, distributors, and customers (including personal information and/or personal sensitive information)and relationships of special trust and confidence with the clients or customers and employees.
The Service Provider shall use the Confidential Information solely for purposes of this Agreement, and shall not disclose to any third party without the prior written consent of the Bank.
The Service Provider agrees and undertakes to ensure that in case Service Provider share any Confidential Information with its affiliates, group companies, associates, subsidiaries, holding company and their respective employees and professional advisors (“Representatives”) and such Representatives shall be bound by the confidentiality obligations under this Agreement and they shall use the Confidential Information only for the purpose of this Agreement.
The Service Provider also agrees that it shall share Confidential Information with the Representatives only to such extent as may be necessary for the performance of the Service Providers obligations under this Agreement. The Service Provider shall inform the confidential nature of Confidential Information to the Representatives and the Service Provider shall ensure that such Representatives shall execute a confidentiality and non-disclosure agreement containing restrictions as stringent as those contained herein to protect the Confidential Information of the Bank.
The Service Provider shall take all measures to protect the confidentiality and security of the Confidential Information and avoid the unauthorized use, disclosure, publication, or dissemination of the Confidential Information; provided, however, that such measures shall be no less stringent than measures taken to protect its own confidential and proprietary information but in no event less than reasonable degree of care.  The Service Provider shall be responsible for breach of any provision of this Agreement by its Representatives. The Service Provider shall and shall ensure that its Representatives shall keep all Confidential Information confidential at all times during the Term and after termination of this Agreement.
The Service Provider agrees and understands that the title to the Confidential Information and Intellectual Property shall always remain with the Bank, and this Agreement shall not be construed to grant to the Service Provider any patents, licenses or similar rights to such Confidential Information and Intellectual Property.
The Service Provider confirms and undertakes that it shall ensure that confidentiality of customer information, if any, shared by the Bank during the course of availing the Service shall be maintained during the Term and even after this Agreement expires or gets terminated. The Service Provider shall be fully liable and responsible in case of breach of security and leakage of customers information.

differences.original:
In case the Service Provider has any access to HDFC ERGO’s IT systems or Data or Customer Information, the Service Provider shall be bound by the following obligations: 

Service Provider shall adhere to the prevailing Information Security Policy of the Company as updated by the Company on its website from time to time. Service Provider further warrants that its collection, access, use, storage, process, disposal and disclosure of information does and will comply with all Applicable Laws, including but not limited  to the applicable local and data protection laws. 
Security Certifications: Service Provider shall ensure that all its products and services being offered to Company under this Agreement shall comply with the applicable industry security standards and Service Provider shall take all measures to implement any changes to the said standards from time to time as may be necessary to remain in compliance with the Applicable Laws or standards with respect to the same, at Service Provider’s sole cost and expense. Service Provider shall provide the Company promptly on such demand by the Company, with copies of the relevant documents and the certificate(s) failing which the Company shall be at liberty to terminate this agreement with 15 days notice. 
Service Provider declares, assures and undertakes to abide by the relevant security standards/ regulations/ requirements/guidelines which would be applicable to the transactions contemplated under this Agreement, including, without limitation, (a) regulatory provisions, if any, as may be applicable from time to time, and (b) undertake security measures and resultant hardware/ software upgrade, upgrade of Service 
Provider’s systems and procedures with a view to ensuring compliance with the Applicable Compliance requirements . 
Service Provider shall ensure compliance with all applicable including but not limited to regulations issued by Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India, Information Technology Act, Information Technology (Reasonable Security Practices and procedures and sensitive personal data or information) Rules, 2011 as amended from time to time and any applicable subsequent Law that may get notified. Service Provider shall 
be responsible for obtaining and keeping current all necessary licenses, approvals, consents, permits, and authorizations/assignments required by applicable law or by its Third-Party suppliers/contractors for it to perform the Services. The Company shall be not be responsible for any fees and taxes associated with obtaining such licenses, approvals, consents, permits, and authorizations. Service Provider shall at all times comply with all the requirements of Annexure “B(i)”, as may be applicable, at Service Provider’s sole cost and expense. 
Service Provider shall at all times remain in compliance with the requirements as specified under the Security Standards, as defined in Annexure B(i), including being aware at all times of changes to guidelines there under and implementing all procedures as may be necessary to remain in compliance with the ISO security standards in each case, at Service Provider’s sole cost and expense. 
Audit: Company shall be entitled to audit/ scrutinize / assess security records and security mechanisms adopted by Service Provider to ensure compliance of Service Provider’s obligations under this Agreement at such intervals or times as company may deem appropriate and Service Provider and shall render complete assistance to company or the authorized agent or its representatives as appointed by company in this regard and Service Provider shall bear all the costs and expenses related to the same, solely upon discovery of a discrepancy. The Security Assessment may require the Service Provider to complete a security questionnaire, answer follow-up questions, and provide the company access to evidence of related security controls. The Service Provider shall take the required corrective measures and perform corrections at their sole cost and expense or as may be required by law, for the time being in force to close all assessment / audit points or observations, if any, within the agreed timelines or within the statutory timelines, whichever is earlier. Service Provider shall provide Company with a copy of the certificate in evidence of such closure of audit observations. Service Provider shall maintain the logs of all Company transactions for at least one (1) year or as prescribed by the law. 
Notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement, the Service Provider agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless company from and against any claims, actions, damages or losses in relation to or as a result of breach by Vendor or its employees, contractors, agents, etc. of the aforesaid obligations with respect to data security and security certifications. 
Hardware, Software, License, Documentation 
The Service Provider shall keep the Company indemnified against any liability, damage, fine, penalty, costs or any other consequential loss on account of violation of the copyright/ License compliance/ Intellectual Property Rights of any Third Party or its Service Provider in respect of the Hardware, Firmware, Software, Applications, processes and all other components used by the Service Provider in providing the services. 
The Service Provider shall maintain and provide relevant Documentation and all records produced in connection with the implementation of this contract and any other necessary documents reasonably requested / required by Company to: 
Comply with applicable laws 
To support audits (Internal, external, customer, statutory, etc)

clauses.original_text:
Unless the context otherwise requires, the different terms and expression used shall have the meaning assigned to them for the purpose of this Annexure in the following paragraphs: a. “Company” means HDFC ERGO General Insurance Company Limited 
“Contract Personnel” means dedicated resources of the Service Provider and Channel Partner in terms of employees, subcontractors including employees of sub contractors and agents including agent’s sub contractors and their employees engaged for the purpose of this Agreement.  
“Sensitive Information” means any company Information marked as classified as per company’s data classification policy or deemed business critical. This also includes any other data, or element of information, notified as such by the Government (e.g. IT Act 2011).  
“Security Standards” means all the relevant contemporary standards associated with national and international security standard related to IT hardware and software and those related to information security, including but without limitation to ISO 27000 series, ISO/ 22301, etc. and as evolved from time to time. 
“Subcontractor”-means any person, partnership or corporation with whom the Service Provider and Channel Partner places a contract and/or an order for the supply of any equipment, item, service or for any work in relation to the purpose of this Agreement, with prior written approval of HDFC ERGO. "Subcontract" shall be construed accordingly. 
“Company Security” means the security organization based within the company.  
“Company Information” means all data including data, text, image, sound, voice, codes, circuit diagrams, core & applications software and database, intellectual property as well as personal, public, operational and services data in company custody which is and /or received which are supplied/ shared with Service Provider and Channel Partner for the purpose of this Agreement or are obtained by the Service Provider and Channel Partner on behalf of company. 
“Company Items” –means all items provided by company to the Service Provider and Channel Partner and all items held by the Service Provider and Channel Partner which belong to company. 
“Company Security Contact” means in-charge of company security operations centre or such other person whose details shall be notified by company the Service Provider and Channel Partner from time to time. 
“Company Systems” means any company computer, application, databases, network infrastructure, network elements and appliances, core and applications software or such other systems as may be agreed in writing from time to time between company and the Service Provider and Channel Partner.  
“Service Provider and Channel Partner Security Contact” means such person whose details shall be notified by the Service Provider and Channel Partner to Company from time to time for ensuring compliance with the information security provisions in terms of this Annexure. 
“Service Provider and Channel Partner Systems” means any Service Provider and Channel Partner owned computer hardware or software, application database or network elements / appliance or such other systems as may be agreed in writing from time to time by company and the Service Provider and Channel Partner. 
“Personal Data” – means Personally Identifiable Information (“PII”),PII includes, but is not limited to, information about an identifiable individual, including name, Aadhar number, PAN number, passport, driver’s license, voter identification card or other government identification documentation, medical/health information, medical / health records, biometric information, financial account number (e.g., credit card number), personal identification number (“PIN”), sexual orientation, address, email address, or phone number

matching_standard_clause.title: DEFINITIONS
matching_standard_clause.text:
“Affiliate” shall mean with respect to either Party, any Person controlling, controlled by or under common control of such Party. For the purpose of this definition of Affiliate, “control” together with grammatical variations when used with respect to any Person, shall mean the power to direct the management and policies of such Person, directly or indirectly, and “Person” shall mean a company, corporation, a partnership, trust or any other entity or organization or other body.
“Agreement” shall mean this agreement and shall include all Annexures, SOWs annexed hereto and any amendments made thereto in writing by mutual consent of the Parties from time to time.
“Business Day” shall mean a day on which KMBL is open for business. 
“Confidential Information” shall mean any/all materials, documents, applications, ideas, data, details, software’s, systems, writings, statements business/customer/supplier information or other information and trade secrets, personal data/sensitive personal information/personally identifiable information of KMBL customers/employees, research and development, processes, tangible information relating to either Party, its Affiliates, products and services or their respective business affairs, financial information etc., which is not in the public domain and is disclosed by a Party or its Affiliate or representatives to the other Party or accessed by a Party for the purpose of this Agreement. 
“Fee” shall mean the fee payable by KMBL to the Service Provider towards the Services offered and Software provided under this Agreement and vide the Scope of Work/s to be executed covering the specific Service.
“Relative/s” shall mean and include any or all of the following persons: 
Spouse
Father
Mother (including step-mother)
Son (including step-son)
Son's Wife
Daughter (including step-daughter)
Daughter's Husband
Brother (including step-brother)
Brother's wife
Sister (including step-sister)
Sister's husband
Brother (including step-brother) of the spouse
Sister (including step-sister) of the spouse
“Services” shall broadly refer to the services already agreed to be provided from time to time or any other service/s to be provided by Service Provider to KMBL as are to be detailed and mutually agreed in the Scope of Work/s from time to time in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.
“Senior Officer” shall mean any employee of KMBL in the grade M6 and above.
“Substantial Interest” means:
(i) in relation to a company, the holding of a beneficial interest by an individual or his Relative(s), whether singly or taken together, in the shares thereof, the amount paid upon which exceeds five lakhs of rupees or ten per cent of the paid-up capital of the company, whichever is less;
(ii) in relation to a firm, means the beneficial interest held therein by an individual or his Relative(s), whether singly or taken together, which represents more than ten per cent of the total capital subscribed by all the partners of the said firm.

clauses.original_text:
This Annexure sets out the provisions under which the Service Provider and Channel Partner will be able to supplyservices and be granted Access to Company’s IT Systems, Network equipment’s, data and facilities and company Information including Personal and Sensitive Information for thepurpose of providing services by the Service Provider and Channel Partner. 

SECURITY REQUIREMENTS: THE SERVICE PROVIDER AND CHANNEL PARTNER SHALL COMPLY WITH FOLLOWING SECURITY POLICIES  
General  
The Service Provider and Channel Partner shall be Authorized to Access only company Systems, company information and customer information in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement and only during the term of this Agreement. 

The Service Provider and Channel Partner shall identify to company details of Service Provider and Channel Partner Security Contact at the Effective Date who will act as a single point of contact for company, such as a senior manager or CIO responsible for security, for any security issues. This responsibility shall be detailed withinhis/her job description. This does not mean that the Service Provider and Channel Partner shall not be responsible as an organization or company and its management. 

As part of the Authorization process, details of Contract Personnel that need Access will be requested by Service Provider and Channel Partner. The Service Provider and Channel Partner Security Contact shall at all times ensure that only Contract Personnel who have a need to access in order to fulfil the purpose of this Agreement is authorized. This authorization and any changes in the Contract Personnel would be notified by the Service Provider and Channel Partner for the information and for the approval (wherever applicable) of the company. 

Pursuant to clause mentioned above, the Service Provider and Channel Partner acknowledges that : 
Only the Contract Personnel having requisite training are Authorized to Access company System. 
The Service Provider and Channel Partner shall have a well defined information security policy compliant with ISO/IEC 27001:2013 or have equivalent standards and in line with the company’s information security policies and requirements. 
The Service Provider and Channel Partner shall ensure that they have information security organization in place to implement the provisions of Company’s information security policies. The information security responsibilities of all Service Provider and Channel Partner employees working for company shall be defined and communicated. 
The Service Provider and Channel Partner shall establish and maintain contacts with special interest groups to ensure that the understanding of the information security environment is current, including updates on security advisories, vulnerabilities and patches and ensure that the same is implemented. 
The Service Provider and Channel Partner shall conduct a Risk Analysis and ensure that all risks due to it own and subcontractors’ operations with company are identified, measured and mitigated as per the Company’s requirements. The 
Risk Assessment report is required to be shared with the Chief Security officer /CISO of company. 

Physical Security  
3.2.1 Service Provider and Channel Partnershall have physical and environmental controls that are commensurate to the risk for Company’s Confidential Information and equipment, assets, or facilities used to hold and process such information. 
3.2.2 All Contract Personnel including Subcontractors and their employees, agents and their employees of the Service Provider and Channel Partner accessing premises (sites, buildings or internal areas) to fulfil the purpose, where Company Information is stored or processed, shall be in possession ofan Identification or Electronic Access Control (“ID/EAC”) card. This card is to be used as a means of identity verification on these premises at all times and as such the photographic image displayed on the ID/EAC card must be clear and be a true likeness of the Contract Personnel or the Subcontractor or the Service Provider and Channel Partner’s employees, Subcontractors and agents. If the Company has any advanced identity verification systems the same would also apply. Company may re-define such verification measures from time to time. 




Logical Security / Access Control 
3.3.1 Service Provider and Channel Partnershall have appropriate access controls in place to maintain the confidentiality of Company’s Confidential Information. Such controls shall include: 
3.3.1.1Authorization process for physical, privileged, and logical access to facilities, systems, networks, wireless networks, operating systems, mobile devices, 
system utilities, and other locations containing COMPANY’s Confidential Information. Service Provider and Channel Partner shall grant access only if it is logged, strictly controlled, and needed for a consultant or third party to perform their job function. 
3.3.2 Authentication:Service Provider and Channel Partner must authenticate each consultant’s identity through appropriate authentication controls such as strong passwords, token devices, or biometrics. 
3.3.3 The Service Provider and Channel Partner shall notify Company immediately if any Contract Personnel no longer requires Access or change role for any reason whatsoever thus enabling company to disable or modify the Access rights. 
3.3.4 Systems Isolation:Service Provider and Channel Partner shall segregate logically all 
Company’s Confidential Information handled herein from all other information. The Service Provider and Channel Partner shall maintain systems, which detect and record any attempted damage, amendment or unauthorized access to company information. The Service Provider and Channel Partner shall, implement necessary and adequate security measures across products and services including software, data to ensure safeguard and confidentiality, availability and integrity of Company and Company Information. The Service Provider and Channel Partner shall provide Company with full documentation in relation to the implementation of logical security in relation to purpose and shall ensure that it has such security as: 
prevents unauthorized individuals e.g. hackers from gaining Access to Company Systems; and 
reduces the risk of misuse of Company Systems or Company Information, which could potentially cause loss of revenue or service (and its quality) or reputation, breach of security by those individuals who are Authorized to Access it; and 
•detects any security breaches that do occur enabling quick rectification of any problem that result and identification of the individuals who obtained Access and determination of how they obtained it 


Information Security  
3.4.1 The Service Provider and Channel Partner shall not use Company Information for any purpose other than for the purposes for which they were provided to the Service Provider and Channel Partner by company and only to the extent necessary to enable the Service Provider and Channel Partner to perform as per this Agreement. 
3.4.2 The Service Provider and Channel Partner shall ensure that all information security requirements in this Agreement are communicated including in writing to all Contract Personnel in relation to their role. 
3.4.3 The Service Provider and Channel Partner shall ensure procedures and controls are in place to protect the exchange of information through the use of emails, voice, facsimile and video communications facilities.

matching_standard_clause.title: The Service Provider shall have a comprehensive Information ...
matching_standard_clause.text:
The Service Provider shall have a comprehensive Information Security Policy that governs the services being provided to Care Health and the security policy must be reviewed and updated at least annually or earlier if there is a significant change to the operating environment. The Security Policy must validate the implemented controls as per ISO27001:2013. The Service Provider shall perform compliance validation yearly basis with Information Technology (IT) Act, 2008. Appropriate access control mechanisms will be deployed by the Service Provider so that un-authorized personnel cannot gain access to Care Health data.
The Service Provider shall label the Confidential Information while sharing it internally and externally and must implement comprehensive controls to protect Confidential Information w.r.t ISO 27001:2013, IT Act 2008. The Service Provider shall ensure that usernames and passwords used to access Care Health data will not be shared or divulged to any un-authorized person, or unauthorized personnel, Service Provider shall also ensure that usernames and passwords stay encrypted during transit and during storage.
Appropriate physical, technical & deterrent controls shall be implemented to prevent intrusions and unauthorized access to hard copy output containing Personal Information, Network Racks, Computing Devices, Care Health Confidential Information or Media containing Care Health Data.
The Service Provider shall annually reconcile their all Information Assets which are used for processing data of Care Health. 
Service Provider shall inform Care Health and obtain an approval before further outsourcing any service/services to third party, which may include sharing of personal data of Care Health users with resepct to this Agreement .
Exchange of any Care Health related Confidential Information shall be only done after written consent from Care Health.
Service Provider shall have a proactive solution for threat intelligence & remediation - capture/remediate/Delete Viruses and Malware in Files/Scripts/Software & Emails.
The Confidential Information involved in online transactions/Electronic Commerce shall be restricted and protected to prevent incomplete transmission, mis-routing, unauthorized message alteration, unauthorized disclosure, unauthorized message duplication or replay. 
Audit Logging for all System/s and application/s involved in Processing Care Health related data shall be enabled & protected to ensure unauthorized access and alteration. 
Vulnerability Assessment and Penetration Testing shall be conducted yearly on Internet facing systems and Vulnerability Assessment shall be conducted on Internal systems or network at least Yearly by Service Provider.
The Service Provider receiving the sensitive personal data or confidential information from Care Health or from any of its representatives shall not disclose it further. The international Standard IS/ISO/IEC 27001 on "Information Technology - Security Techniques - Information Security Management System - Requirements" shall also be adhered.
Service Provider shall have defined process for: 
Patch Network Devices and Servers using the formal change management process;
Password management policy;
Service Provider shall revoke the access provided to admin users and general users within one business day once they exit from the premises from Service Provider.
Service Provider shall have Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) where the Internet Facing servers/applications will reside and relevant (Physical & logical) segregation of Networks in place.
Service Provider shall report cyber/Information security incidents and also security incidents related information along-with correction and corrective actions to Care Health.
Service Provider shall implement Cryptographic controls (Email Encryption, Endpoint Encryption, Network Encryption).
All the Confidential Information shared during the Agreement will be disposed off by the Service Provider after the termination of the Agreement with Care Health.
No USB Access, Internet Access & E-Mail to outer Domain should be available on the systems processing Care Health Confidential information/Care Health customer information. In case the same is not feasible, compensating controls - relevant data leakage controls shall be implemented.
Sensitive personal data or information shall be Protected and controls to be demonstrated— Sensitive personal data or information of a person means such personal information which consists of information relating to;—
password;
financial information such as Bank account or credit card or debit card or other payment instrument details ;
physical, physiological and mental health condition;
sexual orientation;
medical records and history;
Biometric information;
Email address, physical address, phone number and name;
INCIDENT RESPONSE & NOTIFICATION:
The Service Provider shall promptly notify the Company of any actual or suspected security breach, unauthorized access, loss, or theft of the Company's data.
The Service Provider shall cooperate fully with the Company in investigating and resolving any security incidents and take appropriate measures to mitigate the impact of such incidents.

clauses.original_text:
Liaisons. Each Party will designate a liaison contact responsible for coordinating any cooperative efforts between the Parties which are contemplated by this Agreement and also to serve as the recipient of all inquiries from the Customer regarding each Party’s respective Products and Services. Either Party may change its liaison contact at any time upon prior written notice.
For LTIMindtree: 
[Name, Title, Contact Information]
For Alliance Partner: 
[Name, Title, Contact Information]
Responsibility. Except as otherwise agreed in writing, each Party will be responsible for only its own Products, Services and personnel and will have sole and complete control over the charges, terms and conditions for its Products and Services. Each Party will be solely responsible for negotiating agreements and fulfilling all orders, and shall contract directly with the Customer for its respective Products and Services. Notwithstanding the above, the Parties may agree in writing on a case-by-case basis to jointly provide Products and/or Services to Customers with one Party acting as the prime contractor and sub-contracting the relevant portion of the Products and Services to the other Party. 
Conduct. Each Party will conduct all business activities in a manner that does not disparage the good name, reputation, Products and Services of the other Party.
Updates. Each Party will use reasonable efforts to keep the other Party informed in a timely manner regarding any changes to such Party’s Products or Services.
Training. Each Party agrees to provide such training to the other Party’s personnel as is required to adequately market the relevant Party’s Products and Services. 
Technical Personnel. Each Party will provide the other Party reasonable access to its technical personnel as necessary to assist in the use and marketing of such Party’s Products as required for each Registered Opportunity.

matching_standard_clause.title: Both parties mutually agree that personnel assigned to perfo...
matching_standard_clause.text:
Both parties mutually agree that personnel assigned to perform the Services shall be competent and possess the necessary qualifications. The other party shall exercise exclusive control and direction over these personnel, thereby bearing sole responsibility for all associated liabilities and expenses. 
In the execution of this Agreement, the party's personnel will adhere to the standard workplace policies of both parties. The utilization of temporary employees by the party necessitates prior written consent from the other Party. 
Personnel assigned to provide services under this Agreement shall retain their status as employees of the respective party. Their assignment to provide services to another party shall not result in their becoming employees of the respective party. 
The party shall ensure that the personnel assigned to perform services receive all requisite training. 
Both parties acknowledge that the party and its employees are ineligible for and shall not be entitled to participate in any employee benefit plans offered by either Customer or any party. These benefit plans encompass but are not limited to, pension, profit-sharing, retirement, deferred compensation, welfare, insurance, disability, bonuses, vacation pay, severance pay, and similar programs. The party, to the maximum extent permitted by law, explicitly waives any and all rights to such benefits, regardless of whether they are currently available or may be introduced in the future. This acknowledgement, declaration, and waiver pertains to benefits, the respective party offers.  
Both the parties reserves the right, on reasonable notice, to request proof of compliance with the requirements of this Section.

clauses.original_text: Each Party agrees that during the term of this Agreement and for a period of one (1) year after the relevant individual’s last involvement with it, neither it nor its affiliates shall directly or indirectly solicit, attempt to solicit or induce, hire, recruit, employ, engage, any personnel of the other Party, or otherwise cause an employee or consultant of the other Party to terminate his or her employment, contractual or other relationship with the other Party in order to become an employee or consultant to or for LTIMindtree or Alliance Partner or either Party’s affiliates. For the purpose of the foregoing, “employee” or “consultant” shall mean any person who is presently employed or engaged by either Party or was employed or engaged by either Party in the twelve (12) months immediately preceding the solicitation or attempt to hire or hiring of such individual. The above prohibitions shall not apply to any change in employment status as arises by reason of operation of law (i.e., by reason of the operation of the Acquired Rights Directive or equivalent legislation).

matching_standard_clause.title: ANTI-CORRUPTION AND WHISTLEBLOWING
matching_standard_clause.text:
The Service Provider acknowledges and confirms to SG GSC that it has not and will not provide, promise or offer any illegitimate benefit to any person including any employee or officer of SG GSC in connection with the performance of obligations under this Agreement, or in order to have business from SG GSC pursuant to this Agreement. For avoidance of any doubt, illegitimate benefit means any benefit or advantage (whether in cash or kind) which is not legitimately due to the recipient, and includes any bribe or kickback.
The Service Provider shall report any possible acts of seeking bribery, illegitimate benefits and/or favors, illicit gratification, existence of conflict of interest, money laundering, corruption, violations of applicable law/policy or any other unlawful or unethical activity by the employees or representatives of SG GSC in dealing with Service Provider or in relation to the business activities of  SG GSC, which the Service Provider has knowledge or information of, via an email to GSC-Whistleblower@socgen.com. The identity of the Whistleblower/Service Provider will be kept secret and will not be disclosed without the consent of the Whistleblower/Service Provider.

matching_standard_clause.title: CONFIDENTIALITY
matching_standard_clause.text:
Each Party agrees to: (a) use the Confidential Information solely for the purpose of performing its obligations under this Agreement; (b) not to disclose any Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party to any third party without prior written consent of the Disclosing Party; (c) limit the dissemination of the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information to only those of the Receiving Party's officers, and employees (“Representatives”) who require access to such information to perform their functions in connection with the purpose for which the Confidential Information is disclosed and to the attorneys and financial advisors on a strict ‘need to know’ basis; (d) to ensure that each person or entity who is permitted to receive or have access to the Confidential Information is bound by a confidentiality obligation consistent with this Agreement; (e) to exercise the same degree of care with respect to the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information as it uses for its own confidential information of like importance, but no less than reasonable care; and (f) to return to the Disclosing Party, or if such return is not possible destroy, Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party at source which will be incapable of being recovered through normal or laboratory means upon receipt of a written request from the Disclosing Party without retaining any copy thereof.
Either Party shall have a right to disclose the Confidential Information to the legal / regulatory authorities pursuant to a binding court order or government regulation, provided that if permitted under law, the Receiving Party provides a notice to the Disclosing Party, in order for the Disclosing Party to obtain a protective order. If the Disclosing Party is unable to obtain a protective order, the Confidential Information may be disclosed only to the extent necessary under law.
Either Party is not permitted to discuss the other Party’s affairs with any member of the press and other news media without written authorization from the appropriate authorized representative of such other Party. Each Party acknowledges and agrees that any breach of the confidentiality obligations set forth in this Clause shall cause the other party irreparable harm for which monetary damages would be inadequate. Accordingly, in the event of such a breach, the Disclosing Party may seek injunctive or other equitable relief to enforce this Agreement in addition to any available legal remedies.
All Confidential Information disclosed by the Disclosing Party hereunder is provided "AS IS" and without warranty of any kind. All Confidential Information shall remain the property of the Disclosing Party. Nothing contained in this Clause or any disclosure pursuant to this Agreement shall be construed as granting any license or right under any intellectual property right, whether present or future.
This obligation to keep information confidential by both Parties shall survive determination, termination or expiration of this Agreement.

clauses.original_text:
General. Except as provided herein, this Agreement will not be construed to grant any license under any trade secret, patent, patent application, industrial design, trademark, copyright, mask work, confidential process, formula, plan, computer program, data or other valuable confidential information or know-how to either Party. Each Party will own and retain all of its right, title, and interest in and relating to its intellectual property rights in its Products and Services and Confidential Information, both currently used and that which it may be developed and used in the future.
Alliance Partner Product License.  
Trademark and Logo Usage. Each Party will have the non-transferable, non-exclusive, revocable license to use the other Party’s logo(s), trade name(s) and trademarks and the names of its Products (“Marks”) identified on Exhibit C, all in unmodified form, solely for identification purposes in performing the marketing activities described in this Agreement. All Marks must be reproduced on all copies of the Products and may not be altered or removed. The Party owning a Mark may modify, add or delete any such Marks upon thirty (30) days prior notice to the other Party. Each Party further agrees to ensure that all such use will comply with good trademark usage practices and the standards of display and trademark usage guidelines provided by the other Party and to take no action that would in any way infringe or interfere with the other Party’s rights in its Marks. Each Party agrees to cooperate fully with the other Party in facilitating the other Party’s monitoring and control of the nature and quality of the use of the other Party’s Marks. Neither Party will have any right, title or interest in the Marks of the other Party, which will remain its sole and exclusive property, and each Party will retain all goodwill insured through the use of their respective Marks and, thus, agrees to assign to the other Party any rights that such Party may acquire in the applicable Marks by operation of law or otherwise. At no time during or after the term of this Agreement will either Party challenge or assist others to challenge the other Party’s Marks or the registration thereof or attempt to register, use or permit the use of any trademarks, marks or trade names confusingly similar to those of the other Party.

matching_standard_clause.title: INCIDENT MANAGEMENT REPORTING
matching_standard_clause.text:
The Service Provider agrees that they have an incident reporting systems in place which would identify the criticality of incident including but not limited to breach of confidentiality data and intimate immediately within twenty-four (24) hours to ABFSSL/ ABC Companies. Service Provider shall on regular basis share and intimate ABFSSL/ ABC Companiesof the maintenance of the system and shall also on the steps they have taken to remediate further incidents. 
NON-SOLICITATION: Notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement, during the term of this Agreement, each Party to this Agreement and the parties signing the respective SoWs agree not to hire as its own employee or consultant, any employee or consultant of the other party to the SoW who is directly involved in the delivery or receipt of services under that SoW.
ENTIRE AGREEMENT: This Agreement constitutes the whole agreement between the Parties relating to the subject matter hereof and supersedes any prior agreements or understanding relating to such subject matter.
SEVERABILITY: If any provision or portion of a provision of this Agreement is held invalid or unenforceable, the remainder of the Agreement shall not be affected, and the remaining terms will continue in effect and be binding on the Parties.
ASSIGNMENT: 
Neither Party shall assign to any third party, this Agreement, or any part thereof, or any rights, benefits, obligations or interests herein, except with prior written consent of the other Party.
In the event that either of the Party is acquired, merged, amalgamated, reconstituted, consolidated or otherwise subject to corporate or capital restructuring by or with any other entity then this Agreement shall be binding on the acquirer or the Resultant Entity formed as a result of such restructuring for the remainder of the term of this Agreement without any change in terms of agreement.
COVENANTS REASONABLE: The Parties agree that, having regard to all the circumstances, the covenants contained herein are reasonable and necessary for the protection of the Parties and their investments. If any such covenant is held to be void the covenant will apply with such minimum modifications regarding its scope and duration as may be necessary to make it valid and effective.

Limitation. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Indemnifying Party will have no responsibility for any claim of infringement to the extent the claims arises solely from: (i) the unauthorized modification of the Indemnifying Party’s Products or materials used for marketing its Products and Services (“Marketing Materials”) by the other Party; (ii) compliance with or use of the Marketing Materials, specifications, instructions, technology or information of the other Party if such claim would have been avoided but for such compliance or use; (iii) use of the Product with products or services not supplied by the Indemnifying Party if such claim would have been avoided but for such use; or (iv) any marketing activities for the Products or Services by the other Party not in compliance with this Agreement. clauses.original_text:
Term. The term of this Agreement will be one (1) year from the Effective Date and will only be renewed when one Party gives the other Party notice of its intent to renew the Agreement at least thirty (30) days prior to the expiration of the then-current term, unless the Agreement is earlier terminated pursuant to Section 10.2 below.
Termination for Cause/Termination for Convenience. Either Party may terminate this Agreement following thirty (30) days written notice to the other of a material breach of this Agreement if such breach is not cured within such period. Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon notice to the other party if the (i) other Party becomes a direct competitor of the terminating Party; (ii) is acquired by a direct competitor of the terminating Party; or (iii) assigns this Agreement to a direct competitor of the terminating Party, as determined by the terminating Party in its sole discretion. may terminate this Agreement for convenience by providing thirty (30) days written notice to .
Consequences of Termination. Termination of this Agreement shall not affect any Registered Opportunity to the extent such Registered Opportunity has resulted in a contractual commitment to a Customer. Except as otherwise set forth in the preceding sentence, in the event of termination or expiration of this Agreement, each Party will immediately (i) cease all marketing activities hereunder and remove all related references to the other Party, its Products and Services and its Marks from its marketing and other materials and communication channels; and (ii) return any Products, software or hardware, if any, Marketing Materials, and Confidential Information provided by the other Party.
Termination Remedies Not Exclusive. The termination rights and obligations of the Parties set forth above in this Section 10 are not exclusive, but are in addition to any other rights and remedies available to the Parties, in law or in equity, for breach of this Agreement.

matching_standard_clause.title: TERM AND TERMINATION
matching_standard_clause.text:
Term. This Agreement shall become binding on the Parties from the Effective Date and shall continue for three (3) years “Initial Term”), and thereafter, shall automatically renew for additional 1 (one) year term (each, a “Renewal Term”) (the Initial Term and all Renewal Terms are collectively, the “Term”). Either Party may elect to not renew the Agreement for the Renewal Term by giving the other Party a prior written notice of its intention to not renew at least 60 (sixty) days before the expiry of the Initial Term or the then existing Renewal Term, failing which the Agreement shall stand renewed.

Termination at Will. shall have the right to terminate this Agreement at any time during the Term without assigning any reason whatsoever, by giving at least 0 (ty) days prior written notice to the other Party.
Termination for Cause. Either Party shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement upon thirty (90) days’ prior written notice to the other Party in the event of a material breach of any provision of this Agreement by the other Party if the notifying Party requires cure and such breach is not cured within thirty (30) days after the breaching Party’s receipt of notice of such breach (however, if the breach is capable of being cured and such breaching Party is working diligently to cure such breach the period for cure shall be extended for an additional thirty (30) days).   
Termination for Insolvency. Either Party may immediately terminate this Agreement upon the filing or institution of insolvency, bankruptcy, reorganization (in connection with any insolvency), liquidation or receivership proceedings, or upon an assignment of a substantial portion of the assets for the benefit of creditors by the other Party, or in the event a receiver or custodian is appointed for such other Party’s business, or if a substantial portion of such other Party’s business is subject to attachment or similar process; provided, however, that in the case of any involuntary bankruptcy proceeding or the attachment of a substantial portion of a Party’s assets, such right to terminate shall only become effective if the proceeding or attachment is not dismissed within one hundred and eighty (180) days after the admission thereof.

clauses.clause_title: LIMITATION OF LIABILITY AND FORCE MAJEURE
clauses.original_text:
EXCEPT FOR THE ALLIANCE PARTNER’S INDEMNITY OBLIGATIONS UNDER SECTION 9 OR ANY OTHER LIABILITY THAT CANNOT BE EXCLUDED BY APPLICABLE LAW, IN NO EVENT WILL EITHER PARTY’S TOTAL AND CUMULATIVE LIABILITY IN AGGREGATE TO THE OTHER PARTY UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, EXCEED $10,000. IN NO EVENT WILL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL OR INCIDENTAL DAMAGES, HOWEVER CAUSED, EVEN IF SUCH PARTY IS ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. LIMITATIONS OF LIABILITY WILL APPLY NOTWITHSTANDING ANY FAILURE OF ESSENTIAL PURPOSE OF ANY LIMITED REMEDY.
In the event that either Party is unable to perform any of its obligations under this Agreement as a result of natural disasters, epidemics or pandemics, quarantine, actions or decrees of governmental bodies, communication line failures not the fault of the affected Party, or any other delay or failure which arises from causes beyond a Party’s reasonable control (hereafter referred to as a “Force Majeure Event”), the Party whose performance has been so affected shall not be liable for such non-performance but shall promptly give notice to the other Party and shall use commercially reasonable efforts to resume performance as soon as possible. If the period of non-performance exceeds fifteen (15) days from the receipt of notice of the Force Majeure Event, the Party whose ability to perform has not been so affected may by giving written notice to terminate this Agreement.

matching_standard_clause.text:
It shall and hereby undertakes to provide regular updates at such intervals as may be specified by the HDFC AMC with respect to the Services provided in terms of this Agreement. HDFC AMC shall carry out monitoring and assessment with the purpose of undertaking any necessary corrective measure including but not limited to termination of the Agreement. The minimum period required to execute such termination/provision shall be (   ) days before the execution of the termination. 
SERVICE PROVIDER hereby agrees to ensure that high standards of care in performing the Services are maintained by it at all times and the HDFC AMC has the right to intervene with appropriate measures to meet legal and regulatory obligations and require it to take such appropriate measures as the HDFC AMC may deem fit.
Force majeure
It is expressly agreed that neither Party shall be liable for any default, delay, lapse or inability to fulfill their commitments hereunder, occasioned in whole or in part due to reasons beyond their control like strikes, lock-out, fire, war, tempest, sabotage, change of law, act or regulation of Government, inability to secure Government authorization and / or approvals or any other act of God or any other cause beyond their reasonable control (“Force Majeure Event”).
The Party claiming the Force Majeure Event shall promptly notify the other Party in writing of its reasons for the delay or stoppage and its likely duration and shall take all reasonable steps to overcome the delay or stoppage.
Either Party may resume performance under the Agreement after the Force Majeure Event comes to an end.

clauses.original_text:
“Confidential Information” means any and all information disclosed by either Party (the “Disclosing Party”) to the other (the “Receiving Party”), which is marked “confidential” or “proprietary” or which should reasonably be understood by the Receiving Party to be confidential or proprietary, including, but not limited to, the terms and conditions of this Agreement, and any information that relates to business plans, services, marketing or finances, research, product plans, products, developments, inventions, processes, designs, drawings, engineering, formulae, markets, software (including source and object code), hardware configuration, computer programs, and algorithms of the Disclosing Party.
“Documentation” means OpsMx’s technical manuals or other documentation relating to end use of a Product. 
“End Clients” means final purchasers or licensees who obtain the Products from Reseller solely for such End User’s own internal business purposes and not for resale, sublicense or distribution.
"MSA" means OpsMx’s standard Master Software Agreement.
“Intellectual Property Rights” means any intellectual property or proprietary rights, including but not limited to copyright rights, moral rights, trademarks (including logos, slogans, trade names, service marks), patent rights (including patent applications and disclosures), know-how, inventions, rights of priority, and trade secret rights, recognized in any country or jurisdiction in the world.
“Products” means the Software Products/Services, and related Documentation.
“Software” means OpsMx’s proprietary software listed on Annex A attached hereto, in object code form, including any applications and connectors specifically listed on Annex A.
“Software Products” means a copy or copies of the Software, together with a copy or copies of any user manual or other Documentation customarily supplied to end Clients by OpsMx with a copy of the Software.  
“Territory” means APAC

matching_standard_clause.title: DEFINITIONS
matching_standard_clause.text:
“Agreement” shall mean this Agreement, including all Order Form(s) and any amendments agreed in writing by mutual consent of the Parties from time to time.
“Confidential Information” shall mean and include, but is not restricted to all non-public information of either Party that is technical and commercial concerning business, books of record and account, data systems, software, services, any materials, trade secrets, know-how, formulae, processes, algorithms, ideas, strategies, inventions, data, network configurations, system architecture designs, flow charts, drawings, proprietary information, personal data, business and marketing plans, financial and operational information, and all other non-public information, material or data relating to the current and/ or future business and operations, wages related information provided by the disclosing party  (“Disclosing Party”) to the other Party (“Receiving Party”) pursuant to this Agreement including the existence and terms and conditions of this Agreement , or any other information which may come to the knowledge of the Receiving Party. Confidential Information shall not include information which as evidenced by records: (a) is or becomes a part of the public domain through no breach of its confidentiality obligations by of the Receiving Party; (b) was in the Receiving Party’s lawful possession prior to the disclosure and had not been obtained by the Receiving Party either directly or indirectly from the Disclosing Party; (c) is lawfully disclosed to the Receiving Party by a third party entitled to disclose such information,  without restriction on disclosure; or (d) is independently developed by the Receiving Party or its Representatives without reference to the Confidential Information. 
“Corrupt Act” refers to any act consisting of soliciting, authorizing, offering, promising or granting any financial or other benefit (including any payment, loan, gift or transfer of an object of value) for the purpose of inducing a private individual or government official to carry out his duties dishonestly or in a manner that breaches his professional, legal or contractual obligations and/or obtain or retain business with the Customer in a dishonest or unwarranted manner.
“Delivery Date” means the date(s) specified in the Order Form by which the Reseller is required to deliver the Software’s.
“Delivery Location” means the location(s) specified in the Order Form at which the Reseller is required to deliver the Software’s.
“Order Form” shall mean an order in written form issued by SG GSC and accepted by the Reseller with respect to any requirement for the Software’s under this Agreement.
“Original Equipment Manufacturer” or “OEM” shall mean the original manufacturer / owner of the Software supplied by the Reseller under this Agreement.
“Personal Information” or “Personal Data” shall mean any information that relates to a natural person, which, either directly or indirectly, independently or in combination with other information is capable of identifying such person. 
"Software" shall mean any library, utility, tool, or other computer or program code, in object (binary) or source-code form, as well as the related documentation. Software includes the products delivered electronically, pre-installed on an appliance, or locally installed on hardware systems, and Software accessed through the internet or other remote means (such as websites, portals and "cloud-based" solutions).

clauses.original_text:
Ownership in General.  Notwithstanding anything to the contrary stated herein, no transfer is made to Reseller of title or ownership of any Intellectual Property Rights in and to the Products.  Ownership of all Intellectual Property Rights in and to the Products (including without limitation the Documentation, media and software contained therein and all translations, updates, modifications, improvements, or derivative works thereof) is and shall remain with OpsMx.  Reseller shall not remove, alter, cover or obfuscate any copyright notices or other proprietary rights notices placed or embedded by OpsMx on or in any Products.  Reseller shall not, and shall not authorize or assist any third party to, (i) reverse engineer, disassemble, or decompile the Products or otherwise derive or attempt to derive the source code for the Software, except as otherwise expressly permitted by applicable law that may not lawfully be excluded by agreement between the parties; (ii) make unauthorized copies of the Products; or (iii) use the Products for the benefit of Reseller, or to support any third party.
Notification of Unauthorized Use.  Reseller shall promptly notify OpsMx in writing upon its discovery of any unauthorized use or infringement of the Products or of OpsMx’s Intellectual Property Rights with respect thereto.  OpsMx shall have the sole and exclusive right to bring an infringement action or proceeding or to take other measures to enforce its Intellectual Property Rights against a third party, and, in the event that OpsMx brings such an action or proceeding or takes such other measures, Reseller shall cooperate and provide full information and assistance to OpsMx and its counsel in connection with any such action, or proceeding or other measures, provided that all expenses of such action or measures shall be borne by OpsMx and all damages which may be awarded or agreed upon in settlement of such action or measures shall accrue only to OpsMx.
Third Party Software.  The Products may include software licensed from third parties, and the terms of this Agreement are intended to benefit such third parties, who may directly enforce applicable terms of this Agreement to protect their interest in such software.

matching_standard_clause.title: TERM AND TERMINATION
matching_standard_clause.text:
Term.  The term of this Agreement will commence on the Effective Date and will continue for a term of one year, unless sooner terminated under this Section 3.  This Agreement will automatically renew for successive one year terms unless terminated by either Party upon no less than 30 days’ written notice prior to the termination of the initial or any renewal term.
Termination for Breach.  This Agreement may be terminated for material breach of any provision of this Agreement by either Party, provided that written notice of the breach has been given to the breaching Party and the breaching Party has not cured the breach within 30 days after delivery of the notice.
Termination for Convenience.  Salt Security may terminate this Agreement at any time, for any reason or no reason and without further liability to Reseller, by providing Reseller with 5 days’ prior written notice.
Effect of Termination; Survival.  Reseller expressly agrees that Salt Security will have no obligation or liability to Reseller resulting from termination or expiration of this Agreement in accordance with its terms.  Upon expiration or termination of this Agreement for any reason, Reseller shall immediately cease all reseller activities with respect to the Products and Services under this Agreement and shall cease identifying itself as a Salt Security reseller or using the Salt Security Marks in connection with Reseller’s activities hereunder.  The provisions of Sections 1.3, 1.4, 1.7, 1.10, 2, 3.4, and 4–6 will survive expiration or termination of this Agreement for any reason.
