clauses.original_text:
This Agreement shall commence on the Execution Date and shall be valid until terminated in accordance with this Clause 7 (“Term”).
Either Party may terminate this Agreement by giving a thirty (30) days’ prior written notice to the other Party.
The Company may terminate this Agreement with a reasonable prior written notice to the Vendor where the Vendor breaches this Agreement and fails to rectify that breach within 7 (seven) days of receiving a notice of the breach from the Company.
This Agreement shall automatically terminate in the event that either Party (i) files a petition under any bankruptcy or insolvency laws or has any such petition filed against that is not discharged within 60 (sixty) days of the filing thereof, (ii) makes an assignment for the benefit of creditors, (iii) appoints or suffers appointment of a receiver or trustee over substantially all of its property that is not discharged within 90 (ninety) days after such filing, or (iv) proposes or is a party to any dissolution or liquidation.

matching_standard_clause.title: NON-SOLICITATION
matching_standard_clause.text:
Neither SG GSC nor the Service Provider shall Solicit or hire any employee / personnel of the other Party who is directly engaged in the provision of the Services under this Agreement, during the term of their involvement in providing the Services hereunder and for a period of one (1) year thereafter, without prior written consent of the other Party, except as agreed in the applicable SOW(s).  
"Solicit" shall not be deemed to include public advertising (e.g., in newspapers, websites, job portals or trade publications) and it is hereby clarified that in the event an advertisement recruiting personnel is published by one Party and any employee of the other Party, including an employee who has rendered any Services or is directly involved in the Services under this Agreement, applies for such post of its own volition, the Party who has advertised for recruitment of personnel shall not be deemed to be soliciting such personnel and shall be free to hire such employee if found to be suitable.

clauses.original_text:
The Vendor agrees and acknowledges in the course of its engagement with the Company, the Vendor might be exposed to various items of business secret and Confidential Information that are proprietary to the Company. The Vendor shall during the term of this agreement and 3 (three) years thereafter treat as strictly confidential, all records, data, and other information that comes within his knowledge during the term of this Agreement concerning the business of the Company or the Company and shall not at any time, directly or indirectly, use, disclose or divulge any Confidential Information except as required in connection with the performance of its duties for the Company, and except to the extent required by applicable laws (but only after the Vendor has provided the Company with reasonable notice and opportunity to take action against any legally required disclosure). Further, the Vendor shall not copy, reproduce and/or disclose any of the Confidential Information to any other party without the prior written consent of the Company. Upon a reasonable prior written request of the Company, the Vendor shall immediately deliver to the Company, all materials (including all soft and hard copies) in its possession, which contains or relate to the Confidential Information of the Company.
The term “Confidential Information” includes but is not limited to (a) intellectual property, know-how, techniques, processes, programs, schematics, software source documents, data, customer lists, financial information, sales and marketing plans, compilations of client, markets or industry specific demographics and statistics, whether in hard copy or electronic form and any other information which Vendor knows or has reason to know is confidential, proprietary or trade secret information, (b) information or material proprietary to the Company, including information relating to the business affairs of the Company and/or any of its affiliates, customers, clients, vendors, suppliers, consultants or service providers, (c) information designated as confidential by the Company, (d) trade secrets of the Company (e) the terms of this Agreement and (f) any other information imparted in confidence to the Vendor by the Company.

matching_standard_clause.title: CONFIDENTIALITY
matching_standard_clause.text:
Each Party acknowledges that it may obtain the Confidential Information of other Party in the course of performance of its obligations under this Agreement. 
The receiving Party shall only use the Confidential Information for the purpose, for which it is disclosed or otherwise agreed in writing between the Parties. Furthermore, the receiving Party shall keep Confidential Information received from the disclosing Party, in strict confidence and shall not disclose it to any third parties, except to a limited group of the receiving Party’s directors, officers, agents, authorized representatives on a “need-to-know” basis. The receiving Party shall treat all Confidential Information with the same degree of care as it uses to protect its own confidential information of like importance but in no event with less than reasonable care. 
In the event that the receiving Party is required to disclose Confidential Information pursuant to law or any order passed by the governmental department or court of law, the receiving Party will notify the disclosing Party of the required disclosure with sufficient time for the disclosing Party to seek relief, will cooperate with the disclosing Party in taking appropriate protective measures, and will make such disclosure in a fashion that maximizes protection of the Confidential Information from further disclosure.
Upon the termination or non-renewal of this Agreement or upon receiving a request from the disclosing Party, as the case may be, the receiving Party shall either return or dispose (as per the instructions of the disclosing Party) all the Confidential Information belonging to the disclosing Party and certify its actions to the disclosing Party.  
It is agreed that the unauthorized use or disclosure of any Confidential Information by the Customer in violation of this Agreement will cause severe and irreparable damage to the Company.  In the event of any violation of the confidentiality provisions of this Agreement, the Customer agrees that the Company shall be authorized and entitled to obtain from any court of competent jurisdiction preliminary and/or permanent injunctive relief, as well as any other relief permitted by applicable law. The Customer agrees to waive any right it may have as a condition for obtaining any such relief.
Notwithstanding the disclosure of Confidential Information, all Confidential Information shall be and shall remain the sole property of the Disclosing Party. The confidentiality obligations stated herein shall survive for a period of three (3) years from the date of termination or non-renewal of this Agreement.

clauses.original_text: This Agreement shall be governed and construed in accordance with the laws of India. All disputes, claims, suits and actions arising out of this Agreement, or its validity will be finally decided by arbitration in accordance with the provisions of the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996. The arbitral tribunal shall comprise of a sole arbitrator. The venue for arbitration shall be Chennai. Subject to the above, the courts in Chennai shall have exclusive jurisdiction to deal with any disputes arising out of this Agreement.

matching_standard_clause.title: CONSIDERATION
matching_standard_clause.text:
Both the Parties hereby acknowledge that it shall derive benefits in terms of its business growth and strengthening of customer base as a result of entering into this Agreement, which by itself is sufficient and complete consideration for themselves to enter into this Agreement. Neither Party shall be obligated to pay any other consideration in a monetary form or otherwise to the other.  
GOVERNING LAW, JURISDICTION AND ARBITRATION
This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of India. The Parties agree that if the process of the courts is required to be invoked for enforcement of Clause 13.2 below, including for seeking of any interim relief prior, during or after invocation of Clause 13.2 below, the competent courts and tribunals at Mumbai shall have exclusive jurisdiction and both the Parties hereto submit to the same.
All disputes, differences and/or claims arising out of these presents or as to the construction, meaning or effect hereof or as to the rights and liabilities of the Parties shall be settled by arbitration to be held in Mumbai in accordance with the provisions of the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996 and shall be referred to the sole arbitration of a person to be nominated mutually by both the Parties. The award including interim award/s of the arbitrator shall be final and binding on all Parties concerned. The arbitrator may lay down from time to time the procedure to be followed by him in conducting arbitration proceedings and shall conduct arbitration proceedings in such manner as he considers appropriate.

Neither Party shall, for any purpose, be deemed to be an agent or create a partnership/ joint venture with the other Party. The relationship between the Parties shall only be that of independent contractors. Neither Party shall have any right or authority to assume or create any obligations or to make any representations or warranties on behalf of the other Party, whether express or implied, or to bind the other Party in any respect whatsoever.
ASSIGNMENT/ SUBCONTRACTING
Except with the prior written consent from the Company, the Vendor shall not assign or subcontract its rights or obligations under this Agreement to any third party.

matching_standard_clause.title: RELATIONSHIP OF PARTIES
matching_standard_clause.text: The Parties acknowledge and agree that the Services performed by the Service Provider, its employees, agents or sub-contractors shall be as an independent contractor and that nothing in this Agreement shall be deemed to constitute a partnership, joint venture, agency relationship or otherwise between the Parties. Neither Party shall, by virtue of this Agreement, have any right or power to create any obligation, express or implied, on behalf of the other Party. The Service Provider shall retain the right to perform services, of the same or a different kind as those performed under this Agreement, for others during the term of this Agreement. The Company shall retain the right to cause services of the same or a different kind to be performed by its own personnel or other contractors during the term of this Agreement.

matching_standard_clause.title: HARDWARE MAINTENANCE SERVICES
matching_standard_clause.text:
To the extent specified in the PO/SOW, the Supplier must perform Hardware Maintenance Services for the benefit of Vodafone. Without limiting any other obligation of the Supplier under this clause, the Hardware Maintenance Services must comply with the requirements specified in the PO/SOW.
For the avoidance of doubt, the initial term of the Hardware Maintenance Services will not commence until the expiry of any Warranty Period for the Hardware.
Vodafone will cooperate with the Supplier by providing access and facilities as reasonably necessary to enable the Supplier to perform the Hardware Maintenance Services to the required standard.

clauses.original_text: Any notice or other communication to be given hereunder will be in writing and given by facsimile, post-paid registered or certified mail return receipt requested, or electronic mail (with a copy concurrently mailed as set forth above). The date of receipt shall be deemed the date on which such notice is given.  Notice hereunder will be directed to a Party at the address for such Party set forth in this Agreement.

matching_standard_clause.title: NOTICES
matching_standard_clause.text:
Any notice and other communications provided for in this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be sent to the following:
In the case of notices to Client:
the address stated as above in the introduction part or any other address as communicated by Client with an attention to the CFO of Client.
In the case of notices to Service Provider:
the address stated as above in the introduction part or any other address as communicated by the Service Provider in writing.
All notices shall be delivered in writing, and shall be deemed to have been validly given on the date of receipt thereof by the Party to whom such notice is addressed.
A Party may, from time to time, change its address or representative for receipt of notices provided for in this Agreement by giving to the other Parties not less than ten (10) days prior written notice.

No failure or delay on part of any Party hereto exercising any right, power or privilege hereunder shall operate as a waiver thereof, nor shall any single or partial exercise of any right, power or privilege hereunder preclude any other or further exercise thereof or the exercise of any other rights, powers or privileges by such Party.

matching_standard_clause.title: 19. Severability
matching_standard_clause.text: Each Party acknowledges that the provisions of this Agreement are reasonable and waives any defense to the strict enforcement thereof by the other Party.  If any provision of this Agreement is held by a court of competent jurisdiction to be void, invalid, unenforceable or illegal, the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect.

clauses.original_text:
Non-Disclosure Agreement
This One-way Non-Disclosure Agreement (“Agreement”) with Effective date 18th day of August 2023 is entered into by and                between
42Gears Mobility Systems Pvt. Ltd. with offices at 1st Floor, 2B, AMR Tech Park, Hosur Main Road, Bommanahalli, Bangalore- 560068, Karnataka, India (hereinafter termed as “Disclosing Party/Discloser”);
AND
Softcell Technologies Global Private Limited , with registered office at  303 B-Wing, Commercial-1 Kohinoor City, Kirol Road, Kurla (W) Mumbai - 400070 Maharashtra, India and branch office at 1st Floor, 16 Haudin Road, Ulsoor Bengaluru – 560042 Karnataka, India
(Hereinafter referred as “Receiving Party/Recipient”)
This Agreement will govern all Confidential Information shared by Disclosing party to Receiving party for itself and its subsidiaries and affiliates. For the purposes of this Agreement, the Disclosing Party has agreed to disclose its Confidential Information (as defined hereunder), subject to the terms and conditions contained herein and desires the Receiving Party to treat the said Confidential Information as confidential.
Confidential Information: Confidential Information means current and future product information, financial information, current and prospective customer lists, employee information, proprietary software and product related information, tools, methods, diagrams, prototypes, samples, services and support procedures, trade secrets and any other proprietary information that may be disclosed between the parties whether orally or in writing. Any Confidential Information disclosed by a Disclosing Party in writing will be identified as such and any Confidential Information disclosed orally will be identified as confidential at the time of disclosure and will be reduced to writing within thirty (30) days of disclosure or any Information which seems to be Confidential by the circumstances ascribed to it.
The Receiving Party acknowledges and confirms the confidential and sensitive nature of all information, documents and material that (i) may be disclosed or made available to the Receiving Party by the Disclosing Party or its employees/ representatives/ advisors/ Consultants /Including PII – personally Identifiable information of any individual.; (ii) Receiving Party may process or arrive at during the course of the discussion; (iii) Receiving Party may have come across during its discussions with the Disclosing Party; and (iv) All enquiries, negotiations and discussions between the Parties relating to the Services (all the information referred to above is hereinafter referred to as the “Confidential Information”).
Obligations: The Receiving Party shall maintain confidentiality of the Discloser’s Confidential Information with reasonable care and discretion and no less than the degree of care used to protect its own Confidential Information to prevent (a) unauthorized use by any person whether an employee or a third party; (b) unauthorized disclosure to a person without a need to know (c) unauthorized publication of Confidential Information. The Receiving Party will not attempt to decompile, disassemble, and reverse engineer Discloser’s Confidential Information or attempt to reconstruct or discover any source code, underlying ideas, techniques or algorithms in Discloser’s Confidential Information by any means.
Exceptions: Confidential Information shall not include the following:
Information known to Recipient prior to it being shared by Discloser;
Information available in the public domain without any fault of the Recipient;
Information independently developed by the Recipient;
Information disclosed by a third party to Recipient without any confidentiality obligation.
If Recipient is required by a government body or a court of law to disclose any Confidential Information, Recipient shall give sufficient prior notice to the Discloser for the Discloser to seek a protective order or to contest the disclosure and provide assistance to Discloser in its efforts. In case Recipient is obligated to disclose the Confidential Information it shall take reasonable care to limit such disclosure to the minimum.
No warranty: The Confidential Information disclosed hereby is disclosed “as is” without any warranty, responsibility or liability of any manner including that of warranty of fitness for a particular purpose. The Recipient understands and agrees that there is no license granted by 42Gears to Recipient pursuant to this Agreement to use any Confidential Information for any purpose other than for the purpose for disclosure by 42Gears.
This Agreement imposes no obligation on Disclosing Party to share any Confidential Information or get into any contractual arrangement with the Receiving Party.
Ownership: All Confidential Information will remain the exclusive property of the Disclosing Party. Recipient will not use any trade name, trademark, logo or any other proprietary rights of the Disclosing party (or its Affiliates) in any manner without prior authorization of such use by an authorized representative of such Disclosing party.
Recipient acknowledges that breach or threatened breach of any provisions of this Agreement including but not limited to unauthorized and improper disclosure of Confidential Information will lead to irreparable damages to the Discloser, therefore Discloser shall be entitled (a) to equitable relief including injunctive relief/temporary restraining order in addition to all other remedies available under law in case of unauthorized and improper disclosure, and (b) to be indemnified by the Receiving Party from any loss or harm, including but not limited to attorney’s fees, arising out of or in connection with any breach or enforcement of the Receiving Party’s obligations under this Agreement or the
unauthorized use or disclosure of the Disclosing Party’s Confidential information.
Term and Termination: This Agreement will remain in effect for twelve (12) months from the Effective date. Either party may terminate this Agreement by providing a fifteen (15) days’ written notice to the other party before the end of the Term. A Receiving Party’s obligation to maintain confidentiality will remain in effect for three (3) years from the date of disclosure and will survive termination of the Agreement. Upon termination, or earlier at the request of the Discloser, Recipient will return all Confidential Information and copies thereof to the Discloser. At the Discloser’s request, Recipient shall destroy such Confidential Information and certify the same in writing by an authorized signatory of the Recipient.
This Agreement is governed by and will be construed in accordance with the laws of India. The parties agree to submit any dispute arising from this Agreement before the courts in Bengaluru, India.
This Agreement does not create any agency or partnership relationship between the parties. This Agreement forms the entire understanding between the parties with respect to Confidential Information and supersedes any prior discussions or understandings between the parties with respect to Confidential Information. This Agreement cannot be assigned or transferred by either party without the prior written consent of the other party. Any modification to this Agreement has to be made in writing between the parties.
Agreed in writing by:
42Gears Mobility Systems Pvt. Ltd. 
Authorized Signatory: Ashok Poojari  
Designation: Chief Financial Officer
Date: 01-08-2023
Softcell Technologies Global Private Limited

matching_standard_clause.title: BY AND BETWEEN
matching_standard_clause.text:
Fullerton India Credit Company Limited, a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 1956 and having its registered office at Megh Towers, 3rd Floor, Old No. 307, New No. 165, PH Road, Maduravoyal, Chennai, Tamil Nadu – 600 095 and its corporate office at Floor 6, B Wing, Supreme Business Park, Powai, Mumbai - 400076 (hereinafter referred to as  “FICCL” which term shall so far as the context admits be deemed to mean and include its  successors and assigns) of the ONE PART;
AND
THE PERSONS as more particularly described in Schedule I (hereinafter referred to as the “Service Provider”) of the OTHER PART;
FICCL and the Service Provider shall hereinafter be collectively referred to as “Parties” and individually as “Party”.
WHEREAS:
The Service Provider is engaged in providing services to various entities and organizations, in the ordinary course of its business and has offered to provide specialized Services to FICCL more particularly described in Schedule II (hereinafter referred to as “Services”); 
FICCL has agreed to enter into an arrangement with the Service Provider so as to obtain Services (as defined below), on the terms and conditions as contained in this Agreement. 
NOW THIS AGREEMENT WITNESSETH AS FOLLOWS:
SERVICES: 
The Service Provider shall provide specialized Services to FICCL more particularly described in Schedule II (hereinafter referred to as “Services”). 
FICCL may initiate a request for the Services by executing an order (each, an "Order") specifying the Services desired. The Service Provider shall provide Services at/pertaining to places/offices/ branches mentioned in the Schedule IV attached hereto. Any addition/ deletion to the list of locations contained in Schedule IV may be done in writing with mutual consent of the Parties. The terms and conditions of this Agreement shall apply to and govern all Orders accepted by Service Provider hereunder, except that Orders may include other terms and conditions which are inconsistent with the terms and conditions of this Agreement or which are mutually agreed to in writing by FICCL and Service Provider.
FICCL may propose changes to the scope, nature or time schedule of the Services being performed under this Agreement. The Parties will mutually agree in writing to any proposed changes, including adjustments to fees and expenses as a result of any changes to the Services.
The Service Provider warrants to FICCL that the materials and services to be delivered or rendered hereunder will be of the kind and quality designated, and shall meet specifications or performance level as mutually agreed between the Parties from time to time. The performance of each individual Service will be monitored. The benchmarks, targets and metrics to be used in the measurement of performance levels will be as mutually agreed between the Parties from time to time. Service review meetings will be held on periodic basis to monitor the service and performance level. Reports on actual service levels achieved will be provided to FICCL within ten working days after the end of each month. The said reports will cover each service component delivered and the performance achieved compared with target. 
Service Provider acknowledges and agrees that this Agreement does not constitute an exclusive agreement between FICCL and Service Provider nor does FICCL commit or guarantee any volume of availment of Services or rupee amount hereunder.
TERM:
This Agreement is effective from the date as specified in Schedule I attached hereto (“Effective Date”).
This Agreement shall continue in effect for a period as specified in Schedule I hereunder (the "Initial Term"), unless earlier terminated pursuant to the provision contained in this Agreement or unless extended by FICCL at its option for further period as mutually agreed between the parties (“Extended Period”) following the expiration of the Initial Term or extended on a month-to-month basis in accordance with sub-section hereof. FICCL shall notify Service Provider 1 (one) month before the expiration of the Initial Term, of its intent to extend the Initial Term. The Initial Term and the Extended Period, if any, together shall hereinafter be referred to as the "Term". In the event FICCL exercises the option to extend the Term, the charges/ fees for the Extended Period shall remain the same unless mutually agreed between the Parties.
After expiration of the Initial Term, in the event the option to extend has not been exercised by FICCL, and in the event this Agreement is not extended by written agreement of the Parties and is not otherwise terminated as provided herein, this Agreement shall continue in full force and effect on a month-to-month basis till the date of execution of any document for extension of the Term or until terminated by Parties on no less than 30 (thirty) days' prior notice. During such continuation of the Agreement the terms and conditions herein recorded shall be valid, subsisting and remain binding on both Parties.
SERVICES FEE AND BILLING:
In consideration of said Services to be provided by the Service Provider, FICCL shall pay charges/fees (“Charges”) as specified and in the manner mentioned in the Schedule III hereunder. The Charges for the Services shall not be subject to change during the Term of this Agreement unless expressly provided for in this Agreement. Invoices shall be consolidated and submitted by Service Provider on a monthly basis and shall be due and payable not later than the 30th day from the date of receipt of the invoice by FICCL, subject to deduction of taxes as per applicable laws. There will be no late payment service charge of any kind. FICCL may, upon notice to Service Provider, withhold payment for Services that fail to meet the minimum performance standards as stipulated from time to time by FICCL and/or question any items invoiced to FICCL. Such non-payment shall not constitute a default or breach of this Agreement. In the event of any dispute between FICCL and Service Provider with respect to the invoiced Services or other related matters, FICCL shall pay the undisputed amount and FICCL and Service Provider shall promptly seek to resolve the disputed matters.
Service Provider shall be responsible for and pay all taxes on Goods and Services, levies, duties, assessments and deductions of every nature required by law in connection with the provision of Services under this Agreement. 
All invoices shall be numbered and dated and Service Provider agrees not to repeat the invoice number for at least a 7 (seven) year period. In addition to statutory requirements, each invoice shall contain, at a minimum, the following information:
The time period covered by the invoice;
An itemized listing of Services provided and the costs associated therewith by FICCL;
Sub-totals;
Taxes on Goods and Services wherever applicable; and 
Additional information reasonably requested by FICCL from time to time.

FICCL may propose changes to the scope, nature or time schedule of the Services being performed under this Agreement. The Parties will mutually agree in writing to any proposed changes, including adjustments to fees and expenses as a result of any changes to the Services.
The Service Provider warrants to FICCL that the materials and services to be delivered or rendered hereunder will be of the kind and quality designated, and shall meet specifications or performance level as mutually agreed between the Parties from time to time. The performance of each individual Service will be monitored. The benchmarks, targets and metrics to be used in the measurement of performance levels will be as mutually agreed between the Parties from time to time. Service review meetings will be held on periodic basis to monitor the service and performance level. Reports on actual service levels achieved will be provided to FICCL within ten working days after the end of each month. The said reports will cover each service component delivered and the performance achieved compared with target. 
Service Provider acknowledges and agrees that this Agreement does not constitute an exclusive agreement between FICCL and Service Provider nor does FICCL commit or guarantee any volume of availment of Services or rupee amount hereunder.
TERM:
This Agreement is effective from the date as specified in Schedule I attached hereto (“Effective Date”).
This Agreement shall continue in effect for a period as specified in Schedule I hereunder (the "Initial Term"), unless earlier terminated pursuant to the provision contained in this Agreement or unless extended by FICCL at its option for further period as mutually agreed between the parties (“Extended Period”) following the expiration of the Initial Term or extended on a month-to-month basis in accordance with sub-section hereof. FICCL shall notify Service Provider 1 (one) month before the expiration of the Initial Term, of its intent to extend the Initial Term. The Initial Term and the Extended Period, if any, together shall hereinafter be referred to as the "Term". In the event FICCL exercises the option to extend the Term, the charges/ fees for the Extended Period shall remain the same unless mutually agreed between the Parties.
After expiration of the Initial Term, in the event the option to extend has not been exercised by FICCL, and in the event this Agreement is not extended by written agreement of the Parties and is not otherwise terminated as provided herein, this Agreement shall continue in full force and effect on a month-to-month basis till the date of execution of any document for extension of the Term or until terminated by Parties on no less than 30 (thirty) days' prior notice. During such continuation of the Agreement the terms and conditions herein recorded shall be valid, subsisting and remain binding on both Parties.
SERVICES FEE AND BILLING:
In consideration of said Services to be provided by the Service Provider, FICCL shall pay charges/fees (“Charges”) as specified and in the manner mentioned in the Schedule III hereunder. The Charges for the Services shall not be subject to change during the Term of this Agreement unless expressly provided for in this Agreement. Invoices shall be consolidated and submitted by Service Provider on a monthly basis and shall be due and payable not later than the 30th day from the date of receipt of the invoice by FICCL, subject to deduction of taxes as per applicable laws. There will be no late payment service charge of any kind. FICCL may, upon notice to Service Provider, withhold payment for Services that fail to meet the minimum performance standards as stipulated from time to time by FICCL and/or question any items invoiced to FICCL. Such non-payment shall not constitute a default or breach of this Agreement. In the event of any dispute between FICCL and Service Provider with respect to the invoiced Services or other related matters, FICCL shall pay the undisputed amount and FICCL and Service Provider shall promptly seek to resolve the disputed matters.
Service Provider shall be responsible for and pay all taxes on Goods and Services, levies, duties, assessments and deductions of every nature required by law in connection with the provision of Services under this Agreement. 
All invoices shall be numbered and dated and Service Provider agrees not to repeat the invoice number for at least a 7 (seven) year period. In addition to statutory requirements, each invoice shall contain, at a minimum, the following information:
The time period covered by the invoice;
An itemized listing of Services provided and the costs associated therewith by FICCL;
Sub-totals;
Taxes on Goods and Services wherever applicable; and 
Additional information reasonably requested by FICCL from time to time.

The Bank shall review for material errors or defects the documentation to be delivered by Service Provider in accordance with the Work Order which may include reports, analysis, policies etc. The Bank shall complete such review and indicate whether the documentation is accepted within a period of seven (7) days of receipt of such documentation, failing which documentation is deemed to be approved.  The Bank shall notify Service Provider in writing during this period if revisions to the documentation are required under this paragraph and such revisions need to be mutually agreed. 
Service Provider shall make revisions on the unaccepted documentation and deliver the revised documentation expeditiously after notification.

clauses.original_text:
Any training to be provided to the Bank’s employees and or resources as part of the Services, the same shall be as per the provisions of the Work Order for increasing the efficacy of the staff and for implementation of the project as per the Work Order. The training shall be provided as may be agreed in the scope of work. 
4. SERVICE PROVIDER’S REPRESENTATIONS
4.1 The Service Provider hereby represents, warrants and confirms that:
It has full capacity, power and authority to enter into this Agreement and during the continuance of this Agreement, will continue to have full capacity, power and authority to carry out and perform the Service Provider’s obligations and has already taken and will continue to take all necessary and further actions, (including wherever applicable without limitation obtaining of necessary approvals/consents/licenses as are applicable under Applicable Law).
To its best knowledge, it has the necessary skills, knowledge, experience, expertise, required capital net worth, adequate and competent Service Provider’s Employees, Qualified Personnel, systems, equipment and procedures and capability to duly perform the Service Provider’s obligations in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.
The execution of this Agreement and providing Services and delivering Deliverables hereunder, does not and will not violate any Applicable Law and further, to its best knowledge, will not violate or breach any covenants, stipulations or conditions of any agreements or undertaking entered into by the Service Provider with any other Person.
It shall take all reasonable measures to ensure that information and the mode of transfer (within Service Provider’s area of influence) to and from the Bank’s materials is secure and it shall not use, analyse or access the Bank data traffic or any other data except for the limited purposes necessary for undertaking its contractual obligations as set out herein. The Services will be performed in a competent manner and substantially in accordance with any mutually agreed specifications. 
The Service Provider hereby acknowledges and accepts that the Bank has relied upon the above representations and warranties and have entered into this Agreement.
The Service Provider represents and warrants to the Bank that (i)  prior to delivery of any Deliverable or provision of any Service to the Bank, the Service Provider shall have obtained assignment or license of all right, title and interest in and to such deliverable, to the extent necessary for Service Provider to grant to the Bank the rights and licenses granted hereunder; (ii) the Service Provider has not received any written notice or claim, and is not otherwise aware, that any of the deliverables and the use thereof by the Bank and authorized users in accordance with this Agreement as contemplated hereunder, infringes or misappropriates, or would infringe or misappropriate the patent, copyright, trademark, trade secret or other Intellectual Property Rights of any third party;  and (iii) the Services performed by the Service Provider hereunder shall be of professional quality, consistent with generally accepted industry standards for the work of a similar nature.
It shall ensure that services provided under each Work Order will substantially conform to the agreed functional and technical specifications as is set out in the Work Oder and any other such agreed specificationsIt shall ensure that all Services provided to the Bank will not infringe or misappropriate any Intellectual Property rights of any Third Party.  
The Bank  agrees that the Service Provider shall not be liable for any claims of infringement arising from (a) combination of the Deliverable with any hardware, software, data, or other materials not provided and approved by the Service Provider; or (b) the Service Provider’s compliance with the Bank’s specifications, information, designs or requirements; or (c) the Bank’s use of Deliverables for purposes other than those specified under applicable SOW(s) or for any illegal purpose; or (d) the Bank’s failure to comply with the Service Provider’s instructions related to Deliverables.
It has no right, title, or interest in any and all Deliverables whether or not registrable under any statute for the time being in force, except otherwise agreed in writing by the Bank. 
It shall ensure that the resources deployed for rendering services are adequately trained for the required tasks as per the Work Order and any specific training requirements that Bank may require. The Service Provider shall develop and establish a robust framework for documenting, maintaining and testing business continuity and recovery procedures . The Service Provider shall periodically test the business continuity and recovery plan and shall occasionally conduct a joint testing and recovery exercises with the Bank.
4.2  The Service Provider agrees to be vigilant and to report all violations of information security and all suspected security events immediately to concerned teams in the Bank.
The Service Provider further represents, undertakes and agrees that it shall ensure (1) to comply with the provisions of Information Technology Act and the rules framed thereunder including Information Technology (Reasonable security practices and procedures and sensitive personal data or information) Rules, 2011; (b) to monitor the security practices, control processes and checks in respect of the confidential information on a regular basis; (c) to comply with the acceptable usage policy and any other policies as may be informed in writing to the Service Provider by the Bank from time to time, and ( d ) to disclose any breaches in the security practices, control processes and checks without undue delay to concerned employee of the Bank
4.3 The Service Provider represents and warrants that it will provide an integrity certificate from the original equipment manufacturer (OEM) that the OEM has all the necessary legitimate rights, licenses and/or authorization as regards software, Source Code, tools, techniques, used by it relating to the Services rendered under this agreement and for providing the Services and safe guarding the Confidential Information on a periodic basis and as requested by the Bank. 
4.4 The Service Provider agrees that as and when Service Provider is undertaking any incident management testing  internally or externally through any person/Agency/process/service/technology associated with the Bank,  the Service Provider shall inform the Bank and with prior consultation and approval of the Bank, the testing/demonstration shall be carried out by the Service Provider at least once a year or as and when  required by the Bank, any Statutory Body, Regulatory Body as the case may be. Such testing/demonstration of incident management should include, but not limited to, reporting and detecting security incidents involving the networks, systems and/or application used to provide services under the Purchase Order raised from time to time, processes and procedures for assessing the severity of the incident, identifying the cause of incident, redressing the cause to avoid future incidents, restoring normal operations and documenting the results of response post implementation of the redressal actions. Bank should be provided requisite details by the Service Provider within Seven working days from the date of conducting the test/demonstration.
4.5 Except As Otherwise Stated In This Clause, The Service Provider Makes No Warranties Of Any Kind Or Nature, Whether Express Or Implied, Including, But Not Limited To, Warranties Of Merchantability Or Fitness For A Particular Purpose Or Use, Or Warranties Of Any Deliverables Or Services, Or The Appropriateness Of The Bank’s Or Any Third-Party Specifications.  In Addition, The Service Provider Expressly Disclaims Any Warranty Or Liability With Respect To Design Or Latent Defects, Security Of Data, Or Compliance With Laws, Regulations, Or Other Official Government Releases Applicable To The Bank, Which Shall Be The Sole Responsibility Of The Bank.

matching_standard_clause.title: SUB-CONTRACTING AND ASSIGNMENT
matching_standard_clause.text:
The Service Provider shall itself perform its obligations under this Agreement and shall not assign, transfer, or sub-contract any of its rights and obligations in relation to all or part of the Services or related thereto. The Service Provider shall appoint sub-contractors and/or assign or transfer any of the rights and obligations under this Agreement with prior written consent of the Bank.  The Service Provider shall at all times remain responsible and liable to the Bank for all the actions of the agents, sub-agents/sub-contractors, assignee, or transferee, as the case may be, with no dilution or diminution of service, controls, penalties, etc.
Notwithstanding anything contrary contained in the terms of this Agreement, Service Provider shall ensure that such agents, sub-agent, sub-contractor, assignee or transferee etc. shall be bound by the terms of this Agreement. For the purpose of this clause and notwithstanding any such written consent being given by the Bank, the Service Provider shall remain liable for the acts and omissions of any delegate it has delegated its activities to i.e. sub agent, sub-contractor, agent etc. If such delegation is as a result of operation of any laws, then Bank shall have an option on such delegation to immediately terminate this Agreement at its discretion. The Service Provider shall be responsible and liable for the performance and risk management practices of its sub-contractors. 
The Bank shall be entitled to assign/transfer part/ all of its rights and benefits under this Agreement/this Agreement to any Person or entity without any prior notice or intimation to the Service Provider. However, the Service Provider shall not transfer or assign this Agreement and/or any obligations or rights under this Agreement to any third party without prior written consent of the Bank.
BUSINESS CONTINUITY PLAN (“BCP”)
The Service Provider hereby confirms that it has developed and established a robust framework for documenting, maintaining and testing business continuity and recovery procedures and the same are tested periodically and agrees to test such business continuity and recovery plan jointly with the Bank and shall ensure that the Service to the Bank would not be adversely affected in any manner on account of any factors including system breakdowns which may cause disruption in the normal functions of the Service Provider.
The Service Provider hereby agrees and understands that Services to be performed under this Agreement shall continue to be offered under ordinary circumstances. In the event of any difficulty in performing the required Services, Service Provider shall make best efforts to make alternative arrangements to ensure that the required Services are continued to be performed.
The Service Provider shall review and test its BCP on an annual basis and notify the Bank of any substantial changes to its BCP. The test shall validate the functionality and effectiveness of the BCP, including but not limited to the feasibility of the recovery time objectives, recovery point objectives and resumption operation capacities.
Following each test the Service Provider shall confirm to the Bank the functionality and effectiveness of the BCP. The Service Provider shall promptly notify the Bank of any test findings that may affect the Service Provider’s performance of its Services. The Service Provider shall promptly implement remedial measures or actions to address the test findings, including those required by the Bank.
Upon the Bank’s request, the Service Provider shall participate in the Bank’s business continuity and disaster recovery exercises in respect of the Services to be provided by the Service Provider.
The Service Provider shall, on request, provide copies of results of any independent assessments of such Business Continuity Plan to the Bank.

clauses.original_text:
5.1 The Service Provider hereby agrees, undertakes, and confirms as under:
The Service Provider shall, always, maintain and respect, and shall also procure its Employees and Qualified Personnel to maintain and respect, strict confidentiality of Confidential Information including all/any matters relating to the Services, Deliverables, and this Agreement. 
Without prior written permission of the Bank, the Service Provider and its Employee and Qualified Personnel shall not at any time use the name and/or trademark/logo of the Bank in any manner and for any purpose whatsoever.
The Services to be rendered and the Service Provider’s obligations to be performed pursuant to this Agreement shall be rendered and performed by the Service Provider, with utmost care and diligence and shall be of the highest quality and standards. If at any time the Bank is dissatisfied with the Services rendered by the Service Provider, the Bank shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement, provided that Service Provider is provided a cure period of 30 days. The Bank’s decision in this regard shall be final, absolute and binding on the Service Provider.
Any information handed over by the Bank to the Service Provider and/or its Employee or Qualified Personnel in terms of this Agreement or which comes into the hands of the Service Provider and/or its Employee or Qualified Personnel’s custody, power or possession pursuant to or in connection with this Agreement will remain the sole and absolute property of the Bank, and the Service Provider and /or its Employee or Qualified Personnel shall not have and also shall not claim any charge, claim, lien, right of retention, sale or set-off or other right, title or interest therein or thereon for any reason whatsoever. The Service Provider and/or its Employee or Qualified Personnel, shall not at any time use or attempt to use Bank’s logo/trademark or letterheads for any purpose whatsoever.
The Service Provider shall at all times be responsible for conducting periodic background verification checks on its Employee and Qualified Personnel and ensure that the Employee and Qualified Personnel deployed at the Bank’s facilities and/or its own premises shall have no adverse track record including any criminal complaints/ convictions. Service Provider shall promptly inform the Bank if it has any such knowledge of criminal complaints / convictions after deployment of its Employee and Qualified Personnel at the Bank premises/Project Sites/its own premises and make adequate arrangements for substitution of such Employee and Qualified Personnel. 
Service Provider agrees to maintain its books and records reasonably relating to the services performed and invoices issued pursuant to this Agreement for a period of Five (5) years following the end of the calendar year in which the work was performed, and during that time and/or  may be required under Applicable Law whichever is higher , the Bank shall be entitled to access all books, records and information relevant to the Services available with the Service Provider. Upon request from the Bank, the Service Provider shall within 2 (two) business days of such request provide to the Bank access to all the books, records and information in connection with Services.
The Bank shall have a right, but not the obligation, to continuous monitor and assess the Services to be provided by the Service Provider under this Agreement and suggest corrective measures, if any, required to can be taken by the Service Provider.The Service Provider sall not without prior approval/consent of the Bank, use any sub-contractor for undertaking all or part of the Services.
The Bank and its authorized representatives shall have a right to periodically conduct audits on the Service Provider whether by its internal or external auditors, or by agents that are not the competitors of the Service Provider in conjunction with the services performed for the Bank with a prior written notice of ten(10) days. Such audit shall not disturb the normal business hours  of the Service Provider, such audit will exclude internal financial data, other customer data of the Service Provider. Incase of any surprise audit if insisted by any statutory/RBI authorities, the same shall be  provided by the Service Provider. 
Upon request by the Bank, the Service Provider shall allow RBI or persons authorized by it to access Bank’s documents, records of transactions, and other necessary information given to, stored or processed by the Service Provider within a reasonable time.
The Service Providers recognizes the right of RBI to cause an inspection to be made of a Service Provider and its books and account by one or more of its officers or employees or other persons.
The Service Provider shall preserve all the documents and data pertaining to the Services in accordance with the legal/regulatory obligation of the Bank in this regard.
The Service provider shall maintain at its cost worker’s compensation insurance coverage, commercial liability insurance coverage, medical insurance coverage, insurance coverage against physical loss or damage to Service provider’s equipment.
(l ) The Service Provider shall depute Qualified Personnel for the purpose of this agreement and the Service Provider shall ensure that Service Provider’s Employees and Qualified Personnel shall strictly adhere to their norms as required to fulfil the roles and responsibilities assigned to them to the satisfaction of the Bank. It is the sole responsibility of the Service Provider to ensure the safety of its staff and to follow the security norms, while they are performing their duties in the premises of the Bank and the Bank shall never be held responsible for any breach of terms, negligence occurred during its performance under this agreement. 
(m) In case the Services provided by Service provider’s Employees/Qualified Personnel are found not to be satisfactory, in such case the Bank shall inform the same to the Service Provider in writing specifying the reason and requesting to replace the employee or sub-contractor and the Service provider shall within 30 days  or any other period as may be mutually agreed, replace the existing staff with new qualified/experience staff.
(n) Unless otherwise specified in the Work Order, in the event any of Service Provider’s resource remain absent for two consecutive days in a month without the ervice rovider providing the Bank with an alternate resource of the same skillsets/competence and qualification. 
The Service Provider shall provide access to Confidential Information of the Bank only to such Service Provider’s Employees who have executed a Non-Disclosure Agreement and further such access shall only be provided on 'need to know' basis i.e., limited to those areas where the information is required in order to perform the Services.
(p) To extent the Service Provider has any access to Bank’s information, the Service Provider shall isolate and clearly identify the Bank’s customer information, documents, records and assets to protect the confidentiality of the information. In instances, where Service Provider acts as an outsourcing agent for multiple banks, non banking financing services and financial institutions, maximum care shall be taken by it to build robust safeguards so that there is no intermingling of information/documents, records and assets.
If applicable and there are any Services provided on Service Provider’s environment, the Bank shall have a right to review and monitor the security practices and control processes of the Service Provider on a regular basis and require the Service Provider to disclose security breaches. The Service Provider shall provide Services in compliance with the Applicable laws and rules made thereunder, as amended, modified or substituted from time to time. 
(q) In the event that the Service Provider does not deliver the Services as per the specified time schedule due to default on its part, the Bank shall be entitled to procure the Services required under the Work Order from a Third Party without any cost to Service Provider.
(r) In the event that the Service Provider has knowledge or reasonable belief that anything prevents or is likely to prevent or threatens to prevent the timely performance of the Services or other obligations of Service Provider under this Agreement, it shall promptly notify the Bank of such an event or probable event.  The Bank shall in its sole discretion grant Service Provider a reasonable extension of time, if so requested by the Service Provider to complete additional or changed work in the event that Bank’s requirements materially change. 
(s) Service Provider shall for each Work Order designate a project manager, who will be principally responsible for coordinating and monitoring the performance of the Work Order.  Any change in the project manager shall be forthwith intimated to the Bank.  Upon such intimation, all communications would be made with such new project manager. 
(t) Service Provider shall assign and maintain qualified and trained software professionals or other professionals of high calibre to work on the Bank’s assigned projects on project need basis. If, for any reason, any individual is no longer available, or in the opinion of the Bank any individual / personnel assigned needs to be replaced, the service provider will be given a thirty days’ notice (30) to replace such individual/professional.  Service Provider will use reasonable endeavours to replace such  individual promptly by another person of equal competence within a mutually  agreed time frame. Service Provider will however, use reasonable endeavours to minimize changes in the Qualified Personnel to discharge Service Provider's obligations.
(u) Service Provider agrees that the Services and Deliverables shall meet the service level requirements as per the respective service level standards set out in the corresponding Work Order.
(v) All Services and Deliverables shall be rendered/delivered in accordance with the time schedule specified in the Work Order,  except to the extent delays are caused by Bank or any other factors including but not limited to Bank’s  delays providing any approvals, inputs, confirmations, information, force majeure event or any other reasons not attributable to Service Provider
A delay by Service Provider in the performance of Services or delivery of Deliverables due to reasons solely and directly attributable to Service Provider or its Qualified Personnel shall render Service Provider liable to imposition of liquidated damages as identified in the Work Order. This clause will be applicable only if liquidated damages are specifically identified in the Work Order. In any event, unless otherwise agreed in the Work Order, liquidated damages shall not exceed 5% of Work order value during one (1) year. The Service Provider shall comply with procedures to deal with deficiencies in compliance with the obligations undertaken under this Agreement as note by auditors, government regulators, and other internal or external agencies and provide relevant solutions, within the time frame notified and mutually discussed by with the Bank at no additional cost to the Bank. 
The Service Provider represents that the documentation shall contain a description of all the Deliverables and other materials and services (as applicable), shall be prepared and maintained in accordance with the applicable industry standards.
Service Provider shall not hold the Bank responsible for any judgements made by the Service Provider for arriving at any type of sizing or costing for any Work Order under this AgreementService Provider further agrees and recognizes that:The Bank shall control the authorization and access to Bank’s information, including access rights granted to the Service Provider’s Qualified Personnel;
The Service Provider ensure that the Qualified Personnel shall adhere to the Information Security Policy adopted by the Bank from time to time;
Service Provider is fully compliant (and undertakes and agrees to remain compliant) with the provisions of the Sexual Harassment of Women at the Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act, 2013 and the rules thereunder (as may be amended from time to time) and Service Provider shall extend this obligation to all its Qualified Personnel or individuals engaged for fulfilling the Services under this Agreement, and to that extent, shall enter into appropriate legally binding agreements with each such Qualified Personnel
in the performance of this Agreement, Service Provider and its respective director(s), officers(s), agents(s), employees(s), or any other persons(s) acting for or on behalf of the foregoing will comply strictly with all applicable anti-corruption laws and regulations. 
All terms and conditions, payment schedules, time frame for implementation and rendering Services and delivering Deliverables, expected service levels, etc. will remain unchanged unless explicitly communicated executed as an amendment by the Bank and the Service Provider in writing to the Service Provider. The Bank shall not be responsible for any judgements made by the Service Provider in respect to any aspect of the Services that are not documented in this Agreement..
The Bank reserves the right to interview any and all the Qualified Personnel to be deployed by the Service Provider on the Project Sites or onsite-long term projects and select then accordingly. 
Service Provider shall comply with its obligations under all applicable data protection laws in respect of the Services to be provided to the Bank under this Agreement. Service Provider agrees in respect of any such production data supplied to it by the Bank that it shall: (a) only act on instructions from the Bank regarding the processing of such data under this Agreement and shall ensure that appropriate technical and organizational measures shall be taken against unauthorized or unlawful processing of the data and against accidental loss or destruction of, or damage to, the data; and (b) comply with any reasonable request made by the Bank to ensure compliance with the measures contained in this clause.
.
If the issue/complaint received from the customer is of major/critical nature, the Service Provider shall solve the said issue on priority basis without causing any delay. However, if the Service Provider is not able to solve the complaint/issue immediately, in such case the same should be informed to the Bank and its customer and should ensure to solve within 7 days from the date of receipt of the complaint.
If the complaint received from the customer is not major but feels that the same may consume some time, in such case the Service Provider shall ensure to solve the complaint within 15 days from the date of receipt of the complaint and the Service Provider shall inform the same to the Bank and its customer via mail within 3 working days from the date of receipt of the complaint.
In case the customers of the Bank approaches the service provider directly for any issues pertaining to the services of the Service Provider, the Service Provider shall extend all its support and co-operation in this regard and ensures to solve the problem within the time limit as mentioned in the foregoing parasThe Service Provider shall inform/update the Bank in writing about the complaints received from Bank's customers and the solution provided by the Service Provider. The information shall contain, name of the customer, date of receipt of complaint, nature of complaint, time taken for solving (TAT), resolving date, status of the complaint etc. and the Service Provider shall submit the statement to the Bank on weekly basis via email id viz. -------- without fail.
Service Provider shall ensure to render services to the satisfaction of Bank's customer and in case the Bank's customer is not satisfied with the services rendered by the Service Provider, the Service Provider shall exclusively responsible for its acts and the Bank shall not be held responsible for whatsoever reasons for the acts of the Service Provider

The Service provider shall maintain at its cost worker’s compensation insurance coverage, commercial liability insurance coverage, medical insurance coverage, insurance coverage against physical loss or damage to Service provider’s equipment.
(l ) The Service Provider shall depute Qualified Personnel for the purpose of this agreement and the Service Provider shall ensure that Service Provider’s Employees and Qualified Personnel shall strictly adhere to their norms as required to fulfil the roles and responsibilities assigned to them to the satisfaction of the Bank. It is the sole responsibility of the Service Provider to ensure the safety of its staff and to follow the security norms, while they are performing their duties in the premises of the Bank and the Bank shall never be held responsible for any breach of terms, negligence occurred during its performance under this agreement. 
(m) In case the Services provided by Service provider’s Employees/Qualified Personnel are found not to be satisfactory, in such case the Bank shall inform the same to the Service Provider in writing specifying the reason and requesting to replace the employee or sub-contractor and the Service provider shall within 30 days  or any other period as may be mutually agreed, replace the existing staff with new qualified/experience staff.
(n) Unless otherwise specified in the Work Order, in the event any of Service Provider’s resource remain absent for two consecutive days in a month without the service provider providing the Bank with an alternate resource of the same skillsets/competence and qualification in such cases, Bank  reserves its right to recover compensation @ pro-rata basis per day from the service provider as per the cost of implementation agreed as part of the proposal & SOW/Work Order for each day on which the resource is absent. A delay by Service Provider in the performance of Services or delivery of Deliverables to the satisfaction of the Bank due to reasons solely and directly attributable to Service Provider or its Qualified Personnel shall render Service Provider liable to imposition of liquidated damages as identified in the Work Order. In any event, unless otherwise agreed in the Work Order, liquidated damages shall not exceed 5% of Work order value during one (1) year. in the performance of this Agreement, Service Provider and its respective director(s), officers(s), agents(s), employees(s), or any other persons(s) acting for or on behalf of the foregoing will comply strictly with all applicable anti-corruption laws and regulations.

The Bank shall not be responsible for any judgements made by the Service Provider in respect to any aspect of the Services that are not documented in this Agreement..
The Bank reserves the right to interview any and all the Qualified Personnel to be deployed by the Service Provider on the Project Sites or onsite-long term projects and select then accordingly. 
Service Provider shall comply with its obligations under all applicable data protection laws in respect of the Services to be provided to the Bank under this Agreement. Service Provider agrees in respect of any such production data supplied to it by the Bank that it shall: (a) only act on instructions from the Bank regarding the processing of such data under this Agreement and shall ensure that appropriate technical and organizational measures shall be taken against unauthorized or unlawful processing of the data and against accidental loss or destruction of, or damage to, the data; and (b) comply with any reasonable request made by the Bank to ensure compliance with the measures contained in this clause.
In case the Bank notices any defects in the services or products delivered by the Service Provider, the Service Provider agrees and covenants to rectify the defects referred by the Bank directly from its end and the Service Provider shall inform the grievance and its solution to the Bank within 3 working days from the date of receipt of the complaint. The Service Provider shall render all type of support/services to Bank free of cost without raising any objection and ensures to rectify the errors/defects within above mentioned prescribed time.
If the issue/complaint received from the customer is of major/critical nature, the Service Provider shall solve the said issue on priority basis without causing any delay. However, if the Service Provider is not able to solve the complaint/issue immediately, in such case the same should be informed to the Bank and its customer and should ensure to solve within 7 days from the date of receipt of the complaint.
If the complaint received from the customer is not major but feels that the same may consume some time, in such case the Service Provider shall ensure to solve the complaint within 15 days from the date of receipt of the complaint and the Service Provider shall inform the same to the Bank and its customer via mail within 3 working days from the date of receipt of the complaint.

clauses.original_text:
6.1 Bank shall designate one personnel to be its project manager in respect of each Work Order and he will be the single point of contact between the Bank and Service Provider for all communication in connection with the corresponding Work Order.
6.2 The Bank will give Qualified Personnel access (physical and or remote) to the Project Sites and required Confidential and other information, whenever necessary under this Agreement. Bank shall also if agreed between Parties give the Qualified Personnel access to required hardware and equipment to enable such Qualified Personnel to render Services and or deliver Deliverables under this Agreement. Qualified Personnel shall be bound by the code of conduct and other policies of the Bank when delivering services at the Project Sites
6.3 Bank will assist, help and cooperate with the Service Provider and Qualified Personnel in the course of their rendering Services under this Agreement.

clauses.original_text:
7.1 Charges/ Fees shall remain valid for the period specified in the corresponding Work Order.. Charges/ Fees exclude applicable GST and Bank shall pay to the Service Provider the applicable GST at prevailing rate.
7.2 Service Provider will raise valid and correct invoice on the Bank for the Services and or Deliverables. The Bank will pay the invoices with thirty (30) days from the date of receipt of the Invoice unless otherwise specified in the corresponding Work Order. The Bank will raise an objection/dispute relating to the Invoice, if any, within 5 days of receipt of the Invoice. However, Bank shall clear the undisputed amount within the agreed period of 30 days. Upon settlement of disputes with respect to any disputed invoices(s), Bank will make payment within 30 days of the settlement of the dispute.
7.3 The Service Provider understands and acknowledges that no payment other than the payments as per the agreed payment terms under this Agreement or Work Order shall be made by the Bank to the Service Provider.
All payments to Service Provider shall be subject to the deduction of applicable taxes at source and all payments shall be subject to the receipt of a valid and correct invoice from Service Provider. The Parties agree and acknowledge to comply with the GST requirements as set out hereinafter. 
In addition to other remedies available to the Service Provider, in case of non-payment of undisputed Fees by the Bank under this Agreement, the Service Provider shall be relieved of its obligations under this Agreement and shall have the right to suspend provision of Services until receipt of payment from the Bank. A continued breach of this obligation to pay the Fees under this Agreement beyond a period of forty-five (45) days shall constitute a material breach under this Agreement, for which, the Service Provider shall have the right to terminate this Agreement. 
Goods and Service Tax:
All Fees or charges payable by the Bank under this Agreement shall be exclusive of GST (unless Service Provider has opted for the composition scheme in which case the Fees or charges will be inclusive of GST). Further, for the purposes of this Agreement, GST shall include the Central Goods and Services Tax (‘CGST’), the State Goods and Services Tax (‘SGST’)/ Union Territories Goods and Service Tax (‘UTGST’) and/or the Integrated Goods and Services Tax (‘IGST’) as may be applicable.
In due compliance of its obligations, Service Provider shall remit the GST so charged (if any) from Bank, subject to a valid invoice/ debit note, to the appropriate government authority and file GST returns as prescribed, within the statutory timelines, mentioning all appropriate and relevant information on the GSTN platform, which enables Bank to claim timely credit (i.e., in its GST return for the month in which the invoice/ debit note is raised on Bank) of GST in the appropriate GST registration. In the event the credit of GST is not granted or denied to the Bank under its appropriate GST registration under applicable laws for non-payment of taxes charged to the Bank or on account of any non-compliance (including but not limited to non-filing of information, non-filing of returns, non-payment of appropriate GST to appropriate government/incorrect submission of information on the GSTN platform), then Service Provider shall rectify the said non-compliances/errors to ensure that Bank gets the credit in the subsequent month. In the event, the non-compliance/ error is not rectified by Service Provider as above, then the Bank shall have the right to set off such shortfall against the subsequent payments of the Fees or charges to Service Provider or recover the amount of GST charged to it along with the interest, penalty and/or any other cost from Service Provider. If Service Provider’s compliance rating falls below the prescribed limit, tax charged by Service Provider in the invoice would be paid by the Bank only after the credit is reflected on GSTN platform.
a(iii) The billing would be done at the end of the month. The payment of the fees by the Bank to the Service Provider shall be subject to deduction of applicable taxes under the Income Tax Act, 1961 or other applicable laws including GST, as applicable from time to time. The Bank will ensure that the payment is made to Service Provider within 14 days from   the date of invoice raised by Service Provider. In the invoice raised, Service provider shall specify details such as amount of monthly Fee; amount of GST tax if applicable; all shown separately; GST tax registration number; GST tax assesse code; category of taxable service if any and Service Provider  shall forward the invoice to the Bank on the intimated address and the Bank shall pay the said amount due only against the said invoice. Service Provider hereby undertakes to comply with timely uploading of invoice details in the GSTIN for the services provided to the Bank.
a(iv) If any advance payment is to be made by Service Provider, such advance payment will be made on the condition that Service Provider issues an advance receipt voucher quoting the GSTIN of the Bank and any other details as required by applicable laws within three (3) days of receipt of such advance payment. The Bank shall communicate and intimate to Service Provider, the details of invoices against which adjustment of advances paid by the Bank should be made.
a(v) If the Bank has already paid the Fees or charges and there is a decrease in such Fees or charges, then Service Provider will issue to the Bank a credit note for the differential amount. The credit note should be issued in accordance with applicable laws.
a(vi) If there is an increase in the Fee or charges due to provision of additional services/goods, then Service Provider will issue to the Bank a debit note for the differential amount. The debit note should be issued in accordance with applicable laws. 
a(vii) All invoices, credit notes and debit notes issued by Service Provider must set out the various taxes that are charged including but not limited to the GST. All invoices, debit notes and credit notes must be issued in accordance with the applicable laws and should be sent to the Bank within seven (7) days of its issue. If any invoice or debit note does not set out the taxes that are payable with respect to such invoice or debit note, then the Bank will not be required to pay any such taxes and such taxes will be borne by Service Provider.
Service Provider shall nominate a person who will be single point of contact for the Bank for all communication regarding any discrepancy on GSTN reporting by Service Provider.
a(viii) If any tax proceedings are initiated against either Party, in relation to the transaction contemplated under the Agreement, the other Party shall fully co-operate by furnishing all information as available on timely basis as may be required by such Party, including but not limited to confirmation of booking/accrual of expense.
A (ix) As and when there is any change in the GST rules, acts, regulations on input credit (which are available in public domain as on date of signing this Agreement), the Parties shall discuss the provisions relating to the same and may enter into a further amendment, if required, to address each other’s concerns in relation to such compliance.

9.1 The Service Provider shall, if required by the Bank, maintain, or cause to be maintained, in full force and effect for the term of or in connection with this Agreement insurance policies as to appropriately insure the performance of Service Provider's obligations under this Agreement.  
Such insurance policies will contain the following endorsements:
the Bank is named as an additional party insured on liability coverage with respect to the performance of the obligations of Service Provider.
Intentionally deleted. 
That the insurer waives its subrogation rights against the Bank.
Certificates of Insurance shall be delivered to the Bank evidencing compliance with the insurance terms of this Agreement. All of the above insurance shall be written through a company or companies reasonably satisfactory to the Bank, and the Certificates of Insurance shall be of a type that unconditionally obligates the insurer to notify the Bank in writing at least thirty (30) days in advance of the effective date of any material change in or cancellation of such insurance. 
Intentionally deleted.

clauses.original_text:
To extent it is solely and directly attributable to Service Provider, Service Provider shall at all times and at its own cost and expense, indemnify, defend or settle, and hold the Bank and/or its directors, employees, Affiliates, assignees free and harmless from and against any and all losses, liabilities, claims, actions, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees and court costs, relating to, resulting from or in any way arising out of third party claims on account of: 
Breach of confidentiality obligations of Service Provider and its employees, Qualified Personnel contained in this Agreement; and/or
Any gross negligent act or willful omission of Service Provider and/or its employees/agents, resulting in a tangible third party loss, damage or claim against the Bank and / or its personnel; and/or
Any acts of fraud by Service Provider and/or its employees.
